name: HAPPY THANKSGIVING - HOLIDAY BREAK

description:
¡Saludos a todos en AgileUy!

¡Aprovechando que nos visita en Montevideo nuestro amigo Martín Alaimo, tendremos una charla especial!

Martín fue keynote del evento Ágiles 2016 en Quito, Ecuador. El título de su presentación: Bienvenid@s, la puerta abre hacia adentro, y ahora tendremos la oportunidad de verla en este Meetup de AgileUy.

Descripción

Las transformaciones organizacionales hacia la agilidad comienza por lo general a nivel de equipos, a veces pilotos, mediante la adopción de marcos ágiles, foco en los procesos, uso de herramientas y consideración de las personas. Podríamos identificar este enfoque como una transformación guiada por el cambio en la forma de hacer las cosas. 

Este tipo de transformaciones se ven desafiadas muy frecuentemente al tiempo que las personas cambian de proyectos, de áreas, se suman nuevas personas, etc. Tanto es el desafío que enfrentan, que algunas veces se ve una total retracción de la agilidad, volviendo a hacer las cosas como si aquí nunca haya existido una transformación. 

En esta conversación veremos algunos factores que influyen en este tipo de situaciones y analizaremos una dimensión de la transformación organizacional a la cual no se le da la prioridad que merece. Y esta dimensión es, justamente, el factor principal por la cual las transformaciones fallan en su cometido.

¿Qué es eso que estamos olvidando al pretender acompañar a una organización en su transformación? Participa de la conversación y descubrámoslo juntos. Abramos la puerta hacia adentro. 

Día, Hora y Lugar
• Día: Miércoles 9 de Noviembre de 2016
• Hora: 19:30 a 21:00 horas
• Lugar: Pyxis Edificio Bulevar España 2323, Montevideo 

¡Gracias Pyxis por recibirnos nuevamente!

¡Te esperamos!
name: Bienvenid@s, la puerta abre hacia adentro. Keynote Ágiles 2016 con Martín Alaimo

description:
Sparkathon w Warszawie z Apache Spark 2.0.1 i Scala[masked]. Koniecznie musisz nas odwiedzić!

Celem spotkania jest nauka Scali i Sparka (lub odwrotnie) w miłej atmosferze. Wszyscy mile widziani - początkujący lub zaawansowani - i każdy powinien znaleźć coś dla siebie. Będziemy rozszerzali możliwości platformy Spark, więc tworzenie własnych formatów korzystając z DataSource API w Spark SQL lub job schedulers czy streaming sinks to norma. Nie martw się, to naprawdę proste!

"Ludzie i technologie" - tego nie można nie lubić!

Pracujemy w parach i postanowiliśmy, że od tego spotkania będziemy wszyscy pracowali nad jednym tematem, chyba że para (już samodzielnie) postanowi inaczej. Jest z czego wybierać i uczyć się Scali i Sparka.

Pomysły do oprogramowania zbieramy w dokumencie Spark-a-thon - Development Activities (aktualizowany na bieżąco, więc polecamy przeglądać historię zmian).

Weź laptopa z Java SE 8, sbt[masked], i IntelliJ IDEA (z wtyczką do Scali). Pobierz kody źródłowe Sparka z the Spark repo lub po prostu skorzystaj z Spark 2.0.1. The real fun is on master!

Polub nas na Facebooku! RTuj na twitterze.

Pytania? Uwagi? Sugestie? Skorzystaj z możliwości komentowania poniżej!

Official language: Polish + Scala.
name: Sparkathon - Developing Spark Extensions in Scala

description:
Meeting Point 1: 8,45 am, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Meeting Point 2: 9,30 am, Monasterio Montserrat.

Guide: Ferran ( speaks English & Spanish ).

Average age of participants: From 20 to 45 years old, mainly.

Price Excursion: 16 €.

+ Transportation Cost: 6 € ( you pay at the car driver ).

Total Price= 22 €.

Level: Medium. 5 h in total walking aside time for relax & eat. Elevation gain: 560 m.

Estimated arrival time to Barcelona: 7 pm.

What to bring: Trekking or sport shoes, food+water ( you also can buy sandwiches at the bar we´ll breakfast ).

We recommend: Stick.

Points of Interest: The medieval monastry of Montserrat, very important for Catalonia soul & heart. The incredible different forms of the mountains, and the 360º views from the top.

• • •

Punto de Encuentro 1: 8,45 h, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Punto de Encuentro 2: 9,30 h, Monasterio Montserrat.

Guia: Ferran ( habla Inglés & Castellano ).

Edad promedio Participantes: De 20 a 45 años, principalmente.

Precio Excursión: 16 € ( si traes tu coche desde plaza Catalunya y llevas a 4 participantes + tienes 16 € descuento ).

+ Coste Transporte: 6 € ( se lo pagas al conductor del coche en que vayas ).

Precio Total: 22 €.

Nivel: Medio. 5 h de excursión en total, aparte del tiempo para relajarse, desayunar y comer. Desnivel: 560 m.

Hora estimada llegada a Barcelona: 19 h.

Qué traer: Botas o zapatillas de deporte o de treking, comida y agua.

Recomendamos: Palo.

Puntos de Interés: El monasterio medieval de Montserrat, muy importante para el alma y corzón de Cataluña. Las increibles formas de las montañas y las vistas de 360º desde la cima.
name: SANT JERONI: CIMA DE MONTSERRAT.

description:
Co-oking, la première cuisine partagée de Bruxelles, remet le couvert pour le Moving Brunch #2 dans un espace d’exception : le futur musée d’art moderne de Bruxelles et actuel Garage Citroën Yser. Nous avons le plaisir de participer au festival slow food Vini, Birre, Ribelli.

RDV donc au garage Citroen les samedi 26 et dimanche 27 novembre, de 10h à 14h pour le brunch et jusque 19h pour le mini marché de producteurs.

Nos entrepreneurs locaux vont vous régaler !

Au menu pour cette édition :

Les galettes et crêpes de N’oublie pas le souper avec des garnitures typiquement slow food (une garniture végé et une non végé) et pour agrémenter vos crêpes :
Les pralinés, caramel au beurre salé et caramel au sirop de Liège de Eugène Chocolatier
Les Confitures de Itinéraire Bis Gourmand
et les biscuits de Mad Lab
Vous devez vous munir de billets pour entrer sur le festival. Pour ne pas gaspiller et mieux prévoir le nombre de couverts, merci de vous inscrire pour le brunch.

M'inscrire au brunch Réserver mon billet pour le festival
name: Brussels Moving Brunch #2

Join, connect, socialise, and network with other creatives from across Sydney at a gorgeous, hidden, harborside park.

Arts, music, fashion, film, communication, performing arts, design and more - all creatives are welcome.

Join the Facebook event for details:
https://www.facebook.com/events/105466003266724/

Plus, attendees will go into the running to win a $1,000 exposure package.

Eat, drink, and mingle with Sydney's incredible creative community. This is a free social gathering - attend by yourself or with fellow creatives.
name: Sydney Creatives Picnic

description:
This is a regular dinner/social meet for people who may be shy, anxious, lonely, depressed, whatever the label, we are all human and need social interaction!

I know how hard it can be actually turning up so don't beat yourself up for not coming after you have signed up. However, please do try to inform me if you won't make it.

Looking forward to seeing you all! You won't be judged and you don't have to impress anyone. Just turn up and see what happens. :-)

Tony

PS Next week it's very likely we will be at another location as yet undecided...
name: Dinner/drinks Meetup at The Mad Hatter

description:
***Most people come by themselves so please come and join us.***

Let's meet at Bryant Park (northeast corner) as we did last time we met there. We can pick from the premade signs from previous gatherings. Then we can start high-fiving and hugging. If you have not joined us before please check out the video below to see what we do. We hope to see you there.

More high fives and hugs! I encourage people to bring friends/family who would be open to doing this!

So the general idea of how the evening goes:

3pm - meet up at location and pick signs or bring one you make at home. 3:15 - 6pm - We will hug and high five. Here's an awesome video of what we do. http://newyorknatives.com/lets-meet-up-and-hug-and-high-five/

This event is co-hosted with the #1 New York Shyness & Social Anxiety Meetup group. Check them out and join them here:

http://www.meetup.com/NYShynessandSA/

If you need to text me if you're lost please do so at[masked]-0315.

Hope to see you there, Wade
name: Free Hugs & High Fives - Bryant Park - Giving Thanks

description:
Para aquellos que no han estado presentes, o bien deseasen reanudar los primeros episodios de El Mago de Oz, de Lyman Frank Baum, lo escucharemos en versión audio.

¿Qué tan actual se encuentra este maravilloso cuento en nuestras vidas?

La reunión continuará el sábado 12 a las 17:00.

Con la asistencia confirmada, indicaré también la dirección del encuentro.

Si tienes alguna pregunta para hacerme, puedes enviarme un mensaje.

Arrivederci!
name: Revivir en audio los primeros episodios de El Mago de Oz, de Lyman Frank Baum.

description:
This webpage is for ladies' RSVPs
Guys, sign up here...

Event: Meet & Greet
Dress Code: See our definition of semi-formal below
Place: Jammy Buggars
Private Room
Address: 15625 Detroit Ave., Lakewood, Ohio 44107 - (216)[masked]
Date: Dec 11, 2016
Time: TBD (probably 3pm)
Cost: $5

Let's get dressed up and look our best for a December Meet-and-Greet at Jammy Buggars in Lakewood. This event is semi-casual (meaning no blue jeans)... A tie isn't required for guys, but a dress pants & a dress shirt or sweater for guys is the minimum expected. Guys are welcome to wear a suit and tie if they wish. It never hurts to be the best-dress guy in the room. For ladies, semi-formal probably means a dress or skirt, but I will let people decide for themselves how they want to look their best.

There will be a non-refundable $5 charge in order to help prevent no-shows and last minute RSVP changes, so only sign up if you're sure you can make it.  The $5 charge does not include the price of your food & drinks.

There will only be as many spots available for guys as there are ladies signed up. We can only have a maximum of 40 people, so 20 guys/20 ladies.

If anyone wants to help plan games, that would be much appreciated.  It would be nice to try to plan some interactive games so that we can get to know each other a little better, or if people just prefer to mingle, that's fine too. If you help with the planning of the event, there will not be a charge for you.

The venue closes at 6pm, so we'll have 3 hours to hang out of we need that much time.

If this event is a success, we will plan more like it in the future.

See you there!
name: Semi-formal Meet & Greet at Jammy Buggars in Lakewood (Ladies' RSVP Page)

description:
Escape Election Night Madness! Join us for a screening and discussion of a favorite Charles Burnett film! Danny Glover is outstanding in this 90’s classic!

The screening will be followed by audience discussion and Q&A. 

Suggested Donation: $10. Proceeds support BloomBars. Free organic popcorn.

To Sleep with Anger (1990, 102 min), by Charles Burnett - Danny Glover stars as a devilish visitor from down South, who visits a black middle-class home in Los Angeles, and causes problems for the whole family! 

Charles Burnett's beautiful, poetic masterpiece is novelistic in its narrative density and richness of characterization. Harry Mention, an enigmatic drifter from the South, comes to visit an old acquaintance named Gideon, who now lives in South-Central Los Angeles. Harry's charming, down-home manner hides a malicious penchant for stirring up trouble, and he exerts a strange and powerful effect on Gideon and his thoroughly assimilated black, middle-class family.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s5PWGIb6vhc

What: To Sleep with Anger 
When: Tuesday, November 8, 2015  7:00 PM 
Where: BloomBars - community arts space. 
Directions: The location is 7 minutes walking distance from the Columbia Heights METRO Station (map), and a couple of local parking garages - Target (map) and Giant (map).
name: Election Night Escape! 90's Classic "To Sleep with Anger" w/ Q&A

description:
This workshop will …

• help you to see illness within a different context and from a different perspective,

• give you deeper insight into the root of your health issue(s),

• allow you to see the dynamics within your family system that are blocking you from becoming healthy.

You will have the opportunity to visualise your inner picture of your situation by using representatives from the group and shine a light on your sub-conscious and unconscious mind. You will see what dynamics have led to the situation/issue and will be able to address the root of it by being held in a safe space with healing words and expression of emotions. This is a creative, intuitive process and goes very deep, but may give you sustainable results. A new perspective plus higher awareness, as well as a changed attitude will help you see your path ahead more clearly and eventually lead into more peace within yourself.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ring me on 07894434295.

If money is what is holding you back, please talk to me. We’ll work something out.

If fear of feeling painful emotions is what is holding you back, please know that you would be in a very safe place, very well held by the group and the facilitator, and that you would be the one who would be driving your own healing process with no pressure at all, only support.

Please bring lunch to share with you. Teas, coffee and biscuits are available.

Parking: Available
Public transport: Take bus to Abingdon Town Centre or - if bus goes there - 'Saxton Road'  on Drayton Road. From town centre it's a 15 to 20 minutes walk; from stop 'Saxton Road' it's 10 minutes. By rail: Best stop would be Didcot Parkway. I might be able to arrange a pick-up service at about 8:45am.

Please note:
A systemic constellation is not a replacement for professional medical treatment, but it can help significantly with the healing process.
name: Addressing Health Issues through Family Constellations

description:
Demo Day of the 2016's batch of the Bayer Grants4Apps accelerator. ** Please bring an identification card with you: Personal ID, Passport, Driver's license. Thanks for your understanding! **

Please check the date; we needed to change it from the 28th to the 24th of November. Sorry for that.

Usually when Winter is coming, most people stay at home, light up the candles and wait for a reason to go out. We at #G4A invite you to join us on November 24th for another kryptonian #DemoDay. Our startups have worked hard and have a lot of results to show, so have you. Lets come together for the last time in this year and exchange how far we have come, how we can collaborate which each other, to make 2017 YOUR year.

We will have a "market place" for digital health startups where you can present yourself / your product, including a Roll-up. Please contact us and let us know why we should choose you for those spots. Only a few places are available.

Guided tours to the market place startups will be offered for everyone. A special tour to the Grants4Apps offices will be offered at midnight.

Pitches:

• Oasis Websoft - Ghana. bisaapp.com. Telemedicine. Bisa means “ask” in the Ghanaian Twi language. It is a mobile application that allows users with an Android, iPhone or Windows phone to directly interact with medical practitioners without being physically present at the hospital. This is an advantage to people who need medical care and advice but are not able to visit the hospital for various reasons like poverty , long queues at the hospital , the fear of stigmatization, especially for people who have symptoms of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs) makes them embarrassed to seek the needed treatment.

• Turbine - Hungary. turbine.ai. Design effective cancer combination therapies using artificial intelligence. Turbine designs interventions to defeat cancer, screening millions of possible drug combinations on simulated cells.

• Vital Smith - Korea. vitalsmith.com. VITAL SMITH helps commercializing medical ideas through latest technology & design. First product: Saliva-based fertility test.

• xbird - Germany. xbird.io. "We are a medical AI company, using the most advanced technology to save 1 million lives by 2020. Employing the latest know-how in data science and machine learning, our technology captures data streams from the built-in sensors of smartphones and wearables and analyzes these to detect critical health events before they occur."

#G4A #Yes #DemoDay #WeDidItAgain #WeStayTillxAM

Guest Startups pitches & market place:

Anvajo - Verena Kretschmann - anvajo.com - We're a health tech spin-off of TU Dresden and have developed a cutting-edge ‘minilab’ for (1-drop) blood, urine, saliva and sperm home testing, providing immediate results at lab-grade accuracy.

mHealthQA - Jesper Lindholt - We offer a SaaS service for helping software companies assess and approach the question of certification as medical devices.
name: Demo Day Grants4Apps Accelerator 2016

description:
Members only event

------------------------------------

Class Enemy is a 2013 Slovenian drama directed and co-written by Rok Biček. It was Slovenia's entry for the 86th Academy Awards and although it was not nominated it won numerous other awards and received several nominations. 

In tones of chilly blue, Rok Biček captures the fierce power struggle between teacher and students in a nuanced and genuinely thought-provoking way. Many films of recent years have been set in classrooms, but few have been as intense, well played and succinct as Biček's directorial debut.

Robert, the new German teacher, is aloof, authorative and demanding. He lectures on Thomas Mann and expects his pupils to rise when he enters the room. He might even be a Nazi, the dismayed teenagers speculate. When his student Sabina takes her own life shortly after being reprimanded by Robert, the teacher is considered to be cause. Instantly, vengeful youth rebellion stirs among the benches. The realisation that things are not so black and white comes too late.

Awards:  20 wins & 5 nominations
IMDB rating: 7.8
Running time:  1 hour 52 mins

The movie will start at 7.30pm, but I will get there from about 7.00pm to set up the room. There is enough space for you to join us upstairs and make use of the space.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QsOsFByeR0U


Please note that we show this movie for educational purposes within our club. This is a strict members only event. Please do not embarrass yourself (and us) by bringing a guest, who we would need to turn away.

Please note that we ask members for a contribution of £3 to allow us to budget for future events. Your support is very much appreciated! Thanks.

__________________________

London European Club is run by dedicated volunteers, who don't have time to waste with people who don't show up at events. If you don't show up to three events that you have RSVPed to, you will be banned from the Club. Changing your RSVP in the last 24 hours prior to the event is strongly discouraged and may result in an immediate ban, especially when it comes to our most popular events such as this one.
name: LEC Movie Night:  Class Enemy (Razredni sovraznik)

description:
Join us for Wrestling Jerusalem, an off-Broadway show about one-man's foray into the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The show stars American playwright/performer Aaron Davidman.

After the show, the audience will be treated to a talkback featuring a three-member panel discussion. Davidman will be one of the panelists. The audience will also be given an opportunity to ask him some questions about the show.

Our group will save 40 per cent off the regular ticket price! Our tickets will be just $25 each. (Regular ticket price is  $42 per ticket!)

Please follow the "HOW TO BOOK" instructions below to reserve your ticket(s).

THE SHOW

Wrestling Jerusalem comes to Toronto direct from a sold-out, off-Broadway run in New York City. Set in ﻿the United States, Israel and Palestine, Wrestling Jerusalem follow﻿s one man's journey to understand the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

Aaron Davidman's solo performance is a personal story that grapples with the complexities of identity, history and social justice. Giving voice to 17 different characters in 90 minutes, the play sheds light on one of the most entrenched conflicts of our time. More information: WRESTLING JERUSALEM WEBSITE and CANADIAN STAGE.

"Breathtaking"- THE WASHINGTON POST

"Remarkable solo performance... yearning beauty... riveting"- SAN FRANCISCO CHRONICLE

ABOUT AARON DAVIDMAN: Aaron is a playwright, director, actor and producer. He has written, directed and acted in many productions in the United Stated. He  also served as Artistic Director of Traveling Jewish Theatre in San Francisco from 2001  to 2011. He is the author of Wrestling Jerusalem which premiered in San Francisco in 2014. MORE INFORMATION.

https://vimeo.com/103364996

DETAILS

WHEN: Thursday, November 24, 2016

TIME: Show starts at 8 p.m. Meet Belinda between 7:15 and 7:45 p.m.

WHERE: Berkeley Street Theatre, 26 Berkeley Street, Toronto, Ontario

SHOW LENGTH: 90 minutes with no intermission followed by a short break and then a 20 to 30-minute panel discussion

DISCOUNT TICKETS: $25 (regular $42) (includes HST) + $3 service fee

MEETUP FEE:  $2 per attendee 


HOW TO BOOK

RSVP on this event page and then email Belinda for the payment instructions via the following email link: http://www.meetup.com/Thumbs-Up-Theatre-Toronto/message/?recipientId=12578239

Please specify that you are inquiring about Wrestling Jerusalem. Please do NOT block your e-mail address if you want a reply. 

SEATING ARRANGEMENTS: Members will be seated together in excellent reserved seating in the centre section.


MEETUP ARRANGEMENTS

Meet Belinda between 7:15 and 7:45 p.m. in the lobby near the box office inside the front entrance. Belinda is very short and will be wearing a bright pink hat. Cell # (416)[masked] for use on the day/time of the performance only.

AFTER SHOW/PANEL DISCUSSION MEETUP SPOT: Meet Belinda in the lobby where you met her before the show. She will be wearing her bright pink hat.

description:
Thanksgiving traditionally is a North American holiday that takes place on the 4th Thursday of November to celebrate and give thanks for the harvest. However, our host, Building Cultural Connections (BCC), decided to do it a week earlier (before Formula One hits). 

Over time, the holiday has evolved into a time for family and friends to come together and start the holiday season with lots of food and thankfulness for the year and life thus far. I think this will be a great time for us as a new group to get to know each other better in a casual atmosphere. The food presented is Southern American cooking catered by A Lil Taste of the South catering. 

So join us as we eat, talk, laugh, and count our blessings together!!!!


Menu:

3 Meats: Roasted Turkey, Fried Chicken, and Fried Fish

Sides: Cornbread dressing, Cranberry Sauce, Collards, Green bean casserole, 6 cheese Mac and cheese

Desserts: Sweet potato pie, apple pie, and Red Velvet Cake

Drinks: Non-alcoholic. You may bring your own alcohol if desired.

- Food presented in warmers 

*Cost: 165 AED per adult, 80 AED (per child 10-14 years), 55 AED (per child 3-9 years), less than 2 years old free

description:
BEST SCENERY EVER!  This is a rugged, dirt trail.  Some steep climbs, maybe some creek crossings.   No bathrooms, no improvements of any kind, and NO CELL PHONE RECEPTION.  Make sure you know where you're going before you leave home.  Totally worth the drive.  

It's an all-day excursion, but we should get you home in time for dinner.  

The last time that we hiked Pickle, it took us 2 hours to do a 2 mile hike, it's that much fun.  After we finish Pickle, we will head to HICKORY CANYON (below), about 15 minutes away.  It's only about a 1-1.5 mile trail, but scenery is supposed to be just as good.


This outing is more about enjoying the scenery than hiking, so don't get upset if we goof off.  If you want to hike, hike, hike, this is NOT the outing for you.  We can do that without driving 90 minutes.  

Pack a lunch, we will find a scenic spot to sit and picnic.

Only about 3.5-4 miles of hiking, but allow 4-5 hours, including lunch break. 

NOT FOR BEGINNERS. 

We ask that you only come if you've attended at least one other hike (5 miles or more) with us and are comfortable with our pace and how the Dog Pack works.   We will be taking our time and taking pix/enjoying the scenery.  

Do not sign up if you want to power hike!  We don't do that.

Do not sign up if you're out of shape, this is a tough trail

Do not sign up if you're a "first timer", see above comment.

Expect mud on your boots and dirty, wet, tired dogs when we finish.


http://nature.mdc.mo.gov/discover-nature/places/pickle-springs


• HIKING BOOTS/SHOES required, this is a rugged hike

• Expect brush, rocks and some steep slopes.  

• Maybe a creek crossing, bring dry shoes for ride home

• NO GUEST DOGS, human guests are welcome.  

If you bring a human guest, be sure that they know our pace...slow and playful.   We've been having some guests that are upset that we aren't power hiking for them.  Leave those people at home, please.

• BRING WATER FOR YOUR DOG.   There should be some creeks, but ???

• FRONTLINE YOUR DOG, and protect yourself, ticks might still be out.

• No bathrooms, there will be trees.  

• NO "FIRST TIMERS" HERE, as explained above.

• This will be ON LEASH...for all.   Too far from home to lose a dog or end up with a snake bite.  This is not a place to take any chances, and I think all will enjoy the day more if we don't have to worry about offleash dogs.  


LUNCH:   Let's just figure on bringing a sandwich/food and we'll find a picnic table or just a great log or rock with a view.  Everybody bring your own stuff.


DRIVING DETAILS.....

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Pickle+Springs+Natural+Area/@37.8153336,-90.4613596,11z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x87d842a9a6888321:0x7cb7b586588520cc

**ALLOW 90 minutes FROM 270/55**   You should leave Arnold by 8:30

Take HWY 55 TO FESTUS, then take HWY 67 SOUTH TO FARMINGTON, about 50 miles.  From Farmington, take HWY 32 EAST (left off highway) TO HWY AA, about 9 miles on right.  You will turn left onto Dorlac and go a short distance to parking lot.   Not too hard to find.  

WE ARE STARTING AT PICKLE SPRINGS!!!!

From Pickle, we will head to Hickory Canyon.  

*****************

DIRECTIONS FROM PICKLE SPRINGS TO HICKORY CANYON (20 minute drive)

https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Pickle+Springs+Natural+Area+Parking+Lot,+Dorlac+Road,+Ste.+Genevieve,+MO/Hickory+Canyons+Natural+Area,+Ste.+Genevieve,+MO+63670/@37.844189,-90.3951418,12z/data=!4m13!4m12!1m5!1m1!1s0x87d842a9a6985695:0xfa88f105cd14c731!2m2!1d-90.3016627!2d37.8013241!1m5!1m1!1s0x87d85de4b0d2355d:0x7c8a976402cd2e16!2m2!1d-90.3113278!2d37.8906049?hl=en

Unless you know these parks, you need to be sure that you can figure out the directions from the links above.  Be sure to allow enough time, no cell phone reception for the last 8-10 miles.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND PRINTING THESE OUT BEFORE LEAVING HOME.  IF YOUR GPS MESSES UP, THERE WILL NOT BE ANY CELL PHONE SERVICE IN THIS AREA.
name: DOG HIKE at PICKLE SPRINGS/HICKORY CANYON, pack a lunch!

description:
An amazing evening shooting comedians, live bands, films and general tomfoolery. This is going to be Epic! (with a capital 'E') We all know what an amazing job NHS Junior Doctors do, supporting us and our loved ones in times of need. Now is time for show our support for Junior Doctors by helping them spread the word.

The location is The Tooting Tram & Social who have kindly provided their venue for the evening along with many other volunteers giving their time for this evening.

Doors open at 8pm and our small band of 4 photographers are needed to capture the very best of the action as the night progresses. It's going on to 12.30am so make sure you can stay awake for the action.  We want to capture energy of the evening,  and the messages that Junior Doctors will be holding up and sending.

Those expecting to capture portraits with Jeremy Hunt might be sadly disappointed.

What you need

• Do you have a camera? Brilliant, that's really all you need.

• This will be low light but as it's going to be busy, a monopod would be very good.

• A flash with bounce or diffuser is handy but not essential

• A sense of fun and being able to join in the party atmosphere

What you will learn

• This is event photography so you will learn about capturing people having fun and expressing themselves, with music dance and possibly booze

• How to get in close and personal 

• Visual storytelling of documenting an event which has a social message 

Following the shoot, I will ask you to upload your best images images so I can review and provide feedback.  Images will be given to event organisers so please make sure you agree to this before signing up. 

The money raised from this Meetup will be passed on to Great Ormond Street hospital.
name: SOLD OUT Shoot comedians, live bands and partying doctors!

Meeting Point 1: 8,45 am, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Meeting Point 2: 9,30 am, Monasterio Montserrat.

Guide: Ferran ( speaks English & Spanish ).

Average age of participants: From 20 to 45 years old, mainly.

Price Excursion: 16 €.

+ Transportation Cost: 6 € ( you pay at the car driver ).

Total Price= 22 €.

Level: Medium. 5 h in total walking aside time for relax & eat. Elevation gain: 560 m.

Estimated arrival time to Barcelona: 7 pm.

What to bring: Trekking or sport shoes, food+water ( you also can buy sandwiches at the bar we´ll breakfast ).

We recommend: Stick.

Points of Interest: The medieval monastry of Montserrat, very important for Catalonia soul & heart. The incredible different forms of the mountains, and the 360º views from the top.

• • •

Punto de Encuentro 1: 8,45 h, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Punto de Encuentro 2: 9,30 h, Monasterio Montserrat.

Guia: Ferran ( habla Inglés & Castellano ).

Edad promedio Participantes: De 20 a 45 años, principalmente.

Precio Excursión: 16 € ( si traes tu coche desde plaza Catalunya y llevas a 4 participantes + tienes 16 € descuento ).

+ Coste Transporte: 6 € ( se lo pagas al conductor del coche en que vayas ).

Precio Total: 22 €.

Nivel: Medio. 5 h de excursión en total, aparte del tiempo para relajarse, desayunar y comer. Desnivel: 560 m.

Hora estimada llegada a Barcelona: 19 h.

Qué traer: Botas o zapatillas de deporte o de treking, comida y agua.

Recomendamos: Palo.

Puntos de Interés: El monasterio medieval de Montserrat, muy importante para el alma y corzón de Cataluña. Las increibles formas de las montañas y las vistas de 360º desde la cima.
name: SANT JERONI: CIMA DE MONTSERRAT.

description:
So far, we've focused mainly on fiction writing.  So this meetup will be entirely dedicated to poetry.  We do have some stellar poets in our group.  Bring a favorite poem or an original work, and let's discuss what works and what doesn't. 

Whether it's a form (like a sonnet or a villanelle) or free form, uses rhyme or rhythm, is expressive or confessional, is social or political, is personal and political, focuses on an image or ruminates on a complex idea, or is just a lot of fun--it's a poem worth sharing here.

Bring a warm beverage (and a beret, if you like) and get your fingers ready for snapping.
name: Poetry Showcase

Session Description:

(Presentation/Panel Discussion)

A learning session of the Metro NY Chapter of the Construction Specifications Institute designed to create dialogue and introspection regarding the current relevance of BIM in the Design + Delivery of Construction projects and the continued Life Cycle Maintenance of those projects.

Learning Objectives:

1.  Develop an understanding of the current BIM tools available to Design + Construction Professionals

2.  Gain insight into the expectation levels of the various Design + Construction Industry Professionals with respect to the benefits of BIM for their specific discipline.

3.  Explore the un-tapped capabilities of BIM and how each Design + Construction discipline envisions enhanced productivity from their individual discipline perspective and from an overall project delivery perspective moving forward.

4. Analyze what factors differentiate successful BIM implementation from unsuccessful BIM implementation projects.
name: November Monthly Meeting

description:
In partnership with Mary James Management, we are pleased to host a workshop with guitarist Rotem Sivan before his debut London performance.

The remarkable Israeli-born guitarist Rotem Sivan, now resident in New York, makes his Pizza Express and UK debut with his trio of Haggai Cohen Milo on bass and Colin Stranahan on drums. 

Rotem Sivan regularly plays the top New York clubs such as Smalls, Birdland and Blue Note and his albums have received 4.5 stars in Downbeat. 

“The gifted guitarist combines energy, ideas and undeniable chops... A remarkable talent and a welcome new voice on the scene.”  Downbeat

The workshop will take place from 4pm-5.30pm at Pizza Express Jazz Club, Soho. Attendees are welcome to bring guitars and encouraged to bring lots of questions!

At £10, this is a great-value workshop.

Tickets for the evening concert (£15) should be booked directly with Pizza Express Jazz Club: https://www.pizzaexpresslive.com/whats-on/rotem-sivan-trio
name: Rotem Sivan workshop, 4th December

description:
This workshop will …

• help you to see illness within a different context and from a different perspective,

• give you deeper insight into the root of your health issue(s),

• allow you to see the dynamics within your family system that are blocking you from becoming healthy.

You will have the opportunity to visualise your inner picture of your situation by using representatives from the group and shine a light on your sub-conscious and unconscious mind. You will see what dynamics have led to the situation/issue and will be able to address the root of it by being held in a safe space with healing words and expression of emotions. This is a creative, intuitive process and goes very deep, but may give you sustainable results. A new perspective plus higher awareness, as well as a changed attitude will help you see your path ahead more clearly and eventually lead into more peace within yourself.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ring me on 07894434295.

If money is what is holding you back, please talk to me. We’ll work something out.

If fear of feeling painful emotions is what is holding you back, please know that you would be in a very safe place, very well held by the group and the facilitator, and that you would be the one who would be driving your own healing process with no pressure at all, only support.

Please bring lunch to share with you. Teas, coffee and biscuits are available.

Parking: Available
Public transport: Take bus to Abingdon Town Centre or - if bus goes there - 'Saxton Road'  on Drayton Road. From town centre it's a 15 to 20 minutes walk; from stop 'Saxton Road' it's 10 minutes. By rail: Best stop would be Didcot Parkway. I might be able to arrange a pick-up service at about 8:45am.

Please note:
A systemic constellation is not a replacement for professional medical treatment, but it can help significantly with the healing process.
name: Addressing Health Issues through Family Constellations

description:
This will be an informal informational session. Topics covered will include: 

• Some of the options for home 3D printers (types, price ranges, etc). 

• Free modeling and printing software along with resources. 

• Types of filaments (plastics and exotics) 

• Terminology and common issues.

There will plenty of time for questions and for people to check out print samples.

Additionally there will be a 3D printer set up and running.


Since this will be more of a presentation than a class, laptops are not needed.
Although there is no charge for this presentation, an RSVP is required since there is limited space.
name: Introduction to 3D Printing

description:
We've got two talks this evening!

pdb

gdiamond


Building the Real-time Web with Python and aiohttp

What's the real-time web? Can I build it myself? In Python? Of course you can! This talk will help Python web developers learn how to integrate real-time components with their existing web applications using asyncio and aiohttp.

Steven Seguin is a full-stack developer at SurveyMonkey in Ottawa working on real-time and collaboration features. Holds strong opinions about distributed systems, functional programming, and API design.
name: Ottawa Python: Python Debugger; Real-time web with asyncio + aiohttp

description:
Escape Election Night Madness! Join us for a screening and discussion of a favorite Charles Burnett film! Danny Glover is outstanding in this 90’s classic!

The screening will be followed by audience discussion and Q&A. 

Suggested Donation: $10. Proceeds support BloomBars. Free organic popcorn.

To Sleep with Anger (1990, 102 min), by Charles Burnett - Danny Glover stars as a devilish visitor from down South, who visits a black middle-class home in Los Angeles, and causes problems for the whole family! 

Charles Burnett's beautiful, poetic masterpiece is novelistic in its narrative density and richness of characterization. Harry Mention, an enigmatic drifter from the South, comes to visit an old acquaintance named Gideon, who now lives in South-Central Los Angeles. Harry's charming, down-home manner hides a malicious penchant for stirring up trouble, and he exerts a strange and powerful effect on Gideon and his thoroughly assimilated black, middle-class family.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s5PWGIb6vhc

What: To Sleep with Anger 
When: Tuesday, November 8, 2015  7:00 PM 
Where: BloomBars - community arts space. 
Directions: The location is 7 minutes walking distance from the Columbia Heights METRO Station (map), and a couple of local parking garages - Target (map) and Giant (map).
name: Election Night Escape! 90's Classic "To Sleep with Anger" w/ Q&A

description:
A scenic loop over Alander Mountain starts at the Mt. Washington State Forest Headquarters on East Street in the town of Mt. Washington, Massachusetts. Take the Mount Alander Trail to the summit of Mount Alander. There are two choices from the summit. You may go down by the South Taconic Trail, going over the highpoint of Columbia County, NY, or you may take the Alander Loop Trail which joins the South Taconic Trail. In either case, follow the South Taconic Trail to its junction with the Mt. Frissell Trail, and take that trail eastwards passing the tri-state marker and Connecticut highpoint on the way to the summit of Mount Frissell.

Return by following the Mt. Frissell Trail back west slightly beyond the tri-state marker, then take the Ashley Hill Trail north to join the Alander Mountain Trail a short distance from the trailhead. Round trip distance is 11.2 miles, with 1,600 feet of elevation gain, book time is 6:25.
name: Hike to Mount Frissell, Highest Point in CT

description:
This workshop will …

• help you to see illness within a different context and from a different perspective,

• give you deeper insight into the root of your health issue(s),

• allow you to see the dynamics within your family system that are blocking you from becoming healthy.

You will have the opportunity to visualise your inner picture of your situation by using representatives from the group and shine a light on your sub-conscious and unconscious mind. You will see what dynamics have led to the situation/issue and will be able to address the root of it by being held in a safe space with healing words and expression of emotions. This is a creative, intuitive process and goes very deep, but may give you sustainable results. A new perspective plus higher awareness, as well as a changed attitude will help you see your path ahead more clearly and eventually lead into more peace within yourself.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ring me on 07894434295.

If money is what is holding you back, please talk to me. We’ll work something out.

If fear of feeling painful emotions is what is holding you back, please know that you would be in a very safe place, very well held by the group and the facilitator, and that you would be the one who would be driving your own healing process with no pressure at all, only support.

Please bring lunch to share with you. Teas, coffee and biscuits are available.

Parking: Available
Public transport: Take bus to Abingdon Town Centre or - if bus goes there - 'Saxton Road'  on Drayton Road. From town centre it's a 15 to 20 minutes walk; from stop 'Saxton Road' it's 10 minutes. By rail: Best stop would be Didcot Parkway. I might be able to arrange a pick-up service at about 8:45am.

Please note:
A systemic constellation is not a replacement for professional medical treatment, but it can help significantly with the healing process.

If you bring 1 fully paying participant with you, you will get your space half price, if you bring two or more, your space will be free. I will do this by refunding you.
name: Addressing Health Issues through Family Constellations

description:
*Your mind can be your best friend or your worst enemy* 

The program is based on an 8 part protocol for obsessive compulsive disorder of which clinical trials have been done to show its effectiveness. This protocol includes varies breathing techniques to reduce anxiety and deal with fear and will involve a challenging however extremely powerful breath called ocd breath. 

Reference: Kundalini yoga meditation for Psychiatric Disorders by David Shannahoff-Khalsa.
The program will consist of the following: 

• Length of course is 12 weeks, meeting once a week for a 2 hour session. 

• Step by Step instructions of each part within the protocol which can give an almost instant relief

• Support Group to share and allow for progress

• Implementing a daily home practise 

• Ongoing support group once a month after 12 week session

Extremely successful results have been achieved from this program.
This program is open to anyone over 16, no physical requirements. 

*For more information or for any queries you may have regarding this course you can contact Linda directly on[masked] or [masked] 

Personal Summary
Kundalini yoga and Mediation Instructor my passion is promoting positive Mental
Wellbeing. I specialise in treating Obsessive Compulsive Disorder and Anxiety due
to my own challenges with these issues. I currently run 12 week programs and have featured on the radio to promote awareness of mental Wellbeing.
I am currently studying Neurobiology, Mental Health and Meditation. 

Testimonial 12 week OCD program
I heard Linda discuss her condition on the radio and was amazed to hear somebody with exactly the same problems I have suffered from the past 40 years. I thought I was the only person in the world with such bizarre intrusive thoughts and was surprised to hear she had used a yoga breathing technique to heal herself. I contacted her and have attended her classes. After a short time of regular practise I noticed a significant improvement in my condition. I found that some of the techniques brought an almost instant relief to the anxiety and played a major role in helping me get a good nights sleep which was a problem for me previously.As a result of daily practise of these techniques my ocd has completely disappeared. I have found that the support of a group with similar problems to be a very cathartic and also helpful to know you are not alone with this probelm. I would hightly recommend these classes. Niall
name: Heal Within – Obsessive Compulsive Disorder Program - With Linda Culleton

description:
For the last meeting for 2016, we have two talks! Come join us at Survey Monkey.

Getting started with the python debugger

The python debugger module (pdb) helps the developer to resolve bugs that mysteriously appears in their perfect code. This talk is an overview of how to use the pdb module. Hoping that you will find out, that the pdbmodule is an essential tool for pythonistas.

Guinsly Mondésir is a master candidate in Information Studies at the University of Ottawa. In his spare time he likes learning and teaching Python

Building the Real-time Web with Python and aiohttp

What's the real-time web? Can I build it myself? In Python? Of course you can! This talk will help Python web developers learn how to integrate real-time components with their existing web applications using asyncio and aiohttp.

Steven Seguin is a full-stack developer at SurveyMonkey in Ottawa working on real-time and collaboration features. Holds strong opinions about distributed systems, functional programming, and API design.
name: Ottawa Python: Python Debugger; Real-time web with asyncio + aiohttp

description:
Haremos una clase de Danza Consciente con cantos chamanicos.

La tecnica de base es una fusión de diferentes técnicas de Danza, Teatro, Psicología. Yoga y Medicina Oriental combinadas de manera creativa a través del cuerpo. Cada sesión varía en función del tema que se baila, el cual se elige de manera conjunta al final de la clase.

Disfruta del mes de Noviembre a la mitad si te apuntas al mes de Octubre. ----


Se comienza compartiendo cómo se encuentra cada persona. Después se hace un calentamiento a través de movimientos de Danza o estiramientos y luego exploramos el tema elegido a través de ejercicios que permiten que los participantes conecten con su cuerpo, sus emociones y los procesos por lo que están pasando.

Al final de la clase se comparten sensaciones además de elegir el tema para la siguiente sesión.

Se trata de una experiencia profunda, humana y transformadora.

---

No necesitas haber hecho danza antes para participar a esta actividad.

El ambiente es agradable y familiar.
name: Danza Chamanica

description:
Os Óleos Essenciais são conhecidos pelas suas propriedades e utilizações na cozinha e na cosmética, e hoje em dia, são cada vez mais direccionados a utilizações terapêuticas como o tratamento de uma rinite, ou do alivio de dores musculares ou mesmo para melhorar significativamente a qualidade do sono.

Nesta oficina Anna Loutsenko vai direccionar os formandos nos fundamentos da aromaterapia com o foco na arte de tratar com os óleos essenciais: como se podem utilizar e quais são as precauções a respeitar. Vamos abordar as propriedades de alguns óleos essenciais e aprenderemos como os integrar no nosso dia a dia. Como nos estamos a aproximar dos meses mais frios e susceptíveis de doenças sazonais, vamos focar-nos em particular sobre os óleos essenciais úteis para prevenir as infecções do inverno. Inclui ainda uma parte prática de como aprender a fazer uma breve massagem relaxante com os óloes e ainda e elaboração de uma sinergia anti-viral que os formandos podem levar para casa. E, claro, vamos cheirar muitos aromas! Objectivos

​Aprender como usar de maneira prática os óleos essenciais no nosso dia a dia, nomeadamente para tratar várias patologias ou simplesmente melhorar o nosso bem estar. Conteúdos | Programa*

Apresentação

description:
In partnership with Mary James Management, we are pleased to host a workshop with guitarist Rotem Sivan before his debut London performance.

The remarkable Israeli-born guitarist Rotem Sivan, now resident in New York, makes his Pizza Express and UK debut with his trio of Haggai Cohen Milo on bass and Colin Stranahan on drums. 

Rotem Sivan regularly plays the top New York clubs such as Smalls, Birdland and Blue Note and his albums have received 4.5 stars in Downbeat. 

“The gifted guitarist combines energy, ideas and undeniable chops... A remarkable talent and a welcome new voice on the scene.”  Downbeat

The workshop will take place from 4pm-5.30pm at Pizza Express Jazz Club, Soho. Attendees are welcome to bring guitars and encouraged to bring lots of questions!

At £10, this is a great-value workshop.

Tickets for the evening concert (£15) should be booked directly with Pizza Express Jazz Club: https://www.pizzaexpresslive.com/whats-on/rotem-sivan-trio

Live videos:

The trio performing 'Angel Eyes': https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ssRi84UIYrg&feature=youtu.be

Performing 'Sandu' with Peter Bernstein: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G1D7SWMOFWM
name: Rotem Sivan workshop, 4th December

Private Room
Address: 15625 Detroit Ave., Lakewood, Ohio 44107 - (216)[masked]
Date: Dec 11, 2016
Time: TBD (probably 3pm)
Cost: $5

Let's get dressed up and look our best for a December Meet-and-Greet at Jammy Buggars in Lakewood. This event is semi-casual (meaning no blue jeans)... A tie isn't required for guys, but a dress pants & a dress shirt or sweater for guys is the minimum expected. Guys are welcome to wear a suit and tie if they wish. It never hurts to be the best-dress guy in the room. For ladies, semi-formal probably means a dress or skirt, but I will let people decide for themselves how they want to look their best.

There will be a non-refundable $5 charge in order to help prevent no-shows and last minute RSVP changes, so only sign up if you're sure you can make it.  The $5 charge does not include the price of your food & drinks.

There will only be as many spots available for guys as there are ladies signed up. We can only have a maximum of 40 people, so 20 guys/20 ladies.

If anyone wants to help plan games, that would be much appreciated.  It would be nice to try to plan some interactive games so that we can get to know each other a little better, or if people just prefer to mingle, that's fine too. If you help with the planning of the event, there will not be a charge for you.

The venue closes at 6pm, so we'll have 3 hours to hang out of we need that much time.

If this event is a success, we will plan more like it in the future.

See you there!
name: Semi-formal Meet & Greet at Jammy Buggars in Lakewood (Ladies' RSVP Page)

description:
IMPRESCINDIBLE RESERVAR PLAZA EN:

http://www.alzentro.com/eventos/conferencia-gratuita-shiatsu-que-es-y-como-puede-beneficiarte/


¿Alguna vez has tenido interés en Shiatsu? ¿Sabes en qué consiste y como te puede ayudar?

• Si estás interesad@ en las Terapias naturales

• Si has oído hablar de esta técnica pero realmente no sabes en qué consiste

• Si te sientes cansado o nervioso, si te supera el estrés , si no logras dormir bien y quieres saber si el Shiatsu te puede beneficiar

• Si no tienes ninguna especial dolencia pero te gustaría saber si recibir Shiatsu te puede ayudar en tu día a día

• Si quieres conocer cómo se desarrolla una sesión de Shiatsu para conseguir un equilibrio físico y emocional

• Si quieres razones para elegir a Es Shiatsu para acercarte a esta Terapia

¿Te sientes identificado con las afirmaciones de mas arriba?

En esta charla vamos a intentar darte respuesta a todo ello y mostrarte un poco más o por primera vez lo que es esta terapia manual de origen japonés llamada Shiatsu.

Te enseñaremos de una manera práctica cómo se desarrolla una sesión de Shiatsu y cómo tu mism@ puedes aplicarte autoshiatsu.

¡Anímate a conocernos!
name: Conferencia gratuita: "Shiatsu: ¿Qué es y como puede beneficiarte?"

description:
We have two talks this month! Come join us at Survey Monkey.

Getting started with the python debugger

The python debugger module (pdb) helps the developer to resolve bugs that mysteriously appears in their perfect code. This talk is an overview of how to use the pdb module. Hoping that you will find out, that the pdbmodule is an essential tool for pythonistas.

Guinsly Mondésir is a master candidate in Information Studies at the University of Ottawa. In his spare time he likes learning and teaching Python

Building the Real-time Web with Python and aiohttp

What's the real-time web? Can I build it myself? In Python? Of course you can! This talk will help Python web developers learn how to integrate real-time components with their existing web applications using asyncio and aiohttp.

Steven Seguin is a full-stack developer at SurveyMonkey in Ottawa working on real-time and collaboration features. Holds strong opinions about distributed systems, functional programming, and API design.
name: Ottawa Python: Python Debugger; Real-time web with asyncio + aiohttp

description:
Combine the adventure of Colorado River rafting with the Milky Way skies over the Grand Canyon, and you have the trip of a lifetime! Everything is provided for in this workshop: prepared meals, air transfers from Las Vegas to the river and back, camping equipment, entertainment, and great photo instruction by NightScape Photographer, Royce Bair.

Four experienced river guides and an assistant photo instructor will accompany us on this adventure. This trip and workshop will be very similar to our 2016 trip/workshop (check out our 5-star rating and comments).

Don't delay making your reservations. Last year, this trip and workshop filled up less than two weeks after it was announced! These trips are very popular and only a limited number of people are allowed to go down the Grand Canyon each year. Some individuals have waited for up to 20 years to obtain a permit to float through the canyon.

Total Price: Photo workshop fee is $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016). River rafting cost is $1699 ($1899 total). See "Cost" and "Other Expenses" below.

What to expect: This river trip is for all ages, 9 years to 99 years old. It’s still officially “Summer” on our first three days, so it should be nice and warm. Although it rarely gets over 100 degrees at this time of the year, a quick dip in the water will cool you off. The large, motorized J-rig rafts are very safe and roomy (we will have 14 people on each boat compared to the normal 18). There are about 15 white water rapids on this 100-mile stretch of the Colorado. You have the option of staying fairly dry in the back of the raft, or getting wet in the front. All your meals are prepared for you (the food is amazing), and all your camping equipment is provided (cots, tents, sleeping bags, chairs and a water-resistant bag to place your camera and other personals). There is very little hiking involved. All transportation and transfers from Las Vegas to and from the river are provided.

Weather: Mid-September offers the perfect temperatures! May and Sept. are the best months to visit the bottom of the canyon. Day temps are usually 85º - 95º, with evening temps between 65º - 75º. April can be a little cold. June, July and August are often over 100º in the day. The canyon walls radiate stored heat into the evening, typically keeping the temperatures above 80º much of the night.

See the Overview/Video and Download the Brochure

This is one of my few group workshops for 2017: most are private workshops (with 2-4 people per workshop) going on next year. This Grand Canyon River Trip and Photo Workshop will have plenty of spaces available (27 spots on two boats) for my Meetup Group, past workshop alumni and their family/friends.

Extremely Dark Skies: This remote region has some of our Earth's darkest night skies. The Milky Way literally "pops"! For those who come to do night photography, you will be richly rewarded.

=========================================================

Time lapse video from our 2016 workshop by Sergio Garcia Rill.

Time lapse video from our 2016 trip by Jason Rath - courtesy of Adobe Systems, Inc.

=========================================================

Photo Instruction: I will instruct and guide those that wish to participate on these five periods:

• 1st Night - 3 hours of starry night photography (weather permitting)

• 1st Afternoon - 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

• 2nd Night - 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

• 2nd Afternoon - 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

• 3rd Night - 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

• Review and editing of results after the trip

Photography is optional: This workshop will be mostly about free time and relaxation on the Colorado River, so feel free to bring along a non-photographer friend or family member (these will not have to pay my $200 photo instruction fee).

ITINERARY:

DAY 1 » Meet in Las Vegas at 10:15 in the lobby of The Las Vegas Marriott Hotel. A motor coach will take you to the Boulder Terminal where you will begin your Grand Canyon tour with a beautiful flight to the Bar 10 Ranch. Before you start your three-day Grand Canyon river rafting adventure, you’ll enjoy an overnight stay at the Bar 10 Ranch, a working cattle ranch perched high on a plateau above the Colorado River. Your transition from civilization to wilderness includes horseback trail rides, horseshoes, ping pong, skeet shooting, dinner and evening entertainment before settling into bed in the lodge, outdoors in a covered wagon, or outside on a spacious deck. Those who have paid the additional $200 photo instruction fee will attend a 2-hour twilight and starry night workshop instruction with Royce Bair before bedding down for the night.

DAY 2 » After a big country breakfast, a helicopter takes you deep into Grand Canyon where your rafts and guides await. After orientation and introductions, you’ll be on your way downriver surrounded by soul-stirring scenery. Breathtaking canyon walls shoot skyward in a dramatic display of geologic history as you experience your first taste of Grand Canyon river rafting. Hold on for Kolb and Mile 209 Rapids! An optional afternoon canyon photo instruction tour and a 2.5 hour starry night photo workshop will follow after our evening meal.

DAY 3 » Our J-Rig rafts enter awesome Lower Granite Gorge with a series of moderate rapids including Granite Spring, Diamond Creek and Travertine. We take some time to hike, explore and play at Travertine Grotto, a fantastic series of hidden waterfalls and pools (including an afternoon photo instruction tour). Run the biggest rapids of your Grand Canyon river rafting trip, the “230’s.” After your day of adventure, you’ll savor Western’s delicious dinners at the river’s edge and appreciate the unforgettable experience of sleeping under the stars — but first we’ll do up to 3-hours of Milky Way photography for those who wish to share these memories with others back home!


DAY 4 » As you near Lake Mead, the river calms and the canyon widens. Savor your final morning in Grand Canyon as you board a jetboat to head down river and across Lake Mead to where a shuttle will return you to Las Vegas. Lunch will be provided in transit.

COST: $1699 to Western River Expeditions, and $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) to me for the photo workshop portion ($1899 total). If you have a friend or family member that is not interested in photography, the only fee is the $1699 to Western River.

Other Expenses: Airfare to Las Vegas ~ Possible overnight lodging at The Las Vegas Marriott ~ Possible Park Entrance Fee ($12) - unless you have a current Nat’l Park Pass. Western River charges a 1% processing fee ($16.99) and a $3.00 Grand Canyon Conservation Fund contribution. Those three fees bring the total to $[masked] for the river trip and another $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) to me for photo instruction (the total does not include air fare to Las Vegas or lodging in Vegas).

How to Book: 1. RSVP for this workshop and pay the $200 deposit ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) that covers the photo workshop portion of this river trip. 2. Book the river rafting portion online (requires a $300 deposit to Western River) or call Western River at[masked]-7450. Tell the operator that you want to book a “Grand Canyon 4-Day” trip. Tell them it is the chartered, “Royce Bair Photo Group”, for September 18-21, Booking #149438. They will take your contact information and charge your credit card a $300 deposit (the balance of payment is due 90 days before the event). You can also book additional non-photographer spots for family members.

The Western River offices are open from 7:00am to 6:00pm MST, Monday - Friday.
name: 2017 Grand Canyon Photo Workshop & River Rafting

description:
PLEASE ONLY RSVP YES IF YOU ARE GOING. NO NEED FOR THE NO RSVPS. THANKS

Approximately 6 mile loop hike. It might be a little less. Terrain is moderately easy to some moderate. Very few strenuous spots.
Meet at Ingles at Mills River. Meet behind the gas station. Carpool donation suggestion--$5 pp.
Meet at 9:45 a.m. with a depart 10 a.m. with approximate arrival at trail head at 10:30.
We begin at the gate for Caney Bottom group campground. We follow a gravel road for about 1/2 a mile then pick up our trail. We will stop at Cove Creek Falls for photography.
Picking our trail back up we will wander through the forest on a lovely dirt trail. . We cross a creek or two and then will wind past a small waterfall where we will stop again.
We then enter a field where the group campground is and will come to a final sliding cascade. We'll stop here too.
We'll intersect the trail we came in on. There are some nice cascades alongside the road but its a steep scramble down. Some folks might want to just head back to their cars. Others may want to take the scramble. I'll be scrambling.
We then return to Ingles and our cars.
Bring a lunch and lots of water. Not sure where we will take trail break for lunch.
Also wear hiking boots / shoes. Bring poles if needed. The trail down and up to Cove Creek is steep. Not dangerous but it is a climb.
Well behaved dogs on leashes welcome.
name: Cove Creek Falls and Caney Bottom

RESERVATION UNDER NATASHA

BIOS OF PANELISTS

Danny Stone -Author / Speaker / Success Coach Teacher /Entrepreneur / Mentor
Who are you really?
What do you really want?
What does success and happiness look like for you?


These are a few questions that Danny Stone asks his coaching clients and audiences to think about. Danny is a Speaker, Success Coach, Teacher, and Author that has dedicated his life to helping people get unstuck and define and achieve success. In his book, You Have the Keys, Now Drive he lays out the foundation for living a happier more successful life.


Danny believes that everyone has the ability to change their life for the better IF they change their language, change their mindset, and change their actions. He is currently working with a non profit organization called Zero Gun Violence Movement to end gun violence in Toronto and is one of the founding members of Eagle6ix Mentorship, a program to mentor and guide young men to make better decisions through the promotion of education, employment, and empowerment.

Check out his website: iamDannyStone.com for FREE life-help tools.

Follow Danny on social media, his name is @iamDannyStone everywhere.

Nathan Clarke ~ Independent Financial Advisor

My team and I help clients improve their financial situations by tackling all six pillars of financial plan (Cash flow, Debt, Tax, Investments, Insurance, and Estates). I work especially with young families and business owners to help protect the things that are most important to them (their businesses and kids). Additionally, I work with them to achieve their end goals whether that be their retirement or to leave a legacy or both.

Simone McArthur - Personal Brand Photographer

Simone is a personal brand photographer. She promotes businesses and helps companies with branding through her visual illustrations. Simone will talk about what lead her to this industry and how she created a lifestyle of Mompreneurship after leaving the corporate world!

description:
English speakers: unlike our regular meetings, this meetup will be in English, so don’t hesitate to come !

Vous avez un paquet de données et vous aimeriez pouvoir faire tourner des algorithmes de machine learning de fou-furieux en n’utilisant que du R ? Alors ce meetup est fait pour vous !

H2O est un logiciel qui permet de distribuer les algorithmes prédictifs les plus avancés. Il est optimisé pour les environnements “big data” et s’interface avec R grâce au package “h2o”. Au cours de cette soirée, des développeurs et utilisateurs de la plateforme vont venir nous parler de celle-ci plus en détails.

Contrairement aux rencontres habituelles, ce meetup sera en anglais. Mais comme toujours il y aura à boire et à manger dans une ambiance des plus chaleureuses !

Programme de la soirée :

• 19h-19h30 Introduction to Machine Learning with H2O by Jo-fai Chow

In this talk, I will give you an overview of our company (H2O.ai), our open-source machine learning platform (H2O) as well as our new projects (e.g. Deep Water and Steam). This will be useful for attendees who are not familiar with H2O.

• 19h30-20h15 Automatic Machine Learning using H2O - Jiqiong QIU

In this talk, I am going to talk about a general machine learning pipeline using H2O for a Kaggle competition (data mining competition). Participating in Kaggle competitions can be very time-consuming. For this reason, I would like to build an automatic machine learning solution that suits most of the datasets with reasonable results. This talk also gives an overview of the main functions in H2O as well as real-world use cases.

• 20h15-21h Sparkling Water 2.0 - Jakub Háva

Sparkling Water integrates the H2O open source distributed machine learning platform with the capabilities of Apache Spark. It allows users to leverage H2O’s machine learning algorithms with Apache Spark applications via Scala, Python, R or H2O’s Flow GUI which makes Sparkling Water a great enterprise solution. Sparkling Water 2.0 was built to coincide with the release of Apache Spark 2.0 and introduces several new features. These include the ability to use H2O frames as Apache Spark’s SQL datasource, transparent integration into Apache Spark machine learning pipelines, the power to use Apache Spark algorithms via the Flow GUI and easier deployment of Sparkling Water in a Python environment. In this talk we will introduce the basic architecture of Sparkling Water and provide an overview of the new features available in Sparkling Water 2.0. The talk will also include a live demo showing how to integrate H2O algorithms into Apache Spark pipelines – no terminal needed!

• 21h jusqu’au bout de la nuit :


About Joe

LinkedIn: https://uk.linkedin.com/in/jofaichow

Twitter: @matlabulous

Jo-fai (or Joe) is a data scientist at H2O.ai. Before joining H2O, he was in the business intelligence team at Virgin Media in UK where he developed data products to enable quick and smart business decisions. He also worked remotely for Domino Data Lab in US as a data science evangelist promoting products via blogging and giving talks at meetups. Joe has a background in water engineering. Before his data science journey, he was an EngD research engineer at STREAM Industrial Doctorate Centre working on machine learning techniques for drainage design optimization. Prior to that, he was an asset management consultant specialized in data mining and constrained optimization for the utilities sector in UK and abroad. He also holds a MSc in Environmental Management and a BEng in Civil Engineering.

About Jakub

LinkedIn: https://cz.linkedin.com/in/havaj

Jakub (or “Kuba”) finished his bachelors degree in computer science at Charles University in Prague, and is currently finishing his master’s in software engineering as well. As a bachelors thesis, Kuba wrote a small platform for distributed computing of tasks of any type. On his current masters studies he’s developing a cluster monitoring tool for JVM based languages which should make debugging and reasoning about performance of distributed systems easier using a concept called distributed stack traces. At H2O, Kuba mostly works on Sparkling Water project.
name: Hors série: H2O

Members only event

------------------------------------

Once upon a time...

there was a little girl who had never known her mother. She learned the art of her father, a famous bullfighter, but was hated by her evil stepmother. One day she ran away with a troupe of dwarves, and became a legend.

Our Christmas movie takes you to the world of fairy tales in this Spanish black-and-white silent drama directed by Pablo Berger (2012).

Blancanieves is a new take on Snow White and set in 1920s Seville.  It was the Spain's official submission to the 85th Academy Awards and despite not making the shortlist it received another 47 awards and a staggering 50 nominations.  

Awards: 47 wins and 50 nominations
IMDB rating:  7.5
Running time:  1 hour and 44 mins

The movie will start at 7.30pm, but I will get there from about 7.00pm to set up the room. There is enough space for you to join us upstairs and make use of the space.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HanTDiiZLpg


Please note that we show this movie for educational purposes within our club. This is a strict members only event. Please do not embarrass yourself (and us) by bringing a guest, who we would need to turn away.

Please note that we ask members for a contribution of £3 to allow us to budget for future events. Your support is very much appreciated! Thanks.

description:
Combine the adventure of Colorado River rafting with the Milky Way skies over the Grand Canyon, and you have the trip of a lifetime! Everything is provided for in this workshop: prepared meals, air transfers from Las Vegas to the river and back, camping equipment, entertainment, and great photo instruction by NightScape Photographer, Royce Bair.

Four experienced river guides and an assistant photo instructor will accompany us on this adventure. This trip and workshop will be very similar to our 2016 trip/workshop (check out our 5-star rating and comments).

Don't delay making your reservations. Last year, this trip and workshop filled up less than two weeks after it was announced! These trips are very popular and only a limited number of people are allowed to go down the Grand Canyon each year. Some individuals have waited for up to 20 years to obtain a permit to float through the canyon.

Total Price: Photo workshop fee is $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016). River rafting cost is $1699 ($1899 total). See "Cost" and "Other Expenses" below.

What to expect: This river trip is for all ages, 9 years to 99 years old. It’s still officially “Summer” on our September schedule, so it should be nice and warm. Although it rarely gets over 100 degrees at this time of the year, a quick dip in the water will cool you off. The large, motorized J-rig rafts are very safe and roomy (we will have 14 people on each boat compared to the normal 18). There are about 15 white water rapids on this 100-mile stretch of the Colorado. You have the option of staying fairly dry in the back of the raft, or getting wet in the front. All your meals are prepared for you (the food is amazing), and all your camping equipment is provided (cots, tents, sleeping bags, chairs and a water-resistant bag to place your camera and other personals). There is very little hiking involved. All transportation and transfers from Las Vegas to and from the river are provided.

Weather: Mid-September offers the perfect temperatures! May and Sept. are the best months to visit the bottom of the canyon. Day temps are usually 85º - 95º, with evening temps between 65º - 75º. April can be a little cold. June, July and August are often over 100º in the day. The canyon walls radiate stored heat into the evening, typically keeping the temperatures above 80º much of the night.

See the Overview/Video and Download the Brochure

This is one of my few group workshops for 2017: most are private workshops (with 2-4 people per workshop) going on next year. This Grand Canyon River Trip and Photo Workshop will have plenty of spaces available (27 spots on two boats) for my Meetup Group, past workshop alumni and their family/friends.

Extremely Dark Skies: This remote region has some of our Earth's darkest night skies. The Milky Way literally "pops"! For those who come to do night photography, you will be richly rewarded.

=========================================================

Time lapse video from our 2016 workshop by Sergio Garcia Rill.

Time lapse video from our 2016 trip by Jason Rath - courtesy of Adobe Systems, Inc.

=========================================================

Photo Instruction: I will instruct and guide those that wish to participate on these five periods:

• 1st Night - 3 hours of starry night photography (weather permitting)

• 1st Afternoon - 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

• 2nd Night - 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

• 2nd Afternoon - 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

• 3rd Night - 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

• Review and editing of results after the trip

Photography is optional: This workshop will be mostly about free time and relaxation on the Colorado River, so feel free to bring along a non-photographer friend or family member (these will not have to pay my $200 photo instruction fee).

ITINERARY:

DAY 1 » Meet in Las Vegas at 10:15 in the lobby of The Las Vegas Marriott Hotel. A motor coach will take you to the Boulder Terminal where you will begin your Grand Canyon tour with a beautiful flight to the Bar 10 Ranch. Before you start your three-day Grand Canyon river rafting adventure, you’ll enjoy an overnight stay at the Bar 10 Ranch, a working cattle ranch perched high on a plateau above the Colorado River. Your transition from civilization to wilderness includes horseback trail rides, horseshoes, ping pong, skeet shooting, dinner and evening entertainment before settling into bed in the lodge, outdoors in a covered wagon, or outside on a spacious deck. Those who have paid the additional $200 photo instruction fee will attend a 2-hour twilight and starry night workshop instruction with Royce Bair before bedding down for the night.

DAY 2 » After a big country breakfast, a helicopter takes you deep into Grand Canyon where your rafts and guides await. After orientation and introductions, you’ll be on your way downriver surrounded by soul-stirring scenery. Breathtaking canyon walls shoot skyward in a dramatic display of geologic history as you experience your first taste of Grand Canyon river rafting. Hold on for Kolb and Mile 209 Rapids! An optional afternoon canyon photo instruction tour and a 2.5 hour starry night photo workshop will follow after our evening meal.

DAY 3 » Our J-Rig rafts enter awesome Lower Granite Gorge with a series of moderate rapids including Granite Spring, Diamond Creek and Travertine. We take some time to hike, explore and play at Travertine Grotto, a fantastic series of hidden waterfalls and pools (including an afternoon photo instruction tour). Run the biggest rapids of your Grand Canyon river rafting trip, the “230’s.” After your day of adventure, you’ll savor Western’s delicious dinners at the river’s edge and appreciate the unforgettable experience of sleeping under the stars — but first we’ll do up to 3-hours of Milky Way photography for those who wish to share these memories with others back home!


DAY 4 » As you near Lake Mead, the river calms and the canyon widens. Savor your final morning in Grand Canyon as you board a jetboat to head down river and across Lake Mead to where a shuttle will return you to Las Vegas. Lunch will be provided in transit.

COST: $1699 to Western River Expeditions, and $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) to me for the photo workshop portion ($1899 total). If you have a friend or family member that is not interested in photography, the only fee is the $1699 to Western River.

Other Expenses: Airfare to Las Vegas ~ Possible overnight lodging at The Las Vegas Marriott ~ Possible Park Entrance Fee ($12) - unless you have a current Nat’l Park Pass. Western River charges a 1% processing fee ($16.99) and a $3.00 Grand Canyon Conservation Fund contribution. Those three fees bring the total to $[masked] for the river trip and another $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) to me for photo instruction (the total does not include air fare to Las Vegas or lodging in Vegas).

How to Book: 1. RSVP for this workshop and pay the $200 deposit ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) that covers the photo workshop portion of this river trip. 2. Book the river rafting portion online (requires a $300 deposit to Western River) or call Western River at[masked]-7450. Tell the operator that you want to book a “Grand Canyon 4-Day” trip. Tell them it is the chartered, “Royce Bair Photo Group”, for September 18-21, Booking #149438. They will take your contact information and charge your credit card a $300 deposit (the balance of payment is due 90 days before the event). You can also book additional non-photographer spots for family members.

The Western River offices are open from 7:00am to 6:00pm MST, Monday - Friday.
name: 2017 Grand Canyon Photo Workshop & River Rafting

description:
***
Are you interested in coaching? Great! Please fill in this form and we’ll contact you. 

***

The day will include an optional workshop for beginners (and anyone who feels like refreshing their basics), as well as free hacking and collaborating for experts and newbies alike. Around 5-6pm, we’ll wrap up and everyone is invited to demo their achievements. 

Agenda for Sunday: 

10:30 Doors open

11:00-11:15 Welcome

11:15-13:00 Coding in groups

13:00-14:00 Lunch Break (there are many food options in the area, or you can bring your own)

14:00-16:30 Coding in groups

16:30-17:00 Demos

17:00-17:30 Wrap up

An event around CSS… really?

Yes! We believe that CSS is one of the quickest and most fun ways to understand how websites are built and get your hands into coding. And that doesn’t mean CSS is for beginners only: Just check out the stunning experiments on Codepen.io. Or see what leading developers are discussing at events like CSSconf EU to get inspired and see how far you can take the language.

Who is organizing this?

The volunteer teams behind CSSconf EU and OpenTechSchool. We have experience in teaching, organizing workshops and community events, and our motivation is to share knowledge and passion for building fun and beautiful things for the web. We subscribe to the core values of OpenTechSchool and are committed to create a safe and encouraging space for learners and coaches.

Check out our website: http://cssclass.es

Learning Materials: cssclass.es/materials 
Slack channel: slack.cssclass.es

***

Are you interested in coaching? Great! Please fill in this form and we'll contact you.

***

The Basic level training works at the 1st (physical) and 2nd (emotional) pair of the 12 Strand DNA and provides students with the ability to clear physical and emotional energy blockages from the cellular memory and leave in their place positive physical and emotional energy imprints. 

Even though we call this class “basic level” this class provides you with everything you need to do a powerful Integrated Energy Therapy session on yourself or on another person (either in person or absentee). This class has been designed to be a wonderful entry level class for those students wanting to use energy therapy to heal their lives, an ideal class for students wanting to begin an energy therapy practice, and it provides a wonderful complement to other holistic techniques such as Massage, Reiki, and Therapeutic Touch. 

For more information on Integrated Energy therapy see ww.learniet.com
name: Integrated Energy Therapy ® Basic Level Training - With Alistair William
