description:
Combine the adventure of Colorado River rafting with the Milky Way skies over the Grand Canyon, and you have the trip of a lifetime! Everything is provided for in this workshop: prepared meals, air transfers from Las Vegas to the river and back, camping equipment, entertainment, and great photo instruction by NightScape Photographer, Royce Bair.

Four experienced river guides and an assistant photo instructor will accompany us on this adventure. This trip and workshop will be very similar to our 2016 trip/workshop (check out our 5-star rating and comments).

Don't delay making your reservations. Last year, this trip and workshop filled up less than two weeks after it was announced! These trips are very popular and only a limited number of people are allowed to go down the Grand Canyon each year. Some individuals have waited for up to 20 years to obtain a permit to float through the canyon.

Total Price: Photo workshop fee is $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016). River rafting cost is $1699 ($1899 total). See "Cost" and "Other Expenses" below.

What to expect: This river trip is for all ages, 9 years to 99 years old. It’s still officially “Summer” on our September schedule, so it should be nice and warm. Although it rarely gets over 100 degrees at this time of the year, a quick dip in the water will cool you off. The large, motorized J-rig rafts are very safe and roomy (we will have 14 people on each boat compared to the normal 18). There are about 15 white water rapids on this 100-mile stretch of the Colorado. You have the option of staying fairly dry in the back of the raft, or getting wet in the front. All your meals are prepared for you (the food is amazing), and all your camping equipment is provided (cots, tents, sleeping bags, chairs and a water-resistant bag to place your camera and other personals). There is very little hiking involved. All transportation and transfers from Las Vegas to and from the river are provided.

Weather: Mid-September offers the perfect temperatures! May and Sept. are the best months to visit the bottom of the canyon. Day temps are usually 85º - 95º, with evening temps between 65º - 75º. April can be a little cold. June, July and August are often over 100º in the day. The canyon walls radiate stored heat into the evening, typically keeping the temperatures above 80º much of the night.

See the Overview/Video and Download the Brochure

This is one of my few group workshops for 2017: most are private workshops (with 2-4 people per workshop) going on next year. This Grand Canyon River Trip and Photo Workshop will have plenty of spaces available (27 spots on two boats) for my Meetup Group, past workshop alumni and their family/friends.

Extremely Dark Skies: This remote region has some of our Earth's darkest night skies. The Milky Way literally "pops"! For those who come to do night photography, you will be richly rewarded.

=============================================================

Time lapse video from our 2016 workshop by Sergio Garcia Rill.

Time lapse video from our 2016 trip by Jason Rath - courtesy of Adobe Systems, Inc.

=============================================================

Photo Instruction: I will instruct and guide those that wish to participate on these five periods:

• 1st Night - 3 hours of starry night photography (weather permitting)

• 1st Afternoon - 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

• 2nd Night - 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

• 2nd Afternoon - 1 hour daytime on-shore photo tour

• 3rd Night - 3 hours starry night photography (weather permitting)

• Review and editing of results after the trip

Photography is optional: This workshop will be mostly about free time and relaxation on the Colorado River, so feel free to bring along a non-photographer friend or family member (these will not have to pay my $200 photo instruction fee).

ITINERARY:

DAY 1 » Meet in Las Vegas at 10:15 in the lobby of The Las Vegas Marriott Hotel. A motor coach will take you to the Boulder Terminal where you will begin your Grand Canyon tour with a beautiful flight to the Bar 10 Ranch. Before you start your three-day Grand Canyon river rafting adventure, you’ll enjoy an overnight stay at the Bar 10 Ranch, a working cattle ranch perched high on a plateau above the Colorado River. Your transition from civilization to wilderness includes horseback trail rides, horseshoes, ping pong, skeet shooting, dinner and evening entertainment before settling into bed in the lodge, outdoors in a covered wagon, or outside on a spacious deck. Those who have paid the additional $200 photo instruction fee will attend a 2-hour twilight and starry night workshop instruction with Royce Bair before bedding down for the night.

DAY 2 » After a big country breakfast, a helicopter takes you deep into Grand Canyon where your rafts and guides await. After orientation and introductions, you’ll be on your way downriver surrounded by soul-stirring scenery. Breathtaking canyon walls shoot skyward in a dramatic display of geologic history as you experience your first taste of Grand Canyon river rafting. Hold on for Kolb and Mile 209 Rapids! An optional afternoon canyon photo instruction tour and a 2.5 hour starry night photo workshop will follow after our evening meal.

DAY 3 » Our J-Rig rafts enter awesome Lower Granite Gorge with a series of moderate rapids including Granite Spring, Diamond Creek and Travertine. We take some time to hike, explore and play at Travertine Grotto, a fantastic series of hidden waterfalls and pools (including an afternoon photo instruction tour). Run the biggest rapids of your Grand Canyon river rafting trip, the “230’s.” After your day of adventure, you’ll savor Western’s delicious dinners at the river’s edge and appreciate the unforgettable experience of sleeping under the stars — but first we’ll do up to 3-hours of Milky Way photography for those who wish to share these memories with others back home!


DAY 4 » As you near Lake Mead, the river calms and the canyon widens. Savor your final morning in Grand Canyon as you board a jetboat to head down river and across Lake Mead to where a shuttle will return you to Las Vegas. Lunch will be provided in transit.

COST: $1699 to Western River Expeditions, and $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) to me for the photo workshop portion ($1899 total). If you have a friend or family member that is not interested in photography, the only fee is the $1699 to Western River.

Other Expenses: Airfare to Las Vegas ~ Possible overnight lodging at The Las Vegas Marriott ~ Possible Park Entrance Fee ($12) - unless you have a current Nat’l Park Pass. Western River charges a 1% processing fee ($16.99) and a $3.00 Grand Canyon Conservation Fund contribution. Those three fees bring the total to $[masked] for the river trip and another $200 ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) to me for photo instruction (the total does not include air fare to Las Vegas or lodging in Vegas).

How to Book: 1. RSVP for this workshop and pay the $200 deposit ($299 after Dec. 31, 2016) that covers the photo workshop portion of this river trip. 2. Book the river rafting portion online (requires a $300 deposit to Western River) or call Western River at[masked]-7450. Tell the operator that you want to book a “Grand Canyon 4-Day” trip. Tell them it is the chartered, “Royce Bair Photo Group”, for September 18-21, Booking #149438. They will take your contact information and charge your credit card a $300 deposit (the balance of payment is due 90 days before the event). You can also book additional non-photographer spots for family members.

The Western River offices are open from 7:00am to 6:00pm MST, Monday - Friday.
name: 2017 Grand Canyon Photo Workshop & River Rafting

description:
NOTE: This month's session will be FREE to attend, so we encourage you to invite a few sales colleagues to join you!

What exactly is channel sales and why is it so critical? For many tech companies, partners can be a significant percentage of revenue generation, and tapping into that source has been the key driver of scaling the business and fueling exponential growth.  But how do you get started and make it a successful program?

That is the question we will answer on our panel of channel experts.  Our expert speakers include:

• Derek Webster - Founder & CEO Cardflight

• Stefan Deeren - Director of Strategic Partnerships at Parsley

• Scott Pollack - VP of Business Development at WeWork

• Sue Fernand - VP of Chanel Sales Cirrus Insight

This is an excellent session for anyone that is in business development and partnership sales, as well as for companies looking to build a partnership / channel program.

Please share our community and this event with your colleagues and friends in sales.  You can post on LinkedIn and share over Twitter as well as following the conversation on our group hashtag #B2BSales and Twitter account is @Enterprise_Sale­­.

******

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS

Derek Webster is the Founder and CEO of CardFlight, based in New York City. CardFlight is a leading provider of mobile point-of-sale tools and technology that help merchants accept in-person credit card payments on iOS and Android devices. Prior to founding CardFlight, he was the Founder and CEO of LocalBonus, a credit card-linked loyalty network which rewarded consumers for purchases they make at local businesses. Earlier, Derek was an Engagement Manager at Oliver Wyman where he led C-level strategy projects for some of the leading global payment networks and retail banks. He was also part of the team that launched E*TRADE’s credit card business, where he personally led all product development and product marketing efforts for the group. Derek has an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a BS magna cum laude from Georgetown University. Follow: @websterderek 

Stefan Deeren is Director of Strategic Partnerships at Parsley, Stefan built from the ground up and currently oversees the partnership program at Parse.ly, a VC-backed analytics platform for media companies like Conde Nast, Huffington Post and Mashable. Stefan has 10+ years working on technology partnerships at enterprise SaaS companies and managing revenue-generating referral and reseller alliances. Prior to Parse.ly, Stefan managed channel partnerships at NewsCred, another VC-funded tech company based in New York.

Scott Pollack is VP of Business Development at WeWork, where he leads business development efforts in the U.S., focused on building a new Services division. As an expert in partnerships & business development, Scott built up over 15 years of experience in startups most recently as head of business development for SumAll and also Fortune 500 companies such as American Express, where he spent over a decade with. He is a regular speaker, lecturer, and teacher on business development, partnerships, and enterprise sales, and also authored the most commonly-cited definition of Business Development.

Sue Fernand is VP of Chanel Sales Cirrus Insight, the highest rated App on the Salesforce AppExchange for integrating Salesforce with Gmail, Office 365, Outlook and Mobile.  Sue manages channel partners in the Salesforce, Google and Microsoft ecosystems.  Prior to joining Cirrus Insight, Sue had over 15 years of channel sales experience in Telecom and Social Collaboration with vendors such as Cisco, Avaya, Shoretel, Mitel and Jive.

******

THANKS TO OUR EXCELLENT SPONSORS

Special thanks to Axiom for hosting our sales talk this month and Leadfeeder for sponsoring the food & beverages.

• If you like to know who is checking out your sales materials, sign up with DocSend.

• If you seek better control of your cloud IT stuff, chat with BetterCloud (and check out there JOBS).

• If you love to host invitation-only, thought-leadership driven events, talk to BDI.

• If you wish to turn your website visitors into quality sales leads, talk to Leadfeeder.

• If you want to jumpstart your sales career, let Hired find you a great job.

• If you need to increase the performance of your sales reps, get Selleration.

• If you wish to broadcast your events live, the best video solution is Livestream.

• If you are running events and need better check-in software, Boomset is the best.

The Enterprise Sales Meetup is a B2B sales community for sales professionals to share ideas, network with peers, and learn innovative approaches from proven sales leaders. The community has grown to over 10,000 sales professionals across local communities in the US, Europe and Asia If you wish to be a sponsor, please reach out to Christopher Perras at [masked] for more information.
name: Selling into the Channel

description:
Learn how to make your devices interact with your others! Bring your gear and join us for the Triggi Discovery Day, a hands-on day to learn about Triggi's Maker Channel.

Keep an eye on this page as more info may follow!

What is Triggi?

Triggi is a free app for iOS and Android and it allows you to connect a growing list of smart devices, apps and services to each other. According to rules you have defined, Triggi makes smart devices smarter by connecting them to apps, services, and other devices. It makes things easier and fun. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gEhNtVXNEhY

Currently, Triggi works with:

• Philips Hue Lighting
• Nest Thermostat
• Netatmo Weatherstation and Thermostat
• Toon Thermostat
• Weather information provided by Foreca
• Dutch EV charging stations, provided by oplaadpalen.nl
• Location information (GPS on smartphone)
• Date and time
• Sunset and sunrise
• Smartphone notification
• Twitter
• Facebook

You can find Triggi on both the iOS appstore and the Google Play store.

Hands on the Maker Channel

We'll kick off with an introduction to the Maker Channel, Triggi's initiative to facilitate makers and developers, enthousiasts, advanced users to quickly connect new stuff to Triggi, without having to develop a new channel first. The Maker channel can be used for experiments, pilots or more permanent applications that do not justify a channel to be developed and/or maintained. With the Maker channel, developers and ordinary users alike can create 'triggs' containing both actions and conditions to interface with (yet) unsupported external hardware or -services.

One the Discovery Day, Triggi will try both the Things Network as the Maker channel. They will provide some demo material as well as smart devices.

Welcome to bring along your laptop, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, sensors or any other devices you would like to connect to Triggi.

The Triggi team

Triggi developers will be present to help you out with any questions you might have on Triggi and how to connect different devices to each other.
name: The Triggi Discovery Day

While you might know Marion Cotillard for her English-speaking roles in award winning films such as Inception, this November Lost in Frenchlation is bringing you the chance to see her home-turf performance in the Madame Bovary-styled 'Mal de pierres' ('From the Land of the Moon') where she plays 'a passionate married woman consumed with sexual desire for Indochina veteran Louis Garrel in Nicole Garcia’s romantic character study' (The Hollywood Reporter). 

THE PLAN

On Friday 18 November, the screening will be held at the iconic Cinema Studio 28 in the heart of Montmartre - home to the oldest and most beautifully decorated cinema room in Paris - with a film-themed cocktail (€4.50) being served from 8pm and the film starting at 9.15pm. 

THE MOVIE

'Gabrielle (Marion Cotillard) comes from a small village in the south of France, at a time when her dream of true love is considered scandalous, and even insane. Against her will, Gabrielle’s parents marry her to José (Alex Brendemühl), an honest and loving Spanish farmer who they think will make a respectable woman of her. When she is sent away to the Alps to treat her kidney stones, André (Louis Garrel), a dashing injured veteran of the Indochina war, rekindles the passion buried inside of her. With this newfound love, Gabrielle yearns to run away with André, freeing herself from a marriage which seems to imprison her. This time, she’s determined to follow her dream.' 
- Official synopsis 

'But the soul of the film lies in watching her stumble: immaturely making mistakes and obstinately expressing her sexual needs, even though the results are invariably bad. In other words, there’s a lot here that modern viewers can relate to.' 
- The Hollywood Reporter 

VENUE/SPACE 

Studio 28 is located on 10 rue Tholozé, Montmartre 75018 Paris. Tickets to the movie will be available on the night, please arrive early to avoid disappointment. 9€ full price; 7,50€ for students and other concessions.

NOTE: STUDIO 28 DOES NOT ACCEPT CARDS - PLEASE BRING CASH!

Passion for cinema, Manon and Matt want to bring world-renown French cinema to the international community in Paris by showing French films with English subtitles, and they want to be a hub for the international community to get to know each other as well as native Parisians.

Don't miss your chance to see the popular and somewhat controversial 'Mal de pierres' with English subtitles and in true Parisian style - at the cinema! 

À bientôt!
name: Cinema night 'MAL DE PIERRES'- French Film with Eng. Subs - Lost in Frenchlation

description:
Hi All,

So Sorry I've been such a lame leader the past couple of months. I had my first solo art exhibit in NYC, and I simply couldn't focus on anything else, but that's done, and I'm ready to get this back up and running! Since I'm a little late getting this out for this month, I'm moving the date to the very end of November to give us a little more time.

So, the book for November is November- 'Between the World and Me' by Ta Nehisi Coates. In a series of essays, written as a letter to his son, Coates confronts the notion of race in America and how it has shaped American history, many times at the cost of black bodies and lives. Thoughtfully exploring personal and historical events, from his time at Howard University to the Civil War, the author poignantly asks and attempts to answer difficult questions that plague modern society. In this short memoir, the "Atlantic" writer explains that the tragic examples of Michael Brown, Trayvon Martin, and those killed in South Carolina are the results of a systematically constructed and maintained assault to black people--a structure that includes slavery, mass incarceration, and police brutality as part of its foundation. From his passionate and deliberate breakdown of the concept of race itself to the importance of the Black Lives Matter movement, Coates powerfully sums up the terrible history of the subjugation of black people in the United States. A timely work, this title will resonate with all teens--those who have experienced racism as well as those who have followed the recent news coverage on violence against people of color. 

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/17/books/review/ta-nehisi-coates-between-the-world-and-me.html?_r=0

See you then!

Angelique
name: The book for November is November- 'Between the World and Me' by Ta Nehisi Coate

description:
C'est quoi les marchés conversationnels et comment en tirer parti ?

On vous dit qu'il faut vous outiller, et résister à l'infobésité ambiante en imaginant des campagnes toujours plus astucieuses et innovantes. Oui certes : c'est la guerre digitale, il faut combattre.

Mais il y a plus urgent, et plus prometteur : apprendre à devenir vous-mêmes un vendeur augmenté, doté d'un exosquelette numérique sophistiqué, ou bien sûr, savoir comment former vos forces de vente pour le devenir.

Simplement, il faut d'abord bien comprendre : 

• pourquoi les marchés sont des marchés "conversationnels" et ce que ça veut dire, très concrètement pour une marque.

• ce que cela révèle côté acheteurs : explications autour de "l'économie de l'intention" et du social selling qui adresse cette réalité pour aborde les ventes complexes.

• comment aborder, et comment vous approprier ces conversations, et comment préparer / outiller vos équipes

Nous vous promettons des  réponses pragmatiques, de quoi y voir plus clair - venez juste avec vos questions, vos vécus, et n'hésitez pas à nous challenger durement :-)

Les speakers cumulent des années d'expérience en marketing opérationnel, y compris à l'international, ils font partie intégrante d'un cerveau collectif dédié à la transformation de la Vente et du Marketing. 

Les voici : http://efforst.org/contributeurs -

Venez les rencontrer sur le Meetup, vous verrez ils sont généreux et partagent bien volontiers.
name: C'est quoi les marchés conversationnels et comment en tirer parti ?

description:
Does being given criticism at work give you Anxiety?

If yes, you are not alone. For years, even constructive criticism would send me into a downward spiral of Anxiety, and maybe even lead me into Depression. 

Yet, being able to take criticism effectively and to use it to develop is crucial for career success and happiness.

The good news is that there are tools and techniques that you can try straight away, to help you to be ready when criticism comes your way. Even if just one of these tools resonates with you, you might find it makes an instant impact on your work and happiness.

Feel free to come armed with your own ideas about how to cope with criticism, so that we can all leave with a variety of ideas to try!
name: How to cope with criticism at work

group.name: Career Success vs. Mental Illness London Meetup

description:
Ride Name: Cycling a Quiet Trail to Ravenna past Brady’s Leap
Trail: 12 - Riverside Wine (Kent) - Peck Rd (Ravenna) - Riverside Wine (Kent)
Rating: Intermediate
Ride Type: Out and Back
Distance: 17.0 miles roundtrip You mount your saddle at Riverside wine on N. Water Street (Route 43) and head onto the Portage Bike and Hike Crain Avenue trailhead in Kent. You pass the site where Captain Samuel Brady, famed Indian fighter and legendary Kent figure, made his famous leap across the Cuyahoga River. Heading east on the Bike and Hike along an active rail line, you pass Rockwell Road and Beckwith Orchards on your way to Towner’s Woods County Park.

Cycling through heavy woods covering the trail to Ravenna, you are welcomed to Ravenna by factories and residential neighborhoods. Passing under Route 14, the trail continues to Peck Road where you turn. Cycle back to Kent enjoying the sights and sounds of nature along the trail.

Note: We meet at Riverside Wine. Park in their north parking lot on the other side of the neighboring house. Out and back rides are designed with the intermediate and advanced cyclist in mind. These rides cycle out of a trailhead to a set destination, typically 8-10 miles away. After a break, the riders cycle back to the departure trailhead.

Tonight’s ride travels at 10-12 mph and typically takes 2 hours including photo-ops and rest stops. The ride is rated for leisure cyclists who enjoy cycling 10-12 mph on flat trails with an occasional hill or elevation gain. The trail surface is mixed with areas of both asphalt and packed limestone. It is relatively flat with some moderate elevation changes. The ride should be a comfortable ride for the intermediate cyclist.

This ride is on the calendar of the Spin-off Cyclists . We encourage you to join us on this and other rides. We are a group of cyclists of all ages and abilities who cycle the trails of Northeast Ohio and surrounding areas for fun, health and friendship.

description:
Learn how to make your own devices interact with others! Bring your gear and join us for the Triggi Discovery Day, a hands-on day to learn about Triggi's Maker Channel.

Keep an eye on this page as more info may follow!

What is Triggi?

Triggi is a free app for iOS and Android and it allows you to connect a growing list of smart devices, apps and services to each other. According to rules you have defined, Triggi makes smart devices smarter by connecting them to apps, services, and other devices. It makes things easier and fun. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gEhNtVXNEhY

Currently, Triggi works with:

• Philips Hue Lighting
• Nest Thermostat
• Netatmo Weatherstation and Thermostat
• Toon Thermostat
• Weather information provided by Foreca
• Dutch EV charging stations, provided by oplaadpalen.nl
• Location information (GPS on smartphone)
• Date and time
• Sunset and sunrise
• Smartphone notification
• Twitter
• Facebook

You can find Triggi on both the iOS appstore and the Google Play store.

Hands on the Maker Channel

We'll kick off with an introduction to the Maker Channel, Triggi's initiative to facilitate makers and developers, enthousiasts, advanced users to quickly connect new stuff to Triggi, without having to develop a new channel first. The Maker channel can be used for experiments, pilots or more permanent applications that do not justify a channel to be developed and/or maintained. With the Maker channel, developers and ordinary users alike can create 'triggs' containing both actions and conditions to interface with (yet) unsupported external hardware or -services.

One the Discovery Day, Triggi will try both the Things Network as the Maker channel. They will provide some demo material as well as smart devices.

Welcome to bring along your laptop, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, sensors or any other devices you would like to connect to Triggi.

The Triggi team

Triggi developers will be present to help you out with any questions you might have on Triggi and how to connect different devices to each other.
name: The Triggi Discovery Day

Ladies, sign up here...

*There will only be as many spots available for guys as there are ladies signed up. We can only have a maximum of 40 people, so 20 guys/20 ladies. Unfortunately, Meetup doesn't let me create a wait-list since I'm charging for the event, so keep an eye out for availability.


Event: Meet & Greet
Dress Code: See our definition of semi-formal below
Place: Jammy Buggars
Private Room
Address: 15625 Detroit Ave., Lakewood, Ohio 44107 - (216)[masked]
Date: Dec 11, 2016
Time: TBD (probably 3pm)
Cost: $5

Let's get dressed up and look our best for a December Meet-and-Greet at Jammy Buggars in Lakewood. This event is semi-casual (meaning no blue jeans)... A tie isn't required for guys, but a dress pants & a dress shirt or sweater for guys is the minimum expected. Guys are welcome to wear a suit and tie if they wish. It never hurts to be the best-dress guy in the room. For ladies, semi-formal probably means a dress or skirt, but I will let people decide for themselves how they want to look their best.

There will be a non-refundable $5 charge in order to help prevent no-shows and last minute RSVP changes, so only sign up if you're sure you can make it.  The $5 charge does not include the price of your food & drinks.

If anyone wants to help plan games, that would be much appreciated.  It would be nice to try to plan some interactive games so that we can get to know each other a little better, or if people just prefer to mingle, that's fine too. If you help with the planning of the event, there will not be a charge for you. The venue closes at 6pm, so we'll have 3 hours to hang out of we need that much time.

Couples are welcome, but you will both need to RSVP individually.

If this event is a success, we will plan more like it in the future.

See you there!

description:
It is a requirement to read the following trip posting very carefully and to make the proper and responsible preparations for it. Failure to do so, will result in participant not allowed on this trip. As a potential participant, you must check this trip posting for additional directions from the organizer, including up to trip cancellation. 

Trip Description:

This hike will be in completed in the reverse order that it is normally completed. Hike is comprised of three trails which loop back to where you start. We will park at the Powderface Trail head, start on the Prairie Creek Trail then go on Prairie Link Trail and return back to the parking lot via Powderface Trail.  

It will take us thru open meadows,  aspen forest and interesting canyon walls. Toward the halfway point of the Prairie Creek section you rise to a high point above Prairie Creek which has drop off steep canyon walls.

Distance: 12 km

Accumulated Elevation Gain: 375 meters - some steep descents - may be an issue for those with knee injuries.

Time: 4 hrs on trail + 1.75 hrs driving.

Event Pace: Steady with rest stops.

Number of Hikers: 8

Required Gear: Backpack with lunch, water, snacks - layered clothing - jacket, gloves, winter hat.  MICRO-SPIKES ARE MANDATORY  - recent hike had icy sections. 

Recommended Gear: Poles, gaiters and bear spray.

Gas Fee contribution: $10.00 per person.  If wanting to ride share indicate this information in the comments section.

Waiver:

As per the new policy for waivers, I will bring the group waiver form with me to the trailhead. You must sign it before you will be allowed to go on this event. You will also be asked for the name and phone number of an emergency contact. Please come prepared with this information.

Your participation in this event means you have read the waiver and by signing up for this event you have accepted the waiver. If you have stated "no" in your profile you will not be accepted to participate. You are fully aware that organizers are not professional guides and you assume all responsibility for your safety and well-being. You are fully prepared with proper gear and you're physically fit to do this hike with the group.

You are fully aware that organizers are not professional guides and you assume all responsibility for your safety and well-being. You are fully prepared with proper gear and you're physically fit to do this event with the group

All participants are responsible for assessing the current road conditions, current weather conditions, your current physical condition, current trail conditions and current avalanche conditions for the trip and you are responsible for your safety and well-being. You are fully prepared with proper gear and you're physically fit to do this hike with the group.
name: Prairie Creek/Prairie Link/Powderface Creek Loop - T2

description:
This is NOT a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. There is significant elevation gain.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp/lightsource, extra batteries and fluids/snacks as needed. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together.  You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

T-Storms Cancel. Heavy rain cancels or may modify the route. This would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1500

Hike time: 2 hours

Map: NYNJTC #119

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
name: Bear Mountain Monday

description:
In this last ProductTank of the year in Malmö, we welcome our guest speaker Laszlo Fogas to inspire us about team culture from a leadership perspective.

Agenda
* Intro
* Presentation: "Habits of scalable technical organizations"
* BYOP - Bring Your Own Problem
* Pizza, beer and more product discussions

About the speaker
Laszlo Fogas is a software consultant, former early employee and Director of Engineering of Falcon.io. Laszlo helps teams to mature their engineering practices to become scalable product organizations.

About BYOP
Through our BYOP ("Bring Your Own Problem") discussions, you can bring a problem you are currently facing and let other product managers come with ideas on how to approach you challenge. This is an interactive presentation combined with smaller group discussions on a topic that is important to you.

Use attendee status on this event to indicate interest and receive updates, and please register at foocafe.org to reserve your seat. Also, please comment below to discuss the agenda and what you'd like to get out of this event. We listen and adjust to your needs. Thanks. 

Seeking Lightning talkers: if you have experiences you'd like to share, or know of someone you'd love to hear speak at ProductTank, let us know. We're always looking for interesting topics and presenters.
name: Habits of scalable technical organizations

description:
Join us in a beautiful, fun practitioner reiki share to get recharged, honor each other as healers and meet like minded reiki love-bunnies for connection and friendship! Everyone will enjoy time on the reiki table for mini treatments. Participate in a communal distance reiki transmission as a powerful and sweet way to gather in service and love for the greater good! Afterwards, gather around the fire and share tea, good cheer and healthy social medicine. <3

Please arrive on time between 6:45-7pm. We will begin building the grid promptly at 7:00 and respectfully request no late arrivals after 7pm.

Event timeline:

    6:45 Arrivals

    7:00-7:30 - Build distance reiki crystal grid, meditate & send distance reiki transmission

    7:30 - 8:45 - Community reiki share -- two reiki tables set up for simultanious reiki treatments

    8:45 - 9:30 - Tea social around the fire

Event Details:

more info: http://artemisiashine.com/reiki-is-love

- We gather to charge each other up with reiki love and to build a beautiful reiki crystal grid to send concentrated distance reiki out near and far. All lineages and practitioner levels are welcome. The main purpose of this gathering is for practitioners to unite to give and receive reiki in an atmosphere of friendship, support and love and to send communal distance reiki to wherever it is needed most. 

- Reiki practitioners (of any level) may invite up to 2 non-reiki practitioner guests. If you are a non-reiki practitioner and have not been invited by a reiki practitioner, please send a message to the host (Artemisia Shine) to request to join. We strive to be inclusive AND need to maintain a balance to ensure we have enough reiki practitioners for everyone to have time on the reiki tables. 

- We start by co-creating a reiki crystal grid to send out distance reiki together. All levels may participate. Level II reiki practitioners will charge the grid with distance reiki symbols, all others will contribute reiki, love and good intentions. Bring your sacred stone allies and any photos/reiki requests (better yet, use and share this link to submit distance reiki requests in advance!) to place in the center of the grid.

- You are encouraged to liberally share this free distance reiki request link with friends, family, co-workers, frenemies and the like as well as submit your own reiki requests in advance (to be printed by the host) to: http://artemisiashine.com/reiki-is-love

- Afterwards, we will share yummy organic herbal tea, vegetarian treats, and enjoy the warm post-reiki glow of sweet company around the fire. Please bring tea supplies or vegetarian finger treats to share.

- minimum $5 fee is to offset the cost of meet-up fees, crystals, firewood, tea, snacks, etc.

- 💞Further Donations are enthusiastically accepted to offset the cost of printing photos/reiki requests as well as tea, nut milk, honey, crystals, firewood & supplies - keep the energy exchange flowing! 💞

What a great way to spend the third Tuesday night of every month! Come join us!

Visit http://artemisiashine.com/reiki-is-love for more information about reiki or http://artemisiashine.com to find out more about the event host, Artemisia Shine.
name: Reiki Share, Distance Reiki Crystal Grid Transmission + Fire Social

description:
Kendrick will run a game of OSAKA NO EXIT again.

JOINING THE GAME

There are 5 spaces. I request that two spaces are left free for people who do not play regularly in the Demon Hunters game, so that more players can play RPGs in this group! I will also try to give priority to the people who were waitlisted for the previous game.


---------

2069. Osaka. 2am. Rain drizzles on tarmac, sparkling puddles reflect sodium streetlights and neon billboards.

Imagine a future where everything that could go wrong, has gone wrong: Tel Aviv is a smoking irradiated hole. Climate change runs out of control. Manhattan is the new Venice, 2m below the waterline. Texas and California have seceded. The EU is long gone and Europe is ruled by a panoply of petty dictators. Russia and China make increasingly aggressive claims on their neighbours. The Internet is the frontline in a new cyber-cold war.

In Japan, the zaibatsu are run by the Yakuza, and the only comfortable work is living isolated in giant corporate arcologies away from the decaying city centres.

Downtown Osaka is a crumbling mess, filled with drug dealers, immigrants, street gangs, the unhinged and the destitute. Word is that the Yakuza like it that way, the better to pick out the best of the street samurai to elevate into positions of corporate skullduggery.

You the players take the role of these street samurai: skilled at theft, violence, persuasion and more, wielding cybernetics, illicit weaponry and exotic technology. Can you break out of the street life? Into the glory of corporate warfare, or to reclaim your own humanity? Do you have pride and honour, or are you the scum of the earth?

Join OSAKA NO EXIT and find out.
name: Pen n' Paper Evening -  OSAKA NO EXIT

description:
Attend our growth hacking meetup to learn from growth cases from other companies, listen to the expert panel discussion and contributions from the audience. The meetup is open to everyone who is interested in new customer acquisition, activation and retention strategies. 

This meetup will include:

• Growth cases -  We invited 3 startups to give a 5 min overview of their growth strategy, these are companies that have implemented something new, experimented with customer acquisition channels or simply are stuck and are looking for ideas. They have been warned that their ideas & strategies will be heavily scrutinized!

• Panel - We invited experts in relevant fields to validate and provide input to the discussion (i.e. SEO, AdWords, Social, Development, Analytics etc.). Following the startup presentation, each case will be discussed for 15 minutes. During this time the audience can ask questions, contribute, challenge the panel & startups. This time we have a special guest coming all the way from the United States.

• The discussion will be moderated to ensure we stay on track to ensure maximum value for the startups & audience.

description:
Half Day Retreat

A period of intensive insight meditation practice has a long history of helping individuals foster wisdom, compassion, equanimity, loving kindness and joy. A retreat with others may also energize and deepen mindfulness, as well as help to strengthen a sense of sangha (community of spiritual friends).

With these things in mind, we would like to, whenever possible, provide a free monthly half day meditation retreat for those wishing to deepen their mindfulness practice. The location is a private residence in an ideal setting for meditation and a great place to enjoy the beauty of the North Georgia mountains. All you need to bring is the willingness to unplug from your hectic life for a few hours. Meditation cushions and chairs are provided. There is no cost for this retreat. Directions to the retreat site and meeting agenda are below.

Bio: Mark is an Insight Meditation teacher, who began his meditation practice more than 40 years ago with insight meditation teachers Joseph Goldstein, Sharon Salzberg, and Jack Kornfield. His primary teacher has been Joseph Goldstein, and he has trained more recently with guiding senior insight teachers Rodney Smith and Narayan Liebenson. His primary teaching emphasis is practical Essential Buddhism and how mindfulness in all aspects of daily life can provide an opportunity for awakening.  He has studied with numerous other teachers primarily in the Theravada tradition, but also in the Tibetan and Zen traditions.

He has done 3 three-month silent retreats and dozens of other retreats mostly at the Insight Meditation Society, the Forest Refuge, and the Barre Center for Buddhist Studies. He is an organizer/facilitator at the Sandy Springs Insight Meditation Group, is the guiding Insight Meditation teacher for the Half Day retreat, and leads silent retreats in Georgia. He is also an ordained Presbyterian deacon and has a doctorate in Psychology. 

NOTE: If you are on the waiting list, please call or email us to be sure of space availability! If your plans change and you are unable to attend, please cancel your RSVP so that others may attend.*

description:
Träff för de som jobbar inom offentlig sektor, samt de som på ett eller annat sätt stöttar offentlig sektor kring utvärderandet av digital kommunikation och delaktighet.

Vi inom offentlig sektor behöver lära av varandra hur vi mäter och bevisar att värde uppstår med våra digitala initiativ. 

Hur kommer satsningarna medborgarna tillgodo och hur följer vi upp det? Vad utmärker en lyckad användarsession på en webbplats?

Det här blir en träff i två delar. Dels en introduktion till utmaningarna med webbanalys (där Marcus "gråter ut" om den utmaning han tror vi alla lider av med webbanalys i offentlig sektor). Sedan följt av diskussioner, rådslag och exempel på hur man kan ta sig till nästa nivå.

Antagligen är det inte bara inom VGR som arbetet med webbanalys haltar, så förutom att hitta lite tröst så är målet med träffen att hitta konkreta förbättringsåtgärder att ta tag i nästa arbetsdag.

Agenda:

• Introduktion till webbanalys: möjligheter och svårigheter (20 minuter) 
VGRs webbanalytiker (Marcus Österberg) ger en bild av nuläge och önskat läge när det gäller webbanalys. tl;dr, det är väldigt lite agerande på data.

• Fika (10 minuter)

• Diskussion, så-här-gör-vi-hos-oss, etc (2 timmar)
Alla bidrar med sina utmaningar, tips på hur man överkommit svårigheter, förslag på verktyg och rapporter.

Varmt välkommen!
name: Nätverka om mätbara mål med webbplatser & e-tjänster

description:
Salut tous !!!


Nous organisons Une journée “Otaku”


+ Quand: le samedi 19 novembre
+ Rendez-vous: 14H00
+ Lieu: Gare Nishi-Ogikubo (JR 西荻窪駅) la sortie (改札口)
+ Durée: environ 3 heures
+ Le Prix: JPY300


14h00: Rendez-vous à la gare
14h15: Départ
14h30: Visite du Musée de l’animation
15h30: Départ pour Nakano
16h00: Arrivée à Nakano et visite du Nakano Broadway (Mandarake, etc..)
17h00 environ: Fin. Nous allons au cafe ou Izaka-ya ensemble.


<AAA>

Musée de l'Animation de Suginami Ce musée du film d'animation propose de plonger dans un monde où les dessins prennent vie.
Le quartier de Suginami tient à sa réputation, celle du quartier tokyoïte de l'animation. Beaucoup de studios y ont ainsi leur siège
Du crayon à l'ordinateur
Il est un peu petit, certes, mais on peut y passer des heures. Le Suginami Animation Museum propose une riche collection de documents sur le cinéma animé. A l'entrée, un brochure en anglais permet de faire le point. L'histoire de l'animation japonaise est ainsi retracée depuis ses origines... en 1907 !
Au centre du bâtiment, un mur arbore les dédicaces des grands mangaka venus y donner des conférences. Pour bien comprendre le chemin qui a été fait, une immense frise chronologique présente les grandes dates. Quelques animés d'époque sont diffusé sur une télé noir et blanc, entourée de statuettes de collection. Sur le côté, des espaces de travail sont reconstitués. Ils témoignent de l'évolution des méthodes de production du crayon à l'ordinateur


<BBB>

Nakano Broadway

C’est le lieu rêvé pour tout bon collectionneur qui se respecte! On y trouve de tout (surtout pour le retrogaming), des objet d’occasion en très bonne état mais aussi du matériel pour Cosplayer, des livres, vêtements (lollita, spécial gamer, spécial design, ...), etc…
Nakano Broadway est une immense galerie marchande idéale pour les chineurs et fan de bonne affaire! On y trouve en autre le fameux magasin Mandarake (en plus petit version que celui d’Akihabara, mais avec des objets différents)
Durant la visite, nous organiserons un moment temps libre pour que vous puissiez fouinez un peu et faire quelques achats.
name: Une journée “Otaku”, visitons Musée de l’animation et Nakano

description:
Just a reminder to our members....

While human guests are welcome on most of our hikes, please be sure that they realize how we travel. We've had a few "guests" who seem quite put out with our slower pace, or with all of our stops to play or water the dogs. They wear a grumpy face and it's clear they're unhappy.

Really? They aren't even a member, their grumpy faces are ridiculous.

There are plenty of great meetup groups for those who want to hike at a faster pace. We are not one of them! Our group travels at it's own pace, our members are used to it, and we do not adjust our speed for a guest who wants us to walk at their pace.

Please leave the grumpy people at home.
name: "GUESTS" on our Dog Hikes

description:
Who is this workshop for?
The workshop is for anyone interested in voice and sound as a source of courage, fun and power. It makes no difference whether you have or haven’t previous experience of singing or music! What is the workshop about?
Our sound is the simplest and most ancient of all the sources of our creative power. Many of us experienced a deep disconnection from this source at a very young age when we were told we could not sing or we had ‘no voice’. Something healing and magical occurs when we reconnect to this source and find the sound of our own heart and soul. Through it, we move into a new relationship with our creativity, our wisdom and our innate ability to heal and nurture ourselves, no matter what our journey. What will we be doing?
Participants will be introduced to The Naked Voice methodology of sound and voice developed by internationally renowned singer and composer Chloe Goodchild. During the day we will work with singing, silence, movement and play. Who is the Facilitator?
Emer has trained for many years with Chloe Goodchild and is an accredited Naked Voice Facilitator. She has also studied with the UK College of Sound Healing. Emer holds an MSc and works as a trainer in community development and holistic well-being. She has recently released her first CD Eldersong of her own haunting and inspiring songs – see website & facebook & listen to full songs on Breaking Tunes link. Available on itunes, Amazon & Spotify. Booking Essential
Please phone, text or email Emer ;
[masked]; [masked]
name: The Healing Voice Workshop - with Emer Dolphin

【About Tokyo Pub Crawl】

We're a regular group of pub crawlers in Tokyo. It all started about 5 years ago, with a few buddies from work getting friends together to grab some beers on the weekend. We thought it would be fun to visit many bars in one night.  And after 300 events with thousands of new pub crawling friends joining, and we're still going strong!!

Pub crawls are a great alternative to regular International Parties or all-you-can drink parties because:

• We move to a new bar every hour - keeps things fun and interesting!
• In addition to having a chat, there is plenty of space to DANCE and let loose :)
• The event is open to ANYONE who wants to have fun. Not just study language. People often see us on the street and join us because it looks cool.
• You can join and leave (and re-join) the pub crawl at any time!
• By the end, everyone feels like they are partying with 50 new friends
• The last stop is always a popular dance club. And entrance fee is included!

Coming alone?
Don't worry. Many people come alone, so we mix the group and have fun together. Groups are welcome, too.

【東京パブクロールについて】

私たちは東京でパブクロールを開催しているグループてます。5年前、週末に一緒にお酒を飲む友達と始めました。私たちは一晩で沢山のバーを回れたら楽しいと考えたのです。何千人もの新しいパブクロールフレンドと300回のイベントを重ね、私たちはまだまだ成長していきます！

パブクロールが素晴らしい国際交流パーティー もしくは 飲み放題パーティーである理由:

• 毎時間新しいバーに移動します - 飽きることがありません!
• おしゃべりに加えて, たくさんのダンススペースがあります:)
• 楽しみたい人は誰でも参加可能。言葉を学ぶだけじゃありません。道で私たちを見かけた人が参加するのは、パブクロールがクールだから！
• いつでも参加（再入場）可能。いつでも帰れます。
• 最後には50人の新しい友達とパーティーしている様な気がしてきます！
• 最後に訪れるクラブは有名クラブ。クラブの入場料はパブクロールの入場料に含まれているから、安心！

1人で参加？
心配しないでください！沢山の人が1人で参加されますし、私たちも皆さんが一緒に楽しめる様にグループをミックスします。もちろん、団体の方もウェルカムです！

description:
Join other NYC professionals for a private afterwork social where you will get to taste a wide variety of wines in a fun, relaxed environment. Red and white wines will be included in the line -up of featured pours. A sommelier will offer details about each wine and how it was made. 

IMPORTANT: The RSVPs shown for this group DO NOT reflect the total number of people registered. We have 4 different groups plus an outside networking group sponsoring this event.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$35 - Pre-pay only - We need an approximate headcount at least 24 hours in advance of the event. Price goes up to $39 the week of the event.

https://advivywine.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

*CREDITS ARE AVAILABLE IF YOU CANCEL AT LEAST 2 DAYS IN ADVANCE.

*NO REFUNDS ARE AVAILABLE UNLESS THE EVENT IS CANCELED


These events are ideal if you're looking to make new friends and broaden your social circle as well as network. This will be a small intimate group (less than 40 people) so that you have the chance to meet everybody in attendance.

Our members are eclectic and educated, many of which are graduates from competitive institutions, culture enthusiasts, or have moved to NYC from other countries.

Included in the night:

*Unlimited light pours of 6 red and white wines from around the world

*A sommelier to provide information about each wine

*Platters of cheese

*Rental of a private space recently profiled in the NY Times as one of the best wine stores in Manhattan

*Ice breakers & conversations starters to help people interact.

*Quiet atmosphere ideal for mingling and socializing

Should I bring business cards? YES! We encourage all attendees to exchange business cards.

Will everybody in attendance be single? No, but most will be due to the nature of the groups co-sponsoring the event.

What is the dress code? What you wore to work will do. You can jazz it up and throw on a jacket or cocktail dress if you like. Just please no sneakers or active wear.

Can I come alone? Yes

Is this event social? Yes! We like to give our networking events a social vinbe by including ice breakers and conversation starters. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. We can not accept payment at the door since the venue needs an accurate headcount at least 24 hours in advance.

Will there be even number of men and women in attendance? We can't guarantee that. Expect a 60/40 ratio men to women for the under 35 events & 60/40 ratio women to men for the over 35 events..

 CO-SPONSORED BY:

Wine & Networking for 40's & 50's Professionals

Networking for NYC Professionals
Networking for International Professionals
Well Educated Singles
Networking for Wine Lovers of NYC


Learn more & Join our mailing list here to receive invites to non-Meetup affiliated events: http://www.buffsandbrainiacs.com/

description:
From the beginning of time, sacred movements and music have brought people together and healed the soul. In ancient Persia, there were seven sacred animals, birds, and flowers believed to have carried the spirit of the Gods. Numerous archeological antiquities and temples have been found that show the connection between animals and dance. These animals were a symbol of the power of life and represented as a spiritual instrument and these seven sacred birds each represented a certain Persian God or Goddess. These rituals and movements are considered the earliest known form of Persian dance and the origin of sacred dance. The origins of Iranian Shamanic rituals, sacred circles, and the mysteries of Sema will also be discussed.

Bio: Farima Berenji

Farima Berenji is an Iranian-born scholar and dance ethnologist, an award winning internationally acclaimed dance artist, a choreographer, instructor, and an archaeologist specializing in ancient, sacred, classical, and folkloric dances of Persia, Ionia, and the Silk Road. Farima has spent her lifetime studying Persian dance, culture, and history. She performs, offers workshops, and lectures worldwide upon request and has appeared in North America, UK, Austria, Czech Republic, Turkey, Mauritius, and Iran. Recognized as one of a few world scholarly experts of ancient and mystical dance ethnology, she travels worldwide to record, research, lecture, perform, educate, and to inspire dynamic creativity and rejuvenation through dance and movement. As a Sufi and semazen, Farima is an exceptionally inspiring instructor strongly connected to spirituality and healing. She infuses spirituality into her dance and teachings to inspire others to explore dance as a powerful means of expressing emotion, facilitating spiritual healing, and to bridge cultures. Farima teaches her own original findings, methods, techniques, and exercises to uncover the connection between the soul and dance movement. United in all her accomplishments is her contribution in advocating art, culture, and dance to help bridge cultural gaps and create respect among all people. Learn more, watch videos, and admire photos at http://farimadance.com.
name: Ancient Persian Sacred Rituals and Whirling Meditation with Farima Berenji

description:
FUCK UP NIGHTS SYDNEY VOL.3

Free early bird tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fuckup-nights-sydney-vol-3-tickets-29102456230

First announced speakers:

Phoebe Adams, CEO Our Little Foxes 

Benjamin Kassel, Managing Director and Founder Haimat 

Elizabeth Kaelin, CEO Caitre'd 

Emma Denise House, Creative Currency Copywriting

--------

 I. WHAT ARE FUCK UP NIGHTS?

FuckUp Nights is a global movement where stories of failed businesses and projects are told, questioned and celebrated.

The concept evolved from a mezcal-infused conversation between five friends who felt the need to break free from the stigmas surrounding "failure". As fellow entrepreneurs and soon-to-be fuckupreneurs, they deeply believed in communicating failure as a positive step everyone must overcome on the road to success.

II. WHY DO WE DO IT?

• Because the majority of professionals don't create the "project of the year" in their first attempt

• Because one can learn more from stories of failure than from stories of success.

III. HOW IS IT DONE?

In every FuckUp Night each speaker (3 speakers in this case) tells their story: What was the project? What went wrong? What did they learn? What would they do differently?

For updates of our speakers, future events or questions feel free to contact FuckUp Nights Sydney at https://www.facebook.com/FUNSydney

For more info check you can visit: http://fuckupnights.com/
name: FuckUp Nights Sydney Vol. 3

description:
Start: Farnham Station

Time : 11.00

Walk distance: 6.5 miles

Join us for an autumnal walk following in some medieval footsteps. 

We start at Farnham train station and head through the historic town to Farnham Park.

The Bishop of Winchester, who used Farnham Castle as one of his residences, created Farnham Park in 1376. He enclosed fields, woods and pastures as his own private park for keeping deer and other game. Its boundary has remained largely unchanged for 600 years. 

Leaving the Park we head out into the Farnham countryside and enjoy a walk taking in different landscapes.


Towards the end of the walk we will stop off at Farnham castle, founded in 1138 by Henry of Bois, Bishop of Winchester and brother of King Stephen. 

The impressive motte and keep is free to visit but English Heritage do have a collection box if you are able to make a small donation to help towards its upkeep. 

From the castle it is a short walk back into the town where you are free to explore or join us for lunch or a drink at Cote in the lovely cobbled Lamb and Lion Yard, with its luxury shops. 

Walking pace: Brisk (2.5 to 3 miles/hour) 

Meetup fee of £2 per person 

For those driving, you can park at Farnham station for £2, but the ticket machines DO NOT take change, you will need a credit card or download the app.
name: FARNHAM CASTLE & DEER PARK

description:
Hi All,

The book for December is  'Did You Ever Have a Family' by Bill Clegg. On the eve of her daughter’s wedding, June Reid’s life is completely devastated when a shocking disaster takes the lives of her daughter, her daughter’s fiancé, her ex-husband, and her boyfriend, Luke—her entire family, all gone in a moment. And June is the only survivor.

Alone and directionless, June drives across the country, away from her small Connecticut town. In her wake, a community emerges, weaving a beautiful and surprising web of connections through shared heartbreak.

From the couple running a motel on the Pacific Ocean where June eventually settles into a quiet half-life, to the wedding’s caterer whose bill has been forgotten, to Luke’s mother, the shattered outcast of the town—everyone touched by the tragedy is changed as truths about their near and far histories finally come to light. 

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/06/books/review/did-you-ever-have-a-family-by-bill-clegg.html

See you then!

Angelique
name: The book for December is 'Did You Ever Have a Family' by Bill Clegg

description:
Bonjour à tous,

Les Apéros UX font leur rentrée. On commençait à avoir soif (d’apprendre) !

Je vous propose de nous retrouver tous la semaine prochaine, le mardi 08 Novembre à partir de 18h30.

Attention nouveau lieu : le Café Latin ne reçoit plus de groupes donc nous nous retrouverons cette fois au bar « Le 23 », 23 Rue Ecuyere à Caen.

L’actualité a été chargée pour les UX Designers qui se déplacent dans les conférences et meetups nationaux, et nous revenons avec plein de surprise dans notre besace.

Au programme de ce Meetup :

• Tour de table et présentation des nouveaux arrivants.

• Séquence de « Serve Da Needz » : chacun exprime ses besoins en matière d’UX. Dans quels aspects de l’UX voulez-vous vous former ou progresser ? Qui propose ou qui recherche un job, un stage dans l’UX ? Qui recherche des partenaires, sous-traitants ou quo-fondateurs ? Avez-vous des besoins pour vos travaux ou vos recherches en cours ?

• Présentation des Emotionnal Cards, une technique d’idéation expérimentale. Ces cartes permettent de concevoir des produits qui génèrent des émotions positives.

Cet apéro sera surtout, comme les précédents, un bon prétexte pour se retrouver et partager nos expériences respectives dans une ambiance conviviale.

Alors je vous dis, à mardi prochain !

Laurent

PS : Inscription obligatoire (pour réserver les places à l'étage du "23"). Le meetup aura donc lieux à l'étage. Les boissons sont à votre charge.
name: Apéro UX Design #4 : "La maturité"

description:
All enquiries to: [masked] /[masked] 

The Event

The Game Lab brings together teams of games developers and leading research scientists. The challenge is to work together over a period of 48 hours to incorporate the latest stem cell science into a completely new and playable game.

The event starts with a tour of our laboratories and a crash course in stem cell science (no prior knowledge required!). We hope that participants will be inspired by the ground-breaking research that we do and will be able bring their creativity and technical expertise to showcase our work in an original format. Equally, our researchers will appreciate the opportunity to learn some games basics. 

We hosted our first Game Lab in 2015 and are currently working with the winning team to produce their proposed game! This year the event is supported the MRC Festival of medical research

SCHEDULE

Friday 11th November

4:00pm: Interactive tour of the Stem Cell Institute laboratories
5:30pm: Wine reception to form teams.*

*if you cannot attend the tour you can join on Saturday morning 

Saturday 12th November

10:00am: Official launch - Announcement of theme and all rules, regulations and expectations 
01:00pm: Lunch - Hot paninis 
06:00pm: Dinner - pies and gravy
08.30pm: Building closes

Sunday 13th November

09:00am: Breakfast - continental
01:00pm: Lunch - bounteous buffet 
04:30pm: Presentations of final games to judges
05:30: Awards ceremony 

JUDGING

A panel of judges, including scientific & games industry experts will award two prizes:

1) Best Game
2) Best Scientific Content 

In addition to individual prizes on the day, we may choose to work with any of the entered teams to develop their concept further. 

TECH
Each team will have access to a monitor. Participants should bring their own laptops, chargers and any other cables.

REFRESHMENTS
Thanks to generous support from the Medical Research Council, drinks and snacks will be available throughout the jam, to keep the creative juices keep flowing!

REGISTRATION
All participants should have some prior experience of creating games (this includes games art and sound). Places are limited so you must register here to be guaranteed entry. 

If you are a stem cell researcher or biologist who would like to take part, DO NOT register here - please contact Philippa: [masked]

PARKING
There is no parking available at Tennis Court Road - please make other arrangements. 

ACCESSIBITY
Our building is wheelchair accessible, please contact us if you require any additional support to take part:
name: Game Lab 2016 - A Game Jam at Stem Cell Institute

description:
Who is this workshop for?
The workshop is for anyone interested in voice and sound as a source of courage, fun and power. It makes no difference whether you have or haven’t previous experience of singing or music! What is the workshop about?

Our sound is the simplest and most ancient of all the sources of our creative power. Many of us experienced a deep disconnection from this source at a very young age when we were told we could not sing or we had ‘no voice’. Something healing and magical occurs when we reconnect to this source and find the sound of our own heart and soul. Through it, we move into a new relationship with our creativity, our wisdom and our innate ability to heal and nurture ourselves, no matter what our journey. What will we be doing?

Participants will be introduced to The Naked Voice methodology of sound and voice developed by internationally renowned singer and composer Chloe Goodchild. During the day we will work with singing, silence, movement and play. Who is the Facilitator?

Emer has trained for many years with Chloe Goodchild and is an accredited Naked Voice Facilitator. She has also studied with the UK College of Sound Healing. Emer holds an MSc and works as a trainer in community development and holistic well-being. She has recently released her first CD Eldersong of her own haunting and inspiring songs – see website & facebook & listen to full songs on Breaking Tunes link. Available on itunes, Amazon & Spotify. 

Booking Essential
Please phone, text or email Emer ;
[masked]; [masked]
name: The Healing Voice Workshop - with Emer Dolphin

Please note! It is required that you book your tickets through the link provided (RSVP is not enough)

Dim Sum crazy? We got your back!

100's of you have already joined London Cookery School for Dim Sum making experiences which are always a winner with Funzingers. For the new year, Will is bringing something fresh to the table!

Will is going piggie this time as you'll learn how to make the delicious & addictive Roast Pork (Char Sui) Buns and Emerald Pork and Chive Dumplings! We're salivating just at the thought.

Suitable for beginners, in this experience you will be under the expert tuition of the London Cookery School instructors and you'll learn all the processes involved in making
Char Sui Bao (Fluffy Roast Pork Buns)
JuYook Gow Choi Gau (Pork and Chive dumplings)

You will be guided step by step, from learning how Char Sui is made, making proofing and rolling the dough, preparing and mixing the fillings, forming the buns and dumplings and cooking.

Book your spot today & take some advice from a fellow dim sum addict - you do not want to miss out on this one!!

 This class is not suitable for those that cannot eat pork, wheat flour, soy sauce and yeast.

description:
This event is being sponsored by 5 separate Wine & Networking Meetups. The RSVPs on this page do not reflact total number of RSVPs or people prepaid. Pre-payment is required to confirm venue.

Join other NYC professionals for a private afterwork social where you will get to taste a wide variety of wines in a fun, relaxed environment. Red and white wines will be included in the line -up of featured pours. A sommelier will offer details about each wine and how it was made. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$35 Admission - Prepay only

https://advivywine.eventbrite.com

Please note that admission will increase to $39 a couple days before the event

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

These events are ideal if you're looking to make new friends and broaden your social circle as well as network. Our members are eclectic and educated, many of which are graduates from competitive institutions; are culture enthusiasts; or have moved to NYC from other countries.

This will be a small intimate group (less than 40 people) so that you have the chance to meet everybody in attendance.

Learn more & Join our mailing list here to receive invites to non-Meetup affiliated events: http://www.buffsandbrainiacs.com/

CO-SPONSORED BY:

Networking for NYC Professionals
Networking for International Professionals
Well Educated Singles
Networking for Wine Lovers of NYC

Included in the night:

*Unlimited light pours of 6 red and white wines from around the world

*A sommelier to provide information about each wine

*Platters of cheese

*Rental of a private space recently profiled in the NY Times as one of the best wine stores in Manhattan

*Ice breakers & conversations starters to help people interact.

*Quiet atmosphere ideal for mingling and socializing


*CREDITS ARE AVAILABLE IF YOU CANCEL AT LEAST 2 DAYS IN ADVANCE.

*NO REFUNDS ARE AVAILABLE UNLESS THE EVENT IS CANCELED


Should I bring business cards? YES! We encourage all attendees to exchange business cards.

Will everybody in attendance be single? No, but most will be due to the nature of the groups co-sponsoring the event.

What is the dress code? What you wore to work will do. You can jazz it up and throw on a jacket or cocktail dress if you like. Just please no sneakers or active wear.

Can I come alone? Yes

Is this event social? Yes! We like to give our networking events a social vibe by including ice breakers and conversation starters. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. We can not accept payment at the door since the venue needs an accurate headcount at least 24 hours in advance.

*CREDITS ARE AVAILABLE IF YOU CANCEL AT LEAST 2 DAYS IN ADVANCE.

*NO REFUNDS ARE AVAILABLE UNLESS THE EVENT IS CANCELED
name: 🍷Private Wine Tasting & Social - 30's & 40's Members🍷

description:
QS is proud to sponsor this meetup and invite you to attend our QS World MBA Tour.

The skills and insights of an MBA are so invaluable that the earlier you can have an MBA is better for you. If you’re contemplating whether to make the MBA a priority in 2016, consider the pros and cons of studying for an MBA. Achieving career goals doesn’t take place overnight, so if you have a plan, why not make it a priority for this year. 

As the saying from Og Mandino goes “Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later”.

The QS World MBA Tour will be in New York on Saturday, September 24th and you can meet face-to-face with admissions directors from a range of top business schools. This event is a one-stop shop for all of your MBA needs – it will provide you with a platform where you can network with admissions directors, get advice from experts and discover the best MBA option for you.

 What’s best is that for members of this Meetup group, you can gain exclusive free entry to the event (a saving of $15). All you need to do is quote ‘Meetup’ at the entry of the event.

As an attendee, you will be eligible to apply for exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M.

Register for Free for the World MBA Tour New York:
http://goo.gl/lR78O7

Get the most out of the event:

• Meet admissions directors from top local and international business schools 

 • Attend a free GMAT seminar hosted by GMAC - the creators of the exam

• Meet with top tier MBA alumni from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia hosted by Admit Advantage

• Find out how to apply for a pool of exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M, in order to finance your MBA

• Get one-to-one expert advice on your MBA essays, applications and interviews

• Attend an Executive MBA forum to learn more about suitable study options for professionals with 6+ years of work experience

• Attend an inspirational Women in Leadership forum

Business schools attending include:
*Wharton, *Columbia, NYU Stern, Cornell Univ. – Johnson, New York Institute of Technology, UCLA Anderson, St John's University – Tobin, Carnegie Mellon University – Tepper, George Washington Univ., Boston Univ. – Questrom, Emory University – Goizueta, Northeastern University - D'Amore-McKim, Pepperdine University – Graziadio, Univ. of Wisconsin-Madison, UMass-Amherst, SMU Cox, Rice Univ. – Jones, College of William and Mary – Mason, Temple Univ. – Fox, Univ. of Minnesota – Carlson, Texas A&M University – Mays, Univ. of San Diego-Rady, Univ. of California, Univ. of Toronto – Rotman, McGill University-Desautels, London Business School, Cambridge Univ. – Judge, London Business School, The London School of Economics and Political Science, Said Business School, HEC Paris, INSEAD, IE IESE, RSM Erasmus – Rotterdam and many more

In addition to the QS World MBA Tour New York, we also host a Connect 121 event in New York where it might benefit the members of this meet up group who has more than 5 years of working experience.

Connect 121 New York – Saturday, September 24th at Hilton New York (10:00am-2:00pm)

The Connect 1-2-1 event is a perfect forum to meet admissions directors for personal meetings. Candidates and business schools meet at a dedicated time-slot for 30 minute one-to-one sessions. After signing up for the event, the Connect 1-2-1 team will be in touch with you to match you up with specific schools that you are interested in and will arrange meetings for you to attend on the day. 

Register for Free for Connect 121 New York:

http://goo.gl/RmRu5I

Connect 121 Business Schools:
Cornell Univ. Johnson, UCLA Anderson, Univ. of Pittsburgh Joseph M. Katz, Temple Univ.- Fox, Univ. of Miami, Univ. of Minnesota Carlson, Arizona State Univ. – W.P. Carey, Hult, Univ. of Toronto – Rotman, McGill University-Desautels, Imperial College Business School, Cambridge University – Judge, Alliance Manchester Business School, IE, IESE, SDA Bocconi, ESCP Europe, ESSEC Business School, HKUST Business School and many more
name: Should I study for an MBA? Meet us in New York

3 nouvelles startups Data nous dévoilent leur passion pour la data : technos, enjeux, algos, savoir faire ... Et pas des moindres : 

- Zenly : l'appli de géolocalisation au succès fulgurant (20 millions d'euros levés fin septembre) 

- Smartly.ai : accélérée par Numa, la plateforme d'intelligence artificielle utilisée par plus de 1000 développeurs dans le monde permettant de développer des interfaces vocales pour objets connectés (levée de fonds fin septembre)

- Doctrine.fr : le "google" des avocats, déjà utilisé par 40% du legal500 en France (2 millions d'euros levés mi-octobre)

Merci à Numa pour nous accueillir, et à Mobiskill pour son soutien !

description:
The forecast for Friday's weather looks good.  Light winds and 55-60 degrees.  Indicate if there is any interest in playing.

Meet around the putting green at 2:30. We'll form groups and go. If you can't make it by 2:30 or want to play earlier, post a message on Meetup and see it anyone else will be able to join you.

For those of you who have never played Friday Night Golf ( we will call it FNG) it is a nice easy way to start your game if you are nervous about your ability. PW is an executive course consisting of mostly shortish par 3's. The course will not beat you up. And we all usually go in for a bite to eat and a glass of wine or other adult beverage and sit around and socialize. It is a great way to meet your fellow ASGA members.

The cost is approximately $15 to walk 9 holes or $25 to ride. 

10/14 is the last time this year that FNG will count as an official HASGA event.  We'll keep going until we run out of daylight or they throw us off the course.
name: Friday afternoon @ Portland West

description:
After 9 months out, we're finally bringing the Cheltenham Cyber Tech Hub meetup event back online and with added impetus. Cheltenham is the UK's Cyber Tech Hub and is full of talented individuals, great companies, new exciting startups and some exceptional talent. We're relaunching the Cyber Tech Hub meetup group to further promote and encourage:

- Thought collaboration and networking between individuals and companies in the Cyber and Technology sectors
- A proactive support network for new startups in the industry to meet Thought Leaders, Investors, Academia and Advisors
- An opportunity for companies and individuals to present on topical subjects relevant to the group
- A go to place for local and UK-wide Investors to get involved in Cheltenham as a Cyber Accelerator for startup talent

With 250+ local group members, please confirm your attendance early to avoid disappoint as places will be limited to the venue size.
We already have some excellent speakers lined up as well as Alex Chalk MP confirmed in attendance on the night and will be updating the latest news on the Cheltenham Cyber Innovation Centre.

Look forward to seeing you there for a drink or three! More info and venue confirmation to follow…

All the best,

Chris
