description:
日本語は下記になります〜

【 Welcome 】 

Let's all forget about this damn election and celebrate the fact that it's FINALLY OVER!! Flush your minds with booze and start having fun again! Regardless of your politics come out and party with us!   We promise you it's gonna be an epic night! 

Everyone is welcome to come along on this "group bar tour" around Tokyo. We'll visit 4 bars and club together and the last stop is always a club. It's easy to meet people, have a chat, and of course there will be plenty of dancing and drinking. Usually about 80 - 100 fun and friendly people attend each event, so be ready for a party!

For more information about the pub crawl, please read below.

【Theme 】 
Please wear anything related to this years elections,  Hillary, Trump, Ken Bone, the Wall, emails, 1%, Wolf Blitzer, Cats, Obama anything! 

【Includes】 
✔ Entrance fee for 3 bars  
✔ Entrance fee for 1 club 
✔ Welcome shot x 4  
✔ Unlimited FREE SHOTS between bars
✔ Pictures of the evening
✔ Drink discounts at each bar (about 50% off)
✔ Points discount card (please request)
✔ Games and activities

We want to keep the fee low and make sure everyone gets as much as possible for joining! So we are always trying to add things to the event.

【Price】 
□ Guys：¥2500 (advance) ・ ¥2900 (door) 
■ Girls： ¥2000 (advance) ・ ¥2500 (door) 
□ Ticket purchase link (PeaTix)：http://ptix.co/2e1VkGc

※ Plus five hundred yen if paying at the door.

【Schedule】
□ 7:00pm   (Bar 1): Meeting spot, kickoff, shot #1
■ 8:10pm  (Bar 2): Activity, welcome shot #2
□ 9:20pm   (Bar 3): Games, dancing, welcome shot #3
■ 10:30pm (Club): Welcome shot #4, lots of dancing!

Ticket price includes entrance fee for the club,  so you can stay out all night long! Or you can take the last train home if you prefer.

【Dress Code / Club Info】
□ You must bring a valid photo ID to enter club!
■  No shorts, sleeveless shirts, flip-flops, sandals, sweatpants, track pants
□  Tattoos must be covered up
■  Drinking age in Japan is 20 years old

【Location】
■ Bar Propaganda (2F) 
3-14-9 Roppongi, Minato-ku, Tokyo
TEL:[masked]

【Access】  
■ 6 min from Roppongi Station, Exit 3


【About Tokyo Pub Crawl】

We're a regular group of pub crawlers in Tokyo. It all started about 5 years ago, with a few buddies from work getting friends together to grab some beers on the weekend. We thought it would be fun to visit many bars in one night.  And after 300 events with thousands of new pub crawling friends joining, and we're still going strong!!

Pub crawls are a great alternative to regular International Parties or all-you-can drink parties because:

• We move to a new bar every hour - keeps things fun and interesting!
• In addition to having a chat, there is plenty of space to DANCE and let loose :)
• The event is open to ANYONE who wants to have fun. Not just study language. People often see us on the street and join us because it looks cool.
• You can join and leave (and re-join) the pub crawl at any time!
• By the end, everyone feels like they are partying with 50 new friends
• The last stop is always a popular dance club. And entrance fee is included!

Coming alone?
Don't worry. Many people come alone, so we mix the group and have fun together. Groups are welcome, too.

【 ようこそ！ 】

皆さん、東京のクラブを回るこの "グループ バー ツアー"へようこそ！私たちは、4つのバーやクラブに行きます。最後の目的地はいつもクラブです。沢山の人と出会ったり、お喋りしたりするのにとても良いチャンスですし、もちろん踊ったり飲んだりも十分に出来ます。いつも80人から100人の楽しくて陽気な人が参加しています。さあ、パーティーの準備を！

パブクロールについてのより詳しい情報は、下記を読んでください。

【含むもの】 
✔  3つのバーの入場料
✔  1つのクラブの入場料
✔  ウェルカムショットx 4 
✔  バーとバーの間で、無限フリーショット
✔  写真
✔  各バーでのドリンクディスカウント（大体50%オフ）
✔  ポイントカード（エントランスでリクエストを！)
✔  ゲームやアクティビティ

低価格で皆さんに参加して頂くために、私たちはこれからも色々なことにチャレンジしていきます。

【チケット】 
□ 男性：¥2500 (advance) ・ ¥2900 (door) 
■ 女性： ¥2000 (advance) ・ ¥2500 (door) 
□  20% 割引チケット（リンク）：http://ptix.co/2e1VkGc

※ 当日エントランスでお支払い頂く場合は、＋500円です。

【スケジュール】
□ 7:00pm   (Bar 1): 待ち合わせ場所、キックオフ、ショット#1
■ 8:00pm  (Bar 2): アクティビティ、ウェルカムショット#2
□ 9:15pm   (Bar 3): ゲーム、ダンス、ウェルカムショット #3
■ 10:30pm (Club): ウェルカムショット#4、踊り狂って！

パブクロールへの入場料には最後に行くクラブの入場料が含まれるので,  一晩中滞在出来ます! もちろん、最終電車で帰ることも出来ますよ。

【ドレスコード/ クラブ情報】
□ クラブに入るために必ずIDを持ってきて下さい!
■  短パン、袖のないシャツ、flip-flops、サンダル、スウェットパンツ, トラックパンツは禁止
□  タトゥーは隠して下さい
■  日本でお酒が飲めるのは20歳からです

【集合場所】
■ Bar Propaganda (2F) 
東京都港区六本木3-14-9
TEL:[masked]

【アクセス】 
■  六本木駅 出口3番から歩いて6分
□ 上の地図を見てください

【東京パブクロールについて】

私たちは東京でパブクロールを開催しているグループてます。5年前、週末に一緒にお酒を飲む友達と始めました。私たちは一晩で沢山のバーを回れたら楽しいと考えたのです。何千人もの新しいパブクロールフレンドと300回のイベントを重ね、私たちはまだまだ成長していきます！

パブクロールが素晴らしい国際交流パーティー もしくは 飲み放題パーティーである理由:

• 毎時間新しいバーに移動します - 飽きることがありません!
• おしゃべりに加えて, たくさんのダンススペースがあります:)
• 楽しみたい人は誰でも参加可能。言葉を学ぶだけじゃありません。道で私たちを見かけた人が参加するのは、パブクロールがクールだから！
• いつでも参加（再入場）可能。いつでも帰れます。
• 最後には50人の新しい友達とパーティーしている様な気がしてきます！
• 最後に訪れるクラブは有名クラブ。クラブの入場料はパブクロールの入場料に含まれているから、安心！

1人で参加？
心配しないでください！沢山の人が1人で参加されますし、私たちも皆さんが一緒に楽しめる様にグループをミックスします。もちろん、団体の方もウェルカムです！


【メディア】

• イベント写真
https://www.facebook.com/TokyoPub/photos_stream?tab=photos_albums

• イベントビデオhttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0bqjU4IQIq88GnKKHq9CUg/videos

• 日本経済新聞MJ: 


•JAPAN TIMES: 
http://www.japantimes.co.jp/life/2013/12/31/food/on-a-pub-crawl-every-drink-is-one-for-the-road/#.UsQiG_QW2Sq

• TOKYO CHEAPO
http://tokyocheapo.com/food-and-drink/drinking/tokyo-pub-crawl-cheap-drinks-roppongi/
name: (土) 東京パブクロール：Tokyo Pub Crawl Presidentiial Election Party! + club entry

description:
Let's hike to Mount Frissell, the south slope of which has the highest point in Connecticut (2,380'). This point is 64 feet higher than the peak of Bear Mountain.

We will get there via the the Alander Mountain Trail starting in the Washington State Forest in the town of Mount Washington, Massachusetts. This will be an 11.2 mile loop hike incorporating the South Taconic, Mount Frissell, and Ashley Hill Trails. We will reach the summit of Alander Mountain (2250') before we get to Mount Frissell. We will visit three states on this loop and see the NY-CT-MA Tri-State marker. This will be a very strenuous hike and you need to be experienced with long mountain hikes before signing up. Estimated time to complete the hike is 6 hours.

This promises to be a memorable hiking experience.

GPS coordinates to starting point: [masked], [masked]
name: Hike to Mount Frissell, Highest Point in CT

description:
English speakers: unlike our regular meetings, this meetup will be in English, so don’t hesitate to come !

Vous avez un paquet de données et vous aimeriez pouvoir faire tourner des algorithmes de machine learning de fou-furieux en n’utilisant que du R ? Alors ce meetup est fait pour vous !

H2O est un logiciel qui permet de distribuer les algorithmes prédictifs les plus avancés. Il est optimisé pour les environnements “big data” et s’interface avec R grâce au package “h2o”. Au cours de cette soirée, des développeurs et utilisateurs de la plateforme vont venir nous parler de celle-ci plus en détails.

Contrairement aux rencontres habituelles, ce meetup sera en anglais. Mais comme toujours il y aura à boire et à manger dans une ambiance des plus chaleureuses !

Programme de la soirée :

• 18h30-19h Acceuil des participants, networking et snack (pour tenir jusqu'aux pizzas !)

•  19h-19h30 Introduction to Machine Learning with H2O by Jo-fai Chow

In this talk, I will give you an overview of our company (H2O.ai), our open-source machine learning platform (H2O) as well as our new projects (e.g. Deep Water and Steam). This will be useful for attendees who are not familiar with H2O.

• 19h30-20h15 Automatic Machine Learning using H2O - Jiqiong QIU

In this talk, I am going to talk about a general machine learning pipeline using H2O for a Kaggle competition (data mining competition). Participating in Kaggle competitions can be very time-consuming. For this reason, I would like to build an automatic machine learning solution that suits most of the datasets with reasonable results. This talk also gives an overview of the main functions in H2O as well as real-world use cases.

• 20h15-21h Sparkling Water 2.0 - Jakub Háva

Sparkling Water integrates the H2O open source distributed machine learning platform with the capabilities of Apache Spark. It allows users to leverage H2O’s machine learning algorithms with Apache Spark applications via Scala, Python, R or H2O’s Flow GUI which makes Sparkling Water a great enterprise solution. Sparkling Water 2.0 was built to coincide with the release of Apache Spark 2.0 and introduces several new features. These include the ability to use H2O frames as Apache Spark’s SQL datasource, transparent integration into Apache Spark machine learning pipelines, the power to use Apache Spark algorithms via the Flow GUI and easier deployment of Sparkling Water in a Python environment. In this talk we will introduce the basic architecture of Sparkling Water and provide an overview of the new features available in Sparkling Water 2.0. The talk will also include a live demo showing how to integrate H2O algorithms into Apache Spark pipelines – no terminal needed!

• 21h jusqu’au bout de la nuit :


About Joe

LinkedIn: https://uk.linkedin.com/in/jofaichow

Twitter: @matlabulous

Jo-fai (or Joe) is a data scientist at H2O.ai. Before joining H2O, he was in the business intelligence team at Virgin Media in UK where he developed data products to enable quick and smart business decisions. He also worked remotely for Domino Data Lab in US as a data science evangelist promoting products via blogging and giving talks at meetups. Joe has a background in water engineering. Before his data science journey, he was an EngD research engineer at STREAM Industrial Doctorate Centre working on machine learning techniques for drainage design optimization. Prior to that, he was an asset management consultant specialized in data mining and constrained optimization for the utilities sector in UK and abroad. He also holds a MSc in Environmental Management and a BEng in Civil Engineering.

About Jakub

LinkedIn: https://cz.linkedin.com/in/havaj

Jakub (or “Kuba”) finished his bachelors degree in computer science at Charles University in Prague, and is currently finishing his master’s in software engineering as well. As a bachelors thesis, Kuba wrote a small platform for distributed computing of tasks of any type. On his current masters studies he’s developing a cluster monitoring tool for JVM based languages which should make debugging and reasoning about performance of distributed systems easier using a concept called distributed stack traces. At H2O, Kuba mostly works on Sparkling Water project.
name: Hors série: H2O

description:
Run in circles on a high school track anywhere from 2-8 miles. Workouts vary each week. If you have a plan bring it to share! If you don't have a plan, or you're a beginner, we'll show you what to do. We have several easy but effective plans for anyone new to track. 

If this is your first time, ask for Patrick, Clint, Ryan, Christina, or Nicole. We'd be happy to explain the options and do our best to match you with someone your speed.

There are always a multitude of paces (speeds) at track including people who describe their speed as:  molasses, perfect 10, Pokemon, stroller-pusher, track-coach, or x-wing-fighter.  Everyone runs a speed and plan that fit their goals for the day.  

Run for fun, to get fit, or to set a PR (personal record). Whatever. We don't judge (unless you don't show up).

The best part is because we run in circles, we offer encouragement to each other every time we pass or get passed. If it's a nice day, we do plank or wall sits after (just because it's so much fun).  Guests are welcome.
name: Shorewood Track Workout - Election Day Run!

Dim Sum crazy? We got your back!

100's of you have already joined London Cookery School for Dim Sum making experiences which are always a winner with Funzingers. For the new year, Will is bringing something fresh to the table!

Will is going piggie this time as you'll learn how to make the delicious & addictive Roast Pork (Char Sui) Buns and Emerald Pork and Chive Dumplings! We're salivating just at the thought.

Suitable for beginners, in this experience you will be under the expert tuition of the London Cookery School instructors and you'll learn all the processes involved in making
Char Sui Bao (Fluffy Roast Pork Buns)

You will be guided step by step, from learning how Char Sui is made, making proofing and rolling the dough, preparing and mixing the fillings, forming the buns and dumplings and cooking.

Book your spot today & take some advice from a fellow dim sum addict - you do not want to miss out on this one!!

DIETARY REQUIREMENTS
 This class is not suitable for those that cannot eat pork, wheat flour, soy sauce and yeast.

For Tickets and More Info click here

description:
English speakers: unlike our regular meetings, this meetup will be in English, so don’t hesitate to come !

Vous avez un paquet de données et vous aimeriez pouvoir faire tourner des algorithmes de machine learning de fou-furieux en n’utilisant que du R ? Alors ce meetup est fait pour vous !

H2O est un logiciel qui permet de distribuer les algorithmes prédictifs les plus avancés. Il est optimisé pour les environnements “big data” et s’interface avec R grâce au package “h2o”. Au cours de cette soirée, des développeurs et utilisateurs de la plateforme vont venir nous parler de celle-ci plus en détails.

Contrairement aux rencontres habituelles, ce meetup sera en anglais. Mais comme toujours il y aura à boire et à manger dans une ambiance des plus chaleureuses !

Programme de la soirée :

• 18h30-19h Accueil des participants, networking et snack (pour tenir jusqu'aux pizzas !)

•  19h-19h30 Introduction to Machine Learning with H2O by Jo-fai Chow

In this talk, I will give you an overview of our company (H2O.ai), our open-source machine learning platform (H2O) as well as our new projects (e.g. Deep Water and Steam). This will be useful for attendees who are not familiar with H2O.

• 19h30-20h15 Automatic Machine Learning using H2O - Jiqiong QIU

In this talk, I am going to talk about a general machine learning pipeline using H2O for a Kaggle competition (data mining competition). Participating in Kaggle competitions can be very time-consuming. For this reason, I would like to build an automatic machine learning solution that suits most of the datasets with reasonable results. This talk also gives an overview of the main functions in H2O as well as real-world use cases.

• 20h15-21h Sparkling Water 2.0 - Jakub Háva

Sparkling Water integrates the H2O open source distributed machine learning platform with the capabilities of Apache Spark. It allows users to leverage H2O’s machine learning algorithms with Apache Spark applications via Scala, Python, R or H2O’s Flow GUI which makes Sparkling Water a great enterprise solution. Sparkling Water 2.0 was built to coincide with the release of Apache Spark 2.0 and introduces several new features. These include the ability to use H2O frames as Apache Spark’s SQL datasource, transparent integration into Apache Spark machine learning pipelines, the power to use Apache Spark algorithms via the Flow GUI and easier deployment of Sparkling Water in a Python environment. In this talk we will introduce the basic architecture of Sparkling Water and provide an overview of the new features available in Sparkling Water 2.0. The talk will also include a live demo showing how to integrate H2O algorithms into Apache Spark pipelines – no terminal needed!

• 21h jusqu’au bout de la nuit :


About Joe

LinkedIn: https://uk.linkedin.com/in/jofaichow

Twitter: @matlabulous

Jo-fai (or Joe) is a data scientist at H2O.ai. Before joining H2O, he was in the business intelligence team at Virgin Media in UK where he developed data products to enable quick and smart business decisions. He also worked remotely for Domino Data Lab in US as a data science evangelist promoting products via blogging and giving talks at meetups. Joe has a background in water engineering. Before his data science journey, he was an EngD research engineer at STREAM Industrial Doctorate Centre working on machine learning techniques for drainage design optimization. Prior to that, he was an asset management consultant specialized in data mining and constrained optimization for the utilities sector in UK and abroad. He also holds a MSc in Environmental Management and a BEng in Civil Engineering.


About Jakub

LinkedIn: https://cz.linkedin.com/in/havaj

Jakub (or “Kuba”) finished his bachelors degree in computer science at Charles University in Prague, and is currently finishing his master’s in software engineering as well. As a bachelors thesis, Kuba wrote a small platform for distributed computing of tasks of any type. On his current masters studies he’s developing a cluster monitoring tool for JVM based languages which should make debugging and reasoning about performance of distributed systems easier using a concept called distributed stack traces. At H2O, Kuba mostly works on Sparkling Water project.
name: Hors série: H2O

We've added a new location!  We looked at the map and realized that there aren't very many meetups very far up the Georgia 400 corridor.  We've been looking to add one for a while, and finally nailed down a location.

This is not meant to replace the meetup at Moe's that also occurs on Wednesdays.  With the two locations so far apart, there will now be a more convenient location for both areas on that night!

From the Mansell exit on 400, head east and turn left onto North Point Parkway.  The first light on the right is for AMC and Barnes and Noble - you'll want to take the second one.  You should see Jason's right as you make that right turn.

See everyone soon!

description:
Last 6 week Beginner Spin of 2016 - FREE Taster on November 17th if you book the course straight after.  Taster is £10 bookable by phone, paypal or BACS. [masked]

Everyone is a beginner in this class so there is no need to feel intimidated. It is solely about having fun and keeping fit at the same time.

Each week, step by step, you will learn new moves, tricks and spins. We recap and practice moves and individual help is given. 

Every move is personal to the individual, everyone has their own strengths and weaknesses. I have taught a wide range of ability and have the knowledge to help you improve. 

Nothing pleases me more than helping someone achieve something they have said they can’t do. 

In the 6 weeks, as well as the above you will learn to climb the pole and attempt to go upside down. 80% of beginners achieve. this but don’t be disheartened if you can’t. I get everyone up there eventually! 


Pre-booking is essential as places go fast.
To secure your spot. or for more info:

☎[masked]
✐ Send a message [masked]

description:
Picture it:

Smooth jazz welcomes you as you walk in. A smiling host greets you and checks you in. You head over to the bar where there are fifty or so Manhattan professionals mingling, flirting, or networking over wine and cocktails. You smile at someone in the crowd and they smile back.  The group is made up of professionals from various wine, travel, hiking, foodie, and international Meetup groups. And that's just a few of the groups sponsoring this bi-weekly event.

There will be appetizers served and ice breakers games to help you interact with other guests. By the end of the night you've given out all of your business cards and maybe even your phone number to a few people.

The RSVPS here do not reflect the RSVPS or total people registered. This event regularly gets approximately 50-75 people.

Here is how it works:

-We will be on hand at the bar beginning at 6:30pm. 

-Happy hour prices end at 8pm.

-Socialize, mix and mingle with ice breaker at 7:30pm.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$10 in advance/$20 at the door. Admission includes appetizers, venue, staff gratuity, hired jazz band, and ice breakers.

PRE-PAY HERE:

http://jazzwineworldbar.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Learn more & Join our mailing list here to receive invites to non-Meetup affiliated events: http://www.buffsandbrainiacs.com/



CO-SPONSORED BY:

International Single Wine Lovers - 20's, 30's, 40's

Networking for NYC Professionals
Networking for International Professionals
Well Educated Singles
Networking for Wine Lovers of NYC

Can I come alone? Yes! 99% of those attending will be coming on their own.

How do I dress? Business casual

What time does it end? The music goes until 10pm so you can  stay for as long or little as you'd like

How do I get there?

The World Bar is located on the ground floor of the World Tower on the corner of 1st avenue and east 48th.  The Green line subways stop closest but check the weekend schedule for service changes at www.mta.info.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Learn more & Join our mailing list here to receive invites to non-Meetup affiliated events: http://www.buffsandbrainiacs.com/

description:
Join us in a beautiful, fun practitioner reiki share to get recharged, honor each other as healers and meet like minded reiki love-bunnies for connection and friendship! Everyone will enjoy time on the reiki table for mini treatments. Participate in a communal distance reiki transmission as a powerful and sweet way to gather in service and love for the greater good! Afterwards, gather around the fire and share tea, good cheer and healthy social medicine. <3

Please arrive on time between 6:45-7pm. We will begin building the grid promptly at 7:00 and respectfully request no late arrivals after 7pm.

Event timeline:

    6:45 Arrivals

    7:00-7:30 - Build distance reiki crystal grid, meditate & send distance reiki transmission

    7:30 - 8:45 - Community reiki share -- two reiki tables set up for simultanious reiki treatments

    8:45 - 9:30 - Tea social around the fire

Event Details:

more info: http://artemisiashine.com/reiki-is-love

- We gather to charge each other up with reiki love and to build a beautiful reiki crystal grid to send concentrated distance reiki out near and far. All lineages and practitioner levels are welcome. The main purpose of this gathering is for practitioners to unite to give and receive reiki in an atmosphere of friendship, support and love and to send communal distance reiki to wherever it is needed most. 

- Reiki practitioners (of any level) may invite up to 2 non-reiki practitioner guests. If you are a non-reiki practitioner and have not been invited by a reiki practitioner, please send a message to the host (Artemisia Shine) to request to join. We strive to be inclusive AND need to maintain a balance to ensure we have enough reiki practitioners for everyone to have time on the reiki tables. 

- We start by co-creating a reiki crystal grid to send out distance reiki together. All levels may participate. Level II reiki practitioners will charge the grid with distance reiki symbols, all others will contribute reiki, love and good intentions. Bring your sacred stone allies and any photos/reiki requests (better yet, use and share this link to submit distance reiki requests in advance!) to place in the center of the grid.

- You are encouraged to liberally share this free distance reiki request link with friends, family, co-workers, frenemies and the like as well as submit your own reiki requests in advance (to be printed by the host) to: http://artemisiashine.com/reiki-is-love

- Afterwards, we will share yummy organic herbal tea, vegetarian treats, and enjoy the warm post-reiki glow of sweet company around the fire. Please bring tea supplies or vegetarian finger treats to share.

- minimum $5 fee is to offset the cost of meet-up fees, crystals, firewood, tea, snacks, etc.

- 💞Further Donations are enthusiastically accepted to offset the cost of printing photos/reiki requests as well as tea, nut milk, honey, crystals, firewood & supplies - keep the energy exchange flowing! 💞

What a great way to spend the third Tuesday night of every month! Come join us!

Visit http://artemisiashine.com/reiki-is-love for more information about reiki or http://artemisiashine.com to find out more about the event host, Artemisia Shine.
name: Reiki Share, Distance Reiki Crystal Grid Transmission + Fire Social

group.name: Reiki is love. ❤️ San Luis Obispo

description:
£28 including train travel from London Victoria

New hike for November!!!

Join us on our new exciting hike across Surrey's magnificent upland landscapes - designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty! 
Our Surrey Hills exploration will take us through picturesque woodland, heathland and farmland. We will hike to Leith Hill - the second-highest peak in South-East England. Standing at Leith Hill is a majestic tower built in the 18th century which is the highest point in South-East England!
The trails we've chosen will prove the significant landscape value of Surrey, which national importance has been officially recognised since 1958!

Highlights:

• Discover Surrey's Hills - Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB)

• Conquer Leith Hill - the highest peak of the area and second-highest in South-East England.

• See Leith Hill tower - an 18th century masterpiece and the highest point in South-East England

• Hike to Tilling Springs - where River Tillingbourne begins

• Discover the North Downs way and its stunning views towards Dorking

• Hike through England's largest vineyard - Denbies Wine Estate


Photos - All photos were taken by the hike leader on previous trips so are the actual views that you will see from the route that you'll be hiking

>Click here to join our Facebook community of 6100 hikers<


Walk Description

We start off in Holmwood from where we head for Leith Hill and its famous gothic tower which stands at 329 meters. Our hike will take us across fields and woodlands before a strenuous ascent to Leith Hill. The summit is the highest of the Greensand Ridge and its tower is the highest point in south-east England.
Leith Hill will accommodate us for our lunch as it's been a renowned spot for picnic since the 19th century. Afterwards, if we're feeling energetic, we will climb the 74 spiral steps of the 18th century tower of Leith Hill to its top where through the telescope you can see the English Channel on a clear day. Many of London's landmarks could be seen with the naked eye, too.


After lunch, we descent Leith Hill to head north to Dorking via Greensand way. Much of the route passes ancient woods with amazing displays of colour. Greensand way will take us along paths which give unparalleled views across the Weald and towards the North Downs. The way passes through Tilling Springs - the source of River Tillingbourne which is 11 miles long and runs through several villages powering their mills along the way. description:
Every second Tuesday of the month the WRPC gets together at a social event to learn more about photography, to try different techniques and to share information. From time to time guest speakers address the Club on matters ranging from Bird Photography, to Table Top photography; to name a few.


8 November:  We will be taking photos of flowers through water droplet reflections as well as seeing what happens when food colouring is dropped in milk.  Bring camera gear,  Tripod  / Flashguns / speedlights with charged batteries / Lighting stands / Master and slave triggers /   Macro lens or tele lens / Glycerine / Syringe / Balloons / flowers - anything that you think will make for a good photography setup.

Cash bar is available and a light meal will be provided to those who pre order.

For more information: www.wrpc.co.za


From the N1 South, take the 14th Avenue off-ramp and turn right (west) under the freeway (from the N1 North take the 14th Avenue off-ramp and turn left). Continue straight through three traffic lights and on past the Flora Clinic then up the steep hill in William Nicol Drive. Turn right at the top of the hill into Ontdekkers Road. Pass the first traffic lights and then turn left (south) at the next traffic light into Golf Club Terrace. Pass the fire department on your right. Continue for 2km and pass the Kentucky Fried Chicken on your right at Goldman Street and go straight under the railway bridge. Stay on this road for another 1.2km and then at the traffic lights turn left into Hamberg Road (now renamed Sisulu). 200m later turn first left into Eisteddfod Road. Go through the security gate and straight ahead into the Canoe Club grounds and secure parking.

description:
Picture it:

Smooth jazz welcomes you as you walk in. A smiling host greets you and checks you in. You head over to the bar where there are fifty or so Manhattan professionals mingling, flirting, or networking over wine and cocktails. You smile at someone in the crowd and they smile back.  The group is made up of professionals from various wine, travel, hiking, foodie, and international Meetup groups. And that's just a few of the groups sponsoring this bi-weekly event.

There will be appetizers served and ice breakers games to help you interact with other guests. By the end of the night you've given out all of your business cards and maybe even your phone number to a few people.

description:
Let's hike to Mount Frissell, the south slope of which has the highest point in Connecticut (2,380'). This point is 64 feet higher than the peak of Bear Mountain.

We will get there via the the Alander Mountain Trail starting in the Washington State Forest in the town of Mount Washington, Massachusetts. This will be an 11.2 mile loop hike incorporating the South Taconic, Mount Frissell, and Ashley Hill Trails. We will reach the summit of Alander Mountain (2250') before we get to Mount Frissell. We will visit three states on this loop and see the NY-CT-MA Tri-State marker. This will be a very strenuous hike and you need to be experienced with long mountain hikes before signing up. Allow 6 hours to complete the hike.

This promises to be a memorable hiking experience.

GPS coordinates to starting point: [masked], [masked]
name: Hike to Mount Frissell, Highest Point in CT

description:
Join us for the second social of the month! there will be beer, there will be skeptical chat and there will be more beer!


Skeptics in the Pub is a place for inquisitive people of all ages to meet and converse in the High Wycombe area.

Skeptics are people who yearn to discover the truth behind extraordinary claims that people or groups may make, this can be in areas of alternative therapies, the paranormal, religion and faith, the afterlife and many other areas of life. We we often end up talking about superstition, science, religious fundamentalism, health, censorship and conspiracy theory

We make no claims to balance, and actively promote science, freedom of expression and secular humanism..

You are welcome to come along and just sit and listen to others, or if you are braver get stuck right in with conversation and views!

Our Website is at wycombe.skepticsinthepub.org, join our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter.

New hike for November!!!

Join us on our new exciting hike across Surrey's magnificent upland landscapes - designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty! 
Our Surrey Hills exploration will take us through picturesque woodland, heathland and farmland. We will hike to Leith Hill - the second-highest peak in South-East England. Standing at Leith Hill is a majestic tower built in the 18th century which is the highest point in South-East England!
The trails we've chosen will prove the significant landscape value of Surrey, which national importance has been officially recognised since 1958!

Highlights:

• Discover Surrey's Hills - Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB)

• Conquer Leith Hill - the highest peak of the area and second-highest in South-East England.

• See Leith Hill tower - an 18th century masterpiece and the highest point in South-East England

• Hike to Tilling Springs - where River Tillingbourne begins

• Discover the North Downs way and its stunning views towards Dorking

• Hike through England's largest vineyard - Denbies Wine Estate


Photos - All photos were taken by the hike leader on previous trips so are the actual views that you will see from the route that you'll be hiking

>Click here to join our Facebook community of 6100 hikers<


Walk Description

We start off in Holmwood from where we head for Leith Hill and its famous gothic tower which stands at 329 meters. Our hike will take us across fields and woodlands before a strenuous ascent to Leith Hill. The summit is the highest of the Greensand Ridge and its tower is the highest point in south-east England.
Leith Hill will accommodate us for our lunch as it's been a renowned spot for picnic since the 19th century. Afterwards, if we're feeling energetic, we will climb the 74 spiral steps of the 18th century tower of Leith Hill to its top where through the telescope you can see the English Channel on a clear day. Many of London's landmarks could be seen with the naked eye, too.


After lunch, we descent Leith Hill to head north to Dorking via Greensand way. Much of the route passes ancient woods with amazing displays of colour. Greensand way will take us along paths which give unparalleled views across the Weald and towards the North Downs. The way passes through Tilling Springs - the source of River Tillingbourne which is 11 miles long and runs through several villages powering their mills along the way. From there, we will hike towards the hills upto the North Downs Way and pass by an old WWII pillbox.  The path offers beautiful view points which overlook the valley towards Dorking. 
Then, hiking through woodland for a while, the path comes to Ranmore Common and the beautiful church of St Barnabas built in 1860. From the Church, we continue through Denbies Wine Estate - England’s largest vineyard. The way through the Vineyard rewards with excellent views towards Dorking and Boxhill. Our hike finishes with the picturesque market town of Dorking located west from the Holmesdale hills range.

Transport and Meeting Point

Planed return time to London of 6:34pm (we have a group train ticket and you are committed for the day until then)

description:
We dance and journey through the elements of Air, Fire, Water, Earth and back to our Center.

Dance Elemental offers a unique expression of ecstatic dance culture, inspired by nature-centered spiritual traditions.

Become the dance, become the music.  We dance and journey as a community to witness and remind ourselves of the beauty that we are.  We are Air - Fire - Water - Earth and Spirit.  Embody your divine nature.

Learn and grow from each element and work with its unique, palpable energy. Celebrate together and allow your inner light to be revealed!

When? 

Monthly - First and Third Saturdays of every Month 
8pm - 11pm
(doors open at 7:30 pm - newcomer orientation at 8:00 pm) 

Please do your best to arrive on time. 

Where? 
Center for Creative Living
1460 Koll Circle # C, San Jose, CA

Cost?
$15 standard donation at the door.

Sign up early with a friend and get a sweet deal!
Check out our Dance Duo! Two admitted for $25!
MUST pre-register to get the "Dance Duo" discount.  Thank you!

Teen Ticket (ages 16-19): $5
Children (15 and under): FREE
*ALL MINORS must be accompanied by a responsible adult.*

Register for this dance and future dances here...

Volunteer positions available. Contact the organizers IN ADVANCE.
Thank you for your service!

------------

MORE ABOUT THE DANCE

Basic structure: A large and beautiful sacred space for free-form dancing to amazing music in a loving community environment.

* Be moved by Live DJ with Live Drumming and Improvisational music too! 
Bring your heart-felt intention and dance it into being. You are welcome to bring a token to represent your intention if you so desire, and place it on the Community Altar as we journey together.

* Areas set up for meditation, energy work, and community networking. Healthy snacks, tea and water are provided. All ages welcome! Young children should be supervised by parents/guardians.

* Yoga Mats / Back Jacks / Chairs available. Feel free to bring your own yoga mats for stretching or lying down.

* We invite volunteer Reiki healers and other energy/body workers to attend the healing area. Other volunteer opportunities are available as well. Please send us your volunteer inquiries in advance for trade possibilities.  

--------------

General Guidelines and Tips

1. We kindly ask for no talking on the dance floor. This allows for people to go deeper into their Dance and connect with their journey through the elements. (Chat and conversation is welcome in the tea room, outside, or *very* quietly just off the dance floor.)

2. Dance however you want. There is no right or wrong way. Listen to your body and move to the way it feels. Express who you are from the inside out.

3. Respect yourself as well as those around you. Please be mindful to make room for others as you move about the dance floor. Pay attention to your boundaries and the boundaries of others. Communicate through eye contact and body language. Be compassionate and aware. It is our highest intention that this dance is a safe space and sanctuary for community and individual self expression.
Suggestion: If you need space, or wish to disengage with another dancer, simply put your hands together in prayer pose and gently bow. This is a clear signal that you want to be in your own space. Mutual respect, always.

4. Bring extra water.  This is mainly recommended for those who get very thirsty while exercising, or have a cold.

5. Wear clothes that make you feel good and are comfortable for dancing. Be expressive and colorful if you like, or just show up in your sweats. It's all good! Dancing barefoot or in socks is fine. Shoes are ok, but heavy tread shoes or heels are not allowed. Most dance shoes or slippers are great.

6. This is a Clean & Sober event.  No drugs or alcohol of any kind, inside or outside of the body.  This would cause you to be asked to leave.

7. Do not bring cameras, or use your phone to take photos.
Ask the organizers if you have questions about this policy.

8. ALL ages and genders are welcome.

9. Be yourself!

--------------

TIPS FOR THE FIRST TIMER

*  If you have never attended before, please take a few minutes to read.

There will be a brief orientation for newcomers at 8:00 p.m.

Dance Elemental is inspired by ecstatic dance culture and nature-centered spiritual paths. Though you may have attended other ecstatic dance events, Dance Elemental is a unique expression of this form. Music is selected to take you on a journey through the four elements that leads you back to your center (spirit). This is a container created for authentic self expression through dance, meditation in motion, deep play, spiritual centering and community.

Rediscover and liberate your heart of hearts together through dance!  
We welcome all to the dance. Open your heart, and dissolve any blocks of judgment and fear. Move your body and soul to a handpicked mix of world music, tribal, funk, electronica, trance, ambient and much more. Short, guided meditations are spoken between sections to help transition us from element to element as we journey together through the experience. We are dedicated to providing this touchstone for individual wholeness, healing, growth, and community harmony.  

What to expect when you arrive

Arrive to soft music. Check in first and then quietly find a place for your things. Be welcomed with a cleansing/smudge (sage or gentle mist). Relax, breathe and stretch as others arrive.

We will be called together for a welcoming circle, speaking of our names, brief orientation, and grounding meditation. Then the dancing starts.  Dancing continues until 10:45 or so. 

* Closing

We end with a simple Heart Sharing, with a few words spoken by those who wish to speak about what they experienced, and any gratitudes, etc. There is also time allowed for community announcements just before we part. Remember you are free to bring flyers for your events and put them on the community networking table as well.

--------------

Stations 

* Not to be confused with the religious variety.

There are several "stations" in our shared space to help you with being present during the dance.

1. Tea Room: Need a refresher? We have a lovely table with healthy snacks to help re-energize and 'ground' you. A great place to chat as well. (Yes, you may bring wholesome finger-foods or beverages to share on the table - please label contents.)

2. Chill out zone: Need to be still for awhile? This is a cozy space set for meditation/stillness.

3. Healing:  Feeling tapped? Reiki Practitioners and experienced Body/Energy Workers from within our community are often available to offer their care to re-energize and align the participants.

4. Community Altar: This is a space for you to focus your energy and intention, or to draw inspiration from during the dance. Everyone is invited to bring something to place on or near the altar should they feel called.

5. Drumming: There are an assortment of drums/shakers available for you to play. You may borrow available instruments, or bring your own. Please attend children. The goal is to support the dancers by adding to the energy of the music. Sensitivity and awareness is key to holding the energy in the room... 
Please stay attuned to cues from the DJ and/or facilitators.

6. Community networking area: This surface is set up near the entrance so that we can get to know one another better. Bring your business cards and brochures, event flyers, freebies, etc.  Please take a moment to look through the materials during the evening and collect anything of interest. Seek and ye shall find. 

Wow! Thank you for reading all of this!

Now, let's dance!!!
name: DANCE ELEMENTAL - Ecstatic Dance Journey

All paces welcome

description:
How do I communicate with men? What do they want from me? How do I make them see me as their life partner? How do I maintain a good life-long relationship?

Do you know what makes men commit to you and respect you? Why are there women for whom men will do everything while there are other women who suffer in their relationships? Who is the right man for you and how do you have a good, long-term relationship with him.

In a thought provoking and provocative workshop we will see how modern life has caused women to adopt “masculine” behavioral patterns that lead to relationship problems and even to divorce. We will define what is a woman and what is a man and what are the evolutionary role distributions between them. A return to feminine nature will ensure a happy, long, and healthy relationship.

The workshop includes social games, riddles, and prizes for the winners.

Who is this workshop suitable for?
The workshop is suitable for women who are willing to challenge the popular feminist conventions, adopt a different behavioral style than the one expected from them, and go against the flow when necessary. We will talk openly about sex as well as the different and distinct roles that women and men have in relationships.

Please note: We speak freely about sex in this workshop. If you are feminist, conservative or religious, the content of the workshop might hurt your feelings.

The workshop is for women only and is FREE of charge.
name: Free Workshop for Women Only: How to Attract Your Man?

Lightworkers are people whose mission it is to uplift this planet, and they are in all possible fields. In this “Bootcamp” we will discuss the path of a Lightworker, what an Awakening is and how to deal with it, how to find the right path and follow your mission and what you can expect from a life as a lightworker. description:
Ride Name: Cycling a Quiet Trail to Ravenna past Brady’s Leap
Trail: 12 - Riverside Wine (Kent) - Peck Rd (Ravenna) - Riverside Wine (Kent)
Rating: Intermediate
Ride Type: Out and Back
Distance: 17.0 miles roundtrip You mount your saddle at Riverside wine on N. Water Street (Route 43) and head onto the Portage Bike and Hike Crain Avenue trailhead in Kent. You pass the site where Captain Samuel Brady, famed Indian fighter and legendary Kent figure, made his famous leap across the Cuyahoga River. Heading east on the Bike and Hike along an active rail line, you pass Rockwell Road and Beckwith Orchards on your way to Towner’s Woods County Park.

Cycling through heavy woods covering the trail to Ravenna, you are welcomed to Ravenna by factories and residential neighborhoods. Passing under Route 14, the trail continues to Peck Road where you turn. Cycle back to Kent enjoying the sights and sounds of nature along the trail.

Note: We meet at Riverside Wine. Park in their north parking lot on the other side of the neighboring house. Out and back rides are designed with the intermediate and advanced cyclist in mind. These rides cycle out of a trailhead to a set destination, typically 8-10 miles away. After a break, the riders cycle back to the departure trailhead.

Today's ride travels at 10-12 mph and typically takes 2 hours including photo-ops and rest stops. The ride is rated for leisure cyclists who enjoy cycling 10-12 mph on flat trails with an occasional hill or elevation gain. The trail surface is mixed with areas of both asphalt and packed limestone. It is relatively flat with some moderate elevation changes. The ride should be a comfortable ride for the intermediate cyclist.

This ride is on the calendar of the Spin-off Cyclists . We encourage you to join us on this and other rides. We are a group of cyclists of all ages and abilities who cycle the trails of Northeast Ohio and surrounding areas for fun, health and friendship.

By accepting this Spin-off Cyclists Bicycle Club event’s RSVP and attending this event, I have read and voluntarily agree to the RELEASE AND WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND ASSUMPTION OF RISK AND INDEMNITY AGREEMENT. I further agree that no oral representations, statements or inducement apart from the foregoing written agreement have been made. I HAVE READ AND UNDERSTAND THIS DOCUMENT AND RELEASE.
name: Ride & Wine: Portage Bike Riverside Wine - Peck Road - 17.0 Miles

description:
Since 2004 The New York Social Network has been hosting great events in and around NYC.  Come celebrate the anniversary of NYC's most respected social networking group at the newly renovated Empire Hotel Enclosed Roof deck overlooking Lincoln Center.   It will be a great night for members and friends old and new to come together to enjoy this great new space, make new friends and see familiar faces, share stories from past events and see what we have planned for the upcoming year! We will have drink specials, games and prizes plus a great video montage of photo's from the thousands of events we have had in the past 12 years!

Age Range - 20's to 50's

Number of people to expect -[masked]

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$15 ADMISSION - PREPAY ONLY

https://nysnann.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


NYSN is the longest running social networking and activities group of its' kind in NYC.  On this night we celebrate you, the members who make this all possible!

What to expect:

-private space on the rooftop reserved just for our members and their guests.-Upscale classy atmosphere (but no attitudes)-Drink specials until 9pm.-Ice breaker games and NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others.-Free NYSN T-shirt for the first 50 to arrive-Music played at conversation levels-Prizes including show tickets, restaurant certificates and event certificates-A great small plates menu is available-Champagne toast

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You won't feel out of place on your own as our staff will be on hand to welcome everyone and introduce you to others.

I have never been out before, is this a good event for a first timer?? YES!!  This would be the best event a first timer could ever hope to attend!  You will get to meet tons of new people.  Many of those people may be people who have been out before who can tell you of their experiences with the group.

Dress code: Club, Classy, Business Casual

What will the crowd be like? We expect around 200 guests but it won't be overcrowded and loud.  There will be people in their 20's and people in their 40's maybe even 50's.  This has always one of the cool things about an NYSN event, there can be many ages in the same room having a great time!  No matter what your age, you will certainly have enough peers to gravitate to for socializing.

Is the rooftop enclosed?  Yes the rooftop is enclosed and heated.  There are also some outdoor areas that you can check out if it is not too cold.
name: 🎂NY Social Network Anniversary Party at Empire Hotel🎂

description:
Actuarial science is the discipline that applies mathematical and statistical methods to assess risk in insurance, finance and other industries and professions.

SAMA has issued regulations for actuarial work for insurance and reinsurance organizations that has positive implications for us working in data. http://www.sama.gov.sa/en-US/News/Pages/News07012016.aspx The talk will be an introductory awareness on actuarial sciences and their practice in the Kingdom.

We are pleased to invite our esteemed guests who are practitioners in the field and will give their insights and experiences in Saudi Arabia to participate in our inaugural panel discussion at Riyadh Data Geeks.

Panelists:

• Ahmed Bukhamseen CEO Quantda

• Ahmed Abu-Shammala, Actuarial Pricing Analyst Bupa Arabia

• Ahmed Almisfer, Actuarial Analyst, Tawuniya Insurance


Moderator: Atif Abdul Rahman

Level: Beginner:

Topic: Functional

Style: Panel Discussion

Location: Badir incubator حاضنة بادر

https://goo.gl/maps/CgG1DiCKWAw
name: The world of Actuarial Sciences and practices in Saudi Arabia

description:
Playtest UK will be running an evening event at the Museum of Childhood, Bethnal Green, London to tie in with the 'Game Plan - Board Games Rediscovered' exhibition (which is running from 8th October 2016 - 23rd April 2017).

The bar opens at 6.30pm and the event costs £7.

(This meetup is for people who are planning to attend to discuss possible teams and game design ideas. For tickets see below.)

Here is the webpage to buy tickets: http://www.vam.ac.uk/moc/events/games-design-night-playtest-uk/

The evening will have two strands:

1st strand: Publishers prototype showcase

Publishers will be showcasing a published game and it's original prototype, as inspired by Matt Leacock's original Pandemic prototype, which is featured in the exhibition.

2nd strand: Game Design Jam

Teams of games designers will try to design a game inspired by the Museum of Childhood and their new exhibition.

All game design materials will be provided, just bring your ideas and amazing creativity. There will be cool prizes.
name: Playtest UK @ Museum of Childhood 2016

description:
The 13th Rite of the Munay Ki: The Rite of the Womb will be given to you.
This jungle medicine was passed to Marcela Lobos by a lineage of  jungle women, women who freed themselves from suffering. It is a powerful, rewarding rite of releasing fear and pain from the womb healing the feminine.

Marcela Lobos – Utube Rite of the Womb

This will be donation base only held at my offices.

Munay-Ki (Is much love, the energy of love) Ceremony, the Rite of the Womb, for the healing of the feminine.

In October through the powerful teachings of Shamans Marcela Lobos & Dona Juanita of Peru gave us these transmissions. The Q'uero Shamans of Peru -Don Francisco, Don Wilbert and Don Juan with our other male Shamans held sacred space for us.

I was blessed to receive the 13th Rite of the Munay-Ki, the Rite of the Womb, at the Omega Institute, NY with Shaman Linda Ludwig as well as Joshua Tree, CA with hundreds of other women. This is one of the most powerful experiences I have had.

Once transmitted to you, you will be able to transmit to other women.

If men attend, the men will hold sacred space for us receiving healing through the vibrations as they to come from the womb.

You can find more information and details of this rite at this link. http://theriteofthewomb.com

Come and join together for this special ceremony healing our wombs & healing the  divine feminine.

description:
--- We are announcing a new type of meetup - "Meet the UX'perts", where we will invite couple of UX professionals with different backgrounds and ask them same questions based on a topic of the event. Join this interactive interview and learn tips and tricks from guru's in the field! ---


Event description:

How to start in UX field? How to become a better UX designer? Where to search for inspiration? What are the tips that I should learn in order to succeed?

Lately we've received lots of these questions from our community members. If any of these queries have been popping up in your head too - this event is for you!

We are going to bring couple of UX professionals together to share their experiences on how they became gurus in their field. Don’t miss the opportunity to hear some great success stories!


UX level: Beginner.


Publitas is hosting this event.

Speakers list and detailed agenda will follow soon.


Agenda:

18.30 - Welcoming with snacks & drinks

19.00 - 19.15 - Introduction

19.15 - 21.00 - Interviewing speakers

21.00 – Let's socialise! Drinks and snacks

21.45 – End of event



Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Slack to receive the latest updates!
name: MEET THE UX’PERTS: How to start in UX?

At ProductTank NYC we love to hear from fellow product designers/managers about their experiences and challenges they've faced and overcome.

In February we carry on this tradition by presenting 15-minute talks from NYC-based product people, followed up by a Q&A session with our audience.

Drinks and networking will start at 6:30pm, with the speakers starting promptly at 7pm. ProductTank is about starting conversations so the talks are short so we can spend more time talking over drinks and pizza!

Vipul Musale
Product Manager
Namely 

Eric Menzie
Head of Product for the WFS Markets Salesforce CRM
Wells Fargo 


More guest speakers will be announced at a later date.

We look forward to seeing you there, and please do spread the word! 

http://www.producttank.com/ 
http://www.mindtheproduct.com/

description:
Come and get your mid week fix of forró at this friendly and fun class designed to give your forró a boost whether you are new or have been dancing a while

The one hour class starts off with some basic movements and then progresses with some more advanced moves.

This weeks classes will work specifically on the sequences taught at Forró Family on Saturday. Check our website at www.forrofamily.co.uk/classes

No need to bring a partner, just come in comfortable clothes. Class costs £5 or £2 donation if you just want to dance from 8pm
name: Brazilian forró class and social dance in Kilburn

description:
The East Tennessee Wanderers will be doing a NIGHT walk on the Alcoa Greenway on Friday, November 18th.  This will be a new event for us, and it will be on a new route for both the 5k and the 10k walks.

Bundle up and bring your flashlights!  Afterwards we will go to Puleo's for hot chocolate or dessert  (we've heard they have a great chocolate lasagna), or dinner...or all three!

The walk will start at the Quality Inn, 206 Corporate Place, Alcoa. Gather in the lobby to register for the walk.  10k walkers will meet at 6pm, and 5k walkers will meet at 7pm.
name: Alcoa Greenway Night Walk

description:
Being a Lightworker comes with some challenges, such as a feeling of not belonging, mood swings, the feeling that there is more, that reality as you have perceived it before suddenly seems a lot less real. These and many more can be the “symptoms” of a Lightworker.

Lightworkers are people whose mission it is to uplift this planet, and they are in all possible fields. In this “Bootcamp” we will discuss the path of a Lightworker, what an Awakening is and how to deal with it, how to find the right path and follow your mission and what you can expect from a life as a lightworker. 

Booking Essential
Please call or email:[masked] ; [masked]
name: Bootcamp for the Awakening Lightworker - With Kaya

description:
We've added a new location!  We looked at the map and realized that there aren't very many meetups very far up the Georgia 400 corridor.  We've been looking to add one for a while, and finally nailed down a location.

This is not meant to replace the meetup at Moe's that also occurs on Wednesdays.  With the two locations so far apart, there will now be a more convenient location for both areas on that night!

From the Mansell exit on 400, head east and turn left onto North Point Parkway.  The first light on the right is for AMC and Barnes and Noble - you'll want to take the second one.  You should see Jason's right as you make that right turn.

See everyone soon!
name: Well Played - Alpharetta Meetup

description:
This event is being sponsored by 5 separate Wine & Networking Meetups. The RSVPs on this page do not reflact total number of RSVPs or people prepaid. Pre-payment is required to confirm venue.

Join other NYC professionals for a private social where you will get to taste a wide variety of wines in a fun, relaxed environment. Red and white wines will be included in the line -up of featured pours. A sommelier will offer details about each wine and how it was made. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$35 Admission - Prepay only

https://advivywine.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

These events are ideal if you're looking to make new friends and broaden your social circle as well as network. Our members are eclectic and educated, many of which are graduates from competitive institutions; are culture enthusiasts; or have moved to NYC from other countries.

This will be a small intimate group (less than 40 people) so that you have the chance to meet everybody in attendance.

Learn more & Join our mailing list here to receive invites to non-Meetup affiliated events: http://www.buffsandbrainiacs.com/

CO-SPONSORED BY:

Networking for NYC Professionals
Networking for International Professionals
Well Educated Singles
Networking for Wine Lovers of NYC

Included in the night:

*Unlimited light pours of 6 red and white wines from around the world

*A sommelier to provide information about each wine

*Platters of cheese

*Rental of a private space recently profiled in the NY Times as one of the best wine stores in Manhattan

*Ice breakers & conversations starters to help people interact.

*Quiet atmosphere ideal for mingling and socializing

*CREDITS ARE AVAILABLE IF YOU CANCEL AT LEAST 2 DAYS IN ADVANCE.

*NO REFUNDS ARE AVAILABLE UNLESS THE EVENT IS CANCELED



Should I bring business cards? YES! We encourage all attendees to exchange business cards.

Will everybody in attendance be single? No, but most will be due to the nature of the groups co-sponsoring the event.

What is the dress code? What you wore to work will do. You can jazz it up and throw on a jacket or cocktail dress if you like. Just please no sneakers or active wear.

Can I come alone? Yes

Is this event social? Yes! We like to give our networking events a social vibe by including ice breakers and conversation starters. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. We can not accept payment at the door since the venue needs an accurate headcount at least 24 hours in advance.

*CREDITS ARE AVAILABLE IF YOU CANCEL AT LEAST 2 DAYS IN ADVANCE.

*NO REFUNDS ARE AVAILABLE UNLESS THE EVENT IS CANCELED
name: 🍷Private Wine Tasting & Social - 30's & 40's Members🍷

description:
Meeting Point 1: 8,15 am, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Meeting Point 2: 9,45 am, Siurana.

Guide: Ferran ( speaks English & Spanish ).

Average age of participants: From 20 to 45 years old, mainly.

Price Excursion: 16 €.

+ Transportation Cost: 9 € ( you pay at the car driver ).

Total Price= 25 €.

Level: Easy /Medium. 5 h in total walking aside time for relax & eat. Elevation gain: 380 m.

Estimated arrival time to Barcelona: 8 pm. What to bring: Trekking or sport shoes, food+water.

We recommend: Stick.

Points of Interest: The views from the medieval village of Siurana, his castle, his amazing cliffs, the river, the forest.

• • •

Punto de Encuentro 1: 8,15 h, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Punto de Encuentro 2: 9,45 h, Siurana.

Guia: Ferran ( habla Inglés & Castellano ).

Edad promedio Participantes: De 20 a 45 años, principalmente.

Precio Excursión: 16 € ( si traes tu coche desde plaza Catalunya y llevas a 4 participantes + tienes 16 € descuento ).

+ Coste Transporte: 9€ ( se lo pagas al conductor del coche en que vayas ).

Precio Total: 25 €.

Nivel: Fácil/Medio. 5 h de excursión en total, aparte del tiempo para relajarse, desayunar y comer. Desnivel: 380 m.

Hora estimada llegada a Barcelona: 20 h.

description:
*Your mind can be your best friend or your worst enemy* 

The program is based on an 8 part protocol for obsessive compulsive disorder of which clinical trials have been done to show its effectiveness. This protocol includes varies breathing techniques to reduce anxiety and deal with fear and will involve a challenging however extremely powerful breath called ocd breath. 

Reference: Kundalini yoga meditation for Psychiatric Disorders by David Shannahoff-Khalsa.
The program will consist of the following: 

• Length of course is 12 weeks, meeting once a week for a 2 hour session. 

• Step by Step instructions of each part within the protocol which can give an almost instant relief

• Support Group to share and allow for progress

• Implementing a daily home practise 

• Ongoing support group once a month after 12 week session

Extremely successful results have been achieved from this program.
This program is open to anyone over 16, no physical requirements. 

*For more information or for any queries you may have regarding this course you can contact Linda directly on[masked] or [masked] 

Personal Summary
Kundalini yoga and Mediation Instructor my passion is promoting positive Mental
Wellbeing. I specialise in treating Obsessive Compulsive Disorder and Anxiety due
to my own challenges with these issues. I currently run 12 week programs and have featured on the radio to promote awareness of mental Wellbeing.
I am currently studying Neurobiology, Mental Health and Meditation. 

Testimonial 12 week OCD program
I heard Linda discuss her condition on the radio and was amazed to hear somebody with exactly the same problems I have suffered from the past 40 years. I thought I was the only person in the world with such bizarre intrusive thoughts and was surprised to hear she had used a yoga breathing technique to heal herself. I contacted her and have attended her classes. After a short time of regular practise I noticed a significant improvement in my condition. I found that some of the techniques brought an almost instant relief to the anxiety and played a major role in helping me get a good nights sleep which was a problem for me previously.As a result of daily practise of these techniques my ocd has completely disappeared. I have found that the support of a group with similar problems to be a very cathartic and also helpful to know you are not alone with this probelm. I would hightly recommend these classes. Niall
name: Heal Within – Obsessive Compulsive Disorder Program - With Linda Culleton

description:
The Dancer's Workout is a high-energy dance class which includes warm-up, careful stretching, toning, and a thorough cardio workout.  Intermediate, advanced, and advanced-beginner dancers alike enjoy Jules' ability to teach exciting pop choreography in a manner that is fun and easy-to learn. The Dancer's Workout is not a beginner's dance class; it requires training in ballet, jazz, or hip hop and the ability to pick up choreography quickly.  Every version of The Dancer's Workout includes movement sequences from multiple genres of dance, including ballet, lyrical jazz, hip-hop, and contemporary.  Its instructional choreography builds upon itself throughout the hour and offers a powerful, non-stop cardio workout which culminates in a dance to a featured pop song. The class is great for former dancers who want to find their way back home and for active dancers interested in maintaining flexibility and cardio stamina.  Jazz sneakers or jazz slippers preferred.

Jules is a classical ballet graduate of the University of North Carolina School of the Arts (maiden name Julie Redding) who teaches "The Dancer's Workout" at various locations throughout the triangle. She has a knack for teaching intricate pop choreography in a manner which is easy-to-learn while simultaneously providing dancers with an exhilarating, one-hour total body workout. Very supportive atmosphere, especially for former dancers who want to dance again.

For more information about The Dancer's Workout in general, including access to a class demo, visit www.thedancersworkout.com.  For more information about The Dancer's Workout when taught at the Durham Arts Council, including cost and session dates, visit www.durhamarts.org.  The Dancer's Workout is taught at the Durham Arts Council on Thursdays from 6-7 pm in the beautiful Wachovia Dance Studio (second floor).  $3 parking across the street.  Students may sign up for the full session or drop-in ($15/class).  Drop-ins require an RSVP on this meetup and a check made out to Durham Arts Council (give to Jules at the end of class).  All meetup members welcome!
name: The Dancer's Workout

Pływaliśmy już w lutym wcześniej...
Pływaliśmy już w Arktyce wcześniej...
Jednak nigdy nie pływaliśmy w lutym w Arktyce!

Czego się spodziewać:

• zorza polarna!

• wieloryby!

• dzień długości 7 godzin

• temperatura w okolicach -5 stopni - to nie pomyłka Arktyczna Norwegia jest zimą często cieplejsza od okolic Oslo czy Polski

• jeden sztorm - który przeczekamy w jednym z wielu ciekawych portów

• trochę śniegu na pokładzie

• prawdziwej niezapomnianej żeglarskiej wyprawy!

Trasa:

Tromsø - Skjervoy - Hasvik - Havøysund - Honningsvåg (Nordkapp) - Kjøllefjord - Vardo - Kirkenes
około 400nm 
około 60% trasy między wyspami

W trakcie rejsu będziemy mieli okazję nie tylko opłynąć zimą Knivskjellodden na Nordkapp - najbardziej na północ wysuniętą cześć Europy, 

ale również:

Opłynąć Kinnarodden na Nordkinnhalvøya - najbardziej na północ wysuniętą cześć kontynentalnej Europy,

Zobaczyć Finmark - najbardziej na północ wysuniętą część Norwegii którą zamieszkują jej rdzenni mieszkańcy Sami - ostatni nomadzi Europy,

Odwiedzić Vardo - miasto z największą odnotowaną populacją czarownic,

Wyśmienicie się bawić!

Jeśli jeszcze nie jesteś przekonany, oto jak było w zeszłym roku: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UQk8sAbZVkQ


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jjkKy-yKrQo

jacht

Jak w latach poprzednich do Arktyki płyniemy na pokładzie "JoinUs", stalowego yachtu Bruce Roberts NY46.

Jacht w tej chwili (listopad) przechodzi remont w Polsce i będzie gotowy na dalsze wyprawy już w Nowy Rok.

cena

965 euro w tym 290 euro kasy jachtowej.

W chwili obecnej (8/11/2016) wynosi to odpowiednio:
~£860 w tym ~£260 kasy jachtowej.

Koszty podane i rozliczane są w euro ze względu na brak stabilności funta. Środki zbieramy jednak w funtach przed rejsem i nie potrzebujecie wymieniać samodzielnie pieniędzy.

Kasa jachtowa będzie rozliczana wg. faktycznych wydatków na koniec rejsu. Podajemy i zbieramy ją wcześniej by dać Wam lepszą orientacje w całkowitych kosztach wyprawy.

Cena podstawowa obejmuje:

• czarter i ubezpieczenie jachtu

• ubezpieczenie kaucji jachtu do wysokości 2400pln

• obsługę skippera i bosmana

• pamiątkowy kubeczek (bądź koszulkę)

• osobiste ubezpieczenie podróży w rejony Arktyczne 

Kasa jachtowa obejmuje:

• porty

• paliwo

• jedzenie

• gaz

Cena nie obejmuje sprzątania. Na zakończenie rejsu jacht musi być posprzątany przez załogę.
Cena nie obejmuje transportu i wszelkich ewentualnych wydatków na lądzie.

transport:

Codzienne loty SAS i Norwegian przez Oslo. 
Ceny rozsądne, tzn. około £100 w jedna stronę z Londynu na dzisiaj (listopad).

Murmańsk

Dla zainteresowanych możliwość 3-4 dniowej wycieczki z Kirkenes do Murmańska na zakończenie rejsu.

Naszym przewodnikiem będzie nie kto inny jak Jacek. Jak właśnie powiedział:
"Zaczynam sie juz przygotowywac. I beda polskie ackcenty!"

Rejs organizowany przy współpracy JoinUs i North.Voyage 
fot: JoinUs i Michał Przech.

description:
Who is this workshop for?
The workshop is for anyone interested in voice and sound as a source of courage, fun and power. It makes no difference whether you have or haven’t previous experience of singing or music! What is the workshop about?

Our sound is the simplest and most ancient of all the sources of our creative power. Many of us experienced a deep disconnection from this source at a very young age when we were told we could not sing or we had ‘no voice’. Something healing and magical occurs when we reconnect to this source and find the sound of our own heart and soul. Through it, we move into a new relationship with our creativity, our wisdom and our innate ability to heal and nurture ourselves, no matter what our journey. What will we be doing?

Participants will be introduced to The Naked Voice methodology of sound and voice developed by internationally renowned singer and composer Chloe Goodchild. During the day we will work with singing, silence, movement and play. Who is the Facilitator?

Emer has trained for many years with Chloe Goodchild and is an accredited Naked Voice Facilitator. She has also studied with the UK College of Sound Healing. Emer holds an MSc and works as a trainer in community development and holistic well-being. She has recently released her first CD Eldersong of her own haunting and inspiring songs – see website & facebook & listen to full songs on Breaking Tunes link. Available on itunes, Amazon & Spotify. 

Booking Essential
Please phone, text or email Emer ;
[masked]; [masked]
name: The Healing Voice Workshop - with Emer Dolphin

description:
Since leaving Quo, John has worked with many noted and diverse musicians, mostly in his own Diesel Band. Other appearances include Partners In Crime and the short-lived ‘Rockers’ featuring Phil Lynott, Roy Wood and Chas Hodges. Additional collaborations have included Noel Redding (ex-Jimi Hendrix) and Eric Bell (ex-Thin Lizzy).


During the late nineties John Coghlan’s Quo was formed and through various line-ups has enjoyed regular gigs all over the UK and Europe. From 2010 (previously performing as The John Coghlan Band) the band consisted of John on Drums with Baz Barry, Mick Hughes and Pete Knight from NWOBHM Boogie Band ‘Predatür’ completing the line-up. From May 2015, Rick Chase replaced Pete Knight on Bass.

It should be clear this is most definitely not a “tribute” act, the prime aim being to recreate an authentic “70’s Quo Sound” in keeping with John’s time with Quo.

John explains, “Since leaving in 1981 I’ve played with loads of guitarists and they’d say let’s stick a couple of Quo songs in and they would come unstuck. They think it is so easy and they just bluff their way through and really do a poor version.”

“I got a call from Pete Barton who sings with The Animals, but is also a booking agent. He said you had loads of hit records; why not put a band together? I now have these guys from Predatür. Great players and they recreate the sound without this lookalike rubbish. I don’t want to discuss tribute bands because it is not our bag. Baz, Mick and Pete – we get on great and we have a good following for John Coghlan’s Quo. I still play the way I played with Quo, I haven’t changed anything. We even play down my little local Pub; we take all the furniture out! We did it once for fun and now we have done it twice a year for twenty-six years. We still attack the songs the same as at big gigs and Quo fans love it because that’s the way it should be played.”

Aside from the expected Quo standards the Set List will often include songs that have either not been performed by Quo for many years or even on occasion, not at all. If you enjoy a combination of long-lost classic album tracks with a mixture of Quo’s Greatest Hits and delivered with a 70’s vibe, then a John Coghlan’s Quo gig is simply a must.

Tickets £13.20
name: Authentic Recreation Of 1970's Status Quo -  JOHN COGHLAN’S QUO

description:
The Dancer's Workout is a high-energy dance class which includes warm-up, careful stretching, toning, and a thorough cardio workout.  Intermediate, advanced, and advanced-beginner dancers alike enjoy Jules' ability to teach exciting pop choreography in a manner that is fun and easy-to learn. The Dancer's Workout is not a beginner's dance class; it requires training in ballet, jazz, or hip hop and the ability to pick up choreography quickly.  Every version of The Dancer's Workout includes movement sequences from multiple genres of dance, including ballet, lyrical jazz, hip-hop, and contemporary.  Its instructional choreography builds upon itself throughout the hour and offers a powerful, non-stop cardio workout which culminates in a dance to a featured pop song. The class is great for former dancers who want to find their way back home and for active dancers interested in maintaining flexibility and cardio stamina.  Jazz sneakers or jazz slippers preferred.

Jules is a classical ballet graduate of the University of North Carolina School of the Arts (maiden name Julie Redding) who teaches "The Dancer's Workout" at various locations throughout the triangle. She has a knack for teaching intricate pop choreography in a manner which is easy-to-learn while simultaneously providing dancers with an exhilarating, one-hour total body workout. Very supportive atmosphere, especially for former dancers who want to dance again.

For more information about The Dancer's Workout in general, including access to a class demo, visit www.thedancersworkout.com.  For more information about The Dancer's Workout when taught at the Durham Arts Council, including cost and session dates, visit www.durhamarts.org.  The Dancer's Workout is taught at the Durham Arts Council on Thursdays from 6-7 pm in the beautiful Wachovia Dance Studio (second floor).  $3 parking across the street.  Students may sign up for the full session or drop-in ($15/class).  Drop-ins require an RSVP on this meetup and a check made out to Durham Arts Council (give to Jules at the end of class).  All meetup members welcome!
name: The Dancer's Workout - Filming "Crocodile"

description:
You are cordially invited to a nonpartisan Election Night party to watch the results.  After you cast your vote, join us for an evening of Election-themed event.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

• Are you ready to usher in the Era of Trump? 

• Or should the Nation brace itself for another Clinton term?  

• Perhaps 2016 dashes hopes for any viable Third Party challenges in the future? 

• What will the makeup of Congress look like? Will the balance of power change hands?

• Finally, which local races or ballot initiatives are you closely following?

Nonetheless, this only happens every four years and much of what we've discussed this year culminates into this ultimate finale!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Proposed schedule and agenda:

7:00 pm -- doors open

8:00 to 9:30pm -- "Open Mic" (each member has two minutes to "rant" or speak freely, reflecting on this "unconventional" year in politics)

9:30 to 11:30pm -- watch the results via live broadcast, and any Victory and / or Concession speeches

** PLUS, be sure to stop by our Hug-it-Out™ photo booth, a friendly photographic antidote to the "electoral dysfunctional anxieties."

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*** LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH PLANNING THIS EVENT -- please step up!

More details to follow.
name: Election Night — a "Brazen" Political Party!

description:
In Integrated Energy Therapy® we believe that our life is not completely healed until we are living our dreams in life. Therefore, we have developed a progressive focus for our classes that starts with clearing the pain and helping us “survive life”, and progresses to finding and living our soul’s mission so that we can “thrive in life”. 

The Basic level training works at the 1st (physical) and 2nd (emotional) pair of the 12 Strand DNA and provides students with the ability to clear physical and emotional energy blockages from the cellular memory and leave in their place positive physical and emotional energy imprints. 

Even though we call this class “basic level” this class provides you with everything you need to do a powerful Integrated Energy Therapy session on yourself or on another person (either in person or absentee). This class has been designed to be a wonderful entry level class for those students wanting to use energy therapy to heal their lives, an ideal class for students wanting to begin an energy therapy practice, and it provides a wonderful complement to other holistic techniques such as Massage, Reiki, and Therapeutic Touch. 

For more information on Integrated Energy therapy see ww.learniet.com
name: Integrated Energy Therapy ® Basic Level Training - With Alistair William

description:
Please note, our original speaker for this date, Maryam Namazie from One Law for All is not able to make this date due to an important engagement in Europe, we hope to have her come and speak to us in 2017. 

Skeptics in the Pub is a place for inquisitive people of all ages to meet and converse in the High Wycombe area.

Skeptics are people who yearn to discover the truth behind extraordinary claims that people or groups may make, this can be in areas of alternative therapies, the paranormal, religion and faith, the afterlife and many other areas of life. We we often end up talking about superstition, science, religious fundamentalism, health, censorship and conspiracy theory

We make no claims to balance, and actively promote science, freedom of expression and secular humanism..

You are welcome to come along and just sit and listen to others, or if you are braver get stuck right in with conversation and views!

Our Website is at wycombe.skepticsinthepub.org, join our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter.
name: Wycombe Skeptics in the Pub - Talk TBC

description:
RESCHEDULED TO THURSDAY AT 9 AM.    

Weather permitting...A moderate pace ride (roughly 11 to 13 mph) on The Southern Walnut Creek Trail from the trailhead at Govalle Park up to the Abrupt End at Lindell Lane just north of Decker Lake.  Round trip is about 20 miles.  The trail is paved for the entire distance,with a 1/2 mile hill on the outbound.  We'll regroup periodically on the outbound and at the Abrupt End.  The return is mostly downhill. 

The trail is two-way and narrows down in spots. Single-file riding is recommended. 

There are two significant road intersections that require caution to cross. 

This ride is cross-posted to Bike Austin at http://austincycling.org/rides/

A  map of Govalle Park's location is at http://austinparks.org/parks/govalle-park/

Bring water, a snack, a spare bicycle tire tube, and tools to fix a flat. Riders will sign a liability waiver at the ride start and must wear a helmet. 

There are no restrooms on the trail itself. There are restrooms at Govalle Park and at the Austin Tennis Center, about 1/3 mile off the trail. 

Meet after the ride for coffee / brunch at the mellow Sa-Ten cafe, 916 Springdale Rd.  It is within easy cycling distance of Govalle Park.
name: RESCHEDULED to Thurs-Tour de Southern Walnut Creek Trail
