The Old Rag Mountain hike in the Shenandoah National Park is one of the most popular hikes in the mid-Atlantic region. With many spectacular panoramic views, and one of the most challenging rock scrambles in the park.  It is 9 miles round trip.  Bring plenty of water and lunch.  

http://www.hikingupward.com/SNP/OldRag/
name: Old Rag Mountain hike

description:
This is a 10.5 mile (out and back) hike that begins at the Bent Creek River Park where we follow a short connector to the Mountain to Sea Trail South and then to the Sleepy Gap overlook and back, The trail has 3 strenuous climbs and an optional 4th climb near the Sleepy gap overlook. In-between are sections with mild elevation gains or losses. 


The trail includes an overlook of the French Broad River, ridge line views of Asheville and the opposing mountains, and a walk along rhododendron arcades. On the return there is one strenuous climb with mostly down hill sections. The trail is well maintained but there are some roots and rocks. Please be capable of hiking 10 miles with elevation challenges.


Pace:  Fitness hikes proceed at a brisk pace  adjusting for trail conditions; however, we are at different fitness levels & spread out a bit therefore we pause as needed to regroup. Please be capable of hiking at least 10 miles with elevation so that you will not significantly delay the group. 

Our fitness hikes offer different levels of challenge and have a difficulty rating from 1-10 ( 1 being our more difficult challenge).  The difficulty rating for this hike is 4-5.* 

If you are looking for fun and a fitness challenge, please join us.

Dogs; Friendly dogs are most welcome and please have leashes handy. Bring extra water as the natural spring fed area on this trail was dry on our previous hike due to the current drought conditions.  

Hike time:  Usually between 3-3 1/2 hours. See GPS for hike details below:

http://connect.garmin.com/activ...

*Additional Information about Fitness Hike levels: 

An example of a level 1 hike would be Sam's Gap to Big Bald on the AT, a 13 -14 mile hike with 3000 feet elevation gain.  A mid-level (level 4-5)  hike is the Shut-in trail from Bent Creek River Park to Sleepy gap , and a level 10 hike is the MST from the BRP Head Quarters & Visitor Center to the Hendersonville Rd exit & back, (average distance but without significant elevation). These hikes tend to be our base hikes used  to Gage the other hikes in this 10-15 hike series. 

Occasionally we  offer an Ultimate Fitness Challenge such as the 14 mile Black Mountain Crest Trail (Mt. Mitchell to Mt. Celo & back), or a similar challenge.
name: Fitness Hike  -  Shut in Trail 10.5 miles; Difficult

description:
*Your mind can be your best friend or your worst enemy* 

This program is for anyone suffering with any of the following on a daily/ regular basis.

- Generalised Anxiety Disorder
- Panic Attacks
- Social Anxiety

The program will consist of the following:
- Length of course is 12 weeks, meeting once a week for a 1 hour session.
- Techniques to allow for relief with above issues
- Support Group to share and allow for progress
- Implementing a daily home practise
- Ongoing support group once a month after 12 week session 

The program is based on Kundalini yoga and Meditation techniques which give a clear and peaceful mind and allow you to become in control of your emotions.
Extremely successful results have been achieved from this program. 

*For more information or for any queries you may have regarding this course you can contact Linda directly on[masked] or [masked]

Personal Summary
Kundalini yoga and Mediation Instructor my passion is promoting positive Mental Wellbeing. I specialise in treating Obsessive Compulsive Disorder and Anxiety due to my own challenges with these issues. I currently run 12 week programs and have featured on the radio to promote awareness of mental Wellbeing.
I am currently studying Neurobiology, Mental Health and Meditation. 

Testimonial 12 week OCD program
I heard Linda discuss her condition on the radio and was amazed to hear somebody with exactly the same problems I have suffered from the past 40 years. I thought I was the only person in the world with such bizarre intrusive thoughts and was sprised to hear she had used a yoga breathing technique to heal herself. I contacted her and have attended her classes. After a short time of regular practise I noticed a significant improvement in my condition. I found that some of the techniques brought an almost instant relief to the anxiety and played a major role in helping me get a good nights sleep which was a problem for me previously.As a result of daily practise of these techniques my ocd has completely disappeared. I have found that the support of a group with similar problems to be a very cathartic and also helpful to know you are not alone with this probelm. I would hightly recommend these classes. Niall
name: Heal Within – Anxiety - With Linda Culleton

description:
Winter has come and with it also all the more or less common deseases like cold, cough and flu.. how to deal with them in a natural, sustainable and effective way?

Well, in the workshop we are going to present the plants that are commonly used in the Western Herbalism for cold and flu, but also plants that are used to prevent the deseases and boost the immune system, with a special focus on those that are commonly available in Denmark.

We are also going to learn how to make our own syrup against the cold to bring home!

Looking forward to meet you all!
name: Western Herbal Remedies for cold and flu

description:
TICKETS MUST BE PURCHASED THROUGH EVENTBRITE. RSVPS ON MEETUP DO NOT GUARANTEE ATTENDANCE.

PURCHASE TICKETS HERE.

In this Holiday Ornament workshop you will use various clay hand building techniques to craft a fun seasonal piece of pottery. This class is perfect for anyone who wants to experience the basics working with clay. This is a fun 90 minute long class of guided instructions to help you create your winter decorations. This class can hold up to 10 people. Is appropriate for ages 6 years old and up.

•All work will be ready within two so you can enjoy them! Pieces can be picked up Wednesday nights during Lowell Makes Open House from 6-9PM. You can also contact the instructor to set up an alternative time if that does not work. Your art will be held no longer then one month after the work is finished.

Prerequisites: None

Ages: 6 and up

Max students: 10

Lowell Makes Members are entitled to a 20% discount on ticket prices after costs of materials.


Instructor Bio:

Chelsi Hanley grew up in Lowell, Massachusetts, currently a city with a vastly growing art community. Chelsi attended Lowell High School from[masked], where she grew a fast connection and love for ceramics. She carried this love to college where she pursued a degree in Fine Arts. Chelsi attended the University of Massachusetts in Lowell from 2008 to 2013. Here she primarily concentrated in dark room photography, sculpture, and ceramics. Part of the reason she acquired the liking for these three mediums is the hands on connection she can make with the material. Chelsi was the art teacher at the Boys & Girls Club of Greater Lowell where she helped youth gain inspiration for their art and life; between 2011 and 2014. Chelsi was the manager of the Ceramic Studio, Indigo Fire, in Belmont, Massachusetts. Chelsi continued her education after college at MudFlat in Somerville Massachusetts where she took classes and an independent study. Currently she is growing her collection and is creating her ceramic pieces at Lowell Makes.

You can find Chelsi's work on her portfolio site.
name: Ornaments Pottery Workshop

description:
Join us on Wed 23 Nov on visit to a unique collection of drawings and paintings of Bob Dylan’s America. The Beaten Path offers viewers insight into the world of Dylan, whose artistry has transcended every generation and celebrates a vivid manifestation of a country which continues to charm and captivate

Exhibition The show is one of the most extensive displays ever mounted of his drawings, water colours, acrylics and ironwork's. The paintings reflect Dylan’s nearly constant travels throughout the United States on the ‘never ending tour’ that has consumed the last two decades of his life. The choice of subject matter reflects a deep affinity for the North American scene, an abiding affection for its curious roadside attractions and respect for its industrial might.

Staying out of the mainstream and travelling the back roads, freeborn style.”  It’s a panoramic view of the US, similar to the one described in his kaleidoscopic 1975 song Tangled Up in Blue. Railways, skyscrapers, and suspension bridges vie with deserted side streets and overgrown motels for attention. This is a United States of fairgrounds and circuses, forgotten crossroads and neglected cityscapes. The streets are filled with depictions of bulky late 1950s automobiles, including the Ford Edsel, a famous automotive failure. . The sense is of Dylan as a solitary figure with a sketchbook, looking at the country from odd angles. He is also this years winner of the Nobel prize in literature

1200 -  A hour Guided Tour of Royal Academy of Art(RA) including highly decorated 18th century interiors of the John Madejski Fine Rooms.  the way find out how our building has evolved since the 1660s and get an insight into the early years of the Royal Academy, from its early beginnings as a town palace in the heart of London. Selected works from the RA’s extensive collection are on display throughout.  Among its founders were Sir Joshua Reynolds and Sir William Chambers, who were determined to achieve professional standing for British art and architecture. Past Royal Academicians include John Constable, Thomas Gainsborough, JMW Turner, Lord Leighton and Stanley Spencer, while current members include Norman Foster, Richard Rogers, David Hockney, Tracey Emin, Antony Gormley and Anish Kapoor

                                      1130  Meet

                                      1200  Free Guided tour of RA

                                      1315  Leisurely walk thru Burlington Arcade to.....

                                      1330  Bob Dylan Exhibition - self guided tour


   £3 Organisers Fee payable on the day 

 Meet:   Please look for Meetup sign. We will wait 10 min after the advertised time.  If cannot see us  please text me on[masked]

                                   Maybe go for drink and chat after visit.

                                              Look forward to seeing you all there

                                                                    Sandy

description:
Hallo liebe Gettpalers,
(Scroll for Englisch)

seid ihr neu bei Gettpal? Habt ihr Lust, viele neue und liebe Leute kennenzulernen und gleichzeitig erfahren, worum es bei Gettpal geht?

Wir laden euch herzlich zum Willkommens-Event für neue Gettpaler ein, das wir vorallem für die Neulinge organisieren. Der Abend läuft in freundlicher Atmosphäre ab und bei einem lieben Kennenlernspiel werden wir uns alle gegenseitig kennenlernen, sich unterhalten und werden einen angenehmen Abend miteinander verbringen.

Während dem Abend findet ihr neue Freunde und vorallem, falls es bisher irgendwelche Hindernisse gegeben hat, sich eurerseits an den Gettpal-Events teilzunehmen, nach diesem Abend werdet ihr sicher alle über Bord werfen.

Wir freuen uns auf euch! :)

Euer Gettpal Team

-----------------------------------------------------------
Dear Gettpalers,

would you like to meet lots of new and kind people and figure out what Gettpal is actually about?

We would like to invite you to our Welcome Evening to experience the Gettpal community. The evening is held in a friendly atmosphere. We will get to know each other better through a lovely get-to-know game, we will chit-chat and have a good time together. You will spend nice time with interesting people and find new friends :)

Looking forward to meeting you! :)

Your Gettpal Team

This event on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/354361388232244/

More info: http://gettpal.com/home/
name: We will meet new people, have fun and play some games :)

description:
Este evento é para quem lida com a dificuldade de fazer apresentações de alto impacto em tempo reduzido.  

A referência são as apresentações/vendas onde o empreendedor tem de 3 a 5 minutos para expor sua idéia, os motivos que o levaram a criar a empresa/produto, seus diferenciais e as projeções de desenvolvimento. São conhecidas pelo nome de Pitch.

Será uma demonstração prática do processo de Coaching e a apresentação do treinamento concebido específicamente para quem quer melhorar sua forma de se apresentar e empreender, o Pitch Coaching.

Incrições abaixo (para receber as instruções de participação) Após receber seus dados confirmaremos seu RSVP

https://www.eventbrite.com.br/e/pitch-coaching-online-tickets-29248688615

Obs: Necessário ter câmera, microfone e conexão suficiente para a atividade. 

O participante deve se organizar para comparecer um pouco antes da hora na página até que seja enviado o link da sessão que só é gerado quando ela começa. Depois de iniciada a conferência nem sempre é possível adicionar quem chega.
name: Pitch Coaching online

description:
Dear Members,

Make this year your best year yet to improve your English!

If you are serious about wanting to improve your English, then these classes are not to be missed! You will learn a lot and find it of very good value.

This is a mixed level general English class that will take you to the next level. It uses a variety of learning tools which are designed to help you quickly develop, improve and take you to the next level of your English fluency.

With every single class, you will learn and immediately use a lot of very useful and practical vocabulary and phrases. You will quickly improve, develop and expand your:

• English Conversation & Listening skills

• Very Useful Vocabulary and Phrases 

• Phrasal verbs and Idioms

• Pronunciation and Error Correction

• Communication skills

• Confidence, Creativity and Imagination

With regular classes, all these skills and much more will be achieved whilst you are having fun in a friendly, welcoming and supportive environment.

Classes are in small groups - Maximum of 6 per class and suitable for everyone except beginners.

Please bring a pen and notebook to take down important vocabulary and phrases.

Payment

The cost for this 3 hour organised and structured lesson is only £15. Please note: The cost of the lesson also include free refreshments & snack - Tea, Coffee, Hot Chocolate, Water and Biscuits/Cake etc.

• You will need to pay for these classes in advance. Please 'Click' on the RSVP button to book and pay for the class online. Online payment is the quickest and easiest method.

• However, if you want, you can also pay cash into my account or transfer the money directly into my account.  Please send me a message on mobile:[masked] for my account details   As soon as you have made the transfer or put cash into my account, I will book you in and immediately reserve a spot for you.

If you are serious about wanting to improve your English, please RSVP for my Very Useful and Practical English Classes.

Directions:

These classes are  held in Balham which is easy to get to using the Tube or Train.  Balham is on the Northern line and Southern train line. It is only 15 minutes from Victoria train station.

This is a private address. This means the Full address and directions are not open to the public. I will text you or email you the Full address when you have booked the class. 


I very much look forward to meeting you soon.

Please do tell your friends, colleagues and families about my Very Useful and Practical English Classes.  Thank you in advance.

Rachel
name: The Very Useful and Practical  English Class in Balham - SW London

group.name: Improve Your English In London - Make It Your Best Year Yet!

description:
You can register here: www.hackthechangerol.eventbrite.co.uk

All you need to do is bring yourselves, your skills and your kit. And together we can change the world for good.

This is the UK's first Hackathon to materially progress LGBT* human rights with our big challenge to be announced at Kick off on Friday. It's a completely open and inclusive event. If it's your first Hackathon or whether you are a Hackathon addict, you will be well supported and looked after throughout the event.

We’re launching it with Amazon Web Services who will be giving demos of their latest offerings to help you meet the challenge and each team will have pretty much unlimited AWS credits to spin up into the cloud. We will also have AWS Solution architects on hand and in person to help with all your techy needs: it's a chance to learn and upskill. We have some amazing legal experts on hand to talk through any IP, tech, privacy and data questions you may have courtesy of our Legal sponsors Freshfields, Hogan Lovells and Osborne Clarke. 

Whilst we have prizes for the winners and runners up teams, there will be some big time spot prizes to be announced. and everyone gets a swag bag and of course an epic Hack the Change T-shirt!

The event is fully catered event: breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks and of course plenty of pizza, beer and wine to aid the creative juices.

Together we can, for the first time, join together the tech and the legal worlds to make real change. The winners will see their ideas taken forward by the charity we are supporting at this event called the Human Dignity Trust; meaning you will have a real impact on the world. It is an authentic Hack. And we need you!

We are recruiting for coders, developers, designers, innovators, big data experts, machine learners, do-ers, maker-ers, think-ers. Register using our Eventbrite link above or below.
And feel free to email me directly with any queries you may have: [masked]

We are hosting it at the Impact Hub in Westminster which has 24/7 security and you are welcome to bring a sleeping bag and stay over. There are plenty of chillout areas and sleep areas; we even have showers.

The Challenge will be announced at kick off on the Friday night.

Come and get involved! Join us to HACK THE CHANGE you want to see in the world.

You can register here: www.hackthechangerol.eventbrite.co.uk


OUTLINE TIMINGS:

FRIDAY

6PM: WELCOME DRINKS AND SIGN IN

7PM: FORMAL WELCOME, PRESENTATIONS: CHALLENGE REVEAL

9.30PM TEAM FORMING AND SOCIAL DRINKS AND PIZZA

SATURDAY

9.30: BREAKFAST: COFFEE TEA JUICE PASTRIES

10AM RECALIBRATING SCENE SETTING FOR THE DAY AHEAD

11AM DESIGNING HACKING AND DOING

HOT LUNCH, DINNER

7PM: SOCIAL DRINKS AND HACKING AND TAKE AWAY

SUNDAY

9.30: BREAKFAST: COFFEE TEA JUICE PASTRIES

10AM: RECALIBRATING SCENE SETTING FOR THE DAY AHEAD

11AM: DOING AND TESTING AND HOT LUNCH

2PM TEAM PRESENTATIONS

5PM: AWARDS CEREMONY, SOCIAL DRINKS & CLOSE
name: Hack the Change for LGBT* Rights: Lexis Nexis+ AWS + Human Dignity Trust

description:
Here's an opportunity to traverse some seldom visited trails along the river and see some of Maymont from a different perspective!  Starting at the Texas Beach parking lot we'll pick up the North Bank Trail at the intersection of Kansas Avenue and Hampton Street and proceed west to the Pump House.  


Emerging from the riverside, we'll climb the hill behind the Carillon, loop around Shields Lake or cut through Maymont and return to the starting point where we'll descend to the river to check out the famous Texas Beach. 

This is anticipated to be a 4.58 mile hike, half downhill & half uphill, that should take approximately one hour and forty-seven minutes to complete!  Afterward, the option to enjoy morning coffee at Panera Bread will be available for those interested.
name: Nov. 8, 10 AM - Texas Beach Loop

description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Andy Shannon (Startup Bootcamp)

Andy is the Head of Global at Startupbootcamp, one of the world’s largest startup investors with 15 programs in 10 countries and over 350 portfolio companies.

Andy has held multiple startup operating and technology commercialization roles in addition to working with both angel and tech transfer groups. He was previously a Family Office Investment manager where he led the exit of portfolio company ExpenseMagic, and a Fellow at the early stage VC Seedcamp. 

Andy received his MBA from Imperial College London and BA from the University of Wisconsin – Madison. Join us for a fireside chat about startups, finding product market fit and how to grow companies.

We invited Andy to share his wisdom with our audience: how to raise funding, how to find product market fit and how to get your startup to the next level. 

Click here to book your ticket now!

7:00 pm Fireside Chat

8:00 pm Networking, drinks

Director, Europe at Startup Grind.

Founder of Bhere.TV, a platform that brings business leaders live online. Startup mentor and judge at Virgin Startup,Startup Weekend & Mass Challenge. Ex-Orange, ex-Reebok. 

Marian was featured in New Europe 100 (organised by Financial Times, Google, Respublica and Visegrad Fund), the list of outstanding challengers who are leading world class innovation from Central and Eastern Europe.

description:
Enjoy one of Dubai's cheapest cultural breakfasts, at just 70 AED* per person you get to experience one of the most authentic restaurants that provides a real home made Emirati food. This meet up is going to give you the chance to meet Emirati people that were born and live here. The Emirati people you are going to meet are lovely and excited to meet expat people who are living or visiting Dubai. 

*Note: The AED 70 includes a breakfast set menu that includes several selections along with tea or karak (suitable for vegetarians) and our event charge which is AED 14 all inclusive. The amount needs to be paid in cash at the beginning of the event, we kindly request our attendees to bring the exact amount to avoid wasting time in arranging change for everyone. 

The location is Al Fanar Restaurant - Town Centre (Jumeira) 

Location map:

https://goo.gl/maps/yRr6vkGNkxv

You can also contact us on [masked] in case if faced any troubles in finding the restaurant place or if you are coming late. 

Event Program:

10:00 - 10:30 

Introduction and socialising, the aim of our meet up group and we will be explaining the menu items so you make the best selections that suits you.

10:30 to 11:30

Attendees will place their breakfast order and we will talk about about different topics related to our culture and tradition at the same time, while we will be tasting the yummy food we will be telling some real life stories.

11:30 to 12:30

We will take you a short tour in the restaurant to see how the houses looked like in the past and show you samples that represents our old lifestyle.  

12:30 to 1:00 

During this time you can ask us questions, we will give an idea of our future events and we would also love to hear about your feedback and suggestions. 

Thank you,

Meet the Locals Team :)

description:
This is a hands on workshop for those Meetup members who want to get some practical experience of working with blockchain technologies.


Workshop Objectives

• Create a node within a private blockchain 

• Participate in the consensus / mining process of the blockchain

• Create tokens and other custom assets

• Send assets to other participants on the chain

• Understand how to create Public/Private Keys & Addresses

• Construct transactions and learn how to sign and publish them to a chain

• Explore resiliency within a blockchain 


Workshop Prerequisites

These must be setup on your laptop beforehand in order to participate

• Docker[masked] ~110 MB (https://github.com/docker/docker/releases/tag/v1.12.1)

• Docker Hub Account (https://hub.docker.com/)

• Postman Chrome Application (https://www.getpostman.com)

• Git Project (rakutenrbl/multichain-peer).  Clone via:

• ssh: git clone [masked]:rakutenrbl/multichain-peer.git

• https: git clone https://github.com/rakutenrbl/multichain-peer.git

• Docker Image ~380 MB (rakutenrbl/multichain-peer:latest)

• docker pull rakutenrbl/multichain-peer:latest

• Trello Account (https://trello.com)

• https://trello.com/b/j2CFa8ht/build-your-own-blockchain
name: Build Your Own Blockchain (Hands On Workshop)

description:
£28 including train travel from London Victoria

New hike for November, the first one of which will be limited to just 15 attendees!!!

Join us on our new exciting hike across Surrey's magnificent upland landscapes - designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty! 
Our Surrey Hills exploration will take us through picturesque woodland, heathland and farmland. We will hike to Leith Hill - the second-highest peak in South-East England. Standing at Leith Hill is a majestic tower built in the 18th century which is the highest point in South-East England!
The trails we've chosen will prove the significant landscape value of Surrey, which national importance has been officially recognised since 1958!

Highlights:

• Discover Surrey's Hills - Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB)

• Conquer Leith Hill - the highest peak of the area and second-highest in South-East England.

• See Leith Hill tower - an 18th century masterpiece and the highest point in South-East England

• Hike to Tilling Springs - where River Tillingbourne begins

• Discover the North Downs way and its stunning views towards Dorking

• Hike through England's largest vineyard - Denbies Wine Estate


Photos - All photos were taken by the hike leader on previous trips so are the actual views that you will see from the route that you'll be hiking

>Click here to join our Facebook community of 6100 hikers<


Walk Description

We start off in Holmwood from where we head for Leith Hill and its famous gothic tower which stands at 329 meters. Our hike will take us across fields and woodlands before a strenuous ascent to Leith Hill. The summit is the highest of the Greensand Ridge and its tower is the highest point in south-east England.
Leith Hill will accommodate us for our lunch as it's been a renowned spot for picnic since the 19th century. Afterwards, if we're feeling energetic, we will climb the 74 spiral steps of the 18th century tower of Leith Hill to its top where through the telescope you can see the English Channel on a clear day. Many of London's landmarks could be seen with the naked eye, too.


After lunch, we descent Leith Hill to head north to Dorking via Greensand way. Much of the route passes ancient woods with amazing displays of colour. Greensand way will take us along paths which give unparalleled views across the Weald and towards the North Downs. The way passes through Tilling Springs - the source of River Tillingbourne which is 11 miles long and runs through several villages powering their mills along the way. From there, we will hike towards the hills upto the North Downs Way and pass by an old WWII pillbox.  The path offers beautiful view points which overlook the valley towards Dorking. 
Then, hiking through woodland for a while, the path comes to Ranmore Common and the beautiful church of St Barnabas built in 1860. From the Church, we continue through Denbies Wine Estate - England’s largest vineyard. The way through the Vineyard rewards with excellent views towards Dorking and Boxhill. Our hike finishes with the picturesque market town of Dorking located west from the Holmesdale hills range.

Transport and Meeting Point

We'll meet at Victoria station from 8:00am and leave the meeting point at 8:15 for the 8:31train

Planed return time to London of 6:34pm (we have a group train ticket and you are committed for the day until then)

We'll meet between WHSmith (no 34) and the stall called Breadbox (no 29) - both of which can be seen on the map here of our meeting point: http://goo.gl/LCf81


Food

We will stop during the walk for a snack lunch so please bring food and drink. We will visit a pub after the walk where we can get refreshments.


Distance, Difficulty, Terrain and Elevation plot

Distance: 14.8 miles (23.8 kms)
Grading:Moderate >click here for details<
Rating: 7/8 out of 10 
Ascent: 650 metres
Walking time: Around 5.5 to 6.5 actual walking


Elevation plot of actual hike: (>click here for larger version<):

Cost

The trip is £28.00 per person which includes the guided hike and return train travel from the station listed above.


What to Bring

Suitable hiking clothes & hiking footwear (ideally hiking boots) >click here<. Waterproof jacket, trousers and footwear are strongly recommended in case of rain or mud

Water (at least 1 and ideally 2 litres)

Packed lunch/picnic

Money for drinks and refreshments after the walk

That's it! We will take care of train tickets, logistics on the day etc, so that you can just turn up and have a great day :-)


Safety and Terms and Conditions

This walk is led by a trained hike leader (most of our hike leaders are Mountain Leader trained as a minimum) and qualified Outdoor Activity First Aider with extensive hike leading experience. A First Aid kit is carried and the walk is well known to the walk leader.

Payments are non refundable and non transferable but we have a process to release your space for resale to another member. Please follow the instructions in our FAQ page and email us with your Pay Pal “invoice ID” immediately after you change your RSVP to “NO”.
By signing up to this event you agree to the Terms and Conditions at the following link: http://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/TermsConditions/


>Click here to follow us on Facebook<
>Click here to receive our monthly newsletter<

© Outdooraholics Ltd 2016
Errors and Omissions Excepted
name: NEW HIKE, Leith Hill - Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty 23.8km (DAY HIKE)

description:
TICKETS MUST BE PURCHASED THROUGH EVENTBRITE. RSVPS ON MEETUP DO NOT GUARANTEE ATTENDANCE.

PURCHASE TICKETS HERE.

In this Holiday Ornament workshop you will use various clay hand building techniques to craft a fun seasonal piece of pottery. This class is perfect for anyone who wants to experience the basics working with clay. This is a fun 90 minute long class of guided instructions to help you create your winter decorations. This class can hold up to 10 people. Is appropriate for ages 13 years old and up.

•All work will be ready within two so you can enjoy them! Pieces can be picked up Wednesday nights during Lowell Makes Open House from 6-9PM. You can also contact the instructor to set up an alternative time if that does not work. Your art will be held no longer then one month after the work is finished.

Prerequisites: None

Ages: 13 and up

Max students: 10

Lowell Makes Members are entitled to a 20% discount on ticket prices after costs of materials.

Instructor Bio:

Chelsi Hanley grew up in Lowell Massachusetts, currently a city with a vastly growing art community. Chelsi attended Lowell High School from 2004- 2008, where she grew a fast connection and love for ceramics. She carried this love to college where she pursued a degree in Fine Arts. Chelsi attended the University of Massachusetts in Lowell from 2008 to 2013. Here she primarily concentrated in dark room photography, sculpture, and ceramics. Part of the reason she acquired the liking for these three mediums is the hands on connection she can make with the material. Chelsi was the art teacher at the Boys & Girls Club of Greater Lowell where she helped youth gain inspiration for their art and life; between 2011 and 2014. Chelsi was the manager of the Ceramic Studio, Indigo Fire, in Belmont, Massachusetts. Chelsi continued her education after college at MudFlat in Somerville Massachusetts where she took classes and an independent study. Currently she is growing her collection and is creating her ceramic pieces at Lowell Makes.

You can find Chelsi's work on her portfolio site.
name: Adult Snow Flakes Pottery Workshop

description:
Dear Members,

Make this year your best year yet to improve your English!

If you are serious about wanting to improve your English, then these classes are not to be missed! You will learn a lot and find it of very good value.

This is a mixed level general English class that will take you to the next level. It uses a variety of learning tools which are designed to help you quickly develop, improve and take you to the next level of your English fluency.

With every single class, you will learn and immediately use a lot of very useful and practical vocabulary and phrases. You will quickly improve, develop and expand your:

• English Conversation & Listening skills

• Very Useful Vocabulary and Phrases 

• Phrasal verbs and Idioms

• Pronunciation and Error Correction

• Communication skills

• Confidence, Creativity and Imagination

With regular classes, all these skills and much more will be achieved whilst you are having fun in a friendly, welcoming and supportive environment.

Classes are in small groups - Maximum of 6 per class and suitable for everyone except beginners.

Please bring a pen and notebook to take down important vocabulary and phrases.

Payment

The cost for this 3 hour organised and structured lesson is only £15. Please note: The cost of the lesson also include free refreshments & snack - Tea, Coffee, Hot Chocolate, Water and Biscuits/Cake etc.

• You will need to pay for these classes in advance. Please 'Click' on the RSVP button to book and pay for the class online. Online payment is the quickest and easiest method.

• However, if you want, you can also pay cash into my account or transfer the money directly into my account.  Please send me message on mobile:[masked] for my account details   As soon as you have made the transfer or put cash into my account, I will book you in and immediately reserve a spot for you.

If you are serious about wanting to improve your English, please RSVP for my Very Useful and Practical English Classes.

Directions:

These classes are  held in Balham which is easy to get to using the Tube or Train.  Balham is on the Northern line and Southern train line. It is only 15 minutes from Victoria train station.

This is a private address. This means the Full address and directions are not open to the public. I will text you or email you the Full address when you have booked the class. 


I very much look forward to meeting you soon.

Please do tell your friends, colleagues and families about my Very Useful and Practical English Classes.  Thank you in advance.

Rachel
name: The Very Useful and Practical  English Class in Balham - SW London

We're going back to OSU! The last event was pretty successful. The majority of buildings on campus are Pokéstops, and we got a few uncommon Pokémon around the med center area. This time I'm very excited to announce we'll be joined by the resident Pokémon group, the Buckeye Pokémon League! This OSU student organization with a love of anything Pokémon also functions as an officially sanctioned 'Play! Pokémon' location for card games and video games, and occasionally hosts official tournaments at OSU. Anyone is welcome, whether you attend OSU or not. The club currently meets from 7-10 PM on Mondays in the basement of the Student Union, in the Milestones room (but you can ask me, Brian, at any time if that needs confirmed).

We'll only be on campus for two hours this time. After this, we will zip to Berliner Park (this is listed as a separate event, so be sure to RSVP there accordingly) to hunt Bulbasaur until dark. If you need a ride to and from OSU, one of us should be able to give you one.
name: OSU (Collab with the OSU Buckeye Pokémon League)

description:
Abundance & Joy - Enhance Your Life (5 or 3 nights) Meditation Retreat

Well not only will we be staying in a 5 star Lodge in the amazingly scenic Cairngorms equipped with huge log fire, a spa suite with double Jacuzzi, Sauna and an outdoorHot Tub, but also we'll be taking all the time and putting all the focus on ENHANCING Your Life, expanding your Consciousness and looking for practical steps to make your dream Life a REALITY (More details below).

And in a setting like this...  if this doesn't inspire you to Enhance your life then we don't know what will... Take a look at the pictures and see for yourself :)

This is SPECIAL!

How to book:

£100 books your space and you can pay the rest by 21st Nov. There is a range of accommodation options so scroll down for details...

Now, this is a place to be feeling abundant & joyful! We will be plerking (playing+working) on enhancing your life - what actions, upgrades and changes can you make to live the life you are meant to live? All the exercises will blend with the meditation, Singing Bowls Sound immersions and relaxation times - a perfect combination to get your mind, body and soul aligned and in a beautiful flow... Ah....


Well, come join us, what are you waiting for?! :)


Included in the retreat:

* accommodation (5 or 3 nights, 2.5 hrs drive from Glasgow)

* all delicious vegetarian meals

* morning and evening meditation sessions

* daily exercises and group discussions aiming at enhancing Your Life

* Tibetan Singing Bowls sound baths - superb experience

* Music for Manifesting workshop - unique and efficient at helping you manifest the life you want!

* 2 excursions to nearby Nature sights and/or walks (and there are plenty of walks around to go for any time)

* half-day silent time (x2)

* round-the-clock guidance, Aga's energetic support, and our availability

* welcome gift pack


Please note: transport is not included. Car pooling possible.


Place: A phenomenal Log Lodge - Nethy Bridge

Date: 25-30th Nov (5 nights) or  25th-28th (3 nights)

Arrival time: Any time from 5 p.m. on 25th Nov

Leaving time: by 10 a.m. on 30th or 28th 



Non-refundable deposit of £100 upon booking, balance due 2 weeks after booking or no later than 21st Nov[masked] p.m. noon.

Aga and Tony

description:
ATELIER LIBRE DE 15H30 à 20H AU SERVICE DE VOTRE PRATIQUE PERSONNELLE

Je vous propose de développer votre univers personnel, librement, sans professeur, avec votre matériel comme si vous aviez votre propre atelier partagé tout les jeudis après-midi (sauf les jeudi de vacances scolaires et jours fériés). 

Cet après-midi est plutôt réservé à des personnes déjà engagées dans un travail personnel ou dans la préparation d’un concours d’école d’art.Cet atelier est limité à 4/5 artistes maximum pour une ambiance de travail et de calme. Alors si vous connaissez les prix d’un atelier à Paris, profitez en maintenant!Il existe un espace de stockage attenant à l'atelier pour déposer vos travaux en cours de réalisation uniquement. L'atelier n'est pas responsable des pertes ou vol des oeuvres qui y seront stockées. (Il n'y a jamais eu de problème mais je me dois de le dire !)

Des chevalets, tabliers, ainsi qu'un point d'eau sont à disposition.

2 TARIFS POSSIBLES

- Sans abonnement : 15 euros la séance de 4h30 (soit environ 3,3 euros de l'heure). Connaissant le prix d'un café à Paris, cela reste très raisonnable. 

POUR LA PREMIERE APRÉS-MIDI D'ESSAI LE PRIX EST DE 10 EUROS SI VOUS PRENEZ L'ABONNEMENT EN FIN DE SÉANCE!

- Abonnement mensuel : 40 euros pour 4 séances de 4h30 (soit environ de 2,2 euros de l'heure!). Du temps pour développer un vrai projet ! De plus, avec cet abonnement, Vous pouvez bénéficiez d'un tarif de suivi mensuel de projet d'une heure par mois pour 25 euros (au lieu de 30 euros). Ce cours particulier vise à vous soutenir dans le développement de vos projet artistiques. Ce type de suivi joue un rôle déterminant dans le développement d'un projet, c'est pourquoi il est considéré comme centrale dans la plupart des Ecoles des Beaux-Arts . Cette formule est parfaite pour une personne déjà bien engagée dans la pratique ou souhaitant passer un concours.

REGLES DE VIE POUR UNE BONNE AMBIANCE

- Merci de respecter le calme et la propreté dans cet espace de vie partagé en nettoyant et rangeant votre matériel et en contribuant à une bonne ambiance. Vous pouvez si vous le souhaitez amener un petit goûter ou du thé par exemple.

- Pour une bonne organisation, vous devez avoir un sac (avec votre nom) pour votre matériel et de quoi stocker vos oeuvres (carton à dessin par exemple).

- Merci de ramener chez vous les travaux finis, l'atelier n'est pas grand, il s'agit d'avoir une discipline pour que cela reste agréable.

- Vous restez responsable de vous-même et de ce que vous faites. C'est pourquoi seules les personnes majeures avec une responsabilité civile accident sont admises (cette assurance est de toute façon obligatoire et comprise dans la grande majorité des assurances habitation). Là encore, il n'y a jamais eu de problème mais je me dois de le dire !

- Si vous faites de très grands formats cet atelier ne vous conviendra peut-être pas. Merci de me contacter en message privé pour le vérifier.
name: Tout nouveau! ATELIER LIBRE : 4h30 au service de votre pratique personnelle

description:
Essential Oils were used by the Egyptians for religious purposes, as well as beautification. Hypocrites, the father of modern medicine, used essential oils for his health. And thousands and thousands of years ago yoga and frankincense essential oil were paired in India. Essential oils are natural aromatic compounds found in the seeds, bark, stems, roots, flowers, and other parts of the plant. Plants have been around since the beginning of the world and have remained safe from predators and nature. Modern day scientific studies and trends toward more natural approaches to wellness are driving a revival and new discovery of essential oil health uses, and what we're finding is that when we use Essential Oils to support our health and well-being, we're responding like the plants. Remaining healthy in spite of environmental threats and concerns.

I favor doTERRA's Certified Pure Therapeutic Grade Essential Oils, as they are the purest on the market, the company treats their international Harvesters with the upmost respect, and the products have transformed my life from one filled with insomnia constipation and pain, to a life robust with activity, well-being good sleep and regularity. This is why I am a Wellness Advocate for doTERRA.

During this 90-minute complimentary class we will cover the basics of doTERRA essential oils, including how to choose a quality oil, how to use them safely, and which essential oils can best support your daily routine to enhance your general health and wellness, as well as assist in alleviating many of the concerns that fill our daily lives-insomnia, fatigue, anxiety, etc. Once the class is over and I've answered all your questions and we've figured out which oils would best serve you, I'll show you the easiest options for opening an account and becoming a wholesale member.
name: Essential Oils Class 101

description:
Every Sunday from October through April (or May) we will have an activity that is open to everybody.  Bring friends, tell friends.  No charge, but a donation to the space is always welcome.  Beverages and snacks available for a nominal fee, or bring your own.

SECOND SUNDAY is FIXERS CO-OP.  You can bring something to repair that requires tools available at MakeHartford; a project you've been putting off because you don't get the time blocked out; or something that needs someone to help you with the repair.  We cannot guarantee there will be someone who can help you every month, so if you're working on something specific please ask about it so people know what you need.

Theme This Month: Building a Key FOB security system. 

MakeHartford is working on a grant to produce a key FOB security system that can scale and be used by the statewide maker network. 

The system design has been drawn up and now we need your help to build it. The solution calls for the following disciplines:

• Front end UI/UX, 

• Database

• Web service 

• Arduino microprocessing 

• RFID Hardware

Additional discussion available on the MakeHartford Basecamp site.
name: Sunday Salons - FIXERS CO-OP - RFID Lock - Collaboration Session

description:
Pływaliśmy już w lutym wcześniej...
Pływaliśmy już w Arktyce wcześniej...
Jednak nigdy nie pływaliśmy w lutym w Arktyce!

Czego się spodziewać:

• zorza polarna!

• wieloryby!

• dzień długości 7 godzin

• temperatura w okolicach -5 stopni - to nie pomyłka Arktyczna Norwegia jest zimą często cieplejsza od okolic Oslo czy Polski

• jeden sztorm - który przeczekamy w jednym z wielu ciekawych portów

• trochę śniegu na pokładzie

• prawdziwej niezapomnianej żeglarskiej wyprawy!

Trasa:

Tromsø - Skjervoy - Hasvik - Havøysund - Honningsvåg (Nordkapp) - Kjøllefjord - Vardo - Kirkenes
około 400nm 
około 60% trasy między wyspami

W trakcie rejsu będziemy mieli okazję nie tylko opłynąć zimą Knivskjellodden na Nordkapp - najbardziej na północ wysuniętą cześć Europy, 

ale również:

Opłynąć Kinnarodden na Nordkinnhalvøya - najbardziej na północ wysuniętą cześć kontynentalnej Europy,

Zobaczyć Finmark - najbardziej na północ wysuniętą część Norwegii którą zamieszkują jej rdzenni mieszkańcy Sami - ostatni nomadzi Europy,

Odwiedzić Vardo - miasto z największą odnotowaną populacją czarownic,

Wyśmienicie się bawić!

Jeśli jeszcze nie jesteś przekonany, oto jak było w zeszłym roku: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UQk8sAbZVkQ


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jjkKy-yKrQo

jacht

Jak w latach poprzednich do Arktyki płyniemy na pokładzie "JoinUs", stalowego yachtu Bruce Roberts NY46.

Jacht w tej chwili (listopad) przechodzi remont w Polsce i będzie gotowy na dalsze wyprawy już w Nowy Rok.

cena

970 euro w tym 290 euro kasy jachtowej.

W chwili obecnej (8/11/2016) wynosi to odpowiednio:
~£860 w tym ~£260 kasy jachtowej.

Koszty podane i rozliczane są w euro ze względu na brak stabilności funta. Środki zbieramy jednak w funtach przed rejsem i nie potrzebujecie wymieniać samodzielnie pieniędzy.

Kasa jachtowa będzie rozliczana wg. faktycznych wydatków na koniec rejsu. Podajemy i zbieramy ją wcześniej by dać Wam lepszą orientacje w całkowitych kosztach wyprawy.

Cena podstawowa obejmuje:

• czarter i ubezpieczenie jachtu

• ubezpieczenie kaucji jachtu do wysokości 2400pln

• obsługę skippera i bosmana

• pamiątkowy kubeczek (bądź koszulkę)

• osobiste ubezpieczenie podróży w rejony Arktyczne 

Kasa jachtowa obejmuje:

• porty

• paliwo

• jedzenie

• gaz

Cena nie obejmuje sprzątania. Na zakończenie rejsu jacht musi być posprzątany przez załogę.
Cena nie obejmuje transportu i wszelkich ewentualnych wydatków na lądzie.

transport:

Codzienne loty SAS i Norwegian przez Oslo. 
Ceny rozsądne, tzn. około £100 w jedna stronę z Londynu na dzisiaj (listopad).

Murmańsk

Dla zainteresowanych możliwość 3-4 dniowej wycieczki z Kirkenes do Murmańska na zakończenie rejsu.

Naszym przewodnikiem będzie nie kto inny jak Jacek. Jak właśnie powiedział:
"Zaczynam sie juz przygotowywac. I beda polskie ackcenty!"

Rejs organizowany przy współpracy JoinUs i North.Voyage 
fot: JoinUs i Michał Przech.

description:
Meeting Point 1: 8,45 am, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Meeting Point 2: 9,30 am, Monasterio Montserrat.

Guide: Ferran ( speaks English & Spanish ).

Average age of participants: From 20 to 45 years old, mainly.

Price Excursion: 16 €.

+ Transportation Cost: 6 € ( you pay at the car driver ).

Total Price= 22 €.

Level: Medium. 5 h in total walking aside time for relax & eat. Elevation gain: 560 m.

Estimated arrival time to Barcelona: 7 pm.

What to bring: Trekking or sport shoes, food+water ( you also can buy sandwiches at the bar we´ll breakfast ).

We recommend: Stick.

Points of Interest: The medieval monastry of Montserrat, very important for Catalonia soul & heart. The incredible different forms of the mountains, and the 360º views from the top.

• • •

Punto de Encuentro 1: 8,45 h, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Punto de Encuentro 2: 9,30 h, Monasterio Montserrat.

Guia: Ferran ( habla Inglés & Castellano ).

Edad promedio Participantes: De 20 a 45 años, principalmente.

Precio Excursión: 16 € ( si traes tu coche desde plaza Catalunya y llevas a 4 participantes + tienes 16 € descuento ).

+ Coste Transporte: 6 € ( se lo pagas al conductor del coche en que vayas ).

Precio Total: 22 €.

Nivel: Medio. 5 h de excursión en total, aparte del tiempo para relajarse, desayunar y comer. Desnivel: 560 m.

Hora estimada llegada a Barcelona: 19 h.

Qué traer: Botas o zapatillas de deporte o de treking, comida y agua ( también puedes comprar bocadillo en el bar donde desayunaremos ).

Recomendamos: Palo.

Puntos de Interés: El monasterio medieval de Montserrat, muy importante para el alma y corzón de Cataluña. Las increibles formas de las montañas y las vistas de 360º desde la cima.

description:
This is incredible, we created this small community not meant for networking but to help enterprises to overcome business challenges with no charge. However, just over a year, we had grew to nearly 800 members. Due to current bad economy, we had been helping many SMEs to turnaround this year. As such, we cannot organize the business clinic events on regular basis, we sincerely apologize to this.

We are now 1 year old, and we wish to take this opportunity to share more benefits to SMEs. We like to invite you to join our small gathering (max 20 participants) to share your business challenges or solutions. We will also try to provide relevant solutions to those who like to seek advises from us.

One more good news, to celebrate the 1 year old birthday, we will give up free gifts worth a few hundreds dollar to some lucky participants

If you are interested, please RSVP asap as we only limit to 20 participants.

description: If you love the lakes, nature, and paddling, then this easy paced stand up paddleboarding trip is for you. Whether you are a first timer or experienced paddler, everyone will learn something, experience nature close up and personal, and enjoy the gentle lapping of the water against their boards. It's relaxing, informative, and good for your soul. We provide a properly sized paddle and board, land and water instruction, and a guided tour with fun and friendly instructors. We will cover everything you need to know about the paddle stroke, how to get up, where to stand, and how to stay safe and enjoy this amazing sport! Bring water, a hat or sunglasses, sunscreen, and water friendly clothing. Please arrive 15 minutes before class start time. Minimum age is 16 years old and you must know how to swim. Cost $35.00/pp.
name: Morning Eco Paddle

description:
These lessons are to go beyond the basics. Must at least understand Right and Left Turns & accomplish a Cross-Body Lead.
------------------------
Taught by Salsamante Dance Academy's Carlos Rubio aka Salsa King of Ohio. With 17 years of experience, he will break down the moves, steps and combos to the best of his ability to enjoy and discover your Love of Salsa
----------------------
Free Parking
Plenty of Space
$10/Person
name: Salsa Boot Camp

description:
Membership in this Sangha requires no previous instruction in the Pali Canon or meditation. 

Hearing the Dhamma and the practice of Jhana Meditation burns off unwholesome bad qualities and promotes the presence of wholesome qualities. 

This is ideal if you want to build a consciousness built on non-greed, non-hatred, wisdom, tranquility, lightness, equanimity, and mindfulness.

We are not teacher lead.  The Pali Canon was direct in its instruction that wisdom is gained with Direct Knowledge in four ways:

• By understanding the Five Aggregates that are subject to clinging.  This is how you build your own suffering by clinging to hate, greed, and unwholesome consciousness.

• By abandoning Ignorance (of how we are directly responsible for our thoughts and there is no permanent self that controls us) and our clinging to existence (the belief that there is a permanent self that controls us that we cannot change.)

• Developing serenity and insight.  Our insight is that we do not have to react with unwholesome consciousness.  The Serenity is the lack of restlessness that hinders our mindful wholesome actions.

• Realizing true liberation by building wholesome consciousness. 

Sutta 32 of the Middle Length Discourses was very specific that the teachings of the Buddha are not learned second hand from a teacher. They are learned by directly hearing the Dhamma and the dedicated practice of Jhana Meditation which burns off unwholesome consciousness and develops wholesome consciousness.

We encourage any sight challenged Buddhists to attend with a desire to hear the Pali Canon in English.
name: Hear the Pali Canon Dhamma, practice Jhana Meditation, learn Jhana Meditation.

group.name: Pali Canon Sutta Based Buddhist Sangha

venue.name: Jardins del Palau Reial de Pedralbes

description:
Meeting Point 1: 8,15 am, Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Meeting Point 2: 9,45 am, Siurana.

Guide: Ferran ( speaks English & Spanish ).

Average age of participants: From 20 to 45 years old, mainly.

Price Excursion: 16 €.

+ Transportation Cost: 9 € ( you pay at the car driver ).

Total Price= 25 €.

Level: Easy /Medium. 5 h in total walking aside time for relax & eat. Elevation gain: 380 m.

Estimated arrival time to Barcelona: 8 pm. 

What to bring: Trekking or sport shoes, food+water. ( you also can buy sandwiches at the bar we´ll breakfast ).

We recommend: Stick.

Points of Interest: The views from the medieval village of Siurana, his castle, his amazing cliffs, the river, the forest.

• • •

Punto de Encuentro 1: 8,15 h,  Palau Reial ( Avenida Digonal 686 ).

Punto de Encuentro 2: 9,45 h, Siurana.

Guia: Ferran ( habla Inglés & Castellano ).

Edad promedio Participantes: De 20 a 45 años, principalmente.

Precio Excursión: 16 € ( si traes tu coche desde plaza Catalunya y llevas a 4 participantes + tienes 16 € descuento ).

+ Coste Transporte: 9€ ( se lo pagas al conductor del coche en que vayas ).

Precio Total: 25 €.

Nivel: Fácil/Medio. 5 h de excursión en total, aparte del tiempo para relajarse, desayunar y comer. Desnivel: 380 m.

Hora estimada llegada a Barcelona: 20 h.

Qué traer: Botas o zapatillas de deporte o de treking, comida y agua( también puedes comprar bocadillo en el bar donde desayunaremos ).

Recomendamos: Palo.

Puntos de Interés: Las vistas desde el pueblo medieval de Siurana, su castillo, sus increibles acantilados, su rio, el bosque...
name: SIURANA

description:
Want something to do one New Years Eve? Cams Hall Golf Club is putting on a bash. £25 per head. Hot buffet at 8pm and disco and dancing until 1am.

I know we went there for Christmas but let's face it, it's better than being home alone

I am not collecting any money yet, as they need to know it's a viable option. They need us, come on you party goers, let's how them how to have fun
name: New Year's Eve

group.name: Solent Friends:    Gosport, Fareham and surrounding areas

description: While talking to a few members about Thanksgiving I found there are a few of us with no local family and no plans. Victoria's has a nice Thanksgiving day menu, so I thought I'd post it to see if there was any interest. They only accept reservations for up to 8 people that day, so if there is greater interest sign up for the waiting list and we can look for a different venue.
name: Thanksgiving Day Dinner

description:
*This event is the first part of a two-part event being held on this day. Check out the Berliner Park event too!

We're going back to OSU! The last event was pretty successful. The majority of buildings on campus are Pokéstops, and we got a few uncommon Pokémon around the med center area. 

This time I'm very excited to announce we'll be joined by the resident Pokémon group, the Buckeye Pokémon League! This OSU student organization with a love of anything Pokémon also functions as an officially sanctioned 'Play! Pokémon' location for card games and video games, and occasionally hosts official tournaments at OSU. Anyone is welcome, whether you attend OSU or not. The club currently meets from 7-10 PM on Mondays in the basement of the Student Union, in the Milestones room (but you can ask me, Brian, at any time if that needs confirmed, as they tend to only meet when OSU has classes).

We'll only be on campus for two hours this time. After this, we will zip to Berliner Park (this is listed as a separate event, so be sure to RSVP there accordingly) to hunt Bulbasaur until dark. If you need a ride to and from OSU, one of us should be able to give you one.
name: OSU (Collab with the OSU Buckeye Pokémon League)

description:
Join me for a day of informative and fun DIY beauty workshop Would you like to make beauty products that are non toxic, organic and paraben free?

These products are all natural and very nourishing for your skin and body
You will learn how to make many products and can give them as Christmas gifts or can use them to nurture yourself.

All oils are do Terra- CPTG essential oils, they are high vibrational and the only oils I use. We will also infuse some of the products with crystals.
Space for this event is limited

Cost: €65 Early Bird by 22nd October or €75 thereafter

6 products, tea/coffee and snacks plus manual with all recipes included
name: DIY Beauty Workshop - With Mary Henry

Dear All,

We're going to try something different this time, we're going to watch a movie. Invision has created a documentary, Design Disruptors, about the rising importance of design as a competitive advantage in disruptive technologies:

"The future of business is being written by companies and products that shake billion dollar industries. In Design Disruptors, enter the world of 15+ industry-toppling companies—valued at more than $1 trillion dollars combined—with one unifying secret advantage: the transformative power of design.

Design Disruptors reveals a never-before-seen perspective on the design approaches of these companies and how they are overtaking billion dollar industries through design." 


We will organize a screening of this documentary in Amsterdam. We're still finalizing the location, and this means the current date is preliminary, but we'd like to get a sense of how many people are interested in attending this screening.

Also, we are looking for sponsors! If your company is interested in sponsoring this unique event, please let us know!


Cheers,

Gavin, Steven and Iris

Are You Ready to Find Your Passion?

Join the Charleston Investor Association on November 12th & 13th and learn why NOW is the best time to invest in Real Estate

This 2-Day Training will Be Unlike Anything You’ve Ever Experienced,

Here’s Why

You’ll spend 2-days together WITH Industry Experts, going step-by-step through the process of cashing your first, or next, Cash Flow profit check in today’s Real Estate Investing market!

CIA Members Click Here for more Details

Early Registration for Non Members ends soon  NON-MEMBERS CLICK HERE.

This your chance to lock yourself in a room with real estate investing veteran's of over 35 years of combined experience and their exceptional team as they train you on exactly what you need to do to cash your next Cash Flow check in the fastest time possible!

It’s 2 solid days of NO B.S., what works now, training. We’re setting the room classroom style, so we can really dig deep and get to work on your business. 

Here’s Just Some of What you will Learn

Over Coming Obstacles in your Business

description:
Cancelled because of wildfires in the area. They are not damaging the resort, but many roads are closed, and there is smoke in the air. I will do this trip on a weekend next summer.

Join us for a relaxing getaway in the mountains of Lake Lure, North Carolina. We will have our own two bedroom/two bathroom cottage with a full kitchen, living room, and dining area for two nights, from Wednesday, November 16th to Friday, November 18th. The Wyndham Resort at Fairfield Mountains (where we will be staying) has plenty of amenities to use, and we will explore the surrounding area. We will be dining at Larkin's on the Lake, among other local favorites. Feel free to bring any games you might like to play as a group after dinner, and any breakfast food, snacks and beverages you want. The cost of this trip is for two nights, double occupancy (there are two queen size beds in the guest room - one person in each bed). If you would like your own bedroom, please add +1 to your RSVP (it will say you are bringing a guest, but this is to reserve two spots for yourself). Let me know if you have any questions. I hope you can join us!
name: Fall Foliage in the Mountains!

description:
Dear all, 

along with our fellow DiEMers across Europe, we are currently working on developing a Progressive Agenda for Europe. To this end, we are in the process of writing White Papers which will find their way into determining the agenda DiEM25 will eventually adopt. The three topics we are concerned with are 

TRANSPARENCY 

REFUGEES & MIGRATION

A EUROPEAN NEW DEAL (social and economic policy)

If you feel, like we do, passionate about any of these topics and feel an urge to debate policy, or if you are new to DiEM and would simply like to find out more, get involved and join us this Sunday, 12.00. Together we can discuss a set of questions on each topic, exchange insights and information and draft proposals: 

We are meeting at KOFFIE bij Joost en Maartje -- so far we've always had enough space but if we turn out to be too many we can always relocate! Feel free to suggest a more convenient place, but do so by Thursday or Friday.

We will be handing out 'welcome kits' with information on DiEM on Sunday, but if there is any information you want beforehand, contact me or [masked]. You can also find us on Facebook and Twitter and can sign our petition for Transparency in Europe Now!

We look forward to see you!

Carpe Diem!

Dominik
name: DiEM25 Maastricht: A Progressive Agenda for Europe

description:
This is Atwood's latest dystopian novel, speculative fiction at its very best. In an interview about the book, she says she always writes about something that is already happening in our society or that humans have done before. Scary stuff! I resonate deeply with this book as I see it as a metaphor of contemporary society and the lack of personal freedom with all its consequences when engaging in demanding jobs that offer many benefits on the surface. But this is only my interpretation and I'd love to know yours as well as engage in deeper discussions about this great Atwood novel. Here is the interview:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HW7LkFZGg6w

Read more about the book on good reads:

https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/24388326-the-heart-goes-last
name: The Heart Goes Last by Margaret Atwood

description:
Just a reminder to our members....

While human guests are welcome on most of our hikes, please be sure that they realize how we travel. We've had a few "guests" lately who seem quite put out with our slower pace, or with all of our stops to play or water the dogs. They wear a scowl on their face, and it's clear they're unhappy.

Or, they take off faster than the group, taking over as "leaders" of the hike.

Really? They aren't even members!  

There are plenty of great meetup groups for those who want to hike at a faster pace. We are not one of them! Our group travels at it's own pace, our members are used to it, and we do not adjust our speed for a guest who wants us to walk at their pace.  

If you bring a guest and they cannot enjoy our hike, please just politely excuse yourself from the group and then you can race on back to your car by yourself.

Otherwise, LIGHTEN UP and enjoy the day.

Please leave the grumpy people at home.


AS ALWAYS.... NO GUEST DOGS.  

The reason for this is that "guest dogs" don't know our rules.   By joining our meetup group,  a member acknowledges that they have read  our rules and agree to abide by them.  It saves me the trouble of having to correct non-members for things in front of others.
name: "GUESTS" on our Dog Hikes

We are open to companies big and small. We also welcome early-stage technology businesses looking to learn how to get their ideas off the ground.

We're going back to OSU! The last event was pretty successful. The majority of buildings on campus are Pokéstops, and we got a few uncommon Pokémon around the med center area. 

This time I'm very excited to announce we'll be joined by the resident Pokémon group, the Buckeye Pokémon League! This OSU student organization with a love of anything Pokémon also functions as an officially sanctioned 'Play! Pokémon' location for card games and video games, and occasionally hosts official tournaments at OSU. Anyone is welcome, whether you attend OSU or not. The club currently meets from 7-10 PM on Mondays in the basement of the Student Union, in the Milestones room (but you can ask me, Brian, at any time if that needs confirmed, as they tend to only meet when OSU has classes).

We'll only be on campus for two hours this time. After this, we will zip to Berliner Park (this is listed as a separate event, so be sure to RSVP there accordingly) to hunt Bulbasaur until dark. If you need a ride to and from OSU, one of us should be able to give you one.

description:
Come and stay at Swan Barn Farm (https://goo.gl/maps/t5YiE7fKfzC2) just outside Haslemere in Surrey. The work will be in the Woolbeding countryside. We will be working at Lavington Common doing pine pulling and cutting, some birch clearance, and maybe some rhododendron.  It will be heathland scrub clearance and a bonfire, weather permitting.

The weekend starts on Friday night, when everyone arrives. You'll need to supply your own meal for Friday night or there may be a visit to a pub in Haslemere. On Saturday you'll be working with staff to carry out countryside conservation work, normally from about 9am-4pm. Saturday evening will be spent relaxing and enjoying a meal. On Sunday you'll be working from about 9am-1pm, before a lunch back in the basecamp, a quick clean up and then time to head home. 

The weekend costs £12. The cost of the weekend includes breakfast on Saturday and Sunday, a packed lunch and evening meal on Saturday and a cold lunch on Sunday. If you are arriving by public transport a lift can normally be arranged from Haslemere station, please contact the event host to ask for details. 

For information about what to bring on a weekend, and more information about the group please visit our website:

www.lwmntv.org.uk

Please note that not all bookings are taken via Meetup, for up to date details of how many are booked on the task please visit the programme page on our website.
name: Countryside conservation volunteering at Woolbeding with the National Trust

description:
Intermediate & Beginners 2, ON2 Salsa Class taught by Ines & Michael

From 6:30 PM to 8 PM $12 per person, $10 for college students, $20 per person total if the 8:00 Beginners is also taken.

Beginners 2 is to help students transition from Beginners to Intermediate as there is a giant leap between them.  The instructor will tell you when you should move up.

The goal is to learn basic foot work, partnering skills, principles of timing, and eventually variations of shines and turn patterns.  New materials are introduced weekly. No need to bring a partner, as we rotate frequently to ensure even partnering.

RSVP to help us get an accurate count, but if you forget, show up anyway and be ready to dance and make new friends!

Dance sneakers or dance shoes are a must, but don't let this stop you from coming to dance, just dance in your socks.  Street shoes and ladies' spiked heels can ruin the studio floors, so if you don't have dance shoes, please come prepared to dance in your socks.  After a few lessons you'll want to buy shoes both to bring to class and take out social dancing.  Places where we have purchased dance shoes include --

www.exoticsalsashoes.com

http://addicted2salsa.com/ballo_shoes/

http://www.discountdance.com/index.php

http://www.danceshoesstore.com/

info for men http://addicted2salsa.com/shoes/
name: Intermediate & Beginners 2, ON2 Classes

name: Designing with dementia

description:
ProductTank AMS x Kaj van Leeuwen

Sponsored by Clockwork and EDIA


Dear All,

We're going to try something different this time, we're going to watch a movie. We are organising this together with Kaj van Leeuwen.

 Invision has created a documentary, Design Disruptors, about the rising importance of design as a competitive advantage in disruptive technologies:

"The future of business is being written by companies and products that shake billion dollar industries. In Design Disruptors, enter the world of 15+ industry-toppling companies—valued at more than $1 trillion dollars combined—with one unifying secret advantage: the transformative power of design.

Design Disruptors reveals a never-before-seen perspective on the design approaches of these companies and how they are overtaking billion dollar industries through design." 


We will organize a screening of this documentary in Amsterdam, on Dec 7th in Lab111.



Cheers,

Gavin, Steven and Iris
name: Special Edition: Design Disruptors Screening

description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

A Funding Panel (OMERS, Pycap, Maple Leaf Angels)

Entrepreneurs are full of great ideas and powerful ways to implement them, but for many of us who are just starting out, a stack of cold, hard cash would go a long way. When you are just starting out, it can be hard to sort through the many funding options available to determine which are most lucrative.

Come out on November 15th and meet with Toronto's prominent VCs and Angel Investors for a talk about All Things Funding.  

Qasim Mohammad - OMERS Ventures (@OMERSVentures):The venture capital arm of OMERS, one of Canada's largest pension funds with more than $65 billion in net assets. Notable investments include Shopify, Hootsuite, Wattpad, Vidyard.

Omar Dhalla - Real Ventures (@RealVentures): Invests in early stage companies and "likes to write smaller checks often".  Also running the Founder Fuel accelerator, some of their notable investments include VarageSale, Hubba and Frank & Oak.

Melissa Prusky - Maple Leaf Angels (@MapleLeafAngels)2007, MLA's mandate is to connect accredited investors and the brightest, most passionate entrepreneurs.  To date, they've invested in over 30 companies 

Bring your questions!

Agenda

6:30 pm Mix 'n Mingle

7:30 pm Fireside Chat

8:30 pm More Mingling

Hosted By Sharn Kandola, Toronto Director

Hi I'm Sharn Kandola. I'm a Marketing and PR consultant for tech and healthcare companies and co-founder of feeDuck, a disruptive startup that is empowering home sellers and buyers in the real estate industry. I'm thrilled to be part of the collaborative, open and welcoming community that is Startup Grind!


Twitter: @gursharn


Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Intuit Developer has announced with Small Business App Showdown, a contest for anyone who provides solutions to small business problems. Click for more info on how to enter and win a free booth at the annual QuickBooks Connect conference (https://qbcon2016.com/) and a chance at $100k!

Partners


CTO Boost stimulates North America’s greatest companies and industry leaders, helping them outshine the rest with innovation that makes sense. With unparalleled experience, our team has come together because in the pit of our stomachs we know that there is something better. Whether as a Fractional CTO, part time, or other capacity - you decide. CTO Boost: For our Clients. For their Customers. For industry.

feeDuck is a real-time auction that connects you with professional real estate agents who compete for your business.

Traditional investments are often “off the rack” and do not cater to individual investment needs. We don’t believe in compromise. You shouldn’t either. With direct access to the Capital Markets, we offer a variety of customised investment solutions that can be created to suit your ever changing needs.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 200 cities and 85 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
name: A Funding Panel (OMERS, Pycap, Maple Leaf Angels)

description:
TECH WEDNESDAY BLUE LIGHTS SPECIAL

Tech Wednesday is being taken over by the Emergency Services!

Wednesday 16th November, 5:30pm – 8:00pm

This Months Tech Wednesday will feature speakers from the blue lights sector talking about the latest projects and activities focused on innovation. 

Sally Bourner, Chief Superintendent will be talking about "Drawing on Peel’s principles in 21st Century Policing"

The complexity and fast-moving nature of the world within which we all live and work presents challenges and opportunities for policing the like of which none of us have experienced during our service. 

Through our comprehensive and wide ranging WMP2020 programme, West Midlands Police (WMP) is meeting this new environment by changing our culture, behaviour and mind set. WMP2020 places people at the heart of future services. And by people I mean not just police colleagues but also members of the public and our partners, thereby ensuring legitimacy and trust in what we develop.

As well as Chief Superintendent Sally Bourner, other representatives from the Emergency Services will provide a unique insight as to how the adoption of technology and data is evolving blue lights services and improving citizen well being.

Each speaker will have 15 minutes before opening up to the floor for Q&A. After talks delegates will be able to network over beer and pizza.

For more information on Tech Wednesday – the Campus’ monthly meet-up for tech entrepreneurs and enthusiasts click here: http://www.meetup.com/tech-wednesday/

Talks run from 6:00pm – 7:00pm with opportunities for 1 min pitches from attendees between each main speaker.
name: Tech Wednesday

While his Primary business is Real Estate as you can see from his BIO, he has a HUGE Passion for Residual income.  With the Energy Deregulation he got involved in the business of turning energy into income and has built up yet ANOTHER source of passive income that will serve him and his family for the foreseeable future.   

As great as chunks of cash are, its CASH FLOW that makes you rich and give you true freedom?  What are you doing to build passive income?

Steve will be here on Wednesday 11/09/2016 at 7pm all the way from Delaware to explain how the business works, and give you an opportunity to learn another way to add to your passive income portfolio.  

I know this is a last minute meetup, but I would not want you to miss the opportunity to meet Steve and learn more about this opportunity.

description:
En esta segunda sesión del taller de escritura creativa vamos a conocer los principios creativos referidos a la historia y el estilo.

Los escritores de renombre poseen un estilo que los distingue del resto, una manera de escribir consolidada y que no cambia a pesar de que las narraciones sean diferentes. ¿Eres capaz de reconocer a un autor del que hayas leído toda su obra? Probablemente sí y en ese caso estaremos afirmando que sus rasgos, su manera de expresar y comunicar lo definen.

La búsqueda de un estilo lleva tiempo, pero si observamos el tipo de literatura que nos gusta leer y si hemos seleccionado nuestra nómina de autores de cabecera, estaremos cerca de nuestro objetivo.

Por otra parte, en la narración el cómo siempre depende del qué, es decir, dependiendo de lo que desee narrar así será mi estilo y mi voz narrativa. Tener claro qué vamos a contar implica seleccionar un estilo y una voz acorde a nuestra historia.
name: Tema y estilo: historia y voz narrativa

description:
REMINDER....

While human guests are welcome on most of our hikes, please be sure that they realize how we travel. We've had a few "guests" lately who seem quite put out with our slower pace, or with all of our stops to play or water the dogs. They wear a scowl on their face, and it's clear they're unhappy.

Or, they take off faster than the group, taking over as "leaders" of the hike.

Really? They aren't even members!  

There are plenty of great meetup groups for those who want to hike at a faster pace. We are not one of them! Our group travels at it's own pace, our members are used to it, and we do not adjust our speed for a guest who wants us to walk at their pace.  

If you bring a guest and they cannot enjoy our hike, please just politely excuse yourself from the group and then you can race on back to your car by yourself.

Otherwise, LIGHTEN UP and enjoy the day.

Please leave the grumpy people at home.


AS ALWAYS.... NO GUEST DOGS.  

The reason for this is that "guest dogs" don't know our rules.   By joining our meetup group,  a member acknowledges that they have read  our rules and agree to abide by them.  It saves me the trouble of having to correct non-members for things in front of others.

 Invision has created a documentary, Design Disruptors, about the rising importance of design as a competitive advantage in disruptive technologies:

"The future of business is being written by companies and products that shake billion dollar industries. In Design Disruptors, enter the world of 15+ industry-toppling companies—valued at more than $1 trillion dollars combined—with one unifying secret advantage: the transformative power of design.

Design Disruptors reveals a never-before-seen perspective on the design approaches of these companies and how they are overtaking billion dollar industries through design." 


We will organize a screening of this documentary in Amsterdam, on Dec 7th in Lab111.



Cheers,

Gavin, Steven and Iris
