description:
Hear about a depression era forger of independance era documents and how his intimate knowledge of the play between ink & paper made him successful at his craft. Talk by Lynne Friedmann, an award-winning freelance science writer.

This event is hosted by the CHF.

Look to immediate right of doors as you walk in. If the tables have reserved signs, its probably for our group. Talk starts at 6 and ends by 7:15, but our group usually stays on after the talk ends for a post event discussion. Looking for additional hosts to volunteer. All you need to do is get there by 5:10 so you can corner some seats.

The event is free, but please support the venue and don't forget to tip our excellent, excellent waitress, Liz, who even tries to block off tables for us!

Details from ScienceOnTap>>

https://scienceontapphilly.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/benjamin-franklin-s-signature-7896177.jpg?w=351&h=207https://scienceontapphilly.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/lynne-friedmann-hi-res-image.jpg?w=182&h=275

Joseph Cosey, an Irish-American from the Depression Era, has the dubious distinction of being the most successful and prolific forger in U.S. history. While most perpetrators struggle to duplicate the signatures of one or two individuals, Cosey mastered the handwriting styles of virtually all the nation’s founders, a score of latter-day statesmen, and a number of prominent writers—both male and female. A “printer’s devil” apprentice in his youth, Cosey success stemmed from his understanding of the delicate relationship of paper and ink. Cosey’s criminal career began…and ironically ended…with forgeries of Benjamin Franklin.

About the Speaker: Lynne Friedmann is an award-winning freelance science writer with 30 years of experience interpreting scientific discoveries and technological advances for the general public. She has written about topics ranging from astrophysics to zoology for newspapers, consumer magazines, trade publications, and institutions such as the National Academies of Sciences and Engineering, The San Diego Zoo, Scripps Institution of Oceanography, San Diego Supercomputer Center, and American Chemical Society among others. She is currently a Beckman Fellow of the Chemical Heritage Foundation conducting archival research for a book on the history and science of ink.

This month’s Science on Tap is hosted by the Chemical Heritage Foundation.

You'll also have the chance to meet:

1 Freebies from "Free in Philly"

3 Philly Enthusiasts from "Got Culture in Philadelphia"

A total of 6 people are expected to attend!

Edit Linking
name: Science on Tap: The Man Who Forged Benjamin Franklin

description:
En esta segunda sesión del taller de escritura creativa vamos a conocer los principios creativos referidos a la historia y el estilo.

Los escritores de renombre poseen un estilo que los distingue del resto, una manera de escribir consolidada y que no cambia a pesar de que las narraciones sean diferentes. ¿Eres capaz de reconocer a un autor del que hayas leído toda su obra? Probablemente sí y en ese caso estaremos afirmando que sus rasgos, su manera de expresar y comunicar lo definen.

La búsqueda de un estilo lleva tiempo, pero si observamos el tipo de literatura que nos gusta leer y si hemos seleccionado nuestra nómina de autores de cabecera, estaremos cerca de nuestro objetivo.

Por otra parte, en la narración el cómo siempre depende del qué, es decir, dependiendo de lo que desee narrar así será mi estilo y mi voz narrativa. Tener claro qué vamos a contar implica seleccionar un estilo y una voz acorde a nuestra historia.
name: Tema y estilo: historia y voz narrativa

description:
ON2 Salsa Classes taught by Ines and Michael -

Beginner Classes  8 PM to 10 PM $15 per person ($12 with Student ID), Cash and Checks only please.

An hour of Open Shines (individual footwork), followed by an hour of Partner Work

Beginner - Teaches the overall fundamentals of dancing/listening to Salsa music. No prior experience or dance training is required.

ON2 is a leadable dance. No partner is required. We trade partners frequently during class so the men learn to lead and the women learn to follow.

RSVP so we get an accurate head count. If you forget, just show up for class and be ready to dance.

Dance sneakers or dance shoes are a must, but don't let this stop you from coming to dance, just dance in your socks. Athletic shoes are not made for turns and you could damage your knees.  Street shoes and ladies' spiked heels can ruin the studio floors, so if you don't have dance shoes, please come prepared to dance in your socks.  After a few lessons you'll want to buy shoes both to bring to class and take out social dancing.  Places where we have purchased dance shoes include --

www.exoticsalsashoes.com

http://addicted2salsa.com/ballo_shoes/

http://www.discountdance.com/index.php

http://www.danceshoesstore.com/

info for men http://addicted2salsa.com/shoes/

description:
Steez Promo Presents

Brighter Future Tour feat.

Big Gigantic
www.twitter.com/biggigantic
www.instagram.com/biggigantic

Big Gigantic, whose blend of mind-bending beats, thunderous bass and frenetic melodies has developed a rabid following since forming in 2008, have quickly become one of the most celebrated acts in live music. Their latest full-length album, 2014’s The Night Is Young—the fifth album by Boulder, CO-based saxophonist/producer Dominic Lalli and drummer Jeremy Salken—saw their sound hit another dimension with its eclectic mix of tracks spanning from electronic and dance to hip-hop and electro soul.
With a provocative sound that’s as thoughtful as it is danceable, Big Gigantic weaves whirling melodies into addictive beats and samples that wouldn’t sound out of place on a Kanye West or LCD Soundsystem single. No genre is off-limits for Big Gigantic, whose breakthrough sound channels everything from funk and dub‐step to house and hip—°©‐hop.
After graduating with a master’s degree in jazz at the Manhattan School of Music, Lalli relocated to Boulder and began performing with Salken, experimenting with the idea of interpreting traditional DJ‐based music with live instruments. The duo built up early hype in 2008 with local shows and one‐offs around the country before releasing their debut album Fire It Up in 2009 and embarking on a full U.S. tour. Their other releases–Wide Awake (2009), A Place Behind The Moon (2010), 2012’s Nocturnal (which has received more than 1 million downloads to date) and The Night Is Young—have since followed. All music is available for free via the band’s website www.biggigantic.net.
Big Gigantic’s transcendent live shows are a showcase of brilliant improvisation and a tightly‐knit bond between Salken and Lalli, who breathlessly alternates between keys, sax and laptop, building a futuristic wall of sound that keeps the crowd on its feet. The marathon shows feature a variety of songs new, old and unreleased, as well as outside‐of‐the‐box remixes including Wiz Khalifa’s “Black and Yellow,” Aloe Blacc’s “I Need a Dollar” and Notorious B.I.G.’s “Notorious Thugs.”
Since forming, Big Gigantic has toured the country countless times and has become a smash on the festival circuit having performed at all major U.S. festivals including Coachella (where they brought out a local Indio, CA high school marching band during their set), Lollapalooza, Ultra Music Festival, Hangout, Austin City Limits, Governors Ball, Bonnaroo (where they’ve appeared both on their own and as Musical Director of 2014’s Skrillex Superjam performing alongside Damian “Jr. Gong” Marley, Robby Krieger, Lauryn Hill, Zedd, Mickey Hart and Janelle Monae plus more), Electric Forest and Outside Lands among many others. They have also held their own annual event at Colorado’s Red Rocks Amphitheatre called “Rowdytown,” which has sold out every year since its 2012 inception and saw an expansion to two days in 2014. Also in the fall of 2014, the duo performed at the famed Madison Square Garden in New York City supporting Bassnectar.
Big Gigantic is currently in the studio working on new music to be released in late 2015.

With

Illenium
https://soundcloud.com/illeniumofficial
https://www.facebook.com/Illenium
https://twitter.com/ILLENIUMMUSIC
http://instagram.com/illeniumofficial

There are melodic bass producers, and then there is Nick Miller. The Denver-based producer known as Illenium has been turning heads in the dance music community over the past year and for good reason. Illenium has distinguished himself from the myriad of others through an unrivaled ability to create an immersive emotional experience of highs and lows that pulls on the heart strings and leaves the listener awestruck, accomplishing in the span of just a few short minutes what takes many a full set. He has displayed an adeptness for creating aural arrangements that vary in style, yet always maintain beauty, complexity and emotional depth. Illenium gave the world a taste of what he has to offer in 2014 with standout originals “Falling In,” “So Wrong,” “Make Me Do;” remixes of Dawn Golden, Odesza, Oh Wonder; and performances at Global Dance Festival, Decadence NYE and other select dates. However, as foreshadowed by his inclusion in UKF’s “Ones to Watch: 15 for 2015,” this is poised to be Illenium’s breakout year.

All Ages

Doors 2 8pm

description:
Do you want to improve your skills in Java or another programming language in the JVM?

Want to work in an environment where you can learn with like minded people, all interested in growing their skills by practising tutorials, trying out new frameworks and libraries?

The MelbJVM Hack Night is just for you.

Absolute Beginner, Intermediate or Expert, doesn't matter who you are or where you sit in your journey, you'll be welcomed and have some free time to work on whatever project you like.  

Don't have a project, or anything to focus on? We've got a list of ideas on our Slack Channel.  You can sign up here

This is our 3rd hack night for 2016.  You can work on anything introduced in the last hack night (eg Java 9 tutorials), look at anything covered in a recent meetup (eg Andres blog on Monads for Java devs), or work on something new.

This time we are partnering with the Melbourne OSGi professionals meetup group, so there will be an OSGi based project to work on.  In addition we invite anyone who has a project where they'd like to grow their committer base - make a mention of the project in the comments & any github links so we know to introduce you at the start of the night.

Spaces are limited so get in quick. 

Sponsors & Thanks

We'd like to thank our mates at Symplicit (DWS) for providing their venue and wifi for the hack night.  Hays is providing food and drinks.  And a big thankyou to community members Daghan and Mike who are volunteering their time to organise the night.
name: MelbJVM Hack Night

A Funding Panel (OMERS, Pycap, Maple Leaf Angels)

Entrepreneurs are full of great ideas and powerful ways to implement them, but for many of us who are just starting out, a stack of cold, hard cash would go a long way. When you are just starting out, it can be hard to sort through the many funding options available to determine which are most lucrative.

I'm a Marketing and PR consultant for tech and healthcare companies and co-founder of feeDuck, a disruptive startup that is empowering home sellers and buyers in the real estate industry. I'm thrilled to be part of the collaborative, open and welcoming community that is Startup Grind!


Twitter: @gursharn


Global Partner

Intuit Developer has announced with Small Business App Showdown, a contest for anyone who provides solutions to small business problems. Click for more info on how to enter and win a free booth at the annual QuickBooks Connect conference (https://qbcon2016.com/) and a chance at $100k!

With unparalleled experience, our team has come together because in the pit of our stomachs we know that there is something better. Whether as a Fractional CTO, part time, or other capacity - you decide. CTO Boost: For our Clients. For their Customers. For industry.

Traditional investments are often “off the rack” and do not cater to individual investment needs. We don’t believe in compromise. You shouldn’t either. What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 200 cities and 85 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.

description:
Resilience comes from the Latin resilio, which means to jump (or bounce) back. Resilience is the ability to withstand or recover from difficult situations. It includes our capacity to make the best of things, cope with stress and rise to the occasion. This workshop offers practical training in skills, strategies and insights that help our resilience grow.
This workshop we will look at four key skills that raise our resilience:
• visioning skills that strengthen our sense of purpose by helping us see, and then head for, the outcomes that attract us.
• creative problem-solving skills that help us find a path through the obstacles in the way.
• positive relationship skills that enhance our ability to find allies and draw in the support we need.
• emotional intelligence skills that raise our capacity to work with our emotions, so that we can benefit from the guiding signals and energy they offer.
The cost of the workshop is £7
We meet in the function room, if you have trouble finding us please call me on 07455757144.
name: Emotional resilience workshop (the armour for life) Lichfield

description:
Details and registration at www.hackthechangerol.eventbrite.co.uk

All you need to do is bring yourselves, your skills and your kit. And together we can change the world for good.

This is the UK's first Hackathon to materially progress LGBT* human rights with our big challenge to be announced at Kick off on Friday. It's a completely open and inclusive event. If it's your first Hackathon or whether you are a Hackathon addict, you will be well supported and looked after throughout the event.

We’re launching it with Amazon Web Services who will be giving aaccelerators to help you meet the challegne on: Building websites with Elastic Beanstalk and Building APIs with S3, API Gateway and Lambda. Each team will have pretty much unlimited AWS credits to spin up into the cloud. We will also have AWS Solution architects on hand and in person to help with all your techy needs: it's a chance to learn and upskill. We have some amazing legal experts on hand to talk through any IP, tech, privacy and data questions you may have courtesy of our Legal sponsors Freshfields, Hogan Lovells and Osborne Clarke. 

Whilst we have prizes for the winners and runners up teams, there will be some big time spot prizes to be announced. and everyone gets a swag bag and of course an epic Hack the Change T-shirt!

The event is fully catered event: breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks and of course plenty of pizza, beer and wine to aid the creative juices.

Together we can, for the first time, join together the tech and the legal worlds to make real change. The winners will see their ideas taken forward by the charity we are supporting at this event called the Human Dignity Trust; meaning you will have a real impact on the world. It is an authentic Hack. And we need you!

description:
Join us as we do an introduction to modern Data Science at scale.  We will review the concepts and drivers behind the Apache Spark project before diving into an interactive lab.  This lab will be done through the Zeppelin web notebook.

If you want to join into the interactive portion of this demo please download the sandbox and virtual box ahead of time.  http://hortonworks.com/products/sandbox/

APACHE SPARK 

Apache Spark is a fast, in-memory data processing engine with elegant and expressive development APIs to allow data workers to efficiently execute streaming, machine learning or SQL workloads that require fast iterative access to datasets. 

http://hortonworks.com/apache/spark/

APACHE ZEPPELIN

Apache Zeppelin is a web-based notebook which brings data exploration, visualization, sharing and collaboration features to Spark.  It supports Python,Scala, Java, Hive, SparkSQL, shell, markdown, and several other languages. 


http://hortonworks.com/apache/zeppelin/


Objectives of the lab:

• Understand how to load data

• Clean data to produce an easy to use dataset

• Graphing

• Machine learning - Review
name: Interactive Data Science with Spark and Zeppelin

description:

"V Socialbakers sledujeme každý den stovky milionů změn veřejných příspěvků na sociálních sítích. V této přednášce ukážeme, jakým způsobem data ukládáme a jak se nám daří počítat near-realtime agregace dat, která se často mění. Náš systém máme postavený nad HBase a Elasticsearch. V prezentaci ukážeme na co využíváme HBase coprocessory, proč jsme se rozhodli číst replikační log a jak řešíme konzistenci dat a agregací."
name: Jak se pečou data v Socialbakers

 Laughter Wellness Group is a fitness routine that provides energetic balancing for the mind and emotions. A playful activity which involves moments of unconditional laughter with a blend of deep breathing exercises, creative visualizations and simple stretches.

November 27th, 2016 @ 12PM
Tong-In Market, Seochon, Gyeongbokgung
Meet: Gyeongbokgung Station (Line 3) Exit #2
Price: 20,000 KRW (At least 5000 KRW in cash).
*Includes food and currency for Tongin Market.

#1 Tong-In Market
Experience LunchBox with Korean traditional Foods. The market has its unique currency, Yeopjeon, which imitates the coins used during the Joseon Dynasty. Also, amazing snacks are ready for you (cash only)!

#2 Seochon Hanok (Traditional Houses) Village
The best place to feel the Korean traditional architecture, and a glimpse at traditional living.

#3 Deo-oh Bookstore
Bookstore which has 60 years of history.

#4 Jae-bi-Dabang (Cafe)
This is a reformed Hanok for tourism purposes. The place used to be a house belonging to Lee-Sang, one of the most admired writers in Korea. We'll take a short break in here.

#5 Gyeongbokgung
The Palace of Joseon Dynasty. We'll take a walk and take a look at how the Joseon's philosophy was created and worked.
name: SHOWUL Event #1 <The scent of modern Joseon>

description:
Język R w świecie zaawansowanej analizy danych stał się jednym z nieodłącznych narzędzi wykorzystywanych w codziennej pracy. W związku z jego szerokimi możliwościami, znalazł zastosowanie praktycznie we wszystkich dziedzinach począwszy od bio-analizy po automatyzację czynności biurowych i generowanie zautomatyzowanych dokumentów. Warsztat ma na celu wprowadzenie osób w świat programowania w języku R, przekazanie ciekawych metod usprawnienia codziennej pracy, oraz zachęcenie do rozpoczęcia przygody z wizualizacją przetworzonych danych.

Nauczysz się jak zacząć pracę z R, dowiesz się jak skonfigurować środowisko by korzystanie z języka było jeszcze łatwiejsze, jak przygotować dane do analizy oraz jakie metody przetwarzania dobrać by były one optymalne dla postawionego celu. Wszystko będzie poparte praktycznymi przykładami, które otworzą Ci furtkę do dalszej nauki języka R.

Obowiązkowa rejestracja przez formularz. Link na końcu opisu.

Wymagania do warsztatu: 

1. Własny komputer z systemem Windows, OSX, Linux.
2. Chęć do nauki.
3. Pozytywne nastawienie oraz uśmiech :)

Zapewniamy nielimitowany dostęp do pysznej kawy oraz pizzę!

Warsztat poprowadzi Dawid Detko - Specjalista w dziedzinie hurtowni danych oraz zaawansowanej analityki danych. Pracował z wieloma technologiami ale najlepiej czuje się w rozwiązaniach Microsoftu. Ma w swoim dorobku wiele dużych projektów analitycznych obejmujących tematykę integracji danych, wielowymiarowych kostek analitycznych oraz nowoczesnego raportowania self-service. Posiada tytuł MCP (Microsoft Certificate Professional) w dziedzinie SQL Server 2012/2014. Z programowaniem w R związany od 5 lat.

Program warsztatu:

1. Wprowadzenie do środowiska R
  1.1. Zastosowanie i użytkowanie
  1.2.RR + Microsoft
  1.3. Instalacja środowiska R + Rstudio
  1.4. Graficzny interfejs użytkownika w Rstudio
  1.5. Korzystanie z wbudowanych funkcji (R jako kalkulator)
  1.6. Omówienie działania pakietów
2. Omówienie głównych typów danych
  2.1. Wektory
  2.2. Macierze
  2.3. Factors
  2.4. Data.frame
  2.5. Listy
3. Praca ze źródłami zewnętrznymi
  3.1. Import
  3.2. Export
  3.3. Podłączenie do relacyjnej bazy danych
4. Control flow’y
  4.1. If - else
  4.2. Switch
  4.3. Repeat
  4.4. While
  4.5. For
  4.6. Apply
5. Operacje z tekstem
  5.1. Formatowanie tekstu
  5.2. Przedstawienie użytecznych funkcji do pracy z danymi tekstowymi
6. Dodatkowe źródła do nauki R

W trosce o jakość warsztatów jesteśmy zmuszeni ograniczyć liczbę uczestników. Kwalifikacja odbywa się na podstawie odpowiedzi udzielonych w formularzu zgłoszeniowym oraz - w dalszym kroku - kolejności zgłoszeń. Potwierdzenie udziału w warsztatach wraz z instrukcją przygotowania środowiska otrzymasz najpóźniej na 7 dni przed planowaną datą wydarzenia.

Link do obowiązkowej rejestracji: http://www.stacja.it/warsztaty/2016-12-03-podstawy-jezyka-r.html
name: Podstawy języka R

description:
This is one of our most popular talks. David has kindly agreed to once again come and give this amazing talk to our group. Please see the feedback and video from his last event with us. 

There are over 8 million people in London and so many different ways to connect with each other, yet many of us feel disconnected and even isolated. Meet up groups are more popular than ever and designed to bring people closer but how often have you made truly deep connections that could last a lifetime?

Work colleagues, even close friends and family, are often kept at a distance because you are scared to let them see who you really are so, you show them who you think they want to see and that leaves you feeling empty and wondering if this is all there is. Well, it isn’t…….

Who you are and what matters to you are the very reasons why people will want to connect with you. You can create deep connections that will have you feeling fulfilled, energised and will lead to powerful friendships and incredible relationships.

When you learn how to connect deeply with your people, your personal and professional life will know no limits!


Here’s what will be covered on this interactive evening:

Why connecting deeply can be so difficult

What you need to do to connect, fast!

How you are keeping ‘your’ people out of your life

The quickest way to find ‘your’ people

The most important thing that will create a lifelong connection

How deep connections can support you in achieving anything you want in life


At the talk, not only will you learn the concepts that will have you go away able to find your people and connect deeply but, you will also get an experience of using them on the night. That’s right; you get to experiment with making deep connections during the talk; so there is potential for you to make a lifelong friend, colleague or lover right there!

About David:

For a large part of his life he was anxious, lazy, depressed and addicted to one thing or another. Over the past few years he has taken himself from that place to where he is now: passionate, excited, fulfilled and full of wonderment.

David made the leap last year from an uninspiring office job to being self employed. He works with small business owners, CEOs, elite athletes, corporate employees, professional coaches or anyone he is excited by. He gets them to see what they cannot, to create far more than they ever dreamed possible and overcome any obstacle that stands in their way.

He is passionate about his family and has built his life and business around his amazing 100 year old grandma and his incredible mum, who he is proud to support.

Feedback from Interesting Talk's members from when David gave this talk last time;

Rosie "Was a brilliant event! David as per usual was fantastic and it was lovely connecting with so many of you :) x

Emma "Great event. Thanks David and Matt. Brilliant to connect with so many more people than usual in a deeper way!"

Agatha "Thank you Matt for inviting David to present this amazing and powerful tool-talk! I love that idea of feeling fine with deliberate driving people away :-) I honestly think that we do spend far too much time on trying to please, pretend or act just to get others attention or even a temporary approval. For what? For the sake of staying polite, proper or in tack with the etiquette? You have opened my eyes to the amazing and provocatively authentic side we all possess but rarely use it... Thanks, I am acting on it already and it works wonders :-)"

https://youtu.be/o7YqXDTh2t4

Further Event Information

Buying tickets All tickets are purchased through Meetup. You need to RSVP and make payment to be on the "going" list. You have to be a member of this group to purchase a ticket. You do not need a Paypal account to purchase tickets, just a credit or debit card.

All ticket sales are non-transferable between people and non refundable. If you need to cancel your ticket then you can attend another event instead (subject to availability) the same value. For full information please see here http://www.meetup.com/Interesting-Talks-London/pages/Refund_Questions/

Please do not use the comments section to buy and sell tickets or to request tickets. We have a solid ticketing system in place. Repeat posters will be removed from the group.

There are also usually a few tickets available on the night. Door tickets cost £10 and are only available at 7pm. Please turn up on the night to see if any tickets are available.

Phones, laptops and tablets. Please be aware that the use of any of these devices is not permitted at the events. We are often filming the events and it interferes with our equipment. This is also a social group and we encourage people to talk to each other. 

Note taking. If you wish to make notes, please bring paper and pens. These are not supplied.

Arriving on time. Please ensure that you have arrived and got your seat before the start of the talk. Please be aware that if you do not arrive on time we may resell your seat.
name: How to create deep connections and find your people By David Saville

description:
Ghent, in Belgium, is a stunning, vibrant city with a thriving restaurant and bar scene amid it's network of narrow canals overseen by dozens of antique brick houses. Ghent’s medieval past is to be found in a string of superb Gothic buildings including St-Baafskathedraal, whose principal treasure is Jan van Eyck’s remarkable Adoration of the Mystic Lamb, one of the world’s most important paintings.

Supporting the cathedral are the likes of St-Niklaaskerk, with its soaring arches and pencil-thin turrets; the forbidding castle of the counts of Flanders, Het Gravensteen; and the delightful medieval guildhouses of the Graslei. 

​During our visit the Winter Festival will be in full swing. The city centre will become a winter wonderland with an ice-skating rink under the City Pavilion. From the giant Ferris wheel you'll enjoy a view of the city from the air. There is also a Christmas market with international stands and the Castle of the Counts changes into a winter wonderland castle.

​Getting to Ghent with us couldn't be easier! We will pick you up in our comfortable, heated coach from central London or Bexley and travel via the Channel Tunnel straight to the heart of this wonderful winter wonderland. Join us for a winter day trip to remember!

*You must have a valid passport to travel on this trip!*

Cost

£49 per person

Included

Return coach travel from London, channel crossing by ferry, services of a tour guide

Not included

Tickets to attractions, food & drink, gratuities


Departure/Drop off point

Option 1) Tower Hill Coach Park

Look for the sign-posted pedestrian entrance on Petty Wales (painted yellow, underneath Wagamama) take the steps on the right and wait in front of the coach bays. 

Option 2) Hall Place Car Park, Hall Place, Bourne Rd, Bexley DA5 1PQ 

Wait by the coach bays at the far side of the car park.


Departure time

6.45am / 7.30am

Return time (approx)

9.30pm / 10.15pm


Schedule (approx.) (in local times - Ghent is 1 hour ahead)

06.45 – Depart Tower Hill

07.30 – Depart Hall Place

08.50 – Arrive Folkstone for check-in before 9.50 crossing (crossing time approx. 30 mins)

13.30 – Arrive Ghent

18.00 – Depart Ghent

20.00 – Arrive Calais for check-in before 20.50 crossing

21.30 – Arrive Hall Place

22.15 – Arrive Tower Hill


Please leave a comment below if you have any questions (which aren't answered in the FAQ) and I will get back to you as soon as I can. I hope you can join me on this magical trip! Becca :-)
name: Ghent Winter Festival - £49

description:
This week's special:

Ping-Pong? Bowling? Arcades? Darts and pool in a bar? Vote for your favorite activity and we'll do it at 5pm, after our weekly language exchange.

Vote here: https://hienchanh.typeform.com/to/qv6fz8

----

Dear Language Innovators,

Ready to practice languages in a motivating and innovating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, chill, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone :)

The program:

• 3:00PM: Choose your table according the language you'd like to speak and start chatting with the people around you (you'll find icebreaking questions on the table in case that helps). Feel free to move and change seats anytime :)

• 4:00PM: I'll make you draw a table number to meet other people with whom you can feel free to speak any language. We'll also take 5 minutes for any announcement: there's an event, a place you'd like to share with us? You're looking for an apartment, a buddy/driver to travel to Mont Saint-Michel with? That will be your occasion to address everyone :)

Note: You'll find on a table some free stuff to help you interact and find topics to discuss. We're sharing for free all the documents we wrote here: https://overword.com/free-documents-language-exchange-group/

The meeting will be at "Ease Side Café", 129 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France (metro: Gare de l'Est, ligne 4, 5, 7). We'll be next to the pool table, feel free to ask the kind waiters if you can't find us. For prices, you can check the menu here: http://media.wix.com/ugd/94b6bd_4bd10a97c4be446c87e77abc578eb894.pdf

The event is free to join. We rely on donations, but you don't have to donate if you don't want to or if you feel we don't deserve it, no problema :)

If you like a bit what we're doing, please register on Overword.com or like/follow our social network pages. Let's remain connected after the event!

As always, we're happy to hear your question or suggestion. Happy learning!

HC.

Here's the list of the board games we're providing so far, you can help us get new ones by making small donations: Taboo, Scrabble cards, Italian cards (Scopa, Briscola, etc.), Cardline Globetrotter, Sandwich, Tic Tac Boom, Pantomime, Sushi Go, Cards against humanity (new!).

And finally, once a month we're offering a t-shirt to our attendees. Just fill your name on the paper that says "Lottery draw" at the entrance and then cross your fingers until the last Friday of the month!

You can also purchase our t-shirt online here: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products

Until Xmas. Challenge HC at Rock-Paper-Scissors, if you win you'll get a 50% discount on Overword T-shirts! (one trial per event max).

Store: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products
FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/overword.paris/ and https://www.facebook.com/Overword2012
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Overword2012

description:
Pregnant? Scared? Unsure of your options? Looking for ways to prepare positively for the birth of your child? FearFree Birthing are offering a one day Hypnobirthing Course at the Holistic Centre of Ireland on a monthly basis. Here you will be invited to bring your birth partner, and together you will be taught a range of tools and techniques to help you adapt with the flow of your birth path. The mind and body will be preparing together - just as a sports athlete would do! You will both feel more confident about your options, and calm should things take a change on the day which will enable you to make the best decisions for you and baby. Whether you are having a home birth, being induced, having a csection, or planning an epidural, you can be sure that these valuable skills you learn are utilised in anyway you feel you need them during your labour. From self hypnosis to breathing techniques, various positions to massage, and mental activities to various comfort measures - you will be prepared for your plan A and your plan B; Mentally, Physically and most importantly Emotionally so that you can have a positive birth experience. No matter what stage in pregnancy, or how you plan to birth, we will support you and give you everything you need to continue with the practice and preparation at home. Please contact us today for a free consultation via phone or email. Private sessions can also be arranged. The next workshops take place on Sunday 16th October, 20th November, and 18th December 2016. Hypnobirthing price: Full Workshops are €200 and you'll receive all downloads and coursework needed. Plus full support via email up until your baby arrives. As the course is modular, it can also be taken as sessions - one in the morning and one in the afternoon. They cost €130 per session if booked seperately and spread over 2 dates; however the full workshop is discounted if booked together and taken as a full day course to enable the small group to bond and stay in touch if they like. A private session closer to the birth can also be booked on the course day at a discounted rate. Here we can go over anything you require and address any final concerns. Price: Full workshops €200
Per session €130
name: Hypnobirthing - Mind & Body Birth Preparation Class - With Elaine

description:
The magical city of Bruges looks like a fairytale come to life, full of pretty medieval buildings and serene canals, picturesque market squares and ancient churches.

In winter the city has a Christmas card feel, and is home to one of the loveliest of the Belgian Christmas Markets. The stalls are centered on Grote Markt (in the shadow of the 13th century Bell Tower) and Simon Stevinplein. You’ll find eye-wateringly good sweets and marzipan, hot chocolate and waffles to warm up with as well as a dedicated hobby and toy fair, and even an ice skating rink!

When you’ve had your fill of Christmas shopping, why not try the famous Belgian beer in one of the traditional beer houses, or a supper of delicious moules frites or Flemish stew. There are several museums and galleries to explore, or you could take in the sights on a horse and carriage ride or boat trip on the picturesque canal.

Getting to Bruges with us couldn't be easier! We will pick you up in our comfortable, heated coach from central London or Bexley and travel via the Channel Tunnel straight to the heart of this wonderful winter wonderland. Join us for a winter day trip to remember!

*IMPORTANT NOTE: YOU WILL NEED A VALID PASSPORT TO JOIN THIS TRIP*

Departure/Drop off point

Option 1) Tower Hill Coach Park

Look for the sign-posted pedestrian entrance on Petty Wales (painted yellow, underneath Wagamama) take the steps on the right and wait in front of the coach bays.

Option 2) Hall Place Car Park, Hall Place, Bourne Rd, Bexley DA5 1PQ

Wait by the coach bays at the far side of the car park.

*Please mention in the comments when you RSVP which pick-up point you want!*

Departure times

6.30am / 7.15am

Return time (approx)

10.30pm / 11.30pm

Schedule (Approx) (in local times - Bruges is 1 hour ahead)

06.30 – Depart Tower Hill

07.15 – Depart Hall Place

08.35 – Arrive Folkestone for 9.35 channel tunnel train

13.00 – Arrive Bruges

18.15 – Depart Bruges

20.00 – Arrive Calais for 20.50 crossing

21.30 – Arrive Hall Place

22.15 – Arrive Tower Hill

Included

Return coach travel from London, channel crossing by ferry, services of a tour guide

Not included

Tickets to attractions, food & drink, gratuities

*Timings are approximate and the schedule is subject to change when required.  Your tour guide will confirm times to be back at the coach at each stop, the schedule above is a guideline only. 

Please do leave a comment below if you have any questions and I'll get back to you as soon as I can!

Becca :-)
name: Magical Bruges Christmas market day trip - only £49!

Tong-In Market, Seochon, Gyeongbokgung
Meet: Gyeongbokgung Station (Line 3) Exit #2
Price: 20,000 KRW (At least 5000 KRW in cash).
*Includes food and currency for Tongin Market.

#1 Tong-In Market
Experience LunchBox with Korean traditional Foods. The market has its unique currency, Yeopjeon, which imitates the coins used during the Joseon Dynasty. Also, amazing snacks are ready for you (cash only)!

#2 Seochon Hanok (Traditional Houses) Village
The best place to feel the Korean traditional architecture, and a glimpse at traditional living.

#3 Deo-oh Bookstore
Bookstore which has 60 years of history.

#4 Jae-bi-Dabang (Cafe)
This is a reformed Hanok for tourism purposes. The place used to be a house belonging to Lee-Sang, one of the most admired writers in Korea. We'll take a short break in here.

#5 Gyeongbokgung
The Palace of Joseon Dynasty. We'll take a walk and take a look at how the Joseon's philosophy was created and worked.

description:
Do you want to know how to be the BEST you can be, AND have tools to help others?

Prerequisite: None required.
Includes: Book, Practitioner  Manual, refreshments.
Accreditation: On completion, you will be certified as a Theta Healing Basic practitioner. You can do this course for your personal development and/or become a practitioner, the choice is yours.

This 3 day course will give you the skills to change and improve your life! You will gain the amazing potential within yourself as you become aware of the power of your thoughts, and how to  instantly change them to create your reality.  You'll learn powerful techniques that help you create what you want in life.   Decide to create the life you want to live now!  Pre booking for this class is vital as places are limited and fill up rapidly

Quickly reveal systems of belief that can take traditional therapies years to uncover. Discover how to quickly replace limiting beliefs and feelings with positive ones.
This gives you the key to  manifesting what you want in life.

Investment Normally £395  MEETUP PRICE £345 A non refundable deposit of £95 is required to secure your place. 
Bring a friend, £690 for two places, saving £100 . A non refundable deposit of £160 is required to secure two places. The balance is paid by two weeks before the course begins.

MORE INFO
name: Theta Healing® Basic Course

description:
WHAT

Stando alle attuali stime, l'ONU prevede che nell'anno 2040 sul nostro Pianeta ci saranno circa 9 miliardi di abitanti. Una crescita demografica di tale portata impone la messa a punto di nuove tecnologie e modelli alimentari, che siano sostenibili per sfruttare al meglio le risorse della Terra e garantire a tutti una nutrizione adeguata.

Partendo da questi dati abbiamo deciso di dedicare un Meetup ad alcune realtá vicine al nostro Future food Ecosystem che coi loro progetti lanciano segnali per un futuro dell'alimentazione a 360 gradi, from farm to fork!


Come da tradizione, inoltre, svolgiamo i nostri Meetup in concomitanza con altre iniziative legate al mondo food a Bologna. A partire dal 16 novembre partirá il Cioccoshow con le sue cinque giornate ricche di gustose iniziative che renderanno ancora più “dolce” passeggiare nel centro storico della città. Al cioccolato sará dedicato proprio l'ultimo degli interventi della serata quando parleremo del Chocothon, una iniziativa sostenuta da importanti partner internazionali, volta a migliorare le condizioni dei coltivatori di cacao in Ghana e a rendere piú sostenibile un prodotto che altrimenti rischia di scomparire.

Il futuro del cibo parte da questi segnali, parliamone insieme a Food+Tech Meetup Bologna!

WHEN

Martedì 15 novembre 2016

[masked]

-[masked] Registrazione e networking aperitivo

- 18.00 - 19.00 Meet the founders

WHERE 

WellDone Burger

Via Caprarie 3C, Bologna

WellDone Burger si trova in via Caprarie 3/C, nel cuore della city of food, nella zona del quadrilatero. Dista circa 12 minuti a piedi dalla stazione. Trovate le indicazioni a questo link

WHO

Welcome (10 min)

Sara Roversi - Founder of Future Food Institute

Danielle Gould via skype - Founder of Food+Tech Connect

Meet the Founders (5 speakers, 7 minutes for every speaker)

By-ento: La startup che alleva diverse specie di insetti creando una filiera produttiva virtuosa

Perfrutto: Un servizio di monitoraggio, consulenza tecnica e previsione della produzione delle specie frutticole melo, pero e, in futuro, kiwi, basato sull’elaborazione di dati fisiologici misurati sui frutti stessi

Funghi Espresso: La startup che valorizza i fondi di caffè per la coltivazione di funghi freschi e per la produzione di kit per l'autoproduzione domestica.

Cooki: Il software che rende facile la gestione del libro ingredienti ed è pienamente aderente alla Direttiva Allergeni 1169/11

Chocothon: Una iniziativa sostenuta da importanti partner internazionali, volta a migliorare le condizioni dei coltivatori di cacao in Ghana e a rendere più sostenibile un prodotto che altrimenti rischia di scomparire

KNOWLEDGE PARTNERS 

Crowdfooding

Chocothon

HASHTAG UFFICIALE

 #ftmBO


ABOUT FOOD+TECH MEETUP

Food+Tech Meetup è un format nato a Brooklyn creato da Danielle Gould, CEO e founder di Food+Tech Connect, il più noto ed autorevole network internazionale su temi Food, Tech ed Innovazione, riferimento per innovatori, industrie e startupper nell'industria alimentare.

I Food+Tech Meetup possiedono una community di oltre[masked] attivissimi partecipanti. In Italia sono partiti da Bologna, promossi da You Can Group e Future Food Institute un ecosistema alla continua ricerca di idee, tecnologie e modelli di business innovativi che ci aiutino a creare un futuro migliore per il mondo del cibo e quindi per il nostro pianeta.

Food+Tech Meetup nasce con il desiderio di accorciare le distanze tra imprenditori, startuppers, investitori, chef, agricoltori, produttori, giornalisti, foodies, designer e un network sempre più ampio e composito di attori protagonisti e appassionati del mondo food, con l'obiettivo di studiare, ricercare e condividere best practices in questo ambito.
name: Feeding the future: Segnali dal cibo del futuro

Compete in 5 km or 10 km distance races using either classical or skate techniques. Race individual races, or sign up for the complete series tracking individual and team points throughout the season.

Individual races are $15 for non-members, $10 for MadNorSki members, and just $2 for youth & collegiate racers!

Complete 6-race series (weather permitting) is $60 for non-members, $50 for MadNorSki members, and just $10 for youth & collegiate racers!

For questions, please contact [masked] or visit madnorski.org/racing

description:
Hey Everyone,

SA Kitesurf will be running a free introductory kiteboarding lesson this weekend on Saturday and Sunday at 10:30 in Tableview for anyone interested in understanding more about kiteboarding and how it all works. Our instructor will be talking about the wind window, the basics of flying a kite, safety and quick release system and you will get to fly a small training kite on the beach. This is the first fundamental lesson to get started in kiteboarding. 

Then after the lesson, If you thought it was a whole lotta of fun and you want to take things further we offer full courses that will get you up and riding in no time. See the website for details

description:
Wonder why people around you are successful sharing their victories and you are the one always listening to their stories?

Yes, success doesn’t come easily and there is price to pay for it. This is how people tell you.

However, do you also have doubts why you failed, how you failed. Have you ever asked yourself are you doing the right way or is there a mentor along the way to guide you?

We would like to invite you to share with us your failure, be it business in Singapore or overseas.  Get together to share ideas to contribute in a session with an open mindset discussion.

You will get to know friends with positive mindset to energize your way to success. 

Networking isn’t perfect, It’s just BETTER.

Please do a RSVP and call before half an hour when you reached.

Mobile No : [masked]
name: Networking Your Way To Success

description:
"In 10 sessions, you will feel the difference, in 20 sessions you will see the difference and in 30 sessions you will have a whole new body". -Joseph Pilates

Please whatsapp or calls to confirm your space as the class may be full and you may be refused entry. [masked] Devorah

Pilates is a controlled and intelligent approach to exercise and full body-conditioning, which results in a leaner, stronger and more toned body. The breathing techniques also relax the body and calm the mind.

Pilates has been known in the world of dance, gymnasts and rehabilitation for a long time and now been discovered by a wider audience – from those who want a stronger back or flatter stomach to those with specific injuries or medical problems or pregnant. 

As a gentle, non-aerobic exercise method it is a practice that can be made without stressing the joints or the heart, Those who practice pilates find they benifit from improved posture as well as a more mobile body

Prices:

49€ for monthly membership (once a week),

70€ for monthly membership (twice a week)

description:
A gyakorló nap célja:

Ez a kötetlen összejövetel a Balla-hangterápia tanfolyamot végzett résztvevők számára biztosít gyakorlási lehetőséget.

Ha nincs még saját tálkészleted, de szeretnéd frissen tartani a tanfolyamon tanult gyakorlati fogásokat, vagy van, de szeretnél másokkal együtt gyakorolni, tapasztalatokat megosztani, itt megteheted.

A program:

Nincs tematika, ez nem tanfolyam.

A csapat összetételétől (alap vagy haladó tanfolyamot végzettek) függően alakítjuk a nap programját: megosztjuk egymással tapasztalatainkat, megvitatjuk kérdéseinket, és gyakoroljuk a gyakorolni való fogásokat.

Résztvevők:

Balla-hangterápia tanfolyamot végzettek.

Részvételi díj:

A korábbiakhoz hasonlóan továbbra sem cél ezeknek az alkalmaknak a nyereségessé tétele. Így nincs kötött részvételi díj, hanem aki úgy gondolja, a lehetőségeihez mért, szolíd összeget tehet az "adományládába".
name: "KONGATÓS" gyakorló nap

description:
This week's special:

  • We'll be starting at 4pm (instead of 3pm).
  • If you accept it, a photographer will offer his services to take a professional portrait of you (it's always useful right?!), with and without fun accessories. Your photo will also be used to create a quizz to bring the awareness on conscious/unconscious prejudices and promote the beauty of foreign languages.

----

Dear Language Innovators,

Ready to practice languages in a motivating and innovating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, chill, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone :)

The program:

• 4:00PM: Choose your table according the language you'd like to speak and start chatting with the people around you (you'll find icebreaking questions on the table in case that helps). Feel free to move and change seats anytime :)

• 5:00PM: I'll make you draw a table number to meet other people with whom you can feel free to speak any language. We'll also take 5 minutes for any announcement: there's an event, a place you'd like to share with us? You're looking for an apartment, a buddy/driver to travel to Mont Saint-Michel with? That will be your occasion to address everyone :)

Note: You'll find on a table some free stuff to help you interact and find topics to discuss. We're sharing for free all the documents we wrote here: https://overword.com/free-documents-language-exchange-group/

The meeting will be at "Ease Side Café", 129 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France (metro: Gare de l'Est, ligne 4, 5, 7). We'll be next to the pool table, feel free to ask the kind waiters if you can't find us. For prices, you can check the menu here: http://media.wix.com/ugd/94b6bd_4bd10a97c4be446c87e77abc578eb894.pdf

The event is free to join. We rely on donations, but you don't have to donate if you don't want to or if you feel we don't deserve it, no problema :)

If you like a bit what we're doing, please register on Overword.com or like/follow our social network pages. Let's remain connected after the event!

As always, we're happy to hear your question or suggestion. Happy learning!

HC.

Here's the list of the board games we're providing so far, you can help us get new ones by making small donations: Taboo, Scrabble cards, Italian cards (Scopa, Briscola, etc.), Cardline Globetrotter, Sandwich, Tic Tac Boom, Pantomime, Sushi Go, Cards against humanity (new!).

And finally, once a month we're offering a t-shirt to our attendees. Just fill your name on the paper that says "Lottery draw" at the entrance and then cross your fingers until the last Friday of the month!

You can also purchase our t-shirt online here: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products

Until Xmas. Challenge HC at Rock-Paper-Scissors, if you win you'll get a 50% discount on Overword T-shirts! (one trial per event max).

Store: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products
FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/overword.paris/ and https://www.facebook.com/Overword2012
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Overword2012
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/overword2012/
name: Language exchange (+ Profile Pictures taken by a photographer) - All Languages

description:
Do you want to know how to be the BEST you can be, AND have tools to help others?

Prerequisite: None required.
Includes: Book, Practitioner  Manual, refreshments.
Accreditation: On completion, you will be certified as a Theta Healing Basic practitioner. You can do this course for your personal development and/or become a practitioner, the choice is yours.

This 3 day course will give you the skills to change and improve your life! You will gain the amazing potential within yourself as you become aware of the power of your thoughts, and how to  instantly change them to create your reality.  You'll learn powerful techniques that help you create what you want in life.   Decide to create the life you want to live now!  Pre booking for this class is vital as places are limited and fill up rapidly

Quickly reveal systems of belief that can take traditional therapies years to uncover. Discover how to quickly replace limiting beliefs and feelings with positive ones.
This gives you the key to  manifesting what you want in life.

Investment Normally £395  MEETUP PRICE £345 A non refundable deposit of £95 is required to secure your place. 
Bring a friend, £690 for two places, saving £100 . A non refundable deposit of £160 is required to secure two places. The balance is paid by two weeks before the course begins.

MORE INFO
name: Theta Healing® Basic Course

description:
Este evento é para quem lida com a dificuldade de fazer apresentações de alto impacto em tempo reduzido.  

A referência são as apresentações/vendas onde o empreendedor tem de 3 a 5 minutos para expor sua idéia, os motivos que o levaram a criar a empresa/produto, seus diferenciais e as projeções de desenvolvimento. São conhecidas pelo nome de Pitch.

Será uma demonstração prática do processo de Coaching e a apresentação do treinamento concebido específicamente para quem quer melhorar sua forma de se apresentar e empreender, o Pitch Coaching.

Incrições abaixo (para receber as instruções de participação) Após receber seus dados confirmaremos seu RSVP

https://www.eventbrite.com.br/preview?eid=29248955413

Obs: Necessário ter câmera, microfone e conexão suficiente para a atividade. 

O participante deve se organizar para comparecer um pouco antes da hora na página até que seja enviado o link da sessão que só é gerado quando ela começa. Depois de iniciada a conferência nem sempre é possível adicionar quem chega.

description:
Terry Batchelder, and Rick are hosting sand volleyball at Scotland's yard this Saturday Nov 12.

Rick's address is 5615 west Virginia Ave Lakewood CO 80226 .. start time is 11...to 5:00..so as always bring BYOB and Water..a dish to share.. there will be a grill available for those so inclined to bring their own meat...house is undergoing renovation.. but there is access bathroom..most of you have been here before and know the drill..all about socializing and fun ..will have horseshoes and as well..so come on down to opening day at the yard. Please pick up after yourself, and remember to take your dish when you leave.

This is 3 hit volleyball ( Bump, Set, Spike ) as oppose to Jungleball. We will train newcomers if they are not familiar with these skills. Call the score before each serve so that all players can hear. If you interfere with the net by touching it with your body please say that you netted and the play will be dead and serve will go to the other team.
name: Sand Volleyball at Scotlands Yard Nov 12

description:
San Francisco Choral Society presents

Maurice Duruflé – Requiem, Quatre motets sur des thèmes gregoriéns
Gabriel Fauré – Cantique de Jean Racine
Herbert Howells – Te deum, Jubilate

Saturday, November 12 at 8pm
Sunday, November 13 at 4pm

Calvary Presbyterian Church, 2515 Fillmore Street, San Francisco

Ticket Prices:
$34 Front Orchestra, Center Loge Reserved
$31 Side Loge Reserved
$28 Balcony General Admission
$2 off in each section for Students and Seniors

Duruflé’s luminous and very personal version of the requiem mass was dedicated to the memory of his father; he filled it with ecstatic praise, a heartfelt plea for mercy, and shimmering passages of peace and hope. Also by Duruflé, the Quatres motets are sung a cappella and in the Gregorian chant style—the perfect companions to his Requiem.

Cantique de Jean Racine, by Gabriel Fauré, is a lush choral gem set to the words of French playright Jean Racine. And Herbert Howells’ Te Deum rounds out the program—a moving exemplar of the British choral music tradition.

With Special Guest Jonathan Dimmock, organist:
Local treasure Jonathan Dimmock is well-known the world over, having toured on six continents and appeared on over forty lauded CD recordings. description:
Hey Everyone,

SA Kitesurf will be running a free introductory kiteboarding lesson this weekend on Saturday and Sunday at 10:30 in Tableview for anyone interested in understanding more about kiteboarding and how it all works. Our instructor will be talking about the wind window, the basics of flying a kite, safety and quick release system and you will get to fly a small training kite on the beach. This is the first fundamental lesson to get started in kiteboarding. 

Then after the lesson, If you thought it was a whole lotta of fun and you want to take things further we offer full courses that will get you up and riding in no time. See the website for details 

http://www.sakitesurf.co.za/kitesurf-lessons-courses-in-cape-town/.  

All our instructors are VDWS and IKO certified so you are getting the highest standard of kiteboarding lessons in the business. Feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

Hope you can make it and Enjoy!
Dale
SA Kitesurf Owner/ Kiteboarding Instructor

description:
All

Join us at Southwyck Golf Club.

The weather is perfect and the course is in top shape.

Saturday, November 12th, 10:15am 

$34.00 per player includes: 

• Range balls

• 18 hole Green fee 

• Cart fee

• Two (2) free draft beers or two (2) free fountain drinks 

Contests: Closest to Pin on all par 3 holes  

The cost to compete is $10.00. You will have four chances at winning up to $64 when everyone participates. 

Please RSVP by Wednesday, November 9th to reserve your spot! 

PLEASE NOTE: If you need to cancel, please update your RSVP 24 hours before event date. A $10 CANCELLATION FEE WILL BE ASSESSED TO ANYONE WHO DOES NOT SHOW UP OR CANCELS AFTER THE 24 HOUR PERIOD BEFORE GAME DAY. 

About Southwyck Golf Club:

www.southwyckgc.com

Southwyck Golf Club is a links style golf course which meanders through the Silverlake subdivision. It is a true links style course on the front nine as you have 4 holes going out away from the clubhouse, typically playing into the wind, and five holes coming back for the turn, typically playing downwind. The Champion Bermuda greens are an outstanding putting surface – called the bent grass of the south – we believe we have one of the finest sets of greens in Houston public golf. The fairways and tee boxes are always in top notch shape.  A burn runs through the property and water comes into play on 14 of the 18 holes.  The course plays anywhere from 5145 yards to 6914 yards.  We have 4 sets of tees, so finding the correct distance for your game should never be a problem.
name: Southwyck Golf Club - Saturday Nov 12th

description:
On 14th November we will all be experiencing energies from the 2nd of 3 consecutive SUPERMOONS. (A supermoon is when the moon rises closer to the earth making it appear larger in the sky, and emotions are heightened.) 2016 has marked a year of change and transformation for many of us and it's not over yet! We are becoming especially aware of what is NOT working, so we know what needs to be torn down to make way for the new. We should connect with our Inner Dragon strength and ride this crescendo that completes our epic year. 

Talk - Jaclyn
Feeling the current energies and how best to work with them, letting go of ideas, patterns and attachments, stripping away the old and creating the space to allow for the new to enter. Understanding how to work with the full moon energy, play with its intensity in understanding our behaviors.

Grounding - Linda 
Based on the sacred tree, connecting to heaven, beneath the earth and connecting all forms of creation. We will guide you through a meditation to help you to ground your energy and connect with your authentic truth and self as we open your field for the Dragon Transmission.

Dragon Transmission - Aang
Experience a Multidimensional Light Transmission as you connect deeper into you being, raising the frequencies of your thought patterns, your emotional space as you lighten the physical body in preparation for the transmission. Taking you on a journey of feeling, experiencing and balancing your energy field. Awakening the Dragon Guide within as you connect, feel and experience the energy of this amazing being bringing you great Strength, Courage and Wisdom. Open yourself to new insights and creativity as the element of magic flows through you.

Note: Aang will be channelling the transmission from Bali where the two Great Dragon Lines (Male and Female) of our planet meet.

The Team
Jaclyn and Linda have been on the spiritual path for a few years and have both had wonderful awakening experiences. Their experiences are both inspiring and extremely insightful for those on the path. It has been a pleasure be a part of their journeys and experience the rapid changes that they both have been through. Jaclyn and Linda have also both completed the Stepping onto Your Path - 6 Month Training program and they are very well equipped with the tools and the knowledge in holding space and creating a beautiful environment for individuals open themselves to greater essence that exists within. I still love teaching and channelling Light Transmissions, and now we are able to bring you these energy experiences on a completely different level. Love and blessings, Aang

Venue
name: SUPERMOON Transmission:  Connecting to the Dragon Within

description:
Winter has come and with it also all the more or less common deseases like cold, cough and flu.. how to deal with them in a natural, sustainable and effective way?

Well, in the workshop we are going to present the plants that are commonly used in the Western Herbalism for cold and flu, but also plants that are used to prevent the deseases and boost the immune system, with a special focus on those that are commonly available in Denmark.

We are also going to learn how to make our own syrup against the cold to bring home!

The workshop is free od charge, in collaboration with Greencubator (greencubator.dk) and Clorofille (http://clorofille.com/da).

Looking forward to meet you all!
name: Western Herbal Remedies for cold and flu

description:
In this workshop, we'll go explore the proven methods of being gentle with oneself and learning to love yourself so that you can love others. More specifically we'll go over the importance of small positive changes that you can easily implement in for a better life. We'll go over the research and practice in a safe, inclusive environment and have fun in the process. Take charge of your life this fall and make positive changes with positive psychology.

What is Positive Psychology?

Positive psychology is a branch of psychology that focuses on what makes people happy. All studies are evidence-based and rooted in scientific research. It encourages people to make the best choices in their current situation.

Benefits of Positive Psychology and a Positive Mindset

- Increased optimism
- Less depression
- Increased resilience
- Better immune system
- Better coping skills
- Builds physical, social, and creative skills
- Increased success in achieving goals Cost of workshop £7
If you have trouble finding us please phone me on[masked]
name: How to Love Yourself And Others

description:
►►► SAVE THE DATE ◄◄◄   RSVPs WILL OPEN SOON !

Event Rating:    Level 3-4,    ► Difficult ◄

Distance:    ~5 MILES

Time Duration:    ~5 HOURS

Blaze Orange:    Not required

HOLIDAY SHOPPING SALE!   Gorgeous Views, Endless Self-satisfaction, and a Wholelotta Fun, 3166 ft size, all for the special low price of $5 (the NH State Park entrance fee). And there is no need to camp out at the entrance at 4 am to beat out the crowds, because there will be an unlimited supply of all the sale items!
Enter coupon code  GETOFFTHECOUCH

Mount Monadnock... the most climbed mountain in North America and the third most climbed mountain in the world!

This hike is suitable for beginner mountain hikers, BUT...

►►► YOU MUST HAVE ENOUGH HIKING EXPERIENCE TO COMPLETE GOING UP AND DOWN 200O FEET OF ELEVATION GAIN OVER VERY ROUGH AND ROCKY TRAILS! ◄◄◄

If I have not hiked with you before or do not know you, I may contact you to ask about your experience and gear. Please do not be offended, I just want to be sure that you have a safe and happy day - in that order. (... and I don't want to have to carry you down.)

We will be hiking up to the summit at a safe and relaxed pace, but... we will be taking the most difficult route to get there, the Spellman trail! It requires some effort, but delivers a huge reward.

You MUST bring your 10 essentials +4, a minimum of 2L water, snacks,  lunch, and a happy attitude.    

Here's the list. You ain't got 'em, you ain't comin' :

~ ~ ~ ~ ~
1. Map      You are given one at the gate.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
2. Compass   Know how to use it.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
3. Flashlight / Headlamp    Are those batteries fresh ?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
4. Extra Food   (Extra points for bringing Snickers for the leader)
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
5. Extra Clothes    Including rain gear or poncho
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
6. Eye Protection   Is that you behind those Foster Grants?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
7. First-Aid Kit     There will be a group kit. Bring your medications.
.~ ~ ~ ~ ~
8. Pocket Knife    Even better, a multi-tool.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
9. Waterproof Matches
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
10. Firestarter  I use cotton balls soaked in petroleum jelly in a 35mm film case. They ignite instantly, even in rain.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
11. Water / Filter / Bottles   Minimum 2 Liters !
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
12. Whistle    On your pack strap for fast access
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
13. Insect Repellents or Clothing    Probably won't need it
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
14. Sunburn Preventatives   Needed year round.  There is no shade up there.

You also may be asked to share in the carrying of a small amount of group gear. 

Plan on a good stretch of rock scrambling (YES! The best part!).  Got height problems? This hike is probably not for you.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDcnN7job7o

PLEASE NOTE: Your leaders will always be very accommodating and forgiving, but by signing up, you agree that you will abide by any decisions they make concerning your ability, suitability, and safety. Sumitting is at the leader's discretion and is not guaranteed.  We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Anyone leaving the group during the hike will be permanently removed from the club.

Summit Weather:  http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Monadnock/forecasts/965

Hope to see you on the mountain!

Bob

“Hey Mom, can I go outside and play?”

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at http://www.hikesafe.com/ ; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Safety First!

description:
This week's special:

  • "Rock-Paper-Scissors" tournament in teams of 2 or 3 with free drinks for the winners! It will start at 4:30pm, I'll be explaining the rules at East Side directly :)
  • After the event (at 5pm), we'll move to the 15th for our monthly karaoke. If you'd like to join us, you need to register on a separate event, since seats are unfortunately limited: https://www.meetup.com/overword/events/235261509/

----

Dear Language Innovators,

Ready to practice languages in a motivating and innovating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, chill, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone :)

The program:

• 3:00PM: Choose your table according the language you'd like to speak and start chatting with the people around you (you'll find icebreaking questions on the table in case that helps). Feel free to move and change seats anytime :)

• 4:00PM: I'll make you draw a table number to meet other people with whom you can feel free to speak any language. We'll also take 5 minutes for any announcement: there's an event, a place you'd like to share with us? You're looking for an apartment, a buddy/driver to travel to Mont Saint-Michel with? That will be your occasion to address everyone :)

Note: You'll find on a table some free stuff to help you interact and find topics to discuss. We're sharing for free all the documents we wrote here: https://overword.com/free-documents-language-exchange-group/

The meeting will be at "Ease Side Café", 129 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France (metro: Gare de l'Est, ligne 4, 5, 7). We'll be next to the pool table, feel free to ask the kind waiters if you can't find us. For prices, you can check the menu here: http://media.wix.com/ugd/94b6bd_4bd10a97c4be446c87e77abc578eb894.pdf

The event is free to join. We rely on donations, but you don't have to donate if you don't want to or if you feel we don't deserve it, no problema :)

If you like a bit what we're doing, please register on Overword.com or like/follow our social network pages. Let's remain connected after the event!

As always, we're happy to hear your question or suggestion. Happy learning!

HC.

Here's the list of the board games we're providing so far, you can help us get new ones by making small donations: Taboo, Scrabble cards, Italian cards (Scopa, Briscola, etc.), Cardline Globetrotter, Sandwich, Tic Tac Boom, Pantomime, Sushi Go, Cards against humanity (new!).

And finally, once a month we're offering a t-shirt to our attendees. Just fill your name on the paper that says "Lottery draw" at the entrance and then cross your fingers until the last Friday of the month!

You can also purchase our t-shirt online here: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products

Until Xmas. Challenge HC at Rock-Paper-Scissors, if you win you'll get a 50% discount on Overword T-shirts! (one trial per event max).

Store: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products
FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/overword.paris/ and https://www.facebook.com/Overword2012
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Overword2012
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/overword2012/
name: Language exchange (+ Rock-Paper-Scissors tournament) - All Languages

description:
Bring all your enthusiasm with you. Greek, elliniká,  has the longest documented history of any living language, spanning 34 centuries of written records. 

It's estimated that around 30% of the English vocabulary consists, directly and indirectly, of words of Classical Greek origin. Most of them are technical and scientific terms.

Words of Greek origin are often used at the beginning of a word, such as: aero, auto, hyper and many more.

Do you love greek culture, greek history, ancient philosophers and whatever breathes greek? So, here is your chance to learn and enjoy the course.

We are going to start with basics and there is no need of knowledge of Greek.

description:
This week's special:

TBD

----

Dear Language Innovators,

Ready to practice languages in a motivating and innovating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, chill, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone :)

The program:

• 3:00PM: Choose your table according the language you'd like to speak and start chatting with the people around you (you'll find icebreaking questions on the table in case that helps). Feel free to move and change seats anytime :)

• 4:00PM: I'll make you draw a table number to meet other people with whom you can feel free to speak any language. We'll also take 5 minutes for any announcement: there's an event, a place you'd like to share with us? You're looking for an apartment, a buddy/driver to travel to Mont Saint-Michel with? That will be your occasion to address everyone :)

Note: You'll find on a table some free stuff to help you interact and find topics to discuss. We're sharing for free all the documents we wrote here: https://overword.com/free-documents-language-exchange-group/

The meeting will be at "Ease Side Café", 129 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France (metro: Gare de l'Est, ligne 4, 5, 7). We'll be next to the pool table, feel free to ask the kind waiters if you can't find us. For prices, you can check the menu here: http://media.wix.com/ugd/94b6bd_4bd10a97c4be446c87e77abc578eb894.pdf

The event is free to join. We rely on donations, but you don't have to donate if you don't want to or if you feel we don't deserve it, no problema :)

If you like a bit what we're doing, please register on Overword.com or like/follow our social network pages. Let's remain connected after the event!

As always, we're happy to hear your question or suggestion. Happy learning!

HC.

Here's the list of the board games we're providing so far, you can help us get new ones by making small donations: Taboo, Scrabble cards, Italian cards (Scopa, Briscola, etc.), Cardline Globetrotter, Sandwich, Tic Tac Boom, Pantomime, Sushi Go, Cards against humanity (new!).

And finally, once a month we're offering a t-shirt to our attendees. Just fill your name on the paper that says "Lottery draw" at the entrance and then cross your fingers until the last Friday of the month!

You can also purchase our t-shirt online here: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products

Until Xmas. Challenge HC at Rock-Paper-Scissors, if you win you'll get a 50% discount on Overword T-shirts! (one trial per event max).



Store: http://www.zazzle.com/overword/products
FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/overword.paris/ and https://www.facebook.com/Overword2012
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Overword2012
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/overword2012/
name: Language exchange - All Languages

description:
ATTENTION: If Saturday 12th is raining (which is not likely to happen) we'll do it the next day (Sunday).

We're going in search of mushrooms with the guidance of an expert mycologist! We're going to walk along a pretty off sight hill and prairie that only a few connaisseurs know about, inside beautiful pine, chestnut and oak forest belonging to a natural preserve. And we'll have a yummy lunch too with lots of wine!

The area is one of the only well preserved primitive chestnut and oak forests in the center of Spain, and these days is a breathtaking show of red, yellow and orange leaves.

Check last year's photos here http://www.meetup.com/sportypeople/events/144876252/ (http://www.meetup.com/sportypeople/events/144876252/)

The eastern Gredos area, less than 1h from Madrid center, it's a heaven for wild mushrooms. A great number of species share the earth below chestnuts, oaks, ashes, junipers....

We'll spend a full day with Sebastián (bilingual Spa/Eng) looking mushrooms in the morning, while learning about these strange and fascinating living beings. We'll even come across some toxic and even magical ones. He will tell us everything about them and sort them out for you to take home only the good and safe ones.

Half way through the day we'll stop for an outdoor picnic lunch (included in the price) and then we'll take the rest of the day along the beautiful trails of El Castañar, checking out some of the coolest trees changing colors and century old trees.

WHAT TO BRING - IMPORTANT TO BRING IT ALL!!

- An open basket to put your mushrooms in, you can get one for an euro in any chino convenience store (no plastic bags, mushrooms go bad in those)

- A well sharpened small pocket knife (again, any chino store)

- Confy warm clothes with an extra layer in the backpack in case it gets colder.

- A wind/waterproof jacket or raincoat (depending on that day's weather)

- Hat. gloves, scarf combo

- Walking shoes with an extra pair of socks in the bag, in case you get them wet

- 1,5 L bottle of wáter per person MINIMUM

Price: 35€

Includes

- ENTRANCE FEE to the preserved area

- LED mushroom picking with expert mycologist guide

- Sporty People hiking leader

- MIDDAY OUTDOOR PICNIC LUNCH

- THE MUSHROOMS YOU PICK

- CIVIL LIABILITY AND ACCIDENT INSURANCES

If you don't have PayPal or credit card (you can use your credit card through the PayPal platform, just choose the second option 'I don't have a PayPal account'), please send me an email to [masked] and I'll tell you how to do it by bank transfer.

CONTACT Carmen[masked] or Emma[masked]

MEETING UP AT 10:00 am

HOW TO GET THERE - Meeting up in La Bodeguita de Pilar, El Tiemblo town https://goo.gl/maps/gz5J7wm8pEF2 (https://goo.gl/maps/SV9ka)

My phone / whatsapp for anything you need is[masked]

BY CAR - Google maps link https://goo.gl/maps/gz5J7wm8pEF2 (https://goo.gl/maps/SV9ka). Park where you can, we'll be at La Bodeguita de Pilar, having having coffee :)

BY BUS - Take the 8:30 bus 551 from Príncipe Pío station. It's on the lower floor, platform #22. Get off at El Tiemblo, ask anyone about the "Rotonda de los toros de Guisando" roundabout. They'll direct you, it's really close by. We'll be at L Bodeguita de Pilar :) Got lost? Use this link to navigate by foot https://goo.gl/maps/gz5J7wm8pEF2 (https://goo.gl/maps/SV9ka)

Still can't find it? Call Carmen at[masked] or Emma at[masked]

description:
Wonder why people around you are successful sharing their victories and you are the one always listening to their stories?

Yes, success doesn’t come easily and there is price to pay for it. This is how people tell you.

However, do you also have doubts why you failed, how you failed. Have you ever asked yourself are you doing the right way or is there a mentor along the way to guide you?

We would like to invite you to share with us your failure, be it business in Singapore or overseas.  Get together to share ideas to contribute in a session with an open mindset discussion.

You will get to know friends with positive mindset to energize your way to success. 

Networking isn’t perfect, It’s just BETTER.

Please do a RSVP and call before half an hour when you reached.
