description:
►►► SAVE THE DATE ◄◄◄   RSVPs WILL OPEN SOON !

Event Rating:    Level 3-4,    ► Difficult ◄

Distance:    ~5 MILES

Time Duration:    ~5 HOURS

Blaze Orange:    Not required

HOLIDAY SHOPPING SALE!   Gorgeous Views, Endless Self-satisfaction, and a Wholelotta Fun, 3166 ft size, all for the special low price of only $5 (the NH State Park entrance fee). And there is no need to camp out at the entrance at 4 am to beat out the crowds, because there will be an unlimited supply of all the sale items!
Enter coupon code  GETOFFTHECOUCH

Mount Monadnock... the most climbed mountain in North America and the third most climbed mountain in the world!

This hike is suitable for beginner mountain hikers, BUT...

►►► YOU MUST HAVE ENOUGH HIKING EXPERIENCE TO COMPLETE GOING UP AND DOWN 200O FEET OF ELEVATION GAIN OVER VERY ROUGH AND ROCKY TRAILS! ◄◄◄

If I have not hiked with you before or do not know you, I may contact you to ask about your experience and gear. Please do not be offended, I just want to be sure that you have a safe and happy day - in that order. (... and I don't want to have to carry you down.)

We will be hiking up to the summit at a safe and relaxed pace, but... we will be taking the most difficult route to get there, the Spellman trail! It requires some effort, but delivers a huge reward.

You MUST bring your 10 essentials +4, a minimum of 2L water, snacks,  lunch, and a happy attitude.    

Here's the list. You ain't got 'em, you ain't comin' :

~ ~ ~ ~ ~
1. Map      You are given one at the gate.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
2. Compass   Know how to use it.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
3. Flashlight / Headlamp    Are those batteries fresh ?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
4. Extra Food   (Extra points for bringing Snickers for the leader)
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
5. Extra Clothes    Including rain gear or poncho
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
6. Eye Protection   Is that you behind those Foster Grants?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
7. First-Aid Kit     There will be a group kit. Bring your medications.
.~ ~ ~ ~ ~
8. Pocket Knife    Even better, a multi-tool.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
9. Waterproof Matches
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
10. Firestarter  I use cotton balls soaked in petroleum jelly in a 35mm film case. They ignite instantly, even in rain.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
11. Water / Filter / Bottles   Minimum 2 Liters !
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
12. Whistle    On your pack strap for fast access
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
13. Insect Repellents or Clothing    Probably won't need it
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
14. Sunburn Preventatives   Needed year round.  There is no shade up there.

You also may be asked to share in the carrying of a small amount of group gear. 

Plan on a good stretch of rock scrambling (YES! The best part!).  Got height problems? This hike is probably not for you.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDcnN7job7o

PLEASE NOTE: Your leaders will always be very accommodating and forgiving, but by signing up, you agree that you will abide by any decisions they make concerning your ability, suitability, and safety. Sumitting is at the leader's discretion and is not guaranteed.  We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Anyone leaving the group during the hike will be permanently removed from the club.

Summit Weather:  http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Monadnock/forecasts/965

Hope to see you on the mountain!

Bob

“Hey Mom, can I go outside and play?”

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at http://www.hikesafe.com/ ; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Safety First!

This is MSW's opportunity to come out of hibernation and convene at the bike show, see the new 2017 offerings from BRP/Can Am and other manufacturers, everything under the sun in leather, patches and pins, patches, pins, after-market ... .normally followed by breaking bread at a local groaning board ... We'll try for the Padonia Ale House again this for 2017. It worked so well this past year.

Always makes for a nice day.  We get to see each other, pick each other's brains about what's coming up for the 2017 ryding season, replace our worn out this's and that's ...

More to come as this takes shape depending on the weather. Who knows, maybe we can ride in!  Time will tell ... We'll definitely put out the word.  Yes, MSW lives during the winter! TBS Tickets and details at www.cycleshow.net

description:
Greetings, community members! 


We are very excited to launch this group’s activity with the first exclusive meetup dedicated to opportunities in emerging markets.

Although cybersecurity can be perceived as a crowded market these days, there are plenty of opportunities to operate and innovate in less-competitive sectors, mostly solving emerging security threats.

We are preparing a very interesting evening for you that will tackle this issue from three different angles:

1) “Rising above the noise” - insights about the journey to identify, research, and operate in an emerging market.

2) “How do VCs assess opportunities” - a business perspective on the estimation of opportunities in emerging markets.

3) “What does the future holds?”- a review on cybersecurity future trends.

More details about the agenda and speakers will be published soon…

Join us on Wednesday Nov 30th at 19:00 in Rise Tel Aviv (54 Ahad Ha’am St., 5th floor)

Please RSVP now as space is limited. Get ready to be inspired!   

To any of you who haven’t had the chance to read our article “How To Become A Cybersecurity Entrepreneur In A Crowded Market”, you can find it here: http://www.darkreading.com/attacks-breaches/how-to-become-a-cybersecurity-entrepreneur-in-a-crowded-market/a/d-id/1327198

description:
Private, 45 minute reading available Tuesday, November 8th between the hours of  12:00 pm and 4:00pm; $50.  Please call[masked] to schedule your time on 11/8 for your 45 minute reading. Other days and times are available; to schedule a reading on another day email: [masked]

"I want to thank you for a reading that I felt very strongly was right on and has and will help me very much...and I feel has been a big push in my self growth and acceptance. You are always in the utmost integrity and connection with spirit, as far as I am concerned, and I trust you completely with this kind of very personal spiritual encounter.... spirit was very much in powerful presence for my reading."

SR, Palm Beach, FL


Grandfather Rick writes:

"Some years ago my first sundance chief, Manny Twofeathers, taught me how to use his Stone People Medicine stones. After watching me give a few "readings" in the hills of Georgia, he got all excited and encouraged me to offer readings to people the way he did.

Years before even meeting "Uncle," as Manny was known to his sundancers, I had developed the ability to read stones "cold," that is, without any kind of aid or guide, just direct information from Spirit through a set of stones I used that had been selected and handled by the person I was trying to help.

During a reading, I use a set of Manny's stones the way he taught me, but along with that I will integrate my way (and stones) also. Readings last a half hour, which is all anyone should require. Don't try to get everything all at once; you might get overwhelmed.

If you schedule a reading, please be prompt as I cannot allow it to overrun. Stone reading is based on the spiritual practices of certain Indian people and predates European interference with our wisdom teachings, what some might call "religion."

"I thought your reading was really insightful and helpful...I also think anyone who has been a student of yours learning about the animals as medicine helpers, the labyrinth, and so on will gain special insight from your readings.

...(your) Stone People Medicine reading guided me to look at the energy of my current life challenges in both a spiritual way and also a very practical way that allows clearer navigation through life on a daily basis."

MEC, professional reader, WPB

"Amazing and so very accurate. So very glad I did this!"

DS, Coral Springs, FL

"You were superb and the reading was very accurate! I look forward to the next reading when it's offered!"

SR, Lake Worth, FL\

"I highly recommend Stone People Medicine Readings! Grandfather Rick's insight is very profound."

JG, PB, FL

Rick McBride is mixedblood Tsalagi (Cherokee) who has walked the Red Road for over 30 years. He was named Cante Lute (Schan-tay Lou-tuh) by the spirits through his sundance chief, which means Red Heart. He is a sundancer and has been traditionally trained and authorized to lead ceremonies, such as inipi (purification lodge), prayer with the Canunpah (Pipe), drum healing and so forth. He has been publicly teaching these ways for some ten years now. Workshops and lectures are one way to learn from the wisdom of Indian Country. Ceremony brings this knowledge to life. Combined, teaching and ceremony render practical guidance to everyday living. And so, Rick sees his role as that of "translator" of indigenous ways so that mainstream-educated people get the full benefit of these ways. It has taken him years of dedicated interaction with many Elders, as well as his activities as ceremonial leader to get to this place in his life.

For further information, visit his website: www.mixedblood.info
name: Stone People Medicine Readings

description:
Et oui, pour une fois on a de l'avance, par ce que ce n'est pas n'importe quel meetup ! Cette session sera aussi celle de nos 4 ans, et ca passe vite !

Et cette fois ci nous remercions Google, de nous héberger pour cette session un peu particulière :)

Au programme : 

• "GraphQL, the new age of API ?" par Stan Chollet (@tsunammis Software engineer at Dailymotion)

Le monde des APIs est en pleine mutation. Passant de SOAP à Rest il y a quelques années, sommes-nous en train de vivre une nouvelle transition vers GraphQL ? Boosté par Facebook et particulièrement par les développeurs frontend utilisant React.JS, je vais aborder avec vous les forces et faiblesses de cette spécification et vous présenter la manière dont nous l'abordons actuellement chez Dailymotion.

• "www : The Web Will Win" par Olivier Leplus (@olivierleplus  Developer Relations at Google)

Au début du XXème siècle, le web s'imposait sur nos ordinateurs face aux applications. Plus besoin d'installer de lourdes solutions depuis nos CD-Roms. Aujourd'hui, le mobile domine nos vies et les applications natives ont refait leur apparition.Le web n'a pas dit son dernier mot et ne compte pas se laisse faire! Les progressive web apps relèvent le défis afin d'apporter à vos utilisateurs la même expérience sur votre site qu'une application native

• "Tout ce que vous pensez savoir sur la couleur est faux " par Maryla (Google Cultural Institute)

Où comment j'ai appris beaucoup trop de choses sur la couleur en travaillant sur un appareil photo. La couleur a-t-elle vraiment trois dimensions ? Pourquoi ça n'a pas de sens de faire des calculs en RGB ? C'est quoi la balance des blancs ?


• "Prise de parole en public, quelques conseils" par Tim Carry (Co-orga Humantalks & dev evangelist at Algolia)

Vous avez envie de partager votre experience mais vous avez peur de monter sur scène ? Ou alors vous pensez que ce que vous avez à raconter n'intéressera personne ? Dans ce talk je vais vous partager quelques conseils qui m'ont beaucoup aidés pour vaincre mon stress et écrire mes présentations. Je prends désormais beaucoup de plaisir à monter sur scène et je souhaite vous partager ces petits secrets.


• "Hacker-Dev API on the Way" par Kévin Liagre (@_k33n_ Lead Dev at Yogosha)

Plus un jour ne se passe sans que la sécurité informatique fasse la Une de l’actualité de l’IT, quand ce n’est pas de l’actualité en général. La loi, sous peu, imposera aux entreprises de lourdes sanctions en cas de fuite d’information, or celles-ci sont elles aussi devenues quotidiennes. Conséquence logique, on parle de plus en plus de faire du développement sécurisé. Mais n’est-ce pas là une injonction paradoxale quand on sait que l’état d’esprit du hacker est pour ainsi dire l’inverse de celui du dev ? A travers ce talk, nous allons voir qu'aujourd'hui il est possible de collaborer avec les hackers afin d'intégrer la sécurité au coeur des processus de développement.


---

Pour les sessions prochaines, n'hésitez pas à soumettre vos talks  sur twitter (@HumanTalksParis), par mail ([masked]), via le formulaire http://bit.ly/HTParis-sujet ou par pigeon voyageur si ca vous fait plaisir ! :)

description:
►►► SAVE THE DATE ◄◄◄   RSVPs WILL OPEN SOON !

Event Rating:    Level 3-4,    ► Difficult ◄

Distance:    ~5 MILES

Time Duration:    ~5 HOURS

Blaze Orange:    Not required

HOLIDAY SHOPPING SALE!   Gorgeous Views, Endless Self-satisfaction, and a Wholelotta Fun, 3166 ft size, all for the special low price of only $5 (the NH State Park entrance fee). And there is no need to camp out at the entrance at 4 am to beat out the crowds, because there will be an unlimited supply of all the sale items!
Enter coupon code  GETYOURBUTTOFFTHECOUCH

Mount Monadnock... the most climbed mountain in North America and the third most climbed mountain in the world!

This hike is suitable for beginner mountain hikers, BUT...

►►► YOU MUST HAVE ENOUGH HIKING EXPERIENCE TO COMPLETE GOING UP AND DOWN 200O FEET OF ELEVATION GAIN OVER VERY ROUGH AND ROCKY TRAILS! ◄◄◄

If I have not hiked with you before or do not know you, I may contact you to ask about your experience and gear. Please do not be offended, I just want to be sure that you have a safe and happy day - in that order. (... and I don't want to have to carry you down.)

We will be hiking up to the summit at a safe and relaxed pace, but... we will be taking the most difficult route to get there, the Spellman trail! It requires some effort, but delivers a huge reward.

You MUST bring your 10 essentials +4, a minimum of 2L water, snacks,  lunch, and a happy attitude.    

Here's the list. You ain't got 'em, you ain't comin' :

~ ~ ~ ~ ~
1. Map      You are given one at the gate.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
2. Compass   Know how to use it.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
3. Flashlight / Headlamp    Are those batteries fresh ?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
4. Extra Food   (Extra points for bringing Snickers for the leader)
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
5. Extra Clothes    Including rain gear or poncho
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
6. Eye Protection   Is that you behind those Foster Grants?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
7. First-Aid Kit     There will be a group kit. Bring your medications.
.~ ~ ~ ~ ~
8. Pocket Knife    Even better, a multi-tool.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
9. Waterproof Matches
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
10. Firestarter  I use cotton balls soaked in petroleum jelly in a 35mm film case. They ignite instantly, even in rain.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
11. Water / Filter / Bottles   Minimum 2 Liters !
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
12. Whistle    On your pack strap for fast access
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
13. Insect Repellents or Clothing    Probably won't need it
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
14. Sunburn Preventatives   Needed year round.  There is no shade up there.

You also may be asked to share in the carrying of a small amount of group gear. 

Plan on a good stretch of rock scrambling (YES! The best part!).  Got height problems? This hike is probably not for you.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDcnN7job7o

PLEASE NOTE: Your leaders will always be very accommodating and forgiving, but by signing up, you agree that you will abide by any decisions they make concerning your ability, suitability, and safety. Sumitting is at the leader's discretion and is not guaranteed.  We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Anyone leaving the group during the hike will be permanently removed from the club.

Summit Weather:  http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Monadnock/forecasts/965

Hope to see you on the mountain!

Bob

“Hey Mom, can I go outside and play?”

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at http://www.hikesafe.com/ ; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Safety First!

description:
Hey Everyone,

SA Kitesurf will be running a free introductory kiteboarding lesson this weekend on Saturday and Sunday at 10:30 in Tableview for anyone interested in understanding more about kiteboarding and how it all works. Our instructor will be talking about the wind window, the basics of flying a kite, safety and quick release system and you will get to fly a small training kite on the beach. This is the first fundamental lesson to get started in kiteboarding. 

Then after the lesson, If you thought it was a whole lotta of fun and you want to take things further we offer full courses that will get you up and riding in no time. See the website for details 

http://www.sakitesurf.co.za/kitesurf-lessons-courses-in-cape-town/.  

All our instructors are VDWS and IKO certified so you are getting the highest standard of kiteboarding lessons in the business. Feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

Hope you can make it and Enjoy!
Dale
SA Kitesurf Owner/ Kiteboarding Instructor
[masked]

name: HumanTalks Paris Novembre 2016 (Spécial 4 ans!)

description:
Join us for our next Allegro Tech Talks in Poznan. This time we will focus on Site Reliability Engineering (SRE).

First presentation:

Topic: "What Allegro outages and US forest wildfires have in common?"

In our everyday work you have to deal with errors in the code, hardware failures, security problems, sometimes with ordinary human error. You can not totally eliminate these problems, even if you write the best code in the world, even if you introduce most restrictive safety procedures and your data center equipment will be at highest quality and from the best vendors. It is important that in case of emergency you are able to respond quickly to those events.And what about those forest wildfires? You will find the answer in my presentation.

Julian Szulc - Site Reliability Engineer, Allegro

Second presentation:

Topic: "Failure Friday w Allegro."

Everyone wants to know if the thing they’ve built works according the initial assumptions. Among these requirement one can find stability, resistance to failure or anomaly in the system. This is what our Wednesday's Failure Friday are all about. We check if a specific portion of the system behaves put to the test.

Marek Jadżyn - Site Reliability Engineer, Allegro

Krzysztof Kliś - Site Reliability Engineer, Allegro

The meeting will be held in Polish.

Please stay tuned for further updates.

--

Allegro Tech Talks is a series of meetups where we will talk about projects that we run, problems that we face and unique solutions that we implement. What is more, we will invite external guests to learn about their experiences and point of view.
name: Allegro Tech Talks Poznan #2

Free to attend! Free food and soda! Free door prizes! You won't be disappointed, or your money back!
name: Microsoft Cloud MeetUp - SharePoint and Azure - Better together!

description:
Ahoy there, 
The next full moon picnic will be Monday 14 November 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm (moonrise around 5:55 pm). 

Indian Lore
American Indians called November the Beaver Moon. Some people claim this was because it was the last chance to set traps to supply themselves with warm furs for the cold the cold winter ahead. Personally I'm skeptical that Indians would wait until the last minute to build their wardrobe. My theory is that Full Beaver Moon comes from the point of view of the beavers as they make their own preparations for winter. It's also called the Frosty Moon.

Internet Lore
Seems like we keep hearing about a “supermoon" almost every month. “This full moon will be the biggest since... (name some date).” Well, THIS month WILL be a SUPER-DUPER moon! What!??? And did you know there was not even a single supermoon ever before 2011! Read the Puzzler below for more.

WHAT: Everyone brings food and drink to share. If it's chilly bring hot drinks: hot cider, hot chocolate, spiced wine, coffee, etc. That will make you very popular.

WHERE: Pont des Arts. We'll gather around a bench way over on the Left Bank side of the bridge (away from the Louvre). Nearest metros: Pont Neuf and Louvre-Rivoli. 

WHEN:  Monday 14 November 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm 

WHY: Share one of the most memorable sights in Paris with some of the nicest people around. 

WHO: You and your friends.

HOW to find us: Keep your eyes out for a small white telescope on tripod if the sky is clear. Check in by cell phone if you can't find us: [masked] 97.

BIRTHDAYS: Are you a Scorpio? If so, let me know so we can celebrate your birthday this month and blow out the world’s largest birthday candle at exactly 6:05 pm (or maybe 7:05 pm)! This is a new regular feature of the Full Moon Picnic for everyone who has a birthday during the current month of the Zodiac calendar. I hope you know that astrology is not astronomy (any more), but we can still have fun with it. Not sure I should reveal my opinion about astrology, but here’s a glimpse - a debate between a true believer and a sceptic:

Believer: What’s your sign?
Sceptic: Scorpio, but I’m not "resourceful, brave, passionate, stubborn and a true friend.” I’m not any of the things that it says I’m supposed to be.
Believer: I’m not surprised. That is SOOOOO typical of a Scorpio.

PUZZLER: What is the difference between and “supermoon” and a “super-duper moon?” (And how can so many full moons be “super” if we keep hearing about them?) And why did NO supermoons occur before 2011??!!!

PUZZLER ANSWER:  When the full moon is bigger than average, it’s often billed as a “supermoon.” First of all, the moon is not actually bigger; it just looks bigger because it’s closer to the earth. The moon’s orbit around the earth is elliptical; the distance between its closest point (perigee) and furthest point (apogee) is 48,000 km. Of course, the closest point doesn’t necessarily happen to coincide with the time of a full moon. However, this month is the second in a triad of supermoons. It seems logical to me that supermoons come in clusters because the full moon will be at similar points in its orbit several months in a row as the period between full moons averages 29.5 days while the period of the moon’s orbit is about 27.3 days.

This month the precise moment of full moon will occur within 2 hours of perigee. That makes this full moon closer to earth than any time between 1948 and 2034. So many are calling it a “Super-duper moon.” How much bigger and brighter will it appear? 14% bigger and 30% brighter than at its greatest distance ("micromoon”). Of course that makes it only about 7% bigger than average and 16% brighter than average. So I would call the whole supermoon thing the Donald Trump of media hype.

Why no supermoons before 2011? Because the term first became popularized and used by the media for the full moon of March 2011.

For more: http://earthsky.org/?p=190918

ciao for niao,
Captain Bob
name: attend Full Moon Picnic Mon 14 Nov from 5:30 to 7:30 PM

description:
San Francisco Choral Society presents

Maurice Duruflé – Requiem, Quatre motets sur des thèmes gregoriéns
Gabriel Fauré – Cantique de Jean Racine
Herbert Howells – Te deum, Jubilate

Saturday, November 12 at 8pm
Sunday, November 13 at 4pm

Calvary Presbyterian Church, 2515 Fillmore Street, San Francisco

Ticket Prices:
$34 Front Orchestra, Center Loge Reserved
$31 Side Loge Reserved
$28 Balcony General Admission
$2 off in each section for Students and Seniors

Duruflé’s luminous and very personal version of the requiem mass was dedicated to the memory of his father; he filled it with ecstatic praise, a heartfelt plea for mercy, and shimmering passages of peace and hope. Also by Duruflé, the Quatres motets are sung a cappella and in the Gregorian chant style—the perfect companions to his Requiem.

Cantique de Jean Racine, by Gabriel Fauré, is a lush choral gem set to the words of French playright Jean Racine. And Herbert Howells’ Te Deum rounds out the program—a moving exemplar of the British choral music tradition.

With Special Guest Jonathan Dimmock, organist:
Local treasure Jonathan Dimmock is well-known the world over, having toured on six continents and appeared on over forty lauded CD recordings. Just a few phrases that have been used to describe his artistry: “Immaculate playing.” “Articulate, beautifully balanced interpretations.” “A transcendant listening experience.” “Dimmock plays to perfection.”
with
Theresa Cardinale, Mezzo-soprano
Nikolas Nackley, Baritone

Junior High and High School students may attend our concerts for free! Email [masked] for more information.
name: San Francisco Choral Society presents the Duruflé Requiem

description:
Join us at Flaconi's for the Docker Berlin edition of the Docker Global Mentor Week!


Docker Global Mentor Week is your opportunity to #learndocker and spread the docker vision of build, ship and run to your friends and associates.

Right now, Docker is working on self paced online labs that will be available through LearnDot. One lab will be for beginners and one lab will be for intermediate users. Docker mentors will be on hand at this event to help you as you work through the self paced materials.

We would recommend that all who plan on attending become familiar with the user guide. This will facilitate the learn process to install on your computer. For Mac: https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-mac/ or Windows 10: https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-windows/.

Are you an advanced user? We strongly encourage Docker users of all skill levels to attend! We need a network of mentors who understand the Docker platform to answer any questions that newcomers may have. Please contact us if you are willing to help us out for the mentor program. You can click here to sign up as a mentor.

As we get closer to the event, we will share more information including materials on how to prepare for the training.

Agenda:

17:00 Meet and Greet

17:30 Warm Welcome at Flaconi GmbH

17:50 Say hi to our Docker Mentors

18:00 Happy Docker Hacking


+ There will be Snacks and Drinks.
name: Docker Global Mentor Week

Ruházat:
Mivel a gyakorlások folyamán mindannyian leszünk mind a terapeuta, mind a páciens szerepében, így az alábbiakat érdemes szem előtt tartani:

Egyéb felszerelés:
Bár a tanfolyam súlyponti részeit a gyakorlati elemek jelentik, némi jegyzetelésre azért érdemes készülni.

A tanfolyam szervezésében, annak keretei között lesz kávénk, teánk és meleg ebédünk.
Az étkezésre vonatkozó jelzéseket (vegetáriánus, liszt- vagy tejérzékenység stb.) kérjük közvetlenül a jelentkezést követően, üzenetben jelezni!

Oktatók:

Szombat - alap tanfolyam: Pfeiffer Ferenc
Vasárnap - haladó tanfolyam: Balla Tibor

Kezdés és befejezés:

Mindkét napon 9:00 -kor kezdünk, és legkésőbb 18:00 -kor végzünk.
A javasolt érkezési időpont 15-20 perccel a kezdés előtt.

Parkolás

A környéken mindenhol ingyenes, kivéve ott, ahol tilos: nem szabad megállni az utcának a házakkal átellenes, park felőli oldalán, büntetnek is érte szorgosan. Ha közvetlenül a ház előtt nincs parkolóhely, akkor lejtőirányban, az utca alján mindig lehet találni.

Részvételi díj:

42.000.- Ft  (az első nap végén fizetendő)

description:
Hey Everyone,

SA Kitesurf will be running a free introductory kiteboarding lesson this weekend on Saturday and Sunday at 10:30 in Tableview for anyone interested in understanding more about kiteboarding and how it all works. Our instructor will be talking about the wind window, the basics of flying a kite, safety and quick release system and you will get to fly a small training kite on the beach. This is the first fundamental lesson to get started in kiteboarding. 

Then after the lesson, If you thought it was a whole lotta of fun and you want to take things further we offer full courses that will get you up and riding in no time. See the website for details 

http://www.sakitesurf.co.za/kitesurf-lessons-courses-in-cape-town/.  

All our instructors are VDWS and IKO certified so you are getting the highest standard of kiteboarding lessons in the business. Feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

Hope you can make it and Enjoy!
Dale
SA Kitesurf Owner/ Kiteboarding Instructor

description:
*This event is the second part of a two-part event being held on this day. Check out the OSU event too!

At the Tour De Pokémon Go event earlier this month, one of the places we stopped was Berliner Park, a current Bulbasaur nest. We had a Bulbasaur on our Nearby lists at pretty muchall times. Since softball season was over, one field in particular was basically swarming with 10-20 Pokémon GO players. It was cool seeing all those people out there, and it's that kind of environment we hope to encounter again! Hopefully everyone will walk away much closer to a Venusaur.

I'm very excited to announce we'll be joined by OSU's resident Pokémon group, the Buckeye Pokémon League! This OSU student organization with a love of anything Pokémon also functions as an officially sanctioned 'Play! Pokémon' location for card games and video games, and occasionally hosts official tournaments at OSU. Anyone is welcome, whether you attend OSU or not. The club currently meets from 7-10 PM on Mondays in the basement of the Student Union, in the Milestones room (but you can ask me, Brian, at any time if that needs confirmed, as they tend to only meet when OSU has classes).

We'll come straight here from our OSU event, and we'll be at it here until dark (estimated 5:30-6 PM). Since we don't have a lot of time, we will not wait 15 minutes for people to show up as we have, we'll just go out there. Hopefully you won't have much trouble finding the GO players.
name: Bulbasaur at Berliner (Collab with the OSU Buckeye Pokémon League)

description:
Et oui, pour une fois on a de l'avance, par ce que ce n'est pas n'importe quel meetup ! Cette session sera aussi celle de nos 4 ans, et ca passe vite !

Et cette fois ci nous remercions Google, de nous héberger pour cette session un peu particulière :)

Au programme : 

• "GraphQL, the new age of API ?" par Stan Chollet (@tsunammis Software engineer at Dailymotion)

Le monde des APIs est en pleine mutation. Passant de SOAP à Rest il y a quelques années, sommes-nous en train de vivre une nouvelle transition vers GraphQL ? Boosté par Facebook et particulièrement par les développeurs frontend utilisant React.JS, je vais aborder avec vous les forces et faiblesses de cette spécification et vous présenter la manière dont nous l'abordons actuellement chez Dailymotion.

• "www : The Web Will Win" par Olivier Leplus (@olivierleplus  Developer Relations at Google)

Au début du XXème siècle, le web s'imposait sur nos ordinateurs face aux applications. Plus besoin d'installer de lourdes solutions depuis nos CD-Roms. Aujourd'hui, le mobile domine nos vies et les applications natives ont refait leur apparition.Le web n'a pas dit son dernier mot et ne compte pas se laisse faire! Les progressive web apps relèvent le défis afin d'apporter à vos utilisateurs la même expérience sur votre site qu'une application native

• "Tout ce que vous pensez savoir sur la couleur est faux " par Maryla (Google Cultural Institute)

Où comment j'ai appris beaucoup trop de choses sur la couleur en travaillant sur un appareil photo. La couleur a-t-elle vraiment trois dimensions ? Pourquoi ça n'a pas de sens de faire des calculs en RGB ? C'est quoi la balance des blancs ?


• "Prise de parole en public, quelques conseils" par Tim Carry (Co-orga Humantalks & dev evangelist at Algolia)

Vous avez envie de partager votre experience mais vous avez peur de monter sur scène ? Ou alors vous pensez que ce que vous avez à raconter n'intéressera personne ? Dans ce talk je vais vous partager quelques conseils qui m'ont beaucoup aidés pour vaincre mon stress et écrire mes présentations. Je prends désormais beaucoup de plaisir à monter sur scène et je souhaite vous partager ces petits secrets.


• "Hacker-Dev API on the Way" par Kévin Liagre (@_k33n_ Lead Dev at Yogosha)

Plus un jour ne se passe sans que la sécurité informatique fasse la Une de l’actualité de l’IT, quand ce n’est pas de l’actualité en général. La loi, sous peu, imposera aux entreprises de lourdes sanctions en cas de fuite d’information, or celles-ci sont elles aussi devenues quotidiennes. Conséquence logique, on parle de plus en plus de faire du développement sécurisé. Mais n’est-ce pas là une injonction paradoxale quand on sait que l’état d’esprit du hacker est pour ainsi dire l’inverse de celui du dev ? A travers ce talk, nous allons voir qu'aujourd'hui il est possible de collaborer avec les hackers afin d'intégrer la sécurité au coeur des processus de développement.


---

Pour les sessions prochaines, n'hésitez pas à soumettre vos talks  sur twitter (@HumanTalksParis), par mail ([masked]), via le formulaire http://bit.ly/HTParis-sujet ou par pigeon voyageur si ca vous fait plaisir ! :)

---

description:
Hello Volunteers,

Anyone up for teaching English conversation and basic grammar to elementary to middle school kids originally from very low income dysfunctional families and multicultural families?

Our first pilot program of this kind at Dongbu as well as succeeding programs at Seongnam and Gunja regional children's centers have been going really well thanks to our volunteer members' lovely and hearty dedication.

This one is our fourth program of this kind, and this center takes care of 15 to 24 children originally from very low income dysfunctional families and multicultural families from one of the most distressed neighborhoods in Korea. Their environment's been absolutely unlivable and undesirable for any children so they've been raised in foster homes and supported by church and local community.

I'm very happy to find and open up this meetup as this center's located near Seoul Station in central Seoul and convenient for those of our volunteers living in central and western parts of Seoul.

Here're more details.

We need a small team comprised of 3 ~ 5 "NATIVE" English speaker members paired up with "BILINGUAL" Korean members, who will teach English to these underprivileged children who can't afford any private education, registered at Yongsan's Somang Regional Children's Center. Our team will eventually work on 1:1 ratio with roughly 12 to 16 kids registered at this center.

* "NATIVE" English speakers mean nationals from 7 countries - Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, South Africa, U.K., U.S.A. Singaporeans, Hong Kongese , and Europeans proficient in English grammar and verbal communication may join.

** "BILINGUAL" Koreans mean our Korean members who can participate in sessions, and help communicate and coordinate between our native speakers, the Center teachers, and the kids.

These kids can not only afford any private education but also are lonely and not properly taken care of by their parents, so Seoul City's regional children's centers provide cares and certain protections to them after school hours. They're exposed to crimes and abuses if they're gone home early after school. Isn't it sad?

description:
Ahoy there, 
The "Super-Duper Full Moon" picnic will be Monday 14 November 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm (moonrise around 5:55 pm). 

Indian Lore
American Indians called November the Beaver Moon. Some people claim this was because it was the last chance to set traps to supply themselves with warm furs for the cold the cold winter ahead. Personally I'm skeptical that Indians would wait until the last minute to build their wardrobe. My theory is that Full Beaver Moon comes from the point of view of the beavers as they make their own preparations for winter. It's also called the Frosty Moon.

Internet Lore
Seems like we keep hearing about a “supermoon" almost every month. “This full moon will be the biggest since... (name some date).” Well, THIS month WILL be a SUPER-DUPER full moon! What!??? And did you know there was not even a single supermoon ever before 2011! Read the Puzzler below for more.

WHAT: Everyone brings food and drink to share. If it's chilly bring hot drinks: hot cider, hot chocolate, spiced wine, coffee, etc. That will make you very popular.

WHERE: Pont des Arts. We'll gather around a bench way over on the Left Bank side of the bridge (away from the Louvre). Nearest metros: Pont Neuf and Louvre-Rivoli. 

WHEN:  Monday 14 November 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm 

WHY: Share one of the most memorable sights in Paris with some of the nicest people around. 

WHO: You and your friends.

HOW to find us: Keep your eyes out for a small white telescope on tripod if the sky is clear. Check in by cell phone if you can't find us: [masked] 97.

BIRTHDAYS: Are you a Scorpio? If so, let me know so we can celebrate your birthday this month and blow out the world’s largest birthday candle at exactly 6:05 pm (or maybe 7:05 pm)! This is a new regular feature of the Full Moon Picnic for everyone who has a birthday during the current month of the Zodiac calendar. I hope you know that astrology is not astronomy (any more), but we can still have fun with it. Not sure I should reveal my opinion about astrology, but here’s a glimpse - a debate between a true believer and a sceptic:

Believer: What’s your sign?
Sceptic: Scorpio, but I’m not "resourceful, brave, passionate, stubborn and a true friend.” I’m not any of the things that it says I’m supposed to be.
Believer: I’m not surprised. That is SOOOOO typical of a Scorpio.

PUZZLER: What is the difference between and “supermoon” and a “super-duper moon?” (And how can so many full moons be “super” if we keep hearing about them?) And why did NO supermoons occur before 2011??!!!

PUZZLER ANSWER:  When the full moon is bigger than average, it’s often billed as a “supermoon.” First of all, the moon is not actually bigger; it just looks bigger because it’s closer to the earth. The moon’s orbit around the earth is elliptical; the distance between its closest point (perigee) and furthest point (apogee) is 48,000 km. Of course, the closest point doesn’t necessarily happen to coincide with the time of a full moon. However, this month is the second in a triad of supermoons. It seems logical to me that supermoons come in clusters because the full moon will be at similar points in its orbit several months in a row as the period between full moons averages 29.5 days while the period of the moon’s orbit is about 27.3 days.

This month the precise moment of full moon will occur within 2 hours of perigee. That makes this full moon closer to earth than any time between 1948 and 2034. So many are calling it a “Super-duper moon.” How much bigger and brighter will it appear? 14% bigger and 30% brighter than at its greatest distance ("micromoon”). Of course that makes it only about 7% bigger than average and 16% brighter than average. So I would call the whole supermoon thing the Donald Trump of media hype.

Why no supermoons before 2011? Because the term first became popularized and used by the media for the full moon of March 2011.

For more: http://earthsky.org/?p=190918

ciao for niao,
Captain Bob
name: attend Full Moon Picnic Mon 14 Nov from 5:30 to 7:30 PM

description:
Hello Volunteers,

Anyone up for teaching English conversation and basic grammar to elementary to middle school kids originally from very low income dysfunctional families and multicultural families?

Our first pilot program of this kind at Dongbu as well as succeeding programs at Seongnam and Gunja regional children's centers have been going really well thanks to our volunteer members' lovely and hearty dedication.

This one is our fourth program of this kind, and this center takes care of 15 to 24 children originally from very low income dysfunctional families and multicultural families from one of the most distressed neighborhoods in Korea. Their environment's been absolutely unlivable and undesirable for any children so they've been raised in foster homes and supported by church and local community.

I'm very happy to find and open up this meetup as this center's located near Seoul Station in central Seoul and convenient for those of our volunteers living in central and western parts of Seoul.

Here're more details.

We need a small team comprised of 3 ~ 5 "NATIVE" English speaker members paired up with "BILINGUAL" Korean members, who will teach English to these underprivileged children who can't afford any private education, registered at Yongsan's Somang Regional Children's Center. Our team will eventually work on 1:1 ratio with roughly 12 to 16 kids registered at this center.

* "NATIVE" English speakers mean nationals from 7 countries - Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, South Africa, U.K., U.S.A. Singaporeans, Hong Kongese , and Europeans proficient in English grammar and verbal communication may join.

** "BILINGUAL" Koreans mean our Korean members who can participate in sessions, and help communicate and coordinate between our native speakers, the Center teachers, and the kids.

These kids can not only afford any private education but also are lonely and not properly taken care of by their parents, so Seoul City's regional children's centers provide cares and certain protections to them after school hours. They're exposed to crimes and abuses if they're gone home early after school. Isn't it sad?

If you have 2-3 hours of free time you'd contribute to education and wellbeing of these kids before enjoying fun and splendid Saturday afternoon in this city, let's help them together.

I told to the Center staff that our volunteers need a break on weekends, and may not have enough time to prepare a lot to teach them systematically but leading some conversation and reading sessions may be doable. Is it?

Hey everyone, we'll be seeing the new film produced by Luc Besson, "Shut-In".  Tickets are $10.00 per person.  After the film we'll head to a nearby restaurant to discuss it.  Our group will be gathered in the lobby before the film.  If you don't see us before the film, we'll be in the lobby for a few minutes before heading to the restaurant.  The 7 PM start time is a guess and the actual time will be updated when that information becomes available.


Shut In is an English-language French horror-thriller film directed by Farren Blackburn and written by Christina Hodson. The film stars Naomi Watts, Oliver Platt, Charlie Heaton, David Cubitt and Jacob Tremblay.

Following a recent accident that took the life of her husband and left her son paralyzed, a female psychologist (Naomi Watts) finds herself isolated in her own home caring for her child. Cut off from the outside world during a deadly storm, she starts to believe someone is inside her house trying to harm them.

Hope to see you there!
name: "Shut-in" at LANDMARK GLENDALE

description:
Join us for our next Allegro Tech Talks in Poznan. This time we will focus on Site Reliability Engineering (SRE).

First presentation:

Topic: "What Allegro outages and US forest wildfires have in common?"

In our everyday work you have to deal with errors in the code, hardware failures, security problems, sometimes with ordinary human error. You can not totally eliminate these problems, even if you write the best code in the world, even if you introduce most restrictive safety procedures and your data center equipment will be at highest quality and from the best vendors. It is important that in case of emergency you are able to respond quickly to those events.And what about those forest wildfires? You will find the answer in my presentation.

Julian Szulc - Site Reliability Engineer, Allegro

Second presentation:

Topic: "Failure Friday in Allegro."

Everyone wants to know if the thing they’ve built works according the initial assumptions. Among these requirement one can find stability, resistance to failure or anomaly in the system. This is what our Wednesday's Failure Friday are all about. We check if a specific portion of the system behaves put to the test.

Marek Jadżyn - Site Reliability Engineer, Allegro

Krzysztof Kliś - Site Reliability Engineer, Allegro

The meeting will be held in Polish.

Please stay tuned for further updates.

--

Allegro Tech Talks is a series of meetups where we will talk about projects that we run, problems that we face and unique solutions that we implement. What is more, we will invite external guests to learn about their experiences and point of view.
name: Allegro Tech Talks Poznan #2

description:
About Anantagiri:About Anantagiri:Anantagiri is 6 kms from vikarabad and 80 kms from hyderabad. Anantagiri is a great getaway from the pollution and stress of the city life that gets unbearable with the heat and the dust.Nature lovers and tourists are attracted by unchallenged beauty of this place. An alluring deciduous forest where nature is preserved at its best 

Meetup point coordinates :  


https://goo.gl/maps/daQgFJyA6eH2 

Itinerary: 
12:30 Meetup at TSPA/APPA outer ring road  
13:00 start to anantagiri
14:30 reach Vikarabad Stop for Tea and dinner packing 
16:30 Reach the camping Spot  & Exloring the lake
18:00 start pitching tents
20:00 Dinner 
23:00 sleep 
05:00 wakeup and 
05:30 Boating & Kayaking 
08:00 swim 
09:30 start back to anantagiri
10:00 Pictures and birding session
10:30 start to hyderabad

What to wear: Wear your Woolens it could be very cold

What to bring:
water bottles
trekking shoes
track pants swim shorts & extra pair of inner garments.
sleeping bag / or a blanket is fine
2 half sleeve tee shirts
toiletries ( Brush , tooth paste, soap ,shampoo etc)
sun screen
sun glasses
hat or cap as it will be hot afternoons
electrol or glucose
A strong Back-Pack (preferably water proof).
camera
any medications physician prescribed
2 emergency note with your name ,address, emergency contact number.
Loads of energy.

Costs:  800rs per person ( only includes costs for organizing and Equipment Usage )
Includes boating and lifejackets charges too


Trek Level :Easy

Mode of travel :  Own Transport ( car pooling)

Time Slicing : Travel Time 2 hours One way , min of 6 hours or Stargazing

Guidelines: we strictly follow -leave no trace policy ( even if its a banana peel / or and orange peel ) no trace should be left.

* This is a Trek not a tour guide programme if u r not a person to adjust few things , we recommend u not to attend.

Please be at the meetup point 10 mins before .

it is your complete responsibility to be careful throughout the trek .

description:
On Saturday November 12, 2016 Jesse Lee Kincaid (Taj Mahal, Ry Cooder) from the legendary 60's group The Rising Sons will be playing at the Art House Gallery & Cultural Center 2905 Shattuck Ave in Berkeley with his friends Mark Banning from the Unauthorized Rolling Stones; Rob Dietrich from the Cole Tate Band; and Gary Scheuenstuhl from the Marinfidels. Donations $15-$25. at door. Doors 6:30PM Show 7:30PM Don't miss this fantastic show. Please tell your friends about this special concert.

ALL AGES WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE and POT LUCK TOO!!

Jesse Lee Kincaid – played with the legendary 60’s band The Rising Sons with Taj Mahal, Ry Cooder, Gary Magic Marker, and Ed Cassidy. He wrote the song “She Sang Hymns Out Of Tune” which was recorded by several popular groups back in the 60’s.

Mark Banning plays with The Unauthorized Rolling Stones

Gary Scheuenstuhl plays in the Marinfidels and is the owner of Mill Valley Music.

Rob Dietrich plays in a popular Marin County group The Cole Tate Band
name: Hear Live music at Art House Gallery & Cultural Center

description:
This event was by far the best night I have had in London in the 12 years I have lived here.  You are going to LOVE IT!  Hope you can join us :) Kelly

BOOKING LINK: Just rsvp and I'll send it to you

Event details:

You will be greeted with a complimentary drink, for a bit of a social in a nightclub in Piccadilly. From there we will board an exclusive moving nightclub, a pimped out London BUS!!! On board you will be served unlimited drinks for 2 hours whilst we tour the sights of London and dance like there is no tomorrow. We will then be dropped off at one of Mayfair's hottest clubs for an additional complimentary drink. Sounds pretty much like the dream night out, hey? and such good value :) The perfect sightseeing tour and way to make new friends... and who knows, one of them may be that perfect match!

https://player.vimeo.com/video/152352094

Includes:

• Tour of London on an luxury bus exclusive to our group for 2 hours

• unlimited beer, wine, cocktails on board the bus

•  entry to two seperate clubs with a complimentary cocktail at each club

• a host to greet you and make sure you have everything you need, introductions to other guest if you need them.

• booking fee, paypal fee, personal liablity insurance

Limited to 60 guest, RSVP on this site does not reflect numbers attending. This event is listed on other groups. Many guest will attend on their own, so don't be shy!

Tickets:

BOOKING LINK: 

£45, or book 1 week in advance and save £5 (making it only £40)

If tickets are available, the door price is £55

Bon Vivant members save an additional £5

( Bon Vivants attend 10 wine tastings for free each year, as well as free tickets to experiences hosted by third parties such as Decanter, please see www.tastour.com/member-registration for more information)  

Note:

The bus will depart at 8pm. Please aim to arrive at Grace by 7:30. The bus is a moving vehicle and no refunds will be made if you miss it!

Interior photos of the bus:


About Tastour

Tastour is London's largest social club for food and drink experiences. Kelly, your host, is won the UK Wine Educator of the Year* award, and makes meeting new people and learning about food and drink fun, easy and engaging. With a diverse range of events, priced from £5, there is really something for everyone – from epicurean tastings and exclusive dinners, www.tastour.com or phone[masked]
* Awarded by the International Wine Challenge 2010

description:
Del Jordan es una chica que vive con sus padres en el pueblo de Jubilee. Observa el universo rural que se despliega ante sus ojos y narra su relación con la familia, los vecinos y los amigos. La manera de proceder de los demás, el ambiente en el que vive, le descubre que para ganar en la vida siempre hay que elegir: una vida cómoda y mediocre (una familia y un hogar estables) o arriesgar. Del optará por esta última elección y descubrirá su vocación literaria.

Alice Munro despliega en esta novela autobiográfica  toda su maestría y el peculiar modo de ver la vida.

«Lo asombroso es ver que hace cuarenta años Munro estaba ya en posesión y pleno dominio de su hermoso instrumento verbal, por encima de todo eficaz, que ahora me parece único. Y envidiable.» Robert Saladrigas, Cultura/s, La Vanguardia.

Como siempre, os envío por correo la novela.

Más información en http://laletraconarte.blogspot.com.es y http://literariacomunicacion.com

Sara: [masked] [masked]
name: La vida de las mujeres, de Alice Munro

description:
"Why are you so enchanted by this world, when a mine of gold lies within you? 
Open your eyes and come -  Return to the root of the root of your own soul."

 Rumi

Foundations of Meditation Workshop - Week Three - Join At Any Time

Meditation is a practical tool that anyone can use in order to investigate the true nature of any phenomena in nature or within oneself. The basis of any real spiritual path is our own experience of the truth. We acquire this knowledge through the use of consciousness. Meditation is the art of developing the consciousness in all its levels.

Common schools of meditation such as Transcendental Meditation and Vipassana only focus on the preliminary stages of meditation. While they may provide an increased feeling of relaxation and inner peace, they lack the depth that is needed to truly go beyond the mind and experience the great mysteries of life.

A true sanyasin of meditation is able to leave their physical body at will and intimately fuse with that which they are meditating on. Real meditation is not a practice of zoning out at all; it is an intimate experience of the consciousness that leads to mystical ecstasy and tangible experience of the internal worlds. To be able to truly meditate takes years of daily practice and this course will provide the foundation, suitable for both beginners and advanced, to begin to walk on this path...

Each session will comprise of a talk and meditation practice. Come to one or them all! Entry by donation
name: Entering the Dreamtime (True Vipassana)

venue.name: Wellcome Trust - Medical Research Council Cambridge Stem Cell Institute

description:
All enquiries to: [masked] /[masked] 

The Event

The Game Lab brings together teams of games developers and leading research scientists. The challenge is to work together over a period of 48 hours to incorporate the latest stem cell science into a completely new and playable game.

The event starts with a tour of our laboratories and a crash course in stem cell science (no prior knowledge required!). We hope that participants will be inspired by the ground-breaking research that we do and will be able bring their creativity and technical expertise to showcase our work in an original format. Equally, our researchers will appreciate the opportunity to learn some games basics. 

We hosted our first Game Lab in 2015 and are currently working with the winning team to produce their proposed game! This year the event is supported the MRC Festival of medical research

SCHEDULE

Friday 11th November

4:00pm: Interactive tour of the Stem Cell Institute laboratories
5:30pm: Wine reception to form teams.*

*if you cannot attend the tour you can join on Saturday morning 

Saturday 12th November

10:00am: Official launch - Announcement of theme and all rules, regulations and expectations 
01:00pm: Lunch - Hot paninis 
06:00pm: Dinner - pies and gravy
08.30pm: Building closes

Sunday 13th November

09:00am: Breakfast - continental
01:00pm: Lunch - bounteous buffet 
04:30pm: Presentations of final games to judges
05:30: Awards ceremony 

JUDGING

A panel of judges, including scientific & games industry experts will award two prizes:

1) Best Game
2) Best Scientific Content 

In addition to individual prizes on the day, we may choose to work with any of the entered teams to develop their concept further. 

TECH
Each team will have access to a monitor. Participants should bring their own laptops, chargers and any other cables.

REFRESHMENTS
Thanks to generous support from the Medical Research Council, drinks and snacks will be available throughout the jam, to keep the creative juices keep flowing!

REGISTRATION
All participants should have some prior experience of creating games (this includes games art and sound). Places are limited so you must register here to be guaranteed entry. 

If you are a stem cell researcher or biologist who would like to take part, DO NOT register here - please contact Philippa: [masked]

PARKING
There is no parking available at Tennis Court Road - please make other arrangements. 

ACCESSIBITY
Our building is wheelchair accessible, please contact us if you require any additional support to take part:
name: Game Lab 2016 - A Game Jam at Stem Cell Institute

description:
The Best Western Wroxton House Hotel is privately owned by ‘The Smiths’ and set in the beautiful thatched village of Wroxton. Dating in parts from 1649 this hotel is an idyllic retreat only 4 miles from junction 11 of the M40 and on the edge of the Cotswolds.

Those seeking to relax and discover some historic and fascinating areas of the country won’t be disappointed. Guests will be delighted by the hotel’s personal service, attention to detail and tranquil working environment.

Whether a first time guest or regular visitor, all are guaranteed the promise of a warm welcome from a dedicated and professional team.

♠ EN SUITE ROOMS WITH ALL FACILITIES ♠ PRIZES

♠ PARTNERS GUARANTEED ♠AREA FOR SMOKERS ♠
Superb Value only £250 for 2 nights
4 bridge sessions, 2 bridge seminars. half board only £250

No single supplement
name: Bridge Weekend at Wroxton House Hotel, Oxfordshirt

Hi Everyone

Below are details of upcoming Meet ups and  SSC courses.  


1.  Free Meet up sessions +
 Tour to Stirling

1.1.  This Saturday (12th November)[masked]

Develop your English for Finance and learn how to make money

by playing the 'Cashflow'boardgame.


1.2. Every 2nd Thursday, starting Nov. 10 from 7.30 - 9.00 PM:                          

  - International film night - Come to the SSC 'SSCREENROOM' and watch a movie

    Thursday Nov. 10:  The Japanese animation 'Spirited Away'

1.3.  Every 2nd Thursday, starting 17th Nov. from 7.30- 9.00 PM

   - English through Film & Discussion - watch some film and discuss issues relating to Scottish history and culture, human rights, world issues...

These sessions are guided and are ideal if you want to improve your higher level discussion skills in English.

Meet up topics for November- December – on Scottish History/Culture:

17th November – William Wallace

1st December  - Robert the Bruce

1.4.  Saturday Dec. 10th – All day study tour to Stirling, taking in Bannockburn, Stirling Castle, and the Wallace Monument.

Cost £10 contribution for transport in SSC Minibus + Entrance fees to Castle, Bannockburn + Wallace Monument (Entry is optional)


REVIEWS

See Meet up reviews below:

·  “ Great meetup, excellent discussion topics! Highly recommended for everyone who would like to practise English and have a great time. Thank you Anne! ”

— Rita Szentivanszki on Oct 22, 2016.

“ The most interesting meetup I've attended so far because of the themes discussed and awesome to improve spoken English as the conversation is being moderated by an excellent English teacher, Anne McDonald. ”

— Bruno on Jun 22, 2016.

“ It was a great evening. We watched several episodes of the movie and discussed not only the movie, but many many more interesting question. I was really happy to meet so many wonderful and interesting people. I truly enjoyed the event! many thanks to Anne for organizing it, I'm looking forward to seeing other movies with you! ”

— Veronika Afonina on Jun 8, 2016.

“ Very interesting group that helps to learn English via meaningfully discussions, highly recommended to learners and native speakers. ”

— Marcin on May 2, 2016.

“ Very relaxed and friendly.... ”

— graeme on Apr 8, 2016.

You can either start SSC courses now, or you can sign up for the term starting Week beginning January 9,  2017.

Note that there have been changes to the scheduling of some of the courses.  Also, there is some flexibility in the scheduling, so if the timing doesn't suit you, please let me know alternative days/times that do.

I hope some of this will be of interest!

OR Drop by SSC for a coffee and a chat!

description:
Hi Everyone

Below are details of upcoming Meet ups and  SSC courses.  


1.  Free Meet up sessions +
 Tour to Stirling

1.1.  This Saturday (12th November)[masked]

Develop your English for Finance and learn how to make money

by playing the 'Cashflow'boardgame.


1.2. Every 2nd Thursday, starting Nov. 10 from 7.30 - 9.00 PM:                          

  - International film night - Come to the SSC 'SSCREENROOM' and watch a movie

    Thursday Nov. 10:  The Japanese animation 'Spirited Away'

1.3.  Every 2nd Thursday, starting 17th Nov. from 7.30- 9.00 PM

   - English through Film & Discussion - watch some film and discuss issues relating to Scottish history and culture, human rights, world issues...

These sessions are guided and are ideal if you want to improve your higher level discussion skills in English.

Meet up topics for November- December – on Scottish History/Culture:

17th November – William Wallace

1st December  - Robert the Bruce

1.4.  Saturday Dec. 10th – All day study tour to Stirling, taking in Bannockburn, Stirling Castle, and the Wallace Monument.

Cost £10 contribution for transport in SSC Minibus + Entrance fees to Castle, Bannockburn + Wallace Monument (Entry is optional)


REVIEWS

See Meet up reviews below:

·  “ Great meetup, excellent discussion topics! Highly recommended for everyone who would like to practise English and have a great time. Thank you Anne! ”

— Rita Szentivanszki on Oct 22, 2016.

“ The most interesting meetup I've attended so far because of the themes discussed and awesome to improve spoken English as the conversation is being moderated by an excellent English teacher, Anne McDonald. ”

— Bruno on Jun 22, 2016.

“ It was a great evening. We watched several episodes of the movie and discussed not only the movie, but many many more interesting question. I was really happy to meet so many wonderful and interesting people. I truly enjoyed the event! many thanks to Anne for organizing it, I'm looking forward to seeing other movies with you! ”

— Veronika Afonina on Jun 8, 2016.

“ Very interesting group that helps to learn English via meaningfully discussions, highly recommended to learners and native speakers. ”

— Marcin on May 2, 2016.

“ Very relaxed and friendly.... ”

— graeme on Apr 8, 2016.


2.  SSC courses

You can either start SSC courses now, or you can sign up for the term starting Week beginning January 9,  2017.

Note that there have been changes to the scheduling of some of the courses.  Also, there is some flexibility in the scheduling, so if the timing doesn't suit you, please let me know alternative days/times that do.

I hope some of this will be of interest!

For more information, please contact me on[masked], or email [masked],

OR Drop by SSC for a coffee and a chat!

Course fees: discounts on courses for English/Languages Through Film & Discussion Meet up members.

6 Week course:

£90 for courses at 1 X 1.5 hour session per week (£75)

£180 for courses at 2 X 1.5 hour sessions per week  (£130 for English/Languages 

            Through Film & Discussion Meet up members)

Sign up for 12 weeks:

£160 for courses at 1 X 1.5 hour session per week.  (£120  for English/Languages Through Film & Discussion Meet up members)

£340 for courses at 2 X 1.5 hour sessions per week (£230 for English/Languages 

            Through Film & Discussion Meet up members)

Note:  

Depending on the scheduling of classes,  it is possible to mix different courses.

For example, you could take:

            1 X 1.5 hour session on English for Employability and Business

             1 X 1.5 hour session on English for Academic Study

Fees for mixed courses, including Meet up discount + mixed course surcharge: 

6 Weeks at 2 X 1.5 hour sessions per week:

£130 + £20 surcharge = £150

12 Weeks at 2 X 1.5 hour sessions per week:  

 £230 + £20 surcharge = £250

NOTE:

English for REAL Communication - suitable for Lower-intermediate to Intermediate levels

All other courses - suitable for Upper-intermediate to Advanced levels

description:
Have You ever thought of having a holistic treatment but are unsure which one to choose?
Do you feel stressed and are considering having a relaxing treatment yet unsure which one would suit best?
Have you or are you considering training as complementary holistic therapist and would like to experience several therapies and get a flavor of what suits you and what's involved?
If you answered yes to any of the above then this workshop is definitely a step in the right direction for you. These workshops are packed with information regarding the benefits' of each therapy, how to choose which therapy is right for you and best of all - practical hands on experience as you will be guided to practice giving and receiving mini treatments from each therapy throughout the day. This is a great way of learning and you can use these skills at home with your friends and family. Mini treatments are carried out fully clothed. (Arms, hands, feet, head and shoulder massage). Wear old comfy relaxing clothes as we will be working with oils. Certificate of attendance & continuous personal development (5 CPD) points awarded. Workshops are also available from groups upon request and ca be therapeutically designed to suit your groups interests and needs. Small group 8 - 10 max You can book online or contact Joan Hunt[masked] Price: €80
Deposit: €20 to secure your place
name: Introduction to 4 Therapeutic Holistic Treatments - With Joan Hunt

description:
**You must register on Eventbrite to be allowed entry**

http://datasciencegraph.eventbrite.co.uk

Welcome to our last Data Science Lab event of 2016!

This evening will be themed around graphs and graph databases, both theory and case studies of how they are used.

18:30 Doors open

19:00 Talk: What can knowledge graphs do for me?

Speaker: Dr Sheldon Hall

As the world becomes more and more data rich the difficulties of managing and wrangling data become more pronounced. The knowledge graph is positioned to be the next thing big thing in terms of data integration and search, but what is it and where can you get one? The next question might be: should I care? The answer is a definite YES and in this presentation I will justify this claim by highlighting the benefits to data scientists. These include: easy integration of multiple data sources, a flexible schema to check correctness and express how the information is related, and an intuitive graph query language to extract information across all sources.

Sheldon Hall is a software engineer working at Grakn Labs where a distributed knowledge graph is being developed. His current role involves research and development of our graph based knowledge representation system and analytics engine. He has a master’s degree in mathematical modelling and scientific computing, a doctorate in nuclear engineering, and is a previous ASI Fellow. 

19:45 Lightning talk: Speaker TBC

20:00 Lightning talk: Speaker TBC

20:15 Drinks & Networking

21:00 Event finishes
name: Understanding Data and Graph

venue.name: Wellcome Trust - Medical Research Council Cambridge Stem Cell Institute

description:
All enquiries to: [masked] /[masked] 

The Event

The Game Lab brings together teams of games developers and leading research scientists. The challenge is to work together over a period of 48 hours to incorporate the latest stem cell science into a completely new and playable game.

The event starts with a tour of our laboratories and a crash course in stem cell science (no prior knowledge required!). We hope that participants will be inspired by the ground-breaking research that we do and will be able bring their creativity and technical expertise to showcase our work in an original format. Equally, our researchers will appreciate the opportunity to learn some games basics. 

We hosted our first Game Lab in 2015 and are currently working with the winning team to produce their proposed game! This year the event is supported the MRC Festival of medical research

SCHEDULE

Friday 11th November

4:00pm: Interactive tour of the Stem Cell Institute laboratories
5:30pm: Wine reception to form teams.*

*if you cannot attend the tour you can join on Saturday morning 

Saturday 12th November

10:00am: Official launch - Announcement of theme and all rules, regulations and expectations 
01:00pm: Lunch - Hot paninis 
06:00pm: Dinner - pies and gravy
08.30pm: Building closes

Sunday 13th November

09:00am: Breakfast - continental
01:00pm: Lunch - bounteous buffet 
04:30pm: Presentations of final games to judges
05:30: Awards ceremony 

JUDGING

A panel of judges, including scientific & games industry experts will award two prizes:

1) Best Game
2) Best Scientific Content 

In addition to individual prizes on the day, we may choose to work with any of the entered teams to develop their concept further. 

TECH
Each team will have access to a monitor. Participants should bring their own laptops, chargers and any other cables.

REFRESHMENTS
Thanks to generous support from the Medical Research Council, drinks and snacks will be available throughout the jam, to keep the creative juices keep flowing!

REGISTRATION
All participants should have some prior experience of creating games (this includes games art and sound). Places are limited so you must register here to be guaranteed entry. 

If you are a stem cell researcher or biologist who would like to take part, DO NOT register here - please contact Philippa: [masked]

PARKING
There is no parking available at Tennis Court Road - please make other arrangements. 

ACCESSIBITY
Our building is wheelchair accessible, please contact us if you require any additional support to take part:
name: Game Lab 2016 - Jam in a lab with behind the scenes tour

description:
Register for free here: http://juliacomputing.com/blog/2016/11/01/Julia-Day-NY.html

Julia Computing invites you to the first Julia Day in New York. This event will introduce you to Julia, the easy-to-learn high-performance mathematical programming language that is taking the finance industry by storm.

Julia Day takes place on Wednesday, November 30th from 3:30 PM to 6:30 PMfollowed by drinks, dinner and networking. The venue for this event is at Fitch Learning Center, 3rd Floor, 55 Broad St, New York, NY 10004.

Come find out how quants, traders and data scientists from hedge funds, investment banks, and across financial services industry worldwide are using Julia to gain a mathematical computing advantage over their competitors by processing more data up to 1,000x faster than before. Also learn why Nobel Laureate Thomas J. Sargent calls Julia a ‘great tool’ for building high-dimensional macroeconomic models. See how Julia enables innovation in the fintech and regtech sectors, helping companies and regulators keep ahead of a fast changing market.

There will be product demos, benchmarks, customer stories and use cases in Finance and Insurance, especially around trading, risk analytics and asset management among others.

Please register below to attend. We look forward to seeing you in New York.
name: Julia Day

description:
Join Greg as we connect with our deeper selves, support each other in the 4-part PHI breath cycle, and share our experiences.

LIMITED SPACE; Sign up now: [masked]

What will we do? -------------
We will briefly introduce what PHI is about, learn the 4-part PHI breath cycle, practice it together, and share some experiences around emotional awareness and personal growth.

What is PHI? ----------------


Much of what we do day-to-day are based on the relationship patterns we unconsciously learned from our parents, or our adaptations around these situations from that time. As adults, we usually continue them to try to get what we wanted in our childhood, often unsuccessfully. A lot of these strategies and feelings are also stored in our body-mind, in how we hold ourselves and how we react to what we see, hear, smell or feel.

The key to breaking these patterns is to discover the roots of the emotions, give them loving space to complete, and reform them with the loving, supportive messages and sensations that set us free. PHI offers a very powerful, synergistic combination of tools to make this transformation.

Pelvic Heart Integration is a comprehensive system for understanding and harmonizing the whole person, in our intimate relationships with ourselves and others. This unique and powerful synthesis of neo-Reichian breathwork, bodywork, psycho-drama, trauma work, energy work and tantra was developed by pioneering philosopher and bodyworker Dr. Jack Painter and extended by Psychologist Dr. Deborah Anapol. It examines our ancestral lineage and the developmental issues of childhood and their relationship to the physical, emotional, interpersonal and sexual issues confronting us as evolving humans. It uses excitement and sensual pleasure for healing experiences.

Your Facilitator ------------

Gregory Fung was being trained in PHI by the late Dr. Deborah Anapol and brings his experience exploring and integrating techniques from yoga, massage, tantric meditation, conscious kink, body dearmouring, Gestalt dialoging, and for creating a safe relaxing space of deep presence. Having grown up in Vancouver, Canada, he is still active in his first career as an electronics and embedded software engineer, where he developed his experience in team dynamics. He also converses in German and Cantonese. In Berlin, he offers personalized sessions for emotional exploration and release, meditative and breath coaching, and energetic bodywork.


www.pelvicheart.de

Location------------------
UnitedBliss, Jessnerstraße 18, 10247 Berlin, Germany

Contribution -----------------
Pay-as-you-feel-deeply right, suggestion €5 - 15

Registration -----------------
Please write to [masked] secure your place.

description:
ACLARACIÓN DEL LUGAR: 
Ermita de San Isidro de El Boalo, al lado del pueblo del Boalo.
Coordenadas GPS:[masked],-3.919222.
El que no tenga GPS que mire previamente en Google Maps

Sesión para seguir conociendo el telescopio e improvisar. Dispondremos de dos telescopios, un refractor sobre montura ecuatorial y un Macksutov sobre montura altazimutal, así podremos ver la diferencia de ambos en cuanto a montaje y funcionamiento.

Es un fin de semana raro, con bastante Luna, por lo que no puedo precisar si podremos ver objetos de cielo profundo ni cuántos. Aún y así, aprovechando que estaremos con un cielo menos contaminado que la primera sesión, trataremos de observar varios objetos de cielo profundo, a ver si esta vez tenemos mejor suerte. En el peor de los casos, la Luna no estará llena del todo así que dispondremos de mayor tridimensionalidad en el terminador de ésta y las sombras sobre los cráteres serán más acusadas.

En cuanto a fotografía, trataremos de montar una cámara sobre el telescopio para captar imágenes de los objetos a los que apuntemos. También intentaremos hacer alguna fotografía circumpolar, de esas que se ve la estrella polar en el centro y las estrellas moviéndose a su alrededor.

Traeros prismáticos y cámaras réflex si tenéis (con trípode, por supuesto) y así todos podremos experimentar.

La hora de quedada es a las 17:00 para empezar a montar de día, hablar sobre lo que veremos y sobretodo vernos las caras, cosa que apenas pudimos hacer el otro día J.

Como siempre, la quedada estará sujeta a la previsión meteorológica y el punto de quedada será en algún lugar cercano o en la Sierra de Madrid.
name: Observación y fotografía

description:
*This event is the second part of a two-part event being held on this day. Check out the OSU event too!

At the Tour De Pokémon Go event earlier this month, one of the places we stopped was Berliner Park, a current Bulbasaur nest. We had a Bulbasaur on our Nearby lists at pretty muchall times. Since softball season was over, one field in particular was basically swarming with 10-20 Pokémon GO players. It was cool seeing all those people out there, and it's that kind of environment we hope to encounter again! Hopefully everyone will walk away much closer to a Venusaur.

I'm very excited to announce we'll be joined by OSU's resident Pokémon group, the Buckeye Pokémon League! This OSU student organization with a love of anything Pokémon also functions as an officially sanctioned 'Play! Pokémon' location for card games and video games, and occasionally hosts official tournaments at OSU. Anyone is welcome, whether you attend OSU or not. The club currently meets from 7-10 PM on Mondays in the basement of the Student Union, in the Milestones room (but you can ask me, Brian, at any time if that needs confirmed, as they tend to only meet when OSU has classes).

We'll come straight here from our OSU event, and we'll be at it here until dark (estimated 5:30-6 PM). Since we don't have a lot of time, we will not wait 15 minutes for people to show up as we have, we'll just go out there. Hopefully you won't have much trouble finding the GO players.
name: Bulbasaur at Berliner (Collab with the OSU Buckeye Pokémon League)

description:
Kendrick will run a game of OSAKA NO EXIT again.

JOINING THE GAME

There are 5 spaces. Anyone who lives inside the Mittelring near the metro who volunteers to host first automatically gets to play! Either way, I request that two spaces are left free for people who do not play regularly in the Demon Hunters game, so that more players can play RPGs in this group! I will also try to give priority to the people who were waitlisted for the previous game.


---------

2069. Osaka. 2am. Rain drizzles on tarmac, sparkling puddles reflect sodium streetlights and neon billboards.

Imagine a future where everything that could go wrong, has gone wrong: Tel Aviv is a smoking irradiated hole. Climate change runs out of control. Manhattan is the new Venice, 2m below the waterline. Texas and California have seceded. The EU is long gone and Europe is ruled by a panoply of petty dictators. Russia and China make increasingly aggressive claims on their neighbours. The Internet is the frontline in a new cyber-cold war.

In Japan, the zaibatsu are run by the Yakuza, and the only comfortable work is living isolated in giant corporate arcologies away from the decaying city centres.

Downtown Osaka is a crumbling mess, filled with drug dealers, immigrants, street gangs, the unhinged and the destitute. Word is that the Yakuza like it that way, the better to pick out the best of the street samurai to elevate into positions of corporate skullduggery.

You the players take the role of these street samurai: skilled at theft, violence, persuasion and more, wielding cybernetics, illicit weaponry and exotic technology. Can you break out of the street life? Into the glory of corporate warfare, or to reclaim your own humanity? Do you have pride and honour, or are you the scum of the earth?

Join OSAKA NO EXIT and find out.
