description:
►►► SAVE THE DATE ◄◄◄   RSVPs WILL OPEN SOON !

Event Rating:    Level 3-4,    ► Difficult ◄

Distance:    ~5 MILES

Time Duration:    ~5 HOURS

Blaze Orange:    Not required

HOLIDAY SHOPPING SALE!   Gorgeous Views, Endless Self-satisfaction, and a Wholelotta Fun, 3166 ft size, all for the special low price of only $5 (the NH State Park entrance fee). And there is no need to camp out at the entrance at 4 am to beat out the crowds, because there will be an unlimited supply of all the sale items!
Enter coupon code  GETYOURBUTTOFFTHECOUCH

Mount Monadnock... the most climbed mountain in North America and the third most climbed mountain in the world!

This hike is suitable for beginner mountain hikers, BUT...

►►► YOU MUST HAVE ENOUGH HIKING EXPERIENCE TO COMPLETE GOING UP AND DOWN 200O FEET OF ELEVATION GAIN OVER VERY ROUGH AND ROCKY TRAILS! ◄◄◄

If I have not hiked with you before or do not know you, I may contact you to ask about your experience and gear. Please do not be offended, I just want to be sure that you have a safe and happy day - in that order. (... and I don't want to have to carry you down.)

We will be hiking up to the summit at a safe and relaxed pace, but... we will be taking the most difficult route to get there, the Spellman trail! It requires some effort, but delivers a huge reward.

You MUST bring your 10 essentials +4, a minimum of 2L water, snacks,  lunch, and a happy attitude.    

Here's the list. You ain't got 'em, you ain't comin' :

~ ~ ~ ~ ~
1. Map      You are given one at the gate.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
2. Compass   Know how to use it.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
3. Flashlight / Headlamp    Are those batteries fresh ?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
4. Extra Food   (Extra points for bringing Snickers for the leader)
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
5. Extra Clothes    Including rain gear or poncho
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
6. Eye Protection   Is that you behind those Foster Grants?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
7. First-Aid Kit     There will be a group kit. Bring your medications.
.~ ~ ~ ~ ~
8. Pocket Knife    Even better, a multi-tool.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
9. Waterproof Matches
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
10. Firestarter  I use cotton balls soaked in petroleum jelly in a 35mm film case. They ignite instantly, even in rain.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
11. Water / Filter / Bottles   Minimum 2 Liters !
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
12. Whistle    On your pack strap for fast access
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
13. Insect Repellents or Clothing    Probably won't need it
~ ~ ~ ~ ~
14. Sunburn Preventatives   Needed year round.  There is no shade up there.

You also may be asked to share in the carrying of a small amount of group gear. 

Plan on a good stretch of rock scrambling (YES! The best part!).  Got height problems? This hike is probably not for you.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDcnN7job7o

PLEASE NOTE: Your leaders will always be very accommodating and forgiving, but by signing up, you agree that you will abide by any decisions they make concerning your ability, suitability, and safety. Summiting is at the leader's discretion and is not guaranteed.  We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Anyone leaving the group during the hike will be permanently removed from the club.

Summit Weather:  http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Monadnock/forecasts/965

Hope to see you on the mountain!

Bob

description:
Hi team,

Today on our magical Monopoly Takeover tour we land on Electric Company. What better a backdrop to have for that than Battersea Power Station.

The line of the narrative for today is "It turned to its neighbours, those icey blues the other side of Kings Cross's tracks, and asked if they'd heard the news." Definitely something in there to play with.

I thought we could have a go at light painting. Google "Picasso light painting" and you'll see what I mean. In essence, it's what you do with sparklers every 5th November.

How these meetups work: It's free, of course, you just need to bring yourself and a have-a-go attitude. This whole project is in support of the Movember Foundation, so sharing what we get up to after is always great for drumming up support and donations. That's about it.

Not really sure what all this is about? Visit facebook.com/twentypegs and see what's been going on so far.

Look forward to seeing you.

Thanks,

Greg

description:
Camping and hiking at Pedernales Falls State park with some swimming on the side.

Fitness level: moderate  - 8 plus miles on Sat on unpaved trails, 6 miles on Sunday.

Pedernales Falls Park site


Flowing over and around huge slabs of limestone, the Pedernales River can be turbulent. But most often it is tranquil, and a great place to relax and recharge. We are just 30 miles west of Austin. Come over for an afternoon swim or hike, or load up your gear for an overnight adventure. The river awaits!

Hike or bike the scenic Hill Country. Trails range from easy to challenging. Take the .5-mile Twin Falls Nature Trail and stop at the scenic overlook over the falls. Or tackle the six-mile Wolf Mountain Trail. This challenging trail wraps around Tobacco and Wolf mountains and winds along the small canyons created by Mescal and Tobacco creeks. Along the way, cool your heels at Arrowhead Pool, where Bee Creek spills into stair-stepped pools. For the more adventurous cyclist, test your mountain biking skills on the new Juniper Ridge Trail. This 10-mile technical, single track trail provides plenty of obstacles for more advanced riders

Houston Outdoors Camping: 

I have 2 campsites booked (water and Electric) good for 10-12 people, The fee for the event covers the cost of the campsites. The fee is no-refundable to keep the costs consistent for group. If you do not have a Texas State parks pass there is a $6 per person per day fee.  There is an excess vehicle fee past 2 vehicles per site (usually $5 per night), spots will be first come basis.

Occupancy Limit 8 people. Sites have 30 amp electric, a picnic table, fire ring and/or grill. Sewer dump station available. Some sites can hold up to a 40 ft trailer or RV. Limit 2 vehicles (including trailers) at campsite.


Park Map

Agenda:

• Friday:

Arrive and setup camp

Saturday:

• 9AM hike the Wolf Mountain trail 8 miles ish hike map

• Spend afternoon at the falls or in the falls if the weather is warm

• Campfire 

Sunday:

• Hike the 5.5 mile loop past Trammels crossing to the scenic overlook of the falls. Bring waterproof shoes, there is a low water crossing

• Head home

No Show policy: If you are a no show to any camping event that requires paid sites, you will be put on a black list and not allowed to attend future events until you can show that you can be trusted again.  

Refunds: refunds are not offered for these trips to keep the costs low for the group who attend and help cover my costs when I have to cover cancel trips.  Keep in mind I don't charge membership fees or any other fees. 

Expectations: You need to provide all of your own gear, a list of gear needed can be found camping list, Members will typically have cooking stoves. You can rent from Ayoopa, there is a link and 10% discount code on the group page(PC)  Always pack rain gear, bug spray, sunscreen and plenty of food and water.

Organizers: We (organizers) are providing a free experience to our members, we will help you setup your gear and help you as we can to make it an enjoyable trip. The fees will cover the organizers trip expenses.  Houston Outdoors is a group of like minded people coming together to share our outdoor adventures with others.  We are here to share our trips with our members and in no way offer a guided event or take any liability for your well being.  We are all adults, and each Meet Up is well defined and describes the event and physical requirements, it's up to you to determine if you are capable of the event .  In case of emergencies the appropriate emergency response teams will be notified, Houston Outdoors will not provide any emergency aid.  You must understand this before signing up, if you want a guided experience, there are many groups you can join and pay for.

I hope everyone understands the need for outlining all the details/liabilities in the details but in these ages its needed, if you don't agree, then DO NOT SIGN UP!

By signing up to this MeetUp you agree to our Disclaimer
name: Pedernales Falls Camping and Hiking

description:
Who fancies a trip over to Norway to be surrounded by spectacular scenery?!

£479.00pp which includes;
return flights from Gatwick
return transfers
3 nights in a 4* hotel, based on B&B -twin sharing room (I will pair same sex people )

There are a range of excursions available, which once we know who wants to go we can tailor to taste.


**EDITED 12/09/16**

Further information;

The hotel is the 4* Calrion Hotel The Edge

Flight times from Gatwick are-

17FEB2017  GATWICK 14:20 TROMSO 18:50
20FEB2017 TROMSO 19:20 GATWICK 21:50

Deposit required is £150pp, full balance would be due 19th November


Optional excursions are;

Dog sledding with huskies - £150pp

Enjoy the arctic coastal nature with fantastic view over Tromsø, surrounded with white covered mountains and long fjords.Your top trained dogs will find the way no matter what! You’ll drive in pairs, so you can choose to sit in the sled or drive your own team of huskies (and swap part-way). There’s a good chance of spotting some wildlife on the way through the snow-covered landscape.

When you return to the ranch, you’ll then meet the puppies and maybe make some new four-legged friends. Enjoy and included Sami meal which will be served to you with coffee and cake, inside a lavvo, which is a warm Sami tent.

Departs daily at 09:45. Duration: 4 hours

Northern Lights Search - £125pp

This excursion offers the best opportunity for you to spot the Northern Lights. Your expert local guide will have all the weather and Aurora forecasts along with one specific mission: to take you wherever the chance of seeing the magnificent Aurora is the best. Departing from the centre of Tromsø you may move location two or three times during the evening to give the best chances, with the trip lasting up to 6-7 hours. Your knowledgeable and informative guide will also assist in helping you take some memorable photos. The price also includes hot chocolate, cookies, and electronic pictures of the excursion posted on the excursion company's Facebook page.

Departs daily at 19:00 Duration: 6-7 hours

Reindeer Sledding and Sami Culture - £160pp

Reindeer sledding is the oldest form of transport in the north, and an ancient part of Samiculture. You will be driving in pairs, with one sled for each reindeer and You'll also have an amazing view of the wild mountains in the area! People of all ages can participate on this very “soft” adventure. This cultural adventure includes trying lasso-throwing, the way the Sami people still today catch their reindeers when they are rounded up. Also, you will learn about Sami culture and history. A hot meal will also be included.

Departs daily at 09:00 or 17:00 Duration: 7 hours.

Snowmobile Safari - £180pp

Enjoy a thrilling ride as you drive a snowmobile along a 15km trail from Camp Tamok to the frozen water at Lake Tamok. You will be driving in pairs, one driver and one passenger on each snowmobile, with the opportunity to swap places during the trip. The starting point is at 250 metres above sea level, and the guide brings you up to 875 metres. The top point of the trail is a frozen lake, where you can speed up... You’ll journey through some of the most beautiful landscapes on this superb excursion. Once at the lake, you can try your hand at ice fishing. You’ll also be served a drink and hot meal in traditional Sami style.

Departs daily at 09:00 or 17:00 Duration: 7 hours.
name: Anyone up for a Northern Lights trip to Norway?!

description:
Cryptography and digital currencies have presented challenging user experiences for end users when it comes to private key management. With the growth of not just bitcoin, but a slew of decentralized blockchain applications, the problem becomes exponentially more challenging. Users are required to store, encrypt, and remember encryption passwords, key mnemonics, and account files for each blockchain application. Single-sign-on solutions from Facebook and Google have been pervasive throughout centralized websites, and have brought simplicity to account management. However they lack the security and privacy necessary for blockchain apps. Airbitz now brings the first and only Single-Sign-On solution for any blockchain, decentralized, or privacy minded application. Learn how Edge Login technology works and how to utilize it in your blockchain app.


https://airbitz.co/

https://twitter.com/paullinator
name: Airbitz Edge-Login: Bringing Single-Sign-On to Blockchain Technology - Paul Puey

description:
TECH WEDNESDAY BLUE LIGHTS SPECIAL

Tech Wednesday is being taken over by the Emergency Services!

Wednesday 16th November, 5:30pm – 8:00pm

This Months Tech Wednesday will feature speakers from the blue lights sector talking about the latest projects and activities focused on innovation. 

Sally Bourner, Chief Superintendent will be talking about "Drawing on Peel’s principles in 21st Century Policing"

The complexity and fast-moving nature of the world within which we all live and work presents challenges and opportunities for policing the like of which none of us have experienced during our service. 

Through our comprehensive and wide ranging WMP2020 programme, West Midlands Police (WMP) is meeting this new environment by changing our culture, behaviour and mind set. WMP2020 places people at the heart of future services. And by people I mean not just police colleagues but also members of the public and our partners, thereby ensuring legitimacy and trust in what we develop.

As well as Chief Superintendent Sally Bourner, other representatives from the Emergency Services will provide a unique insight as to how the adoption of technology and data is evolving blue lights services and improving citizen well being.

Each speaker will have 15 minutes before opening up to the floor for Q&A. After talks delegates will be able to network over beer and pizza.

For more information on Tech Wednesday – the Campus’ monthly meet-up for tech entrepreneurs and enthusiasts click here: http://www.meetup.com/tech-wednesday/

Talks run from 6:00pm – 7:00pm with opportunities for 1 min pitches from attendees between each main speaker.
name: Tech Wednesday

description:
All enquiries to: [masked] /[masked] 

The Event

The Game Lab brings together teams of games developers and leading research scientists. The challenge is to work together over a period of 48 hours to incorporate the latest stem cell science into a completely new and playable game.

The event starts with a tour of our laboratories and a crash course in stem cell science (no prior knowledge required!). We hope that participants will be inspired by the ground-breaking research that we do and will be able bring their creativity and technical expertise to showcase our work in an original format. Equally, our researchers will appreciate the opportunity to learn some games basics. 

We hosted our first Game Lab in 2015 and are currently working with the winning team to produce their proposed game! This year the event is supported the MRC Festival of medical research

SCHEDULE

Friday 11th November

4:00pm: Interactive tour of the Stem Cell Institute laboratories
5:30pm: Wine reception to form teams.*

*if you cannot attend the tour you can join on Saturday morning 

Saturday 12th November

10:00am: Official launch - Announcement of theme and all rules, regulations and expectations 
01:00pm: Lunch - Hot paninis 
06:00pm: Dinner - pies and gravy
08.30pm: Building closes

Sunday 13th November

09:00am: Breakfast - continental
01:00pm: Lunch - bounteous buffet 
04:30pm: Presentations of final games to judges
05:30: Awards ceremony 

JUDGING

A panel of judges, including scientific & games industry experts will award two prizes:

1) Best Game
2) Best Scientific Content 

In addition to individual prizes on the day, we may choose to work with any of the entered teams to develop their concept further. 

TECH
Each team will have access to a monitor. Participants should bring their own laptops, chargers and any other cables.

REFRESHMENTS
Thanks to generous support from the Medical Research Council, drinks and snacks will be available throughout the jam, to keep the creative juices keep flowing!

REGISTRATION
All participants should have some prior experience of creating games (this includes games art and sound). Places are limited so you must register here to be guaranteed entry. 

If you are a stem cell researcher or biologist who would like to take part, DO NOT register here - please contact Philippa: [masked]

PARKING
There is no parking available at Tennis Court Road - please make other arrangements. 

ACCESSIBITY
Our building is wheelchair accessible, please contact us if you require any additional support to take part:
name: GameLab2016 - Jam in a lab with hands-on tour. Register: www.tiny.cc/MRCgamelab

description:
Dear Property Investor,

Trevor and I are welcoming this month's guest Jenny Fenton to the Clapham Property Meet - we hope that you can join us.

Jenny is the Director of Digs Property in Oxford. She is a qualified and extremely knowledgeable expert in the HMO lettings & management sector with experience in both the residential and commercial fields. Her portfolio includes investors and landlords from all walks of life – from large corporates to private individuals with property portfolios ranging from 180 units to 1. 

Having spent several years in the City, working first for Land Securities & then a number of Investment Banks, Jenny is able to bring the strategies & analysis usually available to only the biggest property portfolios and apply the same principles on a smaller scale – often improving yields dramatically.

If you want to invest in property (real estate) projects, but lack the expertise, experience, confidence, time or required capital to move forward in the present market then now is the time to come along and learn from those that have been there and are happy to share their story over a cold beverage.

Whether you are an experienced property investor, just starting out, or perhaps have cash sitting on the side lines, we are here to help members to network effectively and help their pursuit in property investment.

Do join us if you are interested in property investments, be it local or further afield. 

Registration and early networking is between 6-7pm with Jenny as well as your hosts doing talks between 7-8:45pm. Drinks and further socialising/networking to follow the main event.

description:
Et oui, pour une fois on a de l'avance, par ce que ce n'est pas n'importe quel meetup ! Cette session sera aussi celle de nos 4 ans, et ca passe vite !

Et cette fois ci nous remercions Google, de nous héberger pour cette session un peu particulière :)

Au programme : 

• "GraphQL, the new age of API ?" par Stan Chollet (@tsunammis Software engineer at Dailymotion)

Le monde des APIs est en pleine mutation. Passant de SOAP à Rest il y a quelques années, sommes-nous en train de vivre une nouvelle transition vers GraphQL ? Boosté par Facebook et particulièrement par les développeurs frontend utilisant React.JS, je vais aborder avec vous les forces et faiblesses de cette spécification et vous présenter la manière dont nous l'abordons actuellement chez Dailymotion.

• "www : The Web Will Win" par Olivier Leplus (@olivierleplus  Developer Relations at Google)

Au début du XXème siècle, le web s'imposait sur nos ordinateurs face aux applications. Plus besoin d'installer de lourdes solutions depuis nos CD-Roms. Aujourd'hui, le mobile domine nos vies et les applications natives ont refait leur apparition.Le web n'a pas dit son dernier mot et ne compte pas se laisse faire! Les progressive web apps relèvent le défis afin d'apporter à vos utilisateurs la même expérience sur votre site qu'une application native

• "Tout ce que vous pensez savoir sur la couleur est faux " par Maryla (Google Cultural Institute)

Où comment j'ai appris beaucoup trop de choses sur la couleur en travaillant sur un appareil photo. La couleur a-t-elle vraiment trois dimensions ? Pourquoi ça n'a pas de sens de faire des calculs en RGB ? C'est quoi la balance des blancs ?


• "Prise de parole en public, quelques conseils" par Tim Carry (Co-orga Humantalks & dev evangelist at Algolia)

Vous avez envie de partager votre experience mais vous avez peur de monter sur scène ? Ou alors vous pensez que ce que vous avez à raconter n'intéressera personne ? Dans ce talk je vais vous partager quelques conseils qui m'ont beaucoup aidés pour vaincre mon stress et écrire mes présentations. Je prends désormais beaucoup de plaisir à monter sur scène et je souhaite vous partager ces petits secrets.


• "Hacker-Dev API on the Way" par Kévin Liagre (@_k33n_ Lead Dev at Yogosha)

Plus un jour ne se passe sans que la sécurité informatique fasse la Une de l’actualité de l’IT, quand ce n’est pas de l’actualité en général. La loi, sous peu, imposera aux entreprises de lourdes sanctions en cas de fuite d’information, or celles-ci sont elles aussi devenues quotidiennes. Conséquence logique, on parle de plus en plus de faire du développement sécurisé. Mais n’est-ce pas là une injonction paradoxale quand on sait que l’état d’esprit du hacker est pour ainsi dire l’inverse de celui du dev ? A travers ce talk, nous allons voir qu'aujourd'hui il est possible de collaborer avec les hackers afin d'intégrer la sécurité au coeur des processus de développement.


---

Pour les sessions prochaines, n'hésitez pas à soumettre vos talks  sur twitter (@HumanTalksParis), par mail ([masked]), via le formulaire http://bit.ly/HTParis-sujet ou par pigeon voyageur si ca vous fait plaisir ! :)

---
name: HumanTalks Paris Novembre 2016 (Spécial 4 ans!)

Join us and Father Christmas on his Sleigh collecting door to door.  Money raised is used to create food parcels for the elderly and needy in the local area.  

Collecting with Santa is such an amazing experience, you will love seeing the children's faces when they see Santa in his sleigh!  If you can't get there for 6.30 you can join the route at any time. The more people the better, it means we can cover more route in one night and raise more money. Children are also welcome to attend but you must stay with them at all times, especially when knocking on doors and near roads. Any questions just ask.

description:
Aromatherapy, Reflexology, Indian Head massage & Swedish Massage

•  Have You ever thought of having a holistic treatment but are unsure which one to choose?

• Do you feel stressed and are considering having a relaxing treatment yet unsure which one would suit best?

• Have you or are you considering training as complementary holistic therapist and would like to experience several therapies and get a flavor of what suits you and what's involved?
If you answered yes to any of the above then this workshop is definitely a step in the right direction for you. 

These workshops are packed with information regarding the benefits' of each therapy, how to choose which therapy is right for you and best of all - practical hands on experience as you will be guided to practice giving and receiving mini treatments from each therapy throughout the day. This is a great way of learning and you can use these skills at home with your friends and family. Mini treatments are carried out fully clothed. (Arms, hands, feet, head and shoulder massage). Wear old comfy relaxing clothes as we will be working with oils. 

Certificate of attendance & continuous personal development (5 CPD) points awarded. 

Workshops are also available from groups upon request and ca be therapeutically designed to suit your groups interests and needs. 

Small group 8 - 10 max You can book online or contact Joan Hunt[masked] 
Deposit: €20 to secure your place
name: Introduction to 4 Therapeutic Holistic Treatments - With Joan Hunt

Sesión para seguir conociendo el telescopio e improvisar. Dispondremos de dos telescopios, un refractor sobre montura ecuatorial y un Macksutov sobre montura altazimutal, así podremos ver la diferencia de ambos en cuanto a montaje y funcionamiento.

Es un fin de semana raro, con bastante Luna, por lo que no puedo precisar si podremos ver objetos de cielo profundo ni cuántos. Aún y así, aprovechando que estaremos con un cielo menos contaminado que la primera sesión, trataremos de observar varios objetos de cielo profundo, a ver si esta vez tenemos mejor suerte. En el peor de los casos, la Luna no estará llena del todo así que dispondremos de mayor tridimensionalidad en el terminador de ésta y las sombras sobre los cráteres serán más acusadas.

En cuanto a fotografía, trataremos de montar una cámara sobre el telescopio para captar imágenes de los objetos a los que apuntemos. También intentaremos hacer alguna fotografía circumpolar, de esas que se ve la estrella polar en el centro y las estrellas moviéndose a su alrededor.

Traeros prismáticos y cámaras réflex si tenéis (con trípode, por supuesto) y así todos podremos experimentar.

La hora de quedada es a las 17:00 para empezar a montar de día, hablar sobre lo que veremos y sobretodo vernos las caras, cosa que apenas pudimos hacer el otro día J.

Como siempre, la quedada estará sujeta a la previsión meteorológica y el punto de quedada será en algún lugar cercano o en la Sierra de Madrid.
name: Observación y fotografía

Renowned for an endless string of soulful yet socially aware hits ...Forgotten Town, Ideal World, Born Again, Harvest for the World, What’s in a Word, Hooverville, Words, Father, The Bottle and many more The Christians enjoyed huge acclaim in the late 80s and early 90s both in the UK and Europe and often confused people with their band name (in fact just the brothers surname with absolutely no religious connotation!).
Still headed by enigmatic lead singer Garry Christian (who very much deserves the Daily Mirror’s description of him as having ‘one of the finest voices in pop), who has only gained in vocal stature (and wit) over the years! The band are enjoying a revival currently touring successfully in the UK and Europe.
Currently embarking on a huge UK Tour playing their well-known back catalogue and songs selected from the new album WE released recently to rave reviews which includes the Hillsborough families tribute 'Big Red Sky'.
Catch them at Ferneham and find out why Chris Evans said 'it was the best gig I've ever been to!'

description:
We will gather at Doc's on Westheimer, near Montrose for this Sunday's noon game, as the Houston Texans head off for their game against the Jacksonville Jaguars. With a giant door to let in the fresh air, if the weather is nice, our reserved tables will have that patio feel to make the experience even more special.

Besides a killer Bloody Mary and Mimosa menu for brunch, which is so conveniently scheduled during game time, Doc's also features delicious food items. How does a Hangover Bowl of eggs, black beans, cheese and applewood bacon over jalapeno cornbread sound? Or Pinche's Pie, with Fritos, chili and cheese topped with two fried eggs? Of course, this sports bar has an extensive menu of burgers, wings, nachos, sliders and tacos.

And for the beer drinkers, that menu features Texas on Tap, with dozens of homemade local wonders, as well as other craft beers. But fans of the good, old domestics need not worry, with entire buckets of brew starting at just $13!

So RSVP now. We're going to have some fun this Sunday. Our membership has grown to about 80 people so let's get out to Doc's and make some noise!
name: We'll Watch Another Win as the Texans Take on the Jaguars Sunday

description:
*This event is the second part of a two-part event being held on this day. Check out the OSU event too!

At the Tour De Pokémon Go event earlier this month, one of the places we stopped was Berliner Park, a current Bulbasaur nest. We had a Bulbasaur on our Nearby lists at pretty muchall times. Since softball season was over, one field in particular was basically swarming with 10-20 Pokémon GO players. It was cool seeing all those people out there, and it's that kind of environment we hope to encounter again! Hopefully everyone will walk away much closer to a Venusaur.

I'm very excited to announce we'll be joined by OSU's resident Pokémon group, the Buckeye Pokémon League! This OSU student organization with a love of anything Pokémon also functions as an officially sanctioned 'Play! Pokémon' location for card games and video games, and occasionally hosts official tournaments at OSU. Anyone is welcome, whether you attend OSU or not. The club currently meets from 7-10 PM on Mondays in the basement of the Student Union, in the Milestones room (but you can ask me, Brian, at any time if that needs confirmed, as they tend to only meet when OSU has classes).

We'll come straight here from our OSU event, and we'll be at it here until dark (estimated 5:30-6 PM). Since we don't have a lot of time, we will not wait 15 minutes for people to show up as we have, we'll just go out there. Hopefully you won't have much trouble finding the GO players.

Also, if you need a ride from the OSU area, post a comment or send a private message to me (Brian) and be at the OSU student union by 4 PM.
name: Bulbasaur at Berliner (Collab with the OSU Buckeye Pokémon League)

description:
**You must register on Eventbrite to be allowed entry**

http://datasciencegraph.eventbrite.co.uk

Welcome to our last Data Science Lab event of 2016!

This evening will be themed around graphs and graph databases, both theory and case studies of how they are used.

18:30 Doors open

19:00 Talk: What can knowledge graphs do for me?

Speaker: Dr Sheldon Hall

As the world becomes more and more data rich the difficulties of managing and wrangling data become more pronounced. The knowledge graph is positioned to be the next thing big thing in terms of data integration and search, but what is it and where can you get one? The next question might be: should I care? The answer is a definite YES and in this presentation I will justify this claim by highlighting the benefits to data scientists. These include: easy integration of multiple data sources, a flexible schema to check correctness and express how the information is related, and an intuitive graph query language to extract information across all sources.

Sheldon Hall is a software engineer working at Grakn Labs where a distributed knowledge graph is being developed. His current role involves research and development of our graph based knowledge representation system and analytics engine. He has a master’s degree in mathematical modelling and scientific computing, a doctorate in nuclear engineering, and is a previous ASI Fellow. 

19:45 Lightning talk: Speaker TBC

20:00 Lightning talk: Speaker TBC

20:15 Drinks & Networking

21:00 Event finishes
name: Understanding Data and Graphs

description:
Ok folks, I am doing my first bridge holiday in conjunction with Harold Schogger.

It is basically five sessions of duplicate and two sessions of teaching in a bucolic Oxfordshire village.

You can take a break from bridge and watch the wildlife frolicking or have a drink at some nice country pubs. Nice area for walking too.

The hotel is really comfortable and all your food is included.

Here's the publicity from Harold:

The Best Western Wroxton House Hotel is privately owned by ‘The Smiths’ and set in the beautiful thatched village of Wroxton. Dating in parts from 1649 this hotel is an idyllic retreat only 4 miles from junction 11 of the M40 and on the edge of the Cotswolds.

Those seeking to relax and discover some historic and fascinating areas of the country won’t be disappointed. Guests will be delighted by the hotel’s personal service, attention to detail and tranquil working environment.

Whether a first time guest or regular visitor, all are guaranteed the promise of a warm welcome from a dedicated and professional team.

♠ EN SUITE ROOMS WITH ALL FACILITIES ♠ PRIZES

♠ PARTNERS GUARANTEED ♠AREA FOR SMOKERS ♠
Superb Value only £250 for 2 nights
4 bridge sessions, 2 bridge seminars. half board only £250

No single supplement
name: Bridge Weekend at Wroxton House Hotel, Oxfordshirt
